Name: Business Analyst
Description: Req ID: 36942     At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.     NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Business Analyst to join our team in Austin, TX.       The individual will be responsible for the following:  Eliciting requirements using tasks such as: facilitated workshops with business subject matter experts, interviews, document analysis, prototyping, and interface analysisSpecifying and analyzing business goals/requirements, functional requirements, system interface requirements, reporting requirements, data requirements, non-functionalFacilitates meetings with the business subject matter experts or end users to formulate business strategies and requirements and translate client needs into actionable system requirements.Coordinates, conducts, and documents requirements gathering sessions with end users, project stakeholders and development team(s)Critically evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconciles conflicts, decomposes high-level information into details - abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguishes user requests from the underlying true needsDevelops high quality documentation including business requirements documents, use cases, software requirements specifications, report specifications, epics, user stories, screen and interface designs, conceptual page flows, business process models, user acceptance test plans, and training manuals / user guidesIdentifies, plans and estimates level of effort for business analysis related tasksLeading/hosting large, cross functional meetings to elicit requirements from subject matter experts and build consensusAnalyzing requirements from several functional areas to determine potential conflicts /other requirements that may exist in other areas.Ability to participate in Quality Assurance and User Acceptance.Performs functional testing as needed to ensure adherence to requirementsCoordinates/executes the development of test cases.Successfully engages in multiple initiatives simultaneously      Basic Qualifications: Minimum of 3 years work experience with business process analysis       Preferred Skills:   Business analysis - requirements management and gatheringUnderstanding business process management and business requirements of the customers and translating them to specific software requirementsExceptional communication, presentation, organization and time management skillsExceptional written and verbal communication skillsAbility to participate in various phases of testing (Execution of Plan, Design, Strategy, Coordination, Development, Quality Assurance and Execution)Ability to participate in release and implementation processes         This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.About NTT DATA Services    NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.     NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.     NTT DATA, Inc. (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob SummaryApplied Systems, Inc., a worldwide leader in insurance technology, is currently searching for a Business Analyst to join our IVANS Insurance Solutions Division. In this role, you will be part of a small, fast-paced team comprised of individuals from world class technology and insurance industry firms tasked with the creation of highly innovative products to lead the industry in the digital world. You will work closely with our clients to gather business requirements, conduct software demonstrations, and assist with implementations. Your insurance industry expertise will be critical in helping our technical staff successfully respond to the needs of our clients.  Additional responsibilities include: Co-ordinate multiple business projects concurrentlyConsider the needs of all client constituents, both internal and external, with the goal of delivering software to clients of all sizes – small as well as global in natureFacilitate communication with clients to determine clear understanding of business problems that can be solved by technology solutionsUnderstands, supports, and delivers on the corporate roadmap, vision, and goalsRequirements:Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience3+ years of experience in an independent insurance agency; Applied Epic exposure preferredSome SQL experience is a plusAbility to communicate at all business levels with individuals in both technical and non-technical rolesSelf-driven passion for finding and collaboratively solving problemsStrong oral, written, and interpersonal communication skillsExposure to Power BI/other BI software helpful but not required!Make a Difference Every Day with Team AppliedThe people of Applied are making a difference every day through innovation and a commitment to help safeguard and protect what matters most. With first-to-market software, mobile and data analytics solutions, Applied is revolutionizing companies to strengthen their position as trusted advisors to clients across the world. Our core values challenge employees to make a difference every day with excellence for customers and support for the communities around us. We believe that success comes from a dynamic working environment that offers professionals an opportunity to grow and succeed alongside extraordinary people.  Learn how you can make a difference on Team Applied. Corporate ProfileApplied Systems is a leading provider of software that powers the business of insurance. Recognized as a pioneer in agency management systems, insurance organizations rely on the company’s software to manage their clients and policies in a consistent manner to minimize risk, reduce operating expenses, and drive sustainable growth and profitability. Leading the industry in technology innovation, Applied Systems has been at the forefront of data exchange between agencies, brokers, carriers and their clients. Today, the company has more than 1,500 employees with customers throughout the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and Ireland. By automating the insurance lifecycle, Applied Systems remains committed to help safeguard what matters most to millions of people around the world. To learn more, please visit www.AppliedSystems.com.  Employees feel appreciated at Applied Systems. In addition to a competitive benefits package that starts on the first day of employment, we offer paid time off, a flexible ”Dress for your Day” casual dress code, and an open communication policy. The resulting atmosphere is professional and conducive to productivity, yet comfortable and fun. Applied Systems welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Posting Title:Business Analyst----Hiring Department:Red McCombs School of Business----Position Open To:All Applicants----Number of Vacancies:1----Weekly Scheduled Hours:40----FLSA Status:Exempt----Earliest Start Date:Nov 21, 2018----Position Duration:Expected to Continue----Location:UT MAIN CAMPUS----Job Description:Responsible for working with programs, department and centers to capture their digital and web needs. He/she will gather, analyze and document the requirements in support of the business needs, as outlined by our clients, and communicate those needs and requirements to technical developers to build digital solutions.----Responsibilities and Essential Functions:Process improvement/integration - recommend changes in workflows and practices to maximize effectiveness and efficiencies for the work unit. Analyzes and coordinates the design specifications, development and implementation of build and/or purchasedapplications. (15%)Solution Execution - develop and execute solutions for client review, synthesizing the work of other team members to package a complete solution for clients. May act as the project lead during the design phase of automation projects. (25%)Web/Digital Team Engagement - Responsible for interpreting and presenting requirement and technical details to functional experts and developers in a way that is meaningful to all audiences, meeting with the web team members to review project needs,identify solutions and assign work to the appropriate team member. (30%)Client Engagement - meeting with clients, gathering requirements and discussing best practices and solutions to support business needs. Documenting these in project brief format. Communicating with clients about project status, approvals needed, questions and project blockers (30%)Other related functions as assigned. ----Job Details:General NotesAs an Equal Opportunity Employer, the McCombs School of Business believes that diversity in our faculty, student, and staff populations is integral to our core purpose of educating leaders that create value for society. We welcome applicants from under-represented groups and those who can demonstrate a commitment to inclusion. For more information, please visit the Communications and Media Relations Team webpage. Required Qualifications Able to capture and document business requirements related to digital projects. Strong interpersonal, oral and written communications skills. Professional demeanor, demonstrated ability to manage projects and meet SLAs.  Equivalent combination of relevant education and experience may be substituted as appropriatePreferred QualificationsClient-service oriented mentality. Experience working in/using multiple CMS tools, specifically Sitecore, but also other solutions such as Drupal, WordPress, etc. Experience and confidence in collaborating with technical and digital experts on translating business requirements into technical solutions, and leveraging digital expertise to guide non-technical stakeholders through web/digital projects. Substantial knowledge of UI/UX design principles, SEO best practices and web analytics.Salary Range$53,000- $62,000Working ConditionsMay work around standard office conditionsRepetitive use of a keyboard at a workstationWork performed on multiple projects concurrently, under pressure of rigid deadlines. May include extended hoursRequired MaterialsApplication materials must include Resume, Letter of Interest and 3 References of which one should be a previous supervisor. ----Required Application Materials:A resume or CV is required to apply. A list of 3 references is required to apply. Any additional required materials are noted in the Job Details section.---- Employment Eligibility:Regular staff who have been employed in their current position for the last six continuous months are eligible for openings being recruited for through University-Wide or Open Recruiting, to include both promotional opportunities and lateral transfers. Staff who are promotion/transfer eligible may apply for positions without supervisor approval.---- Retirement Plan Eligibility:The retirement plan for this position is Teacher Retirement System of Texas (TRS), subject to the position being at least 20 hours per week and at least 135 days in length.---- Background Checks: A criminal history background check will be required for finalist(s) under consideration for this position.  ---- Equal Opportunity Employer: The University of Texas at Austin, as an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer, complies with all applicable federal and state laws regarding nondiscrimination and affirmative action. The University is committed to a policy of equal opportunity for all persons and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, disability, religion, or veteran status in employment, educational programs and activities, and admissions.  ---- Pay Transparency: The University of Texas at Austin will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.  ---- Employment Eligibility Verification: If hired, you will be required to complete the federal Employment Eligibility Verification I-9 form. You will be required to present acceptable and original documents to prove your identity and authorization to work in the United States. Documents need to be presented no later than the third day of employment. Failure to do so will result in loss of employment at the university. ----E-Verify: The University of Texas at Austin use E-Verify to check the work authorization of all new hires effective May 2015. The university’s company ID number for purposes of E-Verify is 854197. For more information about E-Verify, please see the following: E-Verify Poster (English) [PDF]E-Verify Poster (Spanish) [PDF]Right To Work Poster (English) [PDF]Right To Work Poster (Spanish) [PDF]----Compliance: Employees may be required to report violations of law under Title IX and the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Crime Statistics Act (Clery Act). If this position is identified a Campus Security Authority (Clery Act), you will be notified and provided resources for reporting. Responsible employees under Title IX are defined and outlined in HOP-3031.  The Clery Act requires all prospective employees be notified of the availability of the Annual Security and Fire Safety report. You may access the 2018 report here or obtain a copy at University Compliance Services, 1616 Guadalupe, Suite UTA 2.206, Austin, TX 78701.

Name: Business Analyst

Name: Business Analyst
Description: E2open is looking for a talented Business Analyst with 3 years of experience in the supply chain industry with ability to perform data analysis, develop and configure reports using analytics tools and work as part of development team in the implementation phase ensuring the business requirements are met. Effective data analysis and understanding of business analytics tools and algorithms is key in determining appropriate demand forecasting algorithms as well as appropriate hierarchy levels for demand sensing and forecasting.  Requirements: 3 years’ experience in the supply chain industry with ability to perform data analysis, develop and configure reports using analytics tools and work as part of development team in the implementation phase ensuring the business requirements are met. Effective data analysis and understanding of business analytics tools and algorithms is key in determining appropriate demand forecasting algorithms as well as appropriate hierarchy levels for demand sensing and forecasting–Design proprietary E2Open solutions for the customer based on their business logics and detail the technical flowImplement and validate the integration between different IT systems using integration tools.Design, implement and test custom technical solutions by leveraging different products in the E2Open suite and optimize performance.Technical authorship of key project documents and architect of key phases of the project (for example Requirements Workshops, User Acceptance Testing, (Super) User Training)Development and execution of test scripts and scenarios based upon business use cases and expected system behaviorsWork closely with clients to validate key system configurations including business rule configuration, source system data integration and mapping, hierarchy and product structure verification and system set upWork closely with customer resources to test and troubleshoot various applications in the E2Open Product suite.Support project team throughout project lifecycle working closely with customers to drive solution designs which align with and enhance best practice collaborative planningPrepare and conduct customer training sessions Location: Austin or Dallas optimally. Remote as a second choice.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Double Line believes that each employee makes a significant contribution to our success. That contribution should not be limited by the assigned responsibilities. This position description is designed to outline primary duties, qualifications and job scope, but not limit the incumbent nor the organization to just the work identified. It is our expectation that each employee will offer his/her services wherever and whenever necessary to ensure the success of our endeavors.  The Business Analyst will be responsible for supporting the data and development teams in the development of technical solutions - from initial collection and documentation of requirements to testing and documentation of the final solution. What we need from you:Experience working with internal and external stakeholder groups to collect and document end-user requirements for technical solutionsExperience with designing and executing QA test plans and processesStrong analytical skills and a meticulous attention to detailExperience with process design, along with strong organizational skillsKnowledge & understanding of reference data concepts and issuesExcellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to work with technical and non-technical teams at all levels, including senior managementAbility to collaborate effectively and work as part of a teamAdditionally, it would be nice if you have:Logical data modeling, UML, metadata and data profiling experience including prior work with standard tools (such as ERWIN, Rational Rose, ER/Studio) and methodologiesData modeling experience in large enterprise environments working with RDBMS and/or data warehousing systemsAn interest in or familiarity with software development processes, such as the Agile methodology

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst  Start apply with LinkedIn  Start apply with Facebook  Apply Now  Start  Please wait...  Date: Nov 13, 2018  Location: Austin, TX, US  Company: New York Life Insurance Co  A career at New York Life offers many opportunities. To be part of a growing and successful business. To reach your full potential, whatever your specialty. Above all, to make a difference in the world by helping people achieve financial security. It's a career journey you can be proud of, and you'll find plenty of support along the way. Our development programs range from skill-building to management training, and we value our diverse and inclusive workplace where all voices can be heard. Recognized as one of Fortune's World's Most Admired Companies, New York Life is committed to improving local communities through a culture of employee giving and service, supported by our Foundation. It all adds up to a rewarding career at a company where doing right by our customers is part of who we are, as a mutual company without outside shareholders. We invite you to bring your talents to New York Life, so we can continue to help families and businesses Be Good At Life. To learn more, please visit LinkedIn, our Newsroom and the Careers page of *******************.  Looking for a highly motivated Business Intelligence Analyst with well-rounded experience to join New York Life's Long Term Care insurance (LTCi) Data and Analytics team. Long-term care is ongoing assistance someone needs to do basic daily activities as the result of a chronic health challenge or cognitive impairment. These various home, community-based and facility services are generally not covered by private health insurance or government programs. The Data and Analytics team a team within the LTCi business that supports the data and reporting needs across its business disciplines, including actuarial, claims, accounting, marketing, etc. We partner with and support each area, leveraging data to drive business strategy, decision making and support of our distribution efforts.  This role requires an individual with a strong sense of ownership, technical and analytical expertise as well as the ability to effectively communicate between business teams and technical teams. In this role, you will focus on partnering with the business areas to better understand data and analytics needs needed to drive the business forward. In addition, the role also requires you to create dashboards, KPIs within Qlik Sense and other tools and develop innovative ways of leveraging data to support a wide cross section of our organization.  The ideal candidate will apply a high energy level and business sense to work and communicate with key stakeholders, and be able to build those business requirements into Qlik Sense reports and other analytical tools and platforms to fill those business needs. Responsibilities: Independently work with the business to identify business data and analytics needs.  Develop and produce KPIs, dashboards and scorecards.  Creating more value from data: Exploring the impact of business strategy changes on information management and investigating ways to extract additional value from existing information assets.  Data modeling: Understanding and providing input for data models in all their forms, including conceptual models, relational database designs, data flows and others.  Contribute to business process models and documentation for internal and external data sources coming into Hadoop Data Lake and SQL Server/Oracle data warehouses.  Analyze and evaluate data / information gathered from multiple sources and reconcile / address conflicts or business issues  Write SQL to query complex data structures  Utilize data wrangling, data matching and ETL techniques to explore variety of data sources, gain data expertise and create datasets to support advanced modeling and Business Intelligence reports Required Skills / Knowledge: 2+ years experience as a Business/Data Analyst, position level commensurate with experience  Experience with SQL Server, MS Excel, Qlik.  Excellent understanding of data and relationship. Ability to write SQL to query complex data structure.  High level of curiosity and investigative mind-set with an attention to detail  Experience using large databases to solve problems  Strong analytical, creative thinking and problem solving skills  Excellent interpersonal skills and highly experienced at dealing with clients/users at all levels  Experience working with Big Data, R, Hadoop is a plus Education - Degrees/Certificates: Master or Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Finance, Computer Science, Statistics or related discipline SF:LI-KV1EOE M/F/D/V If you have difficulty using or interacting with any portions of this Web site due to incompatibility with an Assistive Technology, if you need the information in an alternative format, or if you have suggestions on how we can make this site more accessible, please contact us at: **************.  Nearest Major Market: Austin  Job Segment: Business Analyst, Database, Oracle, Social Media, Claims, Finance, Technology, Marketing, Insurance  Start apply with LinkedIn  Start apply with Facebook  Apply Now  Start  Please wait...

Name: Business Analyst
Description: MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: This position requires a four-year bachelor degree from an accredited college or university and three (3) years of experience in positions that included structural business analysis, business process analysis, auditing, data science, process or quality control, accounting, statistical analysis, computer science, education or other relevant experience. SKILL REQUIREMENTS: This position requires critical thinking, the ability to research insights and learn with autonomy, and significant self-motivation while handling multiple concurrent priorities that vary greatly in size and subject matter. Differing traits can have special strengths for this role, as many different methods are possible for resolving each project. A preferred incumbent would have knowledge of some of these related areas: Governmental accountingGenerally accepted accounting principlesStatistical theory & methodsInternal controlsProgramming languages, including scripting languagesBusiness history/theory/best-practicesFraud methods and investigative techniquesOther audit standards and frameworks (GAGAS, IIA, ISO, COSO, etc.)IT security frameworks (NIST, COBIT, ISO27001, FISMA, PCI, etc.)Advanced audit techniquesDatabases & computer scienceSQLData miningData warehousingData modelingSchool district organizational practices and historySchool district activities in-school or extracurricularRegulations for school districts - education, privacy, IT, HR, Finance, nutrition, etc.General grant-funded program requirements (EDGAR, OMB Uniform Guidance) This position requires the ability to organize and analyze information from a variety of sources and in a variety of formats, and the ability to communicate both orally and in writing. Multi-dimensional data-modeling is a plus, but not required. Incumbent should have a working knowledge of personal computers and their software including Microsoft Office. A preferred incumbent would also have knowledge of relevant tools such as: Excel (DB reports, Macros, VisualBasic, etc.)SQL & Crystal ReportsR, python, or other languages for statistics/data analyticsBusiness Intelligence - Oracle, Business Objects, Cognos, Tableau, MicroStrategy, SSASDB systems - Oracle 11, MySQLERP systems - Lawson+Landmark, KEVSchoolCash, KronosServer systems - Windows Server 2012, Redhat Linux, MacOS Server, SCCMEducation enterprise software, including Texas Education Agency softwareJOB PURPOSE AND RESPONSIBILITY: This position is responsible for planning and executing evaluations of business processes to help Austin ISD accomplish objectives and improve operations. Additional work may include special investigations or audits, including school audits, to determine breaches in District policies or financial accountability. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Perform special projects as requested by the Director of Internal Audit in accordance with requests from the Board of Trustees.Projects are mostly autonomous and many are large, heavily complex and extremely diverse from each other. Typically, these are business-process analyses where data-driven analysis can be the instigator, solution or center of the project.Analyze business systems and operational processes to complete root-cause analyses and determine the workflows of the District, important points in a system and possible controls that exist or should exist. A particular emphasis is placed on closing or creating feedback loops to align incentive structures and allow employees to have the capabilities and capacities to perform their duties.Assist the Internal Audit Department in its evaluation of changing operations, merging/consolidating functions, breaches of compliance, fraudulent events, internal control effectiveness and operational effectiveness and efficiency.Review results of work and evidence obtained to yield conclusions upon data, work papers and inquiries for an improved understanding of possible procedures (whether for the Internal Audit Department or otherwise), the business climate, notable incentives and departmental trends.Collaborate with the Internal Audit Department to share, document and provide a robust base of knowledge for the Department and the District.Assist with other Internal Audit Department activities as needed such as regular audits of high risk accounts and activities, and developing an annual audit plan.Communicate with employees from a broad range of departments and management levels, to convey and to inquire for knowledge of related projects as well as to summarize the results of work performed.Small amounts of travel outside of the District (training/conferences) is typically required.Occasional travel inside of the District to various school campuses or departments is also required.Assist in the development of an annual audit plan using an appropriate risk-based methodology, including any risks or control concerns identified by management.Assist in the implementation of the annual audit plan including as appropriate any special tasks or projects requested by the Director of Internal Audit.OTHER DUTIES AS ASSIGNED: Perform other related duties as assigned; however, all employees are expected to comply with lawful directives in rare situations driven by need where a team effort is required. PHYSICAL EFFORT AND WORK ENVIRONMENT: This position involves working in a normal office setting with no unusual physical demands or exposure to hazardous situations. This position may involve rare exposure to blood or bodily fluids. Regular attendance is required for this position. PERSONAL WORK RELATIONSHIPS: This position reports directly to the Director of Internal Audit. This position will provide regular guidance for a variety of levels in Austin ISD. Incumbent will have little consultation outside of Austin ISD personnel. Incumbent is expected to maintain a positive and effective relationship with employees and supervisors, as well as communicating effectively with colleagues. COMPENSATION: Duty Days: 260  Pay Grade: CP4  Starting Salary: $55,577.60/Yr  Social Security  Teacher Retirement  Comprehensive Benefits Package  Employee Discount Program  Closing Date: Until Filled  An Equal Opportunity EmployerSDL2017

Name: Sr. Business Process Analyst

initiatives through end to end process improvement for the billing team and its stakeholders, and lower business related risk by identifying mitigating controls both operationally and financially.Job Description: Analyze, identify and qualify opportunities for new product features and functions on the billing platform in support of competitive product positioning for PayPal businesses.Provide reporting and analytical support around the performance of billing and payments and the state of the business.Source ideas on how the PayPal Billing group can generate more value to our internal business partners.Enable products and services for our business and technical partners to become more data-driven in enhancing their decision making.Educate other product teams and business units on best practices as related to or applicable to PayPal.Manage billing and payment compliance workstream for assigned business partners.Serve as a project manager for billing and payments projects (product enhancements, new reporting, product integrations, etc.)Manage M&A integrations and represent Global Billing as the Order to Cash SMEDevelop business case for technology/integration requests to the appropriate platform team.Create and facilitate business reviews based on a communication plan for each business unit.Review process improvements, fraud and chargeback trends, payment mix, and expansion plans with key stakeholders within PayPal.Advocate for stakeholder product, operational and technology requests within PayPal roadmaps.Proactively manage regulatory changes and coordinate with appropriate cross-functional teams.Support monthly Proforma reviews as it relates to bill run compliance.Participate in special projects as needed and perform other duties as assigned. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.Paypal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Additional responsibilities may include: functional analysis for specific applications; Project Lead and project cost controls. Position is active in the following functional areas: Business Analysis, Functional Analysis, Project Management. Works with clients and other consultants to formulate plans outlining steps required to develop the program, uses structured analysis and design. And submits to end-users for approval.Conduct business needs analysis against existing technology and supporting processes to determine if area of focus is IT or business-relatedConduct business needs analysis and gather business requirementsAssist business unit(s) in process definition and act as consultant to improve business processes * Collaborate with business unit(s), other technology areas and vendors to identify alternative solutions and translate operational needs into IT specificationsAssemble and present business requirements, functional specifications, and project statements.Monitor activities of assigned projects to ensure project remains on schedule and within approved scope/budgetCommunicate status of each phase for assigned projects to management on a scheduled basisExecute formal change management process to adjust project scope, budget or schedule as neededDevelop testing requirements and plan to validate application changes and supporting business processesCoordinate delivery of business solutions and supporting processes according to business priorities and IT specificationsSupport beta testing, end-user testing and validation by business unit for new or revised applicationsProvide support to end-users on features and functions of applications for assigned area(s)Evaluate proposed changes to existing applications to identify potential adverse impact upon operationsAscertain that newly implemented/revised applications and supporting processes are meeting end-user requirements and business objectivesPerform modeling of business and system processes based on findings through use-case scenarios, workflow diagrams, and data modelsCollaborate with third-party vendors to resolve project or support issuesResearch/analyze current/emerging technologies/vendor services in support of business priorities and objectivesTrain less experienced employees within assigned area(s)Basic Qualifications: Ability to travel abroad as Name: Business Analyst
Description: Working Title: Business Analyst 1 WORK DESCRIPTION: Austin Energy is recruiting for a highly experienced and effective business systems analyst to assist with the development and operation of an Advanced Meter Infrastructure (AMI) program that directly aligns with the utilitys Strategic Plan. This position will be responsible for participation in and oversite of specified areas of the programs day to day operation as well as developing business processes and workflows for the program. Austin Energy's AMI Program is a high profile piece of Austin Energys Strategic Plan and Grid Modernization Initiative, bringing with it substantial changes to the utility for both internal and external customers. The successful candidate will have exceptional skills in workforce management, meter data management, change management, business process development and redesign, user acceptance testing and data analytics. Strong preference toward candidates who have utility experience working with AMI data and meter data management systems. The candidate should exhibit demonstrated success in project coordination, managing stakeholder relations, working with vendors, consultants, and cross functional teams and be adept working in fast paced, dynamic work environment. Essential duties and functions may include the following. Other related duties may be assigned: 1. Meet with decision makers, system owners and end users to define business, financial and operations requirements and systems goals 2. Assist with requirements gathering sessions to elicit requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations related to potential system integration solutions 3. Create models, use cases, process flows, specifications, diagrams and charts to provide direction to developers, designers, and vendors 4. Assist with converting requirements into developing business cases, project charters and statements of work for use in requests for proposals 5. Evaluate compatibility and interoperability of commercial off-the-shelf or in-house technology systems 6. Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and assist with developing strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems 7. Perform cost-benefit and return-on-investment analyses to aid in making business decisions 8. Conduct research on software and hardware products and technology services to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts 9. Write and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential trouble areas in IT applications across the organization 10. Coordinate and perform tests, including end-user reviews for modified and new systems, training and other post-implementation support 11. Assist in the development of a project forecasting nd project plan for Utility Applications 12. Conduct weekly and ad hoc meetings on program and program initiatives; track issues through resolution lifecycle; Develop and deliver presentations for use in Executive Steering Committee and related program meetings WORKER SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS (Required) Minimum (Required): insert specific minimum skills for this Contract Position) Years Skills/Experience YES Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with a degree in Business or Management, Engineering, computer science, computer information systems, or management information systems 5 Demonstrated experience in business process development and redesign 5 Experience in IT/OT systems integration projects 5 Experience in Change Management 5 Expert level skillset using SharePoint and MS Visio; Proficient in Microsoft Outlook, Excel, Word, Project, Power Point Preferred (Optional): insert specific preferred skills for this Contract Position) Years Skills/Experience 5 Experience with Advanced Meter Infrastructure (AMI) technologies including head end systems and meter data management systems 5 Experience Coordinating System Acceptance Testing and User Acceptance Testing 5 Familiarity with utility business practices and relevant business needs 5 Experience working with large data sets and data visualization tools 5 Familiarity with Software/Firmware Release Management 5 Experience in Electric Meter Engineering 5 Familiarity with electric meter programs - provided by DiceDemonstrated experience in business process development and redesign. Experience coordinating System Acceptance Testing and User Acceptance Testing.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: The Business Analyst is responsible for the elicitation, preparation and analysis of external and internal customer requirements; from high level business requirements to functional and non-functional requirements/specifications. The Business Analyst uses a range of analysis models, tools and techniques to capture, analyze and document information. The Business Analyst collaborates with the Product Owner, Development, and QA teams to enable the creation of high-quality software solutions that meet the customer’s needs. Building relationships with other product, development, and quality teams across the global organization is also important. Ensuring an estimated and fueled backlog that is understood and committed to from the delivery team is a key aspect for this role, as well as supporting the Product Manager with release planning based on prioritization, with a customer and technical focus.Responsibilities:Collaborate with all project stakeholders and translate all stakeholder needs into stories, in support of development and testingEvaluate and analyze business processes, requirements, and identify production defects to uncover areas for improvementPerform research and analysis of new product features/requirementsOwnership, creation and maintenance of all necessary requirements documentation, specifications and other related documentsPerform systems analysis, including analysis of data and integration points related to development tasksPerform technical writing and business report writingActively participate in stakeholder meetings, as needed, to gather, assess and validate user requirements.Partner with the UI/UX team to create necessary prototypes, wireframes and use casesAdvise in the development of QA test cases and plansOther duties as assigned Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Design or other related field and 5-7 years of relevant work experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience is requiredKnowledge in use-case definition and requirements gathering/analysis methodologies is requiredExtensive experience in requirements analysis; must be able to manage and prioritize issues/requirements (log, communicate, etc.) in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environmentStrong interpersonal skills with the ability to influence without authorityAbility to work confidently with internal and external stakeholders and members of the development teamStrong assessment/evaluation skills (examine aspects, options, etc.)Strong time management and prioritizations skillsA proven ability to learn new processes, applications, skills and toolsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsMust be able to work effectively independently and within a team settingKnowledge and/or experience in agile software development (e.g. SCRUM) is highly desirableProficiency in Microsoft Office Suite is requiredAbility to self-evaluate and quickly adapt to change Nice to Have: Experience in and knowledge of intellectual property, especially in the area of patents, trademarks and IP related processesprovided by Dice General,Computer science, Software, Engineer

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Concierge Auctions is seeking a Business Analyst to join a growing and leading company that is on a mission to transform the traditional luxury real estate transaction process. We are looking for a talented and motivated individual to be a part of building a global sales operations function with a goal to optimize and scale the productivity and performance of its sales and marketing organizations. This position will report directly to the Vice President of Sales Operations and will need to work effectively in a matrix environment. The primary responsibility of this position is to establish and manage a systematic approach to create, analyze, test and optimize new and existing sales processes. This includes writing and translating business requirements into user stories. Key Activities Identify key process improvement areas that will have the greatest impact on business performance Develop new sales processes in alignment with company sales goals Establish clear selection criteria for process improvements in partnership with key stakeholders Partner with key stakeholders to document as-is processes and identify gaps Facilitate and lead cross-functional process improvement programs Facilitate and partner with internal teams to conduct process time studies Establish baseline metrics and track improvements using a test and learn approach Maintain archive of process documentation Collaborate with stakeholders to identify & recommend process changes Categorize and prioritize the main problems and possibilities and evaluate alternative solutions Communicate business needs to technical partners in form of businessrequirements and user stories Communicate process improvement analysis and recommendations to leadership  Provide clear vision of the as-is process and operating environment Provide clear vision of why the process change is needed and how the organization will benefit from the change Provide clear vision of the to-be process, roles, and responsibilities Communicate and collaborate with necessary stakeholders and internal teams to implement recommendations Knowledge and Experience Requirements Bachelors Degree Four years demonstrated experience in facilitating and/or managing process improvement activities Experience in Agile, Six Sigma or other process improvement methodologies and tools Experience with Marketing Automation tools a plus Experience with Salesforce.com Experience with contact center software a plus Exceptional Communication Skills (written and verbal) Experience with cross-functional and global program management Real Estate background is a plus

Name: Systems Analyst - O&I Business Operations
Description: Common Purpose, Uncommon Opportunity. Everyone at Visa works with one goal in mind – making sure that Visa is the best way to pay and be paid, for everyone everywhere. This is our global vision and the common purpose that unites the entire Visa team. As a global payments technology company, tech is at the heart of what we do: Our VisaNet network processes over 13,000 transactions per second for people and businesses around the world, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks. We are also global advocates for financial inclusion, working with partners around the world to help those who lack access to financial services join the global economy. Visa’s sponsorships, including the Olympics and FIFA™ World Cup, celebrate teamwork, diversity, and excellence throughout the world. If you have a passion to make a difference in the lives of people around the world, Visa offers an uncommon opportunity to build a strong, thriving career. Visa is fueled by our team of talented employees who continuously raise the bar on delivering the convenience and security of digital currency to people all over the world. Join our team and find out how Visa is everywhere you want to be.  The main function of a systems analyst is to analyze asset license, configuration data, and data processes throughout the life cycle of an asset. A typical systems analyst is responsible for analyzing user requirements, automate and improve existing systems integrations and review system capabilities, workflow and scheduling limitations. An entry-level business systems analyst typically has a Bachelors degree in a computer related major with broad knowledge and experience related to relational databases, ETL concepts and common scripting languages. The technical skills, including using T-SQL, SSIS, and familiarity in scripting languages.     Major Job Duties and Responsibilities:  · Gather requirements from business units and translate those to technical specification  · Confer with clients regarding the nature of the data and data source systems, processing or computation needs  · Build integration packages to bring in new data from 60+ source systems into centralized data warehouse.  · Live and breathe data analysis and understand common problems with datasets  · Ability to work independently and build relationships with engineers, financial analysts and business analysts  · Support system admin responsibilities such as deployment, configuration and patching for internally owned tools  · Must be comfortable with ambiguity and fast change with an ability to adapt quickly and easily  · Must have a high attention to detail and accuracy in all work products  Responsibility level  · Exercises minimal independent judgment with direction from supervisor     Skills  · Verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, attention to detail and interpersonal skills (Required)  · Basic ability to work independently and manage one’s time (Required)  · Basic knowledge of ETL concepts and data warehousing (Preferred)  · Basic knowledge of SQL and SSIS etc (Required)  · Able to read and understand scripting languages like Python, C#, .Net.    EDUCATION · Bachelor degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required. MBA or other related advanced degree preferred.  · 1-3 years relevant experience required  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Data Foundry is looking for a polished, energetic Business Analyst to join our Product Team. In this role you will help identify business needs and solutions that provide desired business outcomes to support our strategy, mission and vision. We need you to build and develop business processes, work flows and system requirements for the purpose of streamlining or improving existing systems. The Business Analyst is also responsible for understanding Data Foundry business models and translating business needs across the organization while ensuring internal business partner satisfaction.  Responsibilities: Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies.Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing worthwhile reports.Documenting and communicating results across various internal business units and stakeholders.Ensuring solutions meet the organizational needs and requirements.Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance.Updating, implementing and maintaining procedures.Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements. Requirements: Minimum of 3 years experience in business analysis or a related field.A bachelor's degree in Business or related field.Experience crafting engineering stories in Jira with detailed acceptance criteria.Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.Advanced technical skills and competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook.Excellent documentation skills.Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills.Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.About Us: Technically talented teams. A variety of challenging projects. Standard business hours that allow for an enjoyable work/life balance. And, the ability to contribute! This is what you can look forward to if you join our team. This position also offers a generous 401k profit-sharing plan, medical/dental insurance, vision discount plan, and generous paid time off.  Data Foundry, Inc. provides comprehensive wholesale and retail data center outsourcing, colocation, and disaster recovery services. The company provides its customers with secure premium facilities for servers and equipment, emergency workspace and carrier-neutral network accessibility, supported by experienced onsite technicians and customer support 24/7/365. The company supports more than 1,000 enterprise customers across a variety of industries including energy, healthcare and financial services. Founded in 1994, Data Foundry, Inc. was the first Internet Service Provider in San Antonio and one of the first 50 Internet Service Providers in the United States. Today, Data Foundry, Inc. operates data centers in Austin and Houston and owns private networks in Austin, Houston, San Antonio and Dallas.
