Name: Venture / Financial Analyst Intern
Description: We're looking for the crazy ones that want to change the world. If you're just looking for a job, this isn't for you.Introduction:Newchip is a meta-search engine and marketplace to find and compare investments in startups, real estate, robo-advisors, funds, and cryptocurrencies. Our technology consolidates investment opportunities from hundreds of platforms into a single easy-to-use marketplace-- think Kayak or Priceline for investing online. We connect our users to investments based on their interests, preferences, and goals via machine learning algorithms.We're a veteran founding team with decades of experience, numerous acquisitions under our belts, and we're looking for our next rockstar team member. We recently ranked in the Top 50 Global Startups of 2017 by G-Startups Worldwide, Top 100 VC Backed Startups by Crunchbase, have closed $2M+ in seed funding, and are continuing to scale and build out our team.If you're looking to make a difference in the world, we're here to provide the mentorship, leadership, and long-term growth potential to make that dream a reality. This is an opportunity to get in at the ground floor and grow exponentially as an individual and in the company.Checkout a quick video intro on us here:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d9zMfS9jNDsAbout you…You have experience with startups and venture capitalYou have a passion for startups, and technologyYou are analytical and can do independent research on the internetYou have excellent written communication skillsYou are outgoing and can talk to just about anyoneRole Overview:As a Venture / Financial Analyst Intern, you will be responsible for reviewing funding applications, nurturing companies through the selection process, and helping Newchip and it's partners select companies for our portfolios. You will be the one to ensure that our selection funnel is a well-oiled machine, moving the gears, and ultimately helping our companies be successful.The area of responsibility for this role is very wide and thus requires thorough knowledge and most importantly a passion to learn and be involved in various company processes from both a strategic and execution standpoint. To be successful in this role, you should have extensive knowledge in the startup scene, finance, and CRM software. Ultimately, you will help ensure we only work with companies that fit within ours and our partners business objectives.Over time, your success will be measured by three key metrics:The number of companies that make it through our funnel and join ours and our partners portfolios.The overall conversion rate of our conversion funnels from the point of application to listing.How many companies apply and are interested in crowd-investing and becoming part of the portfolio.Our dream candidate's #1 trait is a compelling hunger and passion to achieve something great in life and change the world. Experience can be gained over time but your passion and drive are what will make you stand out in applying and in the job.You’ll be working closely with the founders as we rapidly grow, deploy new technologies, and all of the birthing pains that come with it. We want team members that will do whatever it takes to get the job done. We're looking for people that can not only operate in the chaos of a startup, but thrive in it and earn a place in our family.We're looking for someone who is hyper-organized, resourceful, and that truly enjoys working in a team to achieve the company vision. Building a multi-platform marketplace is a complex operation, with lots of cross functional minor details and tasks to track. You must be able to prioritize needs between executives and departments, proactively reach out to offer and receive guidance from your team members, and solve roadblocks on your own.Our Mission:Entrepreneurism is the #1 global factor for improving social mobility, creating jobs, improving access to education and healthcare. Our mission is to change the world by connecting entrepreneurs around the world with the capital they deserve to make their dreams come true and most importantly provide returns for their investors. Industry Background:New regulatory changes enacted in the last year are enabling everyday people around the world to invest in what they believe in. We are helping take back control from the venture capitalist and Wall Street, putting it back into the hands of the masses for the first time in over 100 years.Market Size:We're at the precipice of a major global change in how people invest, how they interact with financial institutions, and manage their money.The U.S. industry alone is projected to have a global market cap of one hundred billion dollars by 2025. Newchip is perfectly positioned to gain a large piece of the market and we're building a team to go all the way with us to achieve it.Culture Fit:Hungry, humble, and a desire to do great things togetherComfortable working with founders and receiving feedbackDesire to establish a career + entrepreneurial/startup mindsetSeeks responsibility and understands the need for mentorshipComfortable filling multiple hats/roles + fast pace growth with companyResponsibilitiesYour primary focus will be around identifying, researching and communicating best practices for crowd-investment success for our portfolio of companies, and helping to nurture new companies through the selection process.You will help our portfolio companies meet the challenges of scaling their businesses as well as their campaign success by building a relevant network of executives, service-providers, corporates and growth stage investors.You will help organize meaningful events for our portfolio and bring leaders together to share what they know via our community and webinars.You will always be learning. One of your biggest challenges will be how to operationalize our transfer of knowledge and facilitate knowledge-share to and from time-strapped founders.You will help out on other related duties to meet the ongoing needs of Newchip, some of which we don't know about yet, and some of which you will help to define.You will have the opportunity to perform due diligence research on potential portfolio companies, design and execute marketing and biz-dev plans, attend business related events and conferences, and observe applicant company pitches.About Our InternshipsIntern positions are available immediately and typically last 3 - 4 months. We are accepting interns who can devote at minimum 20 hours per week but prefer 40 hours. We are flexible with schedules but interns may not work remotely. Our primary goal for our interns is education and the potential for new hires. We accept internships in the Fall, Spring, and Summer.Our aim is to encourage entrepreneurship and buffer the ecosystem that supports it. We hope our interns gain practical skills and real-world knowledge they can apply in the industries they're interested in.As a Venture / Investment Analyst Intern, you will collaborate with our finance and biz-dev team to research and uncover investment opportunities to enhance your investing acumen. The ideal candidate will have meaningful exposure to private company investing and a passion for quantitatively and qualitatively evaluating investment opportunities in the venture capital landscape. This internship will propel your career opportunities forward by giving you exposure and real responsibility to make an impact on a growing team. Prior interns have spent time supporting portfolio companies by assisting with financial models and pitch presentations while also researching new opportunities in FinTech. You will help with...Managing the Newchip application processSend out interview invitationsCollect and prepare the presentation decksCoordinate 1-on-1 interviews, both for selection and intreviewsScore and rank applications for selectionOn-boarding all new Newchip companiesKeeping Portfolio Overview documents up to date (weekly)Maintaining all social channels and contact listsCoordinating On-boarding Events such as:Company OrientationsCompany InterviewRequirementsA bachelor's degree in finance, business administration, economics, accounting, and or MBA, (graduated or graduating in the next 12-24 months)Ambitious and flexible, prepared to frequently step out of your comfort zone, work hard to deliver the team’s goals, and have a desire to create a positive, happy work environment.A strong drive and the ability to self-direct, especially on multiple projects at any one time. Our work and time is open-ended by nature and you must be able to identify and execute on opportunities to contribute to the team with little, if any, management or directionPersonable, engaging and able to build relationships quickly and easily.Able to research, assimilate and communicate complex ideas clearly and succinctly in writing and verbally. You will see the big picture, and you’ll sweat the tiniest details.A leader, and are able to initiate change with an ability to listen, counsel and coach.Have had exposure to the technology industry within a startup, leading technology company or consultancy.Have an outstanding network in the US startup scene.Graduated from a leading university with an excellent academic record.Underwrite and evaluate investments based risk and return fundamentalsAssist with deal structuring and the evaluation of term sheetsPrepare discounted cash flow analyses, competitive market analyses and development model analyses for current and pipeline opportunitiesJoin meetings with current and pipeline company management teams and co-investorsAssist in the preparation of pitch decks for companiesLimitless curiosity about business models, competitive dynamics and innovationAn interest in diving deep in more than one investment category, gaining exposure to companies across the financial technology landscape including cryptocurrency, trading platforms, data businesses and technology companies.Passion for high quality work and the ability to relentlessly pursue continuous improvementInterest in pursuing personal and professional growth by learning new principlesFamiliarity with Microsoft Office — specifically PowerPoint and ExcelHave been an assistant or played a support role at a previous organizationPassionate about working in the Austin startup scene and helping companies succeed.Organized and plan ahead, but you don’t get stressed out when things change at the last minute. Because they will. You roll with it.Write things down. You document your process and maintain records so that if you got hit by a bus we we’ll be very sad but still able to continue operating.Are professional and presentable and greet everyone cheerfully. Have a reliable laptop computer and smartphone.Are security aware. You have a passcode on your computer and phone and use a password manager.Comfortable with the Google Apps suite of products. You’re eager to learn about new tools and ways to be more productive.Get to Inbox Zero every day.Don’t gossip and have discretion.Have a cover letter and resume that demonstrates strong attention to detail and appreciation for a polished product.BenefitsStarting pay of $15-$30 per hour up to 20 hours per week depending on level of experience (room for growth into a full time position that will help launch a new type of venture fund)Competitive paid time off (vacation, sick days, and public holidays)Potential for full time hire with industry competitive salary + equity stock optionsFree weekly lunches, plus endless snacks and drink supplyRegularly planned team outings and company eventsStipend for training and career developmentOpportunity to make a meaningful impact in a revolutionary spaceWe're looking forward to meeting you and wish you the best of luck in the recruitment process!

Name: Business Analyst
Description: System Soft Technologies is widely recognized for its professionalism, strong corporate morals, customer satisfaction, and effective business practices. We provide a full spectrum of business and IT services and solutions, including custom application development, enterprise solutions, systems integration, mobility solutions, and business information management. System Soft Technologies combines business domain knowledge with industry-specific practices and methodologies to offer unique solutions, and enable clients to compete with global standards. We find a client-centric approach and a passion for excellence is key in distinguishing ourselves from our competition and in accompanying you on your journey. W2 / W2 contract onlyLOCALS PREFERRED - Min. 8+ years' of experience in Business Analyst-Business Process Analysis, documentation - Understanding business process management and business requirements of the customers and translating them to specific software requirements - Exceptional communication, presentation, organization and time management skills - Exceptional written and verbal communication skills - Ability to participate in various phases of testing (Execution of Plan, Design, Strategy, Coordination, Development, Quality Assurance and Execution) - Ability to participate in release and implementation processes For further clarifications email us at ramachandra.raju@sstech.us- provided by Dice  Business Process Analysis, documentation

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: High performing team members. Challenging projects. A stable and profitable company. And a great place to work! This is what you can expect if you join the Catapult Systems team. Founded in 1993 and headquartered in Austin, Texas, Catapult is an award winning Microsoft National Solution Provider (NSP) and was recently named a 2017 Partner of the Year Finalist in Cloud Productivity and the 2016 Microsoft Partner of the Year (U.S.). It is a very exciting time of growth for Catapult Systems, and we are currently hiring a Business Intelligence Analyst to provide technical leadership for our expanding team.  What do we attribute our award-winning success to? The people we hire, of course! We provide you the tools and leadership that you need to be successful, and then let you do what you do best. We enable you to make the decisions that you feel are in the best interest of our clients, and we trust your judgment. This type of ownership and independence, and an ongoing commitment to solving real business problems through the innovative use of Microsoft technologies, has resulted in Catapult being voted one of the best places to work year after year!What will my role be? As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be part of Catapult's growing productivity team and will be working with some great minds providing data solutions for various Catapult clients. In this role, you will work with our clients to convert their business requirements into technical solutions. The ideal candidate will have the ability to quickly understand the business issues and data challenges within a complex organization. What's required?First and foremost, you should enjoy what you do and have a great attitude!Ability to engage in customer settings and discern client business needsDesire to work in a team environment and ability to work across organization functional boundaries5-10+ years of Business Analysis and requirements' gathering experienceExperience with Microsoft BI stack technologies (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, PowerBI)Strong analytical and problem solving abilitiesAbility to make decisions and manage time effectively to a delivery plan/scheduleAbility to take ownership of delivery and work independently (or in a team) to accomplish joint goalsA bachelor's degreeThe ability to travel 20% So what are you waiting for?? If you are passionate about being a leader and want to work with smart people that are committed to accomplishing great things, then apply today!  Catapult offers an outstanding benefits package including 401(k) match, paid time off, flex spending accounts, identity theft protection, and medical, dental, and life insurance just to name a few.

Name: Junior Business Analyst
Description: About the Role: We are currently seeking a resource that would be interested in playing a role of a Business Analyst This job will have the following responsibilities:Demonstrated experience as a Business Analyst with track record of delivering business process requirements and use cases is required.Solid experience and understanding of Agile Scrum and Rational Unified Process Methodology in developing use cases, use case model, supplementary requirements, and business rules is essential.Solid understanding of relevant business issues.Qualifications & Requirements:Masters DegreeStrong interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving, influencing, prioritization, decision- making and conflict resolution skills.Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong knowledge of MS Project, Excel, MS Word and iGraphx or Visio Drawing tools along with general familiarity with Outlook and other MS Office applications is also required.Experience managing multiple large, complex and cross functional projects, with emphasis on systems, technologies, business process redesign, and knowledge of technical environments.

Name: Lead Business Analyst, BTA
Description: Business Summary: At VMware, we believe that software can unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our software forms a digital foundation that powers the apps, services and experiences that are transforming the world.  This year, VMware celebrates 20 years as an industry pioneer. When the company launched in February 1998, we transformed the data center forever by mainstreaming virtualization, the core principle of cloud computing. Twenty years later, we remain just as focused on innovating in everything we do, and committed to solving the most difficult technology problems for our customers. We apply the same principles of virtualization and software innovation to securely connect, manage and automate the world's complex digital infrastructure. And there's so much more to come.  We see opportunity to apply those principles to growing technology areas like IoT, edge computing, and AI, among others. We are optimistic about the power of technology to improve lives everywhere, with the potential to solve the big societal problems of today and tomorrow. Software, as we see it, has the power to transform business and humanity. We're here to make that happen.  Find out more about VMware at www.vmware.com/company. Job Description: This position is based in Austin, TX, USA, working with the Director, BTA (Business Transformation and Automation) Finance, in Palo Alto, CA.  You will possess an unusual blend of technical, business, and people skills to play a key role as a domain expert and technical consultant throughout the project life cycle of their assigned applications in the Finance Compensation area. The Lead analyst will be heavily involved in planning and implementation of various systems.  Core Responsibilities: Participate in and/or lead requirements gathering sessions for new system requirements or enhancements to existing systems for Finance applications like Global Payroll implementation (Payroll), Workday Cloud Connect payroll integrations and other finance projects; partner with multi functional groups through the systems development life cycle.Develop high quality documentation throughout the duration of projects, including collecting design decisions, system configuration, processes/workflow, data extracts and interface requirements, etc.Design and configure solutions, and partner with IT and the business to develop, test, and deploy such solutions, including integrations. Help support integrated testing strategies, and coordinate testing efforts with end users(during UAT), monitoring test execution, and providing metrics to leadership.Design and document any training material or user guides for systems implementation projects.Participate in data extraction/conversion exercises with business teams and IT for projects involving a change in the current application/vendor.Recommend internal processes and audit procedures to ensure Finance SOX controls compliance and data integrity of systems post go-live.Provide backup support on current Finance systems and cross train with team members in the BTA Finance team. Solve issues through triage and partnership with multi function teams.Prioritize requests with business teams.Attend and participate in team/staff/project meetings as scheduled and assigned. Required Skills: 10+ years experience designing and supporting large ERP systems2 years of Workday experience in any or all HCM/ Absence Management/ Payroll/ Time Tracking required.8-10 years of experience required in the areas of HR and Finance Particularly Payroll systems and Compensation areas is required.Knowledge/experience with some of the following Oracle financials, SAP ECC, Advanced Excel, Microsoft Visio and Power Point.Excellent written and verbal interpersonal skills.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills able to think through issues, and provide alternate solutions, which are well-thought-outOrganization skills to thrive in a dynamic, multi-tasking environment. Comfortable engaging with business and IT team members globally, and with external vendor project teams across different time zones.Ideal candidate should have a positive, upbeat attitude and a strong desire to pursue excellence in all that they do at work.Should be able to work independently, be a great teammate, and show ability to work well, and accurately under time and other constraints.Preferred Skills:B.S. degree in Business, Information Systems, Finance, or related area. Accounting background is a plus.PMP and/or Six Sigma certifications.Workday knowledge of the overall architecture, integration support and implementation experience preferred.Additional experience in finance or HR a huge plus.

Name: Sr Analyst, Release
Description: TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance.  TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR.JOB DESCRIPTION The Sr. Release Analyst is responsible for managing and maintaining all release mgmt. policies while holding teams accountable for on time delivery. This individual will monitor, analyze, identify and improve release management practices across all TriNet’s colleagues. This individual will work with multiple teams across the technology organization to drive a culture of continuity and consistency. The individual will collaborate with cross functional teams to define/redefine internal release processes ensuring that best practices are appropriately coupled with the necessary controls and creating relevant documentation to support the processes. He/She needs to be able to communicate with both management and individual application teams to create an environment where teams understand the shared vision for releases across the enterprise.The Sr. Release Analyst would also need strong interpersonal skills in areas such as facilitation, negotiation, and working with the Cross functional teams in both technology operations and the business. The Sr. Release Analyst is accountable to senior management for the proper design, execution, and improvement of the process. This individual needs to ensure that the process is being carried out, but does not run the day-to-day operation of the process. The Sr. Release Analyst owns the Release Management process and has the responsibility and authority for the overall process results. He/she is the main coordinator within this process and is the focal point regarding releases for Technology organization. The Release Manager will also need to work closely with the Change Manager and the Configuration Management processes to ensure that the shared CMDB is kept up-to-date following changes implemented by new releases.JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIESDefine and Manage the overall process and standard for release management and governanceCoordinate release schedules with Enterprise Release ManagerDevelop, publish, communicate and enforce release management policies and standards with Development teamsEnsure that the accountable parties implement and follow the established delivery processes and methodologiesMeasure release cadence and effectiveness using common metrics across the entire software portfolio.Facilitate cross-department coordination of release management functions.Please Note: TriNet reserves the right to change or modify job duties and assignments at any time. The above job description is not all encompassing. Position functions and qualifications may vary depending on business necessity.  TriNet is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants based on race, religion, color, disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), age, veteran status or other legally protected characteristics. Any applicant with a mental or physical disability who requires an accommodation during the application process should contact a company manager, a company officer or a TriNet HR representative to request such an accommodation.

Name: System Analyst - Java Application Support
Description: Everyone at Visa works with one goal in mind – making sure that Visa is the best way to pay and be paid, for everyone everywhere. This is our global vision and the common purpose that unites the entire Visa team. As a global payments technology company, tech is at the heart of what we do. CyberSource, a Visa company, has been and continues to be a pioneer within the e-Commerce Payment Management world. Our VisaNet network is capable of handling over 65,000 transaction messages per second for people and businesses around the world, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks.We are also global advocates for financial inclusion, working with partners around the world to help those who lack access to financial services join the global economy. Visa’s sponsorships, including the Olympics and FIFA™ World Cup, celebrate teamwork, diversity, and excellence throughout the world. If you have a passion to make a difference in the lives of people around the world, Visa offers an uncommon opportunity to build a strong, thriving career. Visa is fueled by our team of talented employees who continuously raise the bar on delivering the convenience and security of digital currency to people all over the world. Join our team and find out how Visa is everywhere you want to be.“Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.” We are seeking a System Analyst to work in the Distributed Systems, Operations and Engineering Application Support Team. The candidate will be responsible for managing and maintaining mission critical 24*7 applications. You'll be working in a face-paced environment and will be a liaison between the Product Office and Product Development. You will also be working closely with infrastructure, security and other teams as required. Responsibilities would include:•Level 2 Application Support for applications and services at Visa.•Change, Incident and Problem management according to Visa guidelines.•Participate in change planning, deployment and review.•Monitor incident queues, troubleshoot issues and lead conference calls with other groups to mitigate impacts.•Determine root cause of issues and document it in the appropriate system.•Project management for Information Technology initiatives.•Participate in on call rotation as assigned by manager.•Facilitate and attend meetings for Business and Information Technology initiatives.•Write and maintain programs and scripts to achieve Information Technology objectives.•Provide 24/7 support as needed and work with offshore teams to facilitate around the clock support for applications and services.Master’s and 1 years of experience in the job offered, or Bachelors and 3 years of work experience in the job offered.•1 or more years of experience in Level 2 application support for critical applications.•1 or more years of experience using change, incident and problem management systems such as Remedy, Service Now or equivalent.•1 or more years of experience planning, deploying and reviewing changes for critical applications.•1 or more years of experience troubleshooting and resolving incidents.•1 or more years of experience conducting root cause analysis.•1 or more years of experience leading or participating in projects for IT initiatives.•1 or more years of experience being on call in support of critical applications.•1 or more years of experience facilitating meetings for IT initiatives.•1 or more years of experience with Linux and/or Windows operating system.•1 or more years of experience supporting Java applications that run in Apache Tomcat, WebSphere or similar containers.•1 or more years of experience with relational databases such as Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server or equivalent.•1 or more years of experience with SQL.•1 or more years of experience writing scripts in BASH, PYTHON, Windows Shell or PowerShell or equivalent.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Name: Agreements Business Analyst
Description: Summary AppleCare Service Operations is looking for an Analyst to support responsibilities in our Speciality Operations Business Optimization team. This role is an opportunity for a self-driven individual to utilize his or her business insight, enhanced process knowledge, and apply analytical skills to deliver creative,valuable solutions to the Agreements team. The successful candidate will be responsible for process management and administrative tasks related to repairs with a main focus on analysis of AppleCare agreements/warranties processes and systems. This position will require you to collaborate and work with other groups. You will be expected to operate with a high degree of initiative, creativity, and leadership within division or department policy guidelines using independent judgment in achieving assigned objectives.  You will play a key role in producing measurable improvements for the Spec OPs team, by preserving the customer experience, identifying solutions and mitigating risks. This will be achieved through process mapping, root cause analysis, resolution recommendations, execution of operational strategies, and providing data-driven models to support the decision-making process. The Agreements Business Analyst needs to be adept in the use of statistical tools and techniques to be able to identify process gaps, recommend solutions to allow for data driven decision-making, and have the ability to crisply articulate findings to senior leadership and a passion for driving quality is desired.  3-5 years of comparable work experience  Strong experience with SAP preferred  Strong to advanced knowledge of Excel  Background in accounting or finance preferred  SQL experience is a plus  Strong experience in reporting, data mining, and ad hoc analysis  Strong written and verbal communication skills  Adaptive and flexible to changing technologies, process and environments  Able to work and make decisions with minimal supervision  Teammate, reliable and dependable  Strong leadership skills & project management experience a plus  Exemplary professional demeanor, resourcefulness, flexibility, and self-motivation  Ability to maintain a positive attitude in high stress/fast paced work environment  Ability to work non-standard business hours such as evenings or weekends as required Achieve and maintain a comprehensive understanding of AppleCare business, transaction handling, procedures, and systemsExamine and analyze transactions and case history to resolve refund issues and partner concernsMake decisions based on analysis, experience, and judgment; while aggressively seeking out expertise to assist in sound decisionsIdentify potential problems by monitoring trends in transaction errors or through analysis of reporting.Isolate and identify gaps and errors in system functionality as it relates to business process and programs.Work cross functionally with other Apple departments to ensure business needs are addressed.Provide data as required by management for periodic status reporting.Meet minimum team standards and understand the goals of the entire organization and actively participate in achievement of those goals.Establish, document, stage and transition processes as neededEnsure flawless implementation of new processes and procedures by validating completeness of training materials and process documents.Accurately scope out length and difficulty of tasks, and components of projects. Break work down into the process steps, anticipating and adjusting for problems and roadblocks.Recognize and act on opportunities for automation, integration and standardization of global processesParticipate in user acceptance testingEducation & Experience Bachelor’s degree required  MBA or Masters a plus

Name: Systems Analyst (Application Product Support)
Description: Common Purpose, Uncommon Opportunity. Everyone at Visa works with one goal in mind - making sure that Visa is the best way to pay and be paid, for everyone everywhere . This is our global vision and the common purpose that unites the entire Visa team. As a global payments technology company, tech is at the heart of what we do: Our VisaNet network processes over 13,000 transactions per second for people and businesses around the world, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks. We are also global advocates for financial inclusion, working with partners around the world to help those who lack access to financial services join the global economy. Visa's sponsorships, including the Olympics and FIFA™ World Cup, celebrate teamwork, diversity, and excellence throughout the world. If you have a passion to make a difference in the lives of people around the world, Visa offers an uncommon opportunity to build a strong, thriving career. Visa is fueled by our team of talented employees who continuously raise the bar on delivering the convenience and security of digital currency to people all over the world. Join our team and find out how Visa is everywhere you want to be.  The Systems Analyst a.k.a. Application Production Support Level 2 Engineer is part of a team responsible to provide successful implementation and management of Visa services (applications under Visa Information Management (Commercial Cards)) in the test and production environments. Ensuring the service meets the corporate quality, security and compliance standards, and providing the documentation for the ongoing support and maintenance of the systems. Responsibilities:Responsible for providing 24X7 Application Support across multiple Visa applicationsResponsible for applying code and operation break fixes and other proactive maintenance activities to keep the services up and runningResponsible for evaluating the Issues reported by Visa clients and members and providing ongoing solutionsResponsible for managing the performance and tuning of several Visa applicationsWill be responsible for managing the service and ticket SLAs and managing the workflow to achieve the SLAs.Minimum 4 years’ experience in working with Apache, Tomcat, WebSphere, IBM-IHS web server, LDAP, Siteminder/ForgeRock, IBM MQIntermediate level of knowledge on UNIX/Linux/AIX/Windows OSMinimum 3 years’ experience in Production support working in a globally distributed teamWorking experience on Java, J2EE and Perl Script technologiesExperience in working with Db2 UDB, Oracle DB’s and MYSQL, DML/DDL SQLs and Store PROCsExperience with ServiceNow and ticketing workflows is preferredWorking experience with monitoring tools like Splunk or any other monitoring tools/processes will be advantageousGood in handling certificate renewal process and handling security remediation on Linux/Solaris/AIX serversIntermediate level of experience in scripting language (Shell script, Perl, Python, Bash) and expertise in automationPrior working experience with card and transaction domains will be advantageousGood understanding on N-tier architecture and network data flows.A bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering or related field requiredShould have a technical and business mindsetISO 9000 and ITIL experience will be advantageous     All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Name: Entry Level Part-Time Business Analyst
Description: milk + honey is a thriving collection of premier spa and salons in Austin and Houston, Texas, offering a full range of services including massage, facials, waxing, natural nail therapy, hair care, makeup application, and bridal packages in a modern, inviting space.milk + honey abides by and exemplifies its core Four Principles, which have become an essential part of our processes, culture, and growth:Care. Do more with less.milk + honey is looking for an exceptional part-time Business Analyst to join our growing team!Underlying the award-winning services that milk + honey provides in its locations is technology and data which allow us to work efficiently and with intelligence. The Business Analyst will support milk + honeys current business intelligence help to develop new systems to support milk + honeys future growth.The part-time Business Analyst is a new role that will report to the Controller and work closely with the co-founder of milk + honey to ensure that the milk + honey leadership team is provided with actionable business insights. This part time position will average between 20-25 hours per week. The Business Analyst will work with a variety of data sources to create reports, dashboards, and visualizations to support sound data-driven decision making. milk + honey does most of its business reporting using a tool called Domo. While milk + honey is a 12-year-old company with a long term track record of success, we have a growth oriented mentality and needs team members to wear multiple hats.Responsibilities:Manage milk + honeys data and analytics strategyCollaborate with senior leaders to identify their data needs and help create solutions that address these needsUse Domo, Google Sheets, and Excel to bring together dozens of data sources and create data processing scripts for large volumes of dataCreate useful business processes, dashboards, and visualizationsAnalyzes marketplace and industry trends and best practicesPartner with cross functional teams to support systems development and projects focused on future growth and investmentSupport Controller in budgeting process and reporting needsSupport payroll function by automating specific wage reportsQualifications:1-2 years of experience in data science, business analytics, business intelligence or similar tasks, including data warehousing and business intelligence toolsUnderstanding of business metrics (financial, operational, and marketing)Eagerness to bolster your skillset around business analyticsKnowledge of BI software (particularly Domo) , Google Sheets, ExcelBasic knowledge of SQL or ETL conceptsDegree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Business, Economics or comparable work experienceUnderstanding of how to use data to tell a story to non-technical audienceAbility and willingness to learn new applicationsExceptional communication skills; verbal and writtenSelf-driven, conscientious individual who is detailed and organizedCreativity and common sense to determine the best solution for a real-world problem with quantitative dataWillingness to question the validity and accuracy of dataEnjoys collaborating with others in team environment

Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: Description As part of the WebCenter Content (WCC) team, the Business Analyst will work with stakeholders from all Emerson Business Units and World Areas to ensure business requirements are written clearly so the technical staff can respond with design and implementation details that meet the needs of the customer. The employee must be a skilled multitasker, able to handle multiple projects in various states across different teams. They will drive project teams to the agreed upon schedules and ensure any impediments are escalated quickly and appropriately. The incumbent will be the key liaison between the business owners and the WCC technical staff, ensuring business owners understand the WCC processes and standards to be followed. The Business Analyst will often serve as the WCC team representative during interactions with our internal customers. The candidate should be able to stay focused on the positions fundamental goals and identify/drive activities and deliverables to meet them. ResponsibilitiesIdentify, analyze, and validate key business requirements and business objectivesInterview business owners for clarification on business requirements and generate process flows and unit test cases to support the projectEducate business owners about WCC system, standards, and processesCollaborate and build relationships between IT and business organizationsManage acceptance testing, documentation, and prioritizationContribute to project plans driven by Project Manager and own project plans for smaller implementations to ensure projects remain on track and within budgetInvestigate and resolve both project and production issues as neededFollow a prescribed Software Development Life Cycle to manage project and changes. Knowledge of Serena Business Manager a plus.Analyze risks and constraints involved in project/change requests, working with business to get buy in and signoffAdditional Information This position is located in Round Rock, Texas. Travel could be requested, but typically limited to one trip a year.

Name: Business Analyst

Strong interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving, influencing, prioritization, decision- making and conflict resolution skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. * Strong knowledge of MS Project, Excel, MS Word and iGraphx or Visio Drawing tools along with general familiarity with Outlook and other MS Office applications is also required. * The following is preferred but not required: Experience managing multiple large, complex and cross functional projects, with emphasis on systems, technologies, business process redesign, and knowledge of technical environments, a background in the financial services industry * BA/BS degree and/or PMP certification. Name: Business Analyst, Global Partner Success
Description: About HomeAway:HomeAway, a world leader in the vacation rental industry, is the place to book beach houses, cabins, and condos with more than two million places to stay in 190 countries. The site makes it easy to find and book the perfect vacation rental for any getaway, often for less than the cost of traditional hotel accommodations. HomeAway is part of the Expedia Group family of brands. What youll do: As member of a team of four expert commissions analysts that owns the global commission process from portfolio creation, quota setting, attainment calculation, processes and procedures, analysis and recommendations. The team is self-sufficient, has high energy and utilizes an agile methodology approach to business challenges. Since the responsibility is immense, the organization implements regular peer reviews and partnerships with other business units to deliver excellent and accurate work. Feedback and retrospectives are a crucial input to our process to improve and continuously refine our work product.  The Commissions team is one of the three pillars of Global Partner Success Operations (GPSO), and the culture we champion is based on collaboration, cross-functionality, and openness. We strive to deliver quotas and compensation that is accurate, on-time, and insightful while maintaining a fun work environment. Striving towards a deep understanding of the subject matter as we use the scientific methodology to test and learn from our operations and decisions. Day-to-day responsibilitiesYou will be responsible for designing, managing and communicating processes of administration, documentation, and payment of monthly/quarterly/annual Partner Success (PS) commissions globally including conducting formal meetings with PS managers and directors for monthly reviewLead the full cycle of the companys variable compensation process, including documentation, calculations, and sign-off workflowYou will support monthly/quarterly Net Book Value and New Listings quota striving towards archiving company top line objectives.Enthusiastically utilize your quantitative and qualitative analytics and advanced technical skills and technology to extract data from multiple sources and provide clear output for decision-making.Maintain procedural documentation while collaborating with the GPSO partners and the internal teams to drive consistency and clarity as there are communicated to the rest of the organization.Who you are: Are you someone that loves working with data, building and maintaining models, reports and solving challenges? Are you passionate about data-driven decisions based on meaningful analysis? HomeAway is looking for a dynamic Commissions Analyst on the Global Partner Success Operations (GPSO) team to dive in and provide expertise in attainment, commissions calculations and quota setting modeling. This role reports to the Senior Manager, Global Partner Success Operations and collaborates actively with the Partner Success management teams, Human Resources, and Finance to ensure alignment of plans, policy, and adoption. The commissions analyst also works closely with our reporting and analytics team to develop and deliver a robust quota and technology infrastructure. Highly proficient in portfolio creation, modeling for quota setting, commissions calculations and compensation plan implementation (5+ years experience)Proficient in global labor laws principals and payroll processesAdvanced Excel knowledge a requirement.Proficient written and verbal skills to deliver results and methodologies to global senior leadership.Proficient in SQL, Tableau, Qubole, Salesforce specifically for data querying, model creation, and analysis content and message creation.Knowledgeable on statistical analysis and modeling design based on Trending, Account planning, Business insight and Regression models for quota creation and portfolio allocation methodologiesAbility to be self-sufficient and work in an agile environment thats dynamic and evolving constantly towards achieving best in class processes, tools, technologies and outputAbility to lead and established relationships with peers, cross-functional team members, and product usersShown history of workplace flexibility and continued desire to learnUnderstanding of basic GAAP principlesStrong organization skills, time management and ability to multi-taskBenefits & Perks:Competitive health and insurance benefits.Competitive salary.Annual target bonus or commission.Parental leave for up to 20 weeks (dependent on eligibility).Paid vacation and sick time.Employee Stock Purchase Program.Free snacks and beverages.Frequent company update talks with our leadership team.Free listing on HomeAway.com.Electronic, adjustable stand-up desk.Discounted Metro & Rail pass.Casual dress.Why join us: Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them to tools to do so.  Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.  Our family of travel brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Egencia®, trivago®, HomeAway®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Wotif®, lastminute.com.au®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Hotwire®, Classic Vacations®, Expedia® Media Solutions, CarRentals.com, Expedia Local Expert®, Expedia® CruiseShipCenters®, SilverRail Technologies, Inc., ALICE and Traveldoo®.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description: About GoDaddy GoDaddy powers the world's largest cloud platform dedicated to small, independent ventures. With nearly 18 million customers worldwide and over 77 million domain names under management, GoDaddy is the place people come to name their idea, build a professional website, attract customers and manage their work. Our mission is to give our customers the tools, insights and the people to transform their ideas and personal initiative into success. To learn more about the company visit www.GoDaddy.com.  What is the opportunity?  We are looking for a savvy individual who is part analyst, part data expert, and part strategic business partner. If you enjoy using data to answer key business questions, while building systems that scale and enable both business owners and fellow analysts, this may be the job for you! Your goal as a Senior Business Analyst will be to use your unique skill set to create leverage through repeatable reporting and analytics that can be used by the entire organization.  Here’s a sampling of what you’ll tackle in this role: Build Data Sets and Dashboards that Fulfill Real Company Needs: Consult with fellow analysts and leaders in sales, marketing, and customer operations to define data needs, and build/validate shared Tableau data sets that meet needs. Build out initial dashboards to prime the pump and minimize time to value. Gather Insights from Data: Use data to tell a story. Routinely analyze operational data, share insights, and make recommendations for additional KPIs.Become a Thought Leader: Be the subject matter expert on the BI team for all things related to data infrastructure, data governance, SQL skills, and smart Tableau buildout. Uplevel the team by guiding us through particularly complex report building or data modeling problems.Influence Business Intelligence Roadmap: Consolidate input from analysts and business owners across the company to make recommendations on next areas of engineering investment. Roadmap could include additional Tableau data sets, enhancements to existing PostgreSQL reporting database, or integration of entirely new data sources.Maintain Partnerships: Maintain relationships with product management, engineering, and customer facing groups. Work closely with these groups to define requirements, project manage initiatives, and troubleshoot problems with existing data ecosystem.Represent BI in Future Data Integration/Migration Activities: Work with Godaddy engineering teams to define prioritization and timing of future migration to GDDY data infrastructure. Implement integration/migration as needed.Ad hoc Modeling/Analysis: We are all analysts at heart. We pride ourselves in our flexibility and are able to dive in to tackle urgent modeling and analysis needs. In addition to building out our reporting infrastructure. You will have ample opportunity to solve one-off analysis problems through models and visualizations.What will it take to succeed?5+ years of experience as a business analyst, data analyst, or in a similar data-focused capacityAdvanced Excel and SQL skillsExperience with business intelligence software, particularly TableauDemonstrated analytical skills and problem-solving acumenStrong written and oral communication skillsExperience consulting with business owners to identify reporting needs and translate needs to automated, scalable systemsHighly motivated self-starter able to take ownership of analysis projects from start to finishPassion for working in a fast-paced environment, with an ability to adapt quickly to changing prioritiesProject management skillsEnthusiasm for local businesses and a fit with GoDaddy valuesBonus points for: Exposure to CRM (Salesforce.com preferred) and other business systemsExperience with local or SMB recurring revenue modelWhy is it exciting?You will work with leaders around the organization to define and build out our reporting infrastructure. We have taken steps to decrease our reliance on Excel, but you will be a driving force in taking us to the next level of driving automated insights and analysis deeper in the organization.This role will report directly to the VP Finance, with close relationships to both customer facing and product teams. You’ll collaborate with executives to instrument and analyze the engine of the company.What are the benefits and perks?Mission-driven, values-based culture.Unlimited paid time off, plus company holidays.100% paid medical, dental, and vision option.401(k) match.Employee Stock Purchase Program. GoDaddy is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of age, race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, medical condition, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status or civil partnership/union status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, childbirth, genetic information, military and veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state or local law. GoDaddy will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with local and federal requirements.  If you need assistance completing an application for a position with us, please reach out to our Recruiting Team at Recruiting@godaddy.com  To submit your application to this position, please click Apply . On the next screen, after you click Apply, click Create to establish your candidate account. If you have previously created a candidate account, please slick Sign-In and use that account to complete your application.

Name: HR Systems Analyst - Workday Core HCM
Description: Visa operates the world's largest retail electronic payments network and is one of the most recognized global financial services brands. Visa facilitates global commerce through the transfer of value and information among financial institutions, merchants, consumers, businesses and government entities. We offer a range of branded payment product platforms, which our financial institution clients use to develop and offer credit, charge, deferred debit, prepaid and cash access programs to cardholders. Visa's card platforms provide consumers, businesses, merchants and government entities with a secure, convenient and reliable way to pay and be paid in 170 countries and territories.  Visa’s Corporate IT (CIT) organization is adding an HR Systems Analyst role to it's HR Technology team to work across the portfolio but focus primarily on Workday Human Capital Management (HCM).  Imagine yourself as part of the team that is building the future of HR Technology at Visa. We need you to leverage your hands-on Workday configuration experience to design, build and deliver Technology solutions with successful outcomes. You will be empowered to innovate the future of our HR Technology strategy and will deliver with excellence. You will not take orders; you will build deep partnerships with our HR partners and champion proactive new ways Technology can advance our employees’ development. You will plug into a team entirely located in Austin, TX where you work closely with passionate, hard working leaders who leverage Technology to make our employees lives and careers better. Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: Job Description:Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related field At least 5 years of experience working with IT systems and knowledge of SDLC process3+ years experience working in a corporate Web/Internet focus area.Solid understanding of the challenges and opportunities the web offers in today's commercial worldKnowledge of enterprise ecommerce systems such as ATG, Blue Martini, Sterling Commerce, IBM Commerce, Microsoft Commerce, Comergent, etc.Knowledge of enterprise CMS systems such as Day, Interwoven, Documentum, Vignette, FileNet, etc.Ability to conduct user workshops, define requirements, write use and business cases, and design workflow processes.Assist in creating backlog acceptance criteria documents, design documents, and process flow diagrams that technical development team can use for application development.Strong written and oral communication skills.Ability to communicate with internal customers and team members in a non-technical manner.Must be able to work with and effectively communicate (listen, speak, present and write) to all levels of management and build working relationship with others outside of the Team.Ability to organize, disseminate information efficiently and set expectations.Ability to multi-task and work with cross-functional teams in a very fast- paced environment.Strong time management skills, prioritization abilities and "take ownership of issues and task .Ability to work as a team member and contribute to the overall success of a team as well as work independently and handle multiple tasks.Must be self confident, assertive and self-motivated.

Name: Business Analyst, Customer Operations
Description: What is the opportunity? The Business Intelligence team is looking for an experienced analyst to focus on customer operations and retention. As a business analyst, your goal will be to use data analysis to yield new insights about our customer base and make recommendations for increasing revenue and operational efficiency.  Here's a sampling of what you'll tackle in this role: Own reporting for our Customer Operations team: Identify key performance indicators and design reporting for stakeholders across all levels (individual contributors to the COO) and functions (customer success, onboarding, content, operational excellence). Build both xls and Tableau reports that deliver actionable insights to the team.Dive deep into customer data:You will be tasked with developing a deep understanding of key retention drivers like customer demographics, pricing and product selectionBuild models to forecast retention and operations:You will build a variety of models to answer operational and financial questions. For example, these models will help us to assess retention impact of operational initiatives, project hiring needs, evaluate new opportunities, and create long range operational and financial forecasts.Dive deep into our Customer Operations organization: As the key data partner for our Customer Operations organization, you will need to develop an intimate knowledge of the inner workings of our business processes and the customer life cycleInterface with Product Team: Use your customer retention expertise to help inform the roadmap for our Product teams by being a thought partner for new product and process roll-outsWhat will it take to succeed?3-5+ years of experience as a data analyst or in a similar data-focused capacityDemonstrated analytical skills and problem-solving acumenHighly motivated and able to take ownership of analysis projects from start to finishPassion for working in a fast-paced environment, with an ability to adapt quickly to changing prioritiesStrong communication skills, and the ability to translate the results of complex analysis into a simple and actionable explanationAn exemplary work ethic, a "get it done" attitude, and high personal accountabilityEnthusiasm for local businesses and a fit with Main Street Hub valuesExcellent Excel and SQL skills are a mustExperience with business intelligence software, particularly Tableau, is a plusBonus points for:Exposure to CRM and marketing automation systems (Salesforce.com preferred).Familiarity with the Local/SMB spaceWhy is it exciting?You will play an integral role in shaping growth strategy across the entire companyThis role will report directly to the Vice President of Finance, with close relationships with the Customer Operations and Product teams. You'll get a well-rounded view into the inner-workings of the organization, and build relationships with key individuals across the companyWhat are the benefits and perks?Mission-driven, values-based culture.Unlimited paid time off, plus company holidays.100% paid medical, dental, and vision option.401(k) match.Employee Stock Purchase Program.

Name: Business Analyst (Salesforce Service Cloud)
Description: Job DescriptionWe live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity. Data and technology are transforming industries, society, and even the workplace by creating professions that did not exist before the emergence of data, cloud, social, and mobile technologies.  As the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, IBM is a leader in this global transformation and is just the place to continue your career. Network in an open, friendly and flexible work environment where diversity is embraced, while new and creative ways of thinking are encouraged and supported. As an IBMer, you can change the way the world works. Join this IBM team and be part of a diverse and global company of thinkers and doerspeople who want to make an impact, cultivate their expertise and collaborate with some of the worlds top business and technology professionals.  The Client Support IT team is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our high-performing application development team. Our portfolio of applications spans electronic support, call/problem management, and entitlement systems. We operate and transform the capabilities for IBM worldwide technical support which is key to IBMs growth.  IBM is focused on the client experience. A key measurement of client satisfaction is the Net Promoter Score (NPS). In this role, you will be responsible for driving NPS improvements for clients as well as IBM support professionals. Youll work with the support and transformation leadership teams to gather, analyze and drive change using client satisfaction data, direct client interaction, and executives from across the IBM support organization. Working with the development teams, you will develop actions to improve NPS scores and communicate the progress to executive leadership as well as the IBM support teams. This position will require the ability to work across management matrices and also leverages strong Agile and iteration management skills. Who you are:Self-motivated and self-managed with a demonstrated analytical ability and curiosityTakes creative approaches to problem solving, innovation, and issue resolutionWorks independently and within a team settingStrong oral and written communication skillsFluent in EnglishLive in or willing to move to Armonk NY, Austin TX, Littleton MA, or Raleigh NC to work collaboratively in the officeHow well help you grow:This role will give you executive visibility and the chance to show that you can drive impactful change.Offer an opportunity to be a part of a hardworking team in a collaborative, borderless organization in an inspiring, empowered environmentProvide a place where youre proud to work and where you are motivated to produce the best results possible No remote opportunities exist  Must have the ability to work in the US without current/future need for IBM sponsorshipRequired Technical and Professional Expertise 10+ years of experience with IBM support or development processAbility to work with both the business and technical resources to understand and define functional/technical requirements Ability to use Agile collaboration tools (e.g. Mural, Slack, RTC, Trello)Working familiarity with Agile development conceptsMust have excellent communication skills Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Subject matter expert in Salesforce Service CloudFamiliarity with IBM brand and business structure EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Senior Retail Systems Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe Senior Retail Systems Business Analyst will work within a growing and highly visible retail systems portfolio, which is undergoing transformational change. The position will be responsible for driving and defining requirements to enable solutions that align to Whole Foods business objectives and are built for scalability, maintainability, and operability. While defining effective requirements is a key part of the position, the Business Analyst will lead and participate in all phases of projects. The position will serve as a subject matter expert within capabilities being delivered. We are looking for people with strong initiative, drive for results, and passion for delivering value to our stores, team members, and customers.Responsibilities Include:Ownership and development of requirements strategy.Drives, and participates in, gathering and progressive elaboration of requirements under direction of product owner. Ensures requirements have acceptance criteria, are testable and traceable.Facilitates work with the architects, and impacted teams, to translate requirements into detailed functional designs for development, testing, and implementation. Supports the Product Owners in grooming items in the Retail Demand backlog.Subject matter expert on the business requirements/capabilities being delivered. Identifies, communicates and drives to resolution, risks and issues impacting business rules, requirements, and specifications. Lead, and assist, in managing the scope of applications and related changes.Approves functional test scenarios for quality assurance. Collaborates with stakeholders on the evaluation of the feasibility, effort, and costs to implement requirements.Participates in the creation of training materials and may assist with user orientation and training. Effective vendor collaboration, and management, to deliver project results.Participates in the development of new business process.Lead ad hoc solution efforts.Qualifications:5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst.5+ years working experience with SDLC and associated deliverables within each phase, as well as adherence to change control.At least 1 year of experience in either Retail or POS Systems.Must have analytical/elicitation skills to ask the right questions of business partners, dissect, organize, translate and cross reference requirements.Must have strong problem solving and analytical skills, and be detail orientated.Great communication skills and best practices, leveraged while communicating across executive leadership, business and technical teams.Ability to lead various efforts across teams.Strong initiative and strength in delivering results.Able to articulate complex technical topics for non-technical audiences.Bring a breadth of business and technology experience.Experience working on a highly visible, complex, and business critical portfolio.Knowledge of PCI and SOX regulations, as well as applicable data privacy practices and laws.Experience with payment processing and integration across various forms of tenders.Experience operating within large program, managing multiple priorities in a fast paced and date driven environment.Experience delivering enterprise-minded, holistic solutions within the store systems space.At Whole Foods Market we provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all team members and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. Whole Foods Market hires and promotes individuals solely on the basis of their qualifications for the position to be filled.

Name: Business Analyst II
Description: Position Purpose: Perform various analysis and interpretation to link business needs and objectives for assigned function Support business initiatives through data analysis, identification of implementation barriers and user acceptance testing of new systemsIdentify and analyze user requirements, procedures, and problems to improve existing processesPerform detailed analysis on assigned projects, recommend potential business solutions and assist with implementationIdentify ways to enhance performance management and operational reports related to new business implementation processesDevelop and incorporate organizational best practices into business applicationsLead problem solving and coordination efforts between various business unitsAssist with formulating and updating departmental policies and proceduresQualifications:Education/Experience:Bachelors degree in related field or equivalent experience.2-4 years of business process or data analysis experience, preferably in healthcare.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Applications, including Excel and Access preferred.Project management experience preferred.

Name: Business Analyst III
Description: POSITION TITLE: Business Analyst IIIPOSITION OVERVIEW: The Business Analyst (BA) position at the Texas Education Agency works on multiple projects that support the mission of the agency of improving outcomes for Texas students. This position performs advanced, senior-level business analysis work. The business analyst serves as the conduit between the program/customer community and the software development team through which requirements flow. This position may support more than one project or be assigned to special projects at any time. This BA will be involved at some level throughout the entire software development life cycle. Upon establishment of the requirements baseline, the focus is shifted towards the management of the requirements specification and verifying the fulfillment of all requirements, including requirements for enhancements post-implementation. This position will report to the managers under the Assistant Director of Business Management within the Office of Information Technology Services. In addition, the business analyst is also responsible for:the review, assessment, and development of business processes, assisting with user acceptance testing,the performance of post-implementation support of systems,research and special project support provided to users.Please note that attachments, including resumes and cover letters, will not be considered for this position.Additionally, please be sure to respond to the short answer prompts found in the supplemental questions. These responses should be attached to application submission.Applicants who are strongly being considered for employment must submit to a national criminal history background check.Additional Military Crosswalk (occupational specialty code) information can be accessed at: https://bit.ly/2Kx9BcU ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSOversees the service request life cycle through customer-related service request responses, business requirements coordination, technical specifications and related artifacts review, and monitoring system integration and user acceptance testing prior to implementationCoordinates and/or analyzes user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate or improve existing systems; and coordinates and/or analyzes computer system capabilities, workflow, and scheduling limitationsElicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, storyboards, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, event lists, business analysis, competitive product analysis, task and workflow analysis, and/or viewpointsOrganizes and facilitates joint application development (JAD) sessions or meets one-on-one with internal customers to elicit system requirementsWrite requirements specifications per standard templates, using natural language simply, clearly, unambiguously, and conciselyMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Education: Graduation from an accredited four-year college or universityExperience: At least five (5) years of experience in deriving requirements from interviews with customers and creating system requirements documents based on the interviews. Work experience in conducting a complete and detailed analysis of business processes is required. Substitutions: Each additional year of related experience above the required minimum may substitute for education on a year-for-year basis. OTHER QUALIFICATIONS:Experience with software development life cycle and systems development life cycle concepts Experience with contemporary requirements elicitation, analysis, specification, verification, and management practices and the ability to apply them in practiceUnderstanding of requirements engineering according to software lifecycle methodologies in a team environment, including AgileExperience and skill in analyzing and evaluating complex information technology programs, policies, and issuesExperience and skill in developing workable solutions to complex problems and issuesInterviewing and listening skills to talk with individuals and understand their needs and elicit the essential requirements informationAnalytical skills to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a more general understandingFacilitation and observational skills to lead requirements elicitation workshopsWriting ability to communicate information effectively to program area customers, managers and technical staff Organizational skills to work with the vast array of information gathered during elicitation and analysis and to cope with a rapidly changing environment Interpersonal skills to help negotiate priorities and to resolve conflicts among project stakeholdersUnderstanding, experience, and development of use casesAbility to work on multiple projects at the same time and work constructively as part of a team or teams to coordinate with developers and business users to analyze system characteristicsAbility to communicate technical concepts to professional, non-technical clients or program areasMISSION: The Texas Education Agency (TEA) will improve outcomes for all public school students in the state by providing leadership, guidance, and support to school systems.
