Name: Watson Health - Business Analyst Lead
Description: Job Description As a Lead Business Analyst, you will provide subject matter expertise both internally and externally to the data warehouse center of excellence and customers alike. You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You must enjoy spending time in the market to understand their problems, and find innovative solutions for the broader market. You must be able to communicate with all areas of the company. You will work with an engineering counterpart to define product release requirements. You may be asked to travel as is necessary. You will oversee day-to-day activities of the business analyst team responsible for specifying business requirements to support the technical design and application development of healthcare reporting solutions. Essential Responsibilities:Lead a multi-disciplinary team of Business Analysts in a rapid and ever changing business environment.Lead the customer through steps of Agile/Iterative Methodology associated with the delivery of BI solutions; Requirements, Design, Development, System Test, User Acceptance Test and OperationsResponsible for facilitating customer Requirement Analysis Sessions (RAS) and is responsible for capturing and documenting customer business process models (BPM)Acts as a representative from the business area and to identify and refine their requirements for information, informing the creation of a warehouse data modelInteracts with functional users and data stewards/SME to ensure that all the proper questions have been identified and answered satisfactorilyClarify issues relating to scope and business requirements for project team (including technical implementation team, project management and client management)Assists Quality Assurance team with development, execution, and documentation of test casesWorks to identify and document data quality issuesAssists Data Modelers and Data Analysts in assuring requirements are traceable between the source data and target tables/entities in the respective data modelsLeads RAS sessions with clientsWorks with Implementation and Development leads to translate and map business requirements to technical requirements/specificationsDefines scope of work for work proposed to meet business requirementsDefine business requirements for change requests, investigate issues/defects and define remediation requirementsOversee the day to day activities of the Business Analysis team including but not limited to assignments, scheduling, performance evaluationPlays a role in the accounts leadership team, communicating across technical and delivery towers, in support of the Account Executive's ability to deliver on the contract requirements. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Ability to work on site in Santa Fe, NM 5 days a week3-5+ years of experience with Medicaid10+ years experience as business analyst for data warehouse OR business intelligence projects.Experience with large scale system development.Demonstrated ability to understand industry issues and problems, relate them to clients' needs, and propose appropriate solutionsExcellent organization skills, ability to take initiative and work independently or as a member of a small team.Excellent interpersonal skills and relationship building, ability to collaborate and build consensusDesire to continue learning more about healthcare and the technologies supporting healthcare dataStrong presenter, comfortable presenting in front of customers, conveying status, answering Q&ADemonstrated ability to convey complex ideas in an easily understood manner to guide audience through written or verbal communications Preferred Tech and Prof Experience PREFERRED Skills and Experience:Previous experience as a business analyst working with software developersKnowledgeable in technology, specifically data warehousingCompetent in at least one BI technology (e.g. Cognos, Business Objects, Tableau)Competent in at least one analytics technology (e.g. SAS, R, SPSS)Competent in at least on geospatial technology (e.g. mapinfo, ESRI)Understanding of both technical and business process MITA requirements EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Name: Senior Business Analyst - Customer Success
Description: Headquartered in the Bay Area with offices in Jaipur, India and Austin, Texas, venture-funded, Punchh is the world leader in innovative digital marketing products for brick and mortar retailers, combining AI and machine learning technologies, mobile-first expertise, and omni-channel communications designed to dramatically increase lifetime customer value. Leading global chains in the restaurant, health and beauty sectors rely on Punchh to grow revenue by building customer relationships at every stage to becoming brand loyalists, including more than 100 different chains representing more than $12B in annual spend, 30,000 locations globally, 26M+ consumers, and 1M+ transactions daily. Punchh boasts a customer list that includes Pizza Hut, Quiznos, Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf and many more. JOB REQUIREMENT The business analyst position is reporting directly to the head of data science, and will develop a close work relationship with the senior members of our Customer Success (CS) org. He/she will leverage prior industrial experience in business analytics, and help solve the most relevant business problems from our clients.  He/she will not only become our business domain expert, but also play a critical role in defining Punchh's best practices in data-driven decision making. This is a challenging role that requires strong project management, time management and communication skills. The job responsibilities include: Participate in client calls with senior marketing executives to understand business needs and define reporting solutionsWork with the CS managers to develop insightful analytic report for our clients. Make actionable business recommendations. Define performance measurement / KPI / recurring reports.One of the key owners of the quarterly business review process that highlight the relevant business opportunities.Be a key liaison between the data and CS teams to:Quantify technical and business requirements of our data productsEnsure high quality of our data warehouseRepresent company's expertise in advanced analytics in a variety of media outlets such as client interactions, conferences, blogs and interviews.Occasional business travels are required.QUALIFICATIONSStrong business acumen, presentation and client communication skills. This role requires excellent written, verbal and presentation skills. Candidates must be able to articulate well the requirements and solutions to business clients.5+ years of experience in business analyst role with proven analytic skills.Advanced degree in business, economics, statistics or other related fields, with a strong interest in marketing technology.Must have excellent statistical / analytical skills with advanced knowledge in data visualization, Tableau, Excel, etc.Exceptional client relationship management skills.Must have extensive experience as a super user of big data technologies, i.e. relational, NoSQL or Hadoop.BENEFITSHealth benefits - medical, vision and dental401K plan without a wait periodWe have a PTO programCompetitive salaries, bonus and stock optionsWe help you master your craft and grow your careerFree lunch every day, plus a well stocked refrigerator

Name: Geospatial Project Manager / Business Analyst
Description: Map out your career at WSB, recognized as a top workplace for the sixth consecutive year and the Zweig Group Hot Firm List for the fifth consecutive year.  WSB s GIS Group has been taking on increasingly complex and innovative GIS projects. We have an immediate need for a Geospatial Project Manager/Business Analyst to bring creative and technical solutions to our clients. This position can be located in any WSB office. A Small-Scale View of Your Role: As a Geospatial Project Manager/Business Analyst, you will work closely with internal and external clients to create GIS solutions. The Project Manager/Business Analyst will:  Work with clients to define, understand, and analyze business requirements and develop functional/technical specifications  Work with the development team to design and deliver GIS solutions using the entire ArcGIS platform  Build GIS solutions using the ArcGIS platform  Manage a variety of projects including agile development projects  You will also work with end users, create mapping products, and perform complex GIS analyses using the ArcGIS Platform. While project oriented, you will be required to understand WSB s core business and be able to see how GIS fits into our Information and Technology strategy. Your Attributes: A Bachelor's or Master s degree in GIS, Computer Science, or Geography and three years of applicable experience is required. Our preferred candidate will have at least seven years of applicable experience. Additional requirements include a thorough working knowledge of the ArcGIS platform, strong analytical and quantitative skills, the ability to effectively communicate with both business and technology experts, and knowledge of the software development life cycle. Excellent technical skills in SQL, MS Excel, JIRA, MS Project, SharePoint, Visio, and MS Project, Smartsheet, or Primavera P6 are also required. A valid driver's license and a clean driving record are required as well as strong project management skills, collaboration and the ability to work effectively in a team environment.  Expertise in AutoCAD Civil 3D, Asset Management Systems, SAP, GPS, and drone technology is preferred. Who We Are: WSB is a professional consulting and design firm with offices in Minnesota, North Dakota, Texas, and Colorado. WSB has over 400 staff members who provide diverse engineering, planning, environmental, and construction services to clients in the government, energy, and commercial markets. Our services also include GIS, landscape architecture, right of way, and surveying.

This position requires the ability to bend, stoop, kneel and reach as needed to perform filing and other similar routine office duties. Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Overview Allied Consultants, Inc. is an Austin-based firm which has for 25 years been a premier provider of technical and business professionals to clients in Texas. We are currently seeking an experienced Business Systems Analyst to be a key resource on a technical services team. Allied Consultants offers its family of consultants excellent rates, a local support staff, and an attractive benefits package which includes medical insurance (Allied shares a percentage of the cost), life insurance, a matching 401(k) plan and a cafeteria plan. Candidates selected for interview will be required to undergo criminal background checks and may be required to complete a drug screen in accordance with Federal and State Law. Offers of Employment are contingent on a successful background check Allied Consultants is an equal opportunities employer. Responsibilities The BSA will assist in the assessment and documentation of business opportunities, benefits, risks, and success factors of potential applications. Elicits and clearly defines and documents client needs and associated requirements. The BSA’s specific responsibilities: Gather and document requirements, create and update use cases for the current project. Understand the business requirements of the existing system Coordinate and participate in the review of test plans, scripts and results of user acceptance test plans with business and technical groups. Develop complex test scenarios, test scripts and test plans using testing tools for software specifications. Execute test plans and script reviews and assist team members in performing and completing test activities. Coordinate, monitor, and perform all phases of user acceptance testing. Identify, analyze and document software defects and assist developers in analyzing and resolving defects. Review documents and assist with quality assurance of the application, the artifacts and the processes of the project. Assist in developing and monitoring project plans and schedules; and assist project managers in making assignments and managing project tasks. Qualifications Required Skills/Experience: 6 yrs. Performing duties as a business systems analyst (BSA) on complex application development. projects for all phases of the software development life cycle. 6 yrs. Planning and conducting user and technical team meetings to elicit business requirements of the client. 6 yrs. Creating user requirements and software design documents. 6 yrs. Identifying, analyzing, and documenting software defects. 6 yrs. Creating test plans, test data, executing test cases, and validating results - provided by DiceBusiness Analyst, Testing, test plans, software documentation, test cases

Name: Analyst I, Business
Description: TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance. TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR. GENERAL REQUIREMENTS:• You thrive in fast-paced environments, are flexible and able to roll with changing business and technology environments. • You are a change agent: see ‘ambiguity’ as an opportunity as opposed to a hurdle, thrive on challenging yourself to push beyond conventional thinking. • You are a problem solver: make things happen & work well with others to build constructive & effective relationships. • You seek initiative: volunteer readily; undertake self-development activities; seek increased responsibilities; takes independent actions and calculated risks. • You are detail-oriented, someone who rolls up their sleeves and gets the job done. • You have the intellectual curiosity to surface insights & implications and use this knowledge to think creatively about solutions. ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:• Make solution recommendations that align to short- and/or long-term strategic plans and roadmaps. • Articulate solution alternatives and employ data-based recommendations and influence decision makers to ensure business outcomes will be achieved. • Work closely with business and development teams to analyze and develop the best solution design and approach as a hands-on analyst or PM. • Mentor other team members, ensure adherence to SDLC practices, including scoping, analysis, design, and testing standards via Agile and/or Waterfall methodologies (desired). • Expertise and Experience in SalesForce features and functionality, including Strategic Partners such as Apptus, FinancialForce desired. • Expertise and Experience in Lead-to-cash related applications desired. • Expertise and Experience in BI & Analytics related applications desired. • Expertise and Experience in Financial processing and related applications desired. • Expertise and Experience in Enterprise Workflow and Application Integration desired. • Maintain Industry-wide and/or best practices through research and communities memberships (desired). • Develop, evaluate, and implement improved processes, methods and tools to continually improve software analysis, project management, and delivery (strongly desired). • Communicate effectively and consistently with other Technology and business team members and management. • Produce designs and functional specifications for custom development, package configuration, and/or system integration requirements. Ensure design/specification properly address business requirements, follows architecture standards and appropriately leverages native Salesforce capabilities (desired). • Demonstrated high-quality, high velocity, measureable project execution expertise (desired). • Provide hands-on issue resolution alternatives and takes ownership of assigned deliverables (desired). • Provide high-quality consultation to technology and business partners, demonstrating a high level of functional and/or project management expertise in their assigned domain (CRM, Lead-to-cash, Marketing, Finance, HR, and/or Legal). Must demonstrate good judgment and pragmatic approach to delivering solutions or project plans that optimizes project activities across company needs, business constraints and technological realities (desired). • Assist in Move-to-Production, Release, Business Deployment plan creation and transition knowledge to application production support teams for major projects/changes (desired). • Facilitate improvements to enterprise development and design standards, guidelines and processes (desired). • Conduct frequent business reviews to ensure solutions and projects deliver the expected business outcomes while continuing to raise the bar on quality standards and best practices for solution development and project management (desired). • May act as a liaison or primary point of contact for communicating solution within and outside the team (desired). • Other projects and responsibilities may be added at the manager’s discretion. JOB REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS:• Bachelor’s degree desired, or equivalent education and/or related work experience.• 2-5 years’ previous experience in a similar role required. • Hands-on, extensive experience with requirements analysis, solution design, and/or project management across diverse applications including Enterprise workflow and integration strongly desired. • Experience in SFDC with end-to-end implementation experience in Sales, Service and Force.com Cloud is a definite plus. • Demonstrated Capability Roadmap and Enterprise-level Service-Oriented Architecture Articulation and Implementation skills strongly desired. • Demonstrated ability to understand business objectives and requirements and convert them into solution designs and/or project plans strongly desired. • Experience managing expectations when balancing alternatives against business and financial constraints strongly desired. • Strong Object-Oriented analysis and design skills from a customer-in vantage point strongly desired. • Should be well-versed in Agile (Scrum) project methodologies and development practices, particularly sprint planning and assessment, and test driven development and continuous integration. • Peoplesoft HR and Financials Experience is a definite plus. • Demonstrated experience with multiple Software Development Lifecycle methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, etc.) strongly desired. • The ideal candidate also has hands-on analysis and/or project management expertise in multiple of the following technologies: Force.com, APEX, VisualForce, Workflows, OBM, Integration/EAI technologies (e.g. Mulesoft, Pervasive, Informatica, Jitterbit, ESB, etc.), Java, JavaScript, ASP,C++Java/J2EE, including SOAP, RESTful, .NET and related technologies (JSON, XML, etc), common frameworks such as struts, spring, hibernate, etc. and database technologies (Oracle, MySQL, JDBC, SQL, PL/SQL, stored procedures). Experience using Salesforce data tools (e.g., Data Loader, DemandTools, Eclipse Force.com IDE). KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:• Excellent senior executive and team-level presentation, verbal and written communication, and facilitation skills strongly desired; Ability to communicate with employees at all levels of the organization; Excellent interpersonal skills • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills strongly desired. • Strong problem solving, communication and relationship building skills strongly desired. • Strong collaboration skills strongly desired. Works well in a team environment where team members may be distributed (not collocated). • Ability to manage multiple, concurrent work streams and tasks strongly desired. • Excellent thinker with deep hands-on analytical and/or project management expertise • Sales, Sales Operations, Service Management, Finance, HR (Employee management, Performance Management, Talent Management, Payroll, and/or Benefits), Legal business domain experience a plus. • A demonstrated commitment to high professional ethical standards and a diverse workplace strongly desired. TriNet is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants based on race, religion, color, disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), age, veteran status or other legally protected characteristics. Any applicant with a mental or physical disability who requires an accommodation during the application process should contact a company manager, a company officer or a TriNet HR representative to request such an accommodation.#LI-JJ1

Name: Business Operations Analyst (Planning & Analytics)
Description: RetailMeNot is looking for a full-time Business Analyst to join us at our headquarters located in the heart of sunny, downtown Austin.Do you have a real passion for solving complex technical problems at scale? Enjoy constantly learning and implementing new technologies? Love telling cool stories from data and getting significant results? Then read on! Our Business Analytics team is built from experts in statistical analysis and data lifecycle. We take pride in our dynamic and fun environment in which we constantly learn from each other to develop our skills. As part of the team, you will uncover insights from rich and powerful big-data. You will work with teams across RMN to develop critical metrics and rich data visualizations, lead analytical projects and provide ad-hoc reporting - all while being mentored by a team of great technical talent. In this role, you will unearth trends and shifts in user behavior with our rich internal data and disseminate these trends within the company and beyond. You will also advocate the RMN brand by delivering new, exciting, and relevant trends to consumers.Who You Are:1 year of relevant experience in a data science, business analytics, business intelligence or comparable data engineering role, including data warehousing and business intelligence tools, techniques and technology. Exposure to ad agencies or advertising a plusB.S. in math, statistics, computer science or equivalent technical or analytic field.Experience in data mining structured and unstructured data (SQL, ETL, data warehouse, RDS, RedShift, Oracle, etc.) in a business environment with large-scale, complex data sets.Business experience or coursework preferred.Experience in marketing or financial analysis highly desirable.Ability to dive deep on data analysis or technical issues to identify effective solutions.Knowledge of SQL to write complete, optimized queries across large volumes of data.Demonstrated ability to frame complex analytical problems, pull data and extract insights that led to tangible results (revenue, seller launches, new product features, etc.).Enjoy speaking, writing, and presenting, as well as the ability to evangelize your findings. Summarize key insights for technical and non-technical audiences.Experience communicating with senior management (VP-level decision-makers) as well as with colleagues from computer science, machine learning and business backgrounds.What You'll Do:Develop interactive dashboards and reports using relational databases, Tableau and Excel to educate decision-makers at all levels of the businessDistill actionable insights from over 1PB of data to uncover new revenue opportunities and drive the product roadmap forwardDevelop and share new data products for expedited downstream analysis and applicationSolve complex business problems through building statistical models from data and metadataParticipate in strategic and tactical planning discussions, collaborate with business customers, gathering requirements and delivering complete reporting solutionsUse data to equip client-facing teams with insights for client conversationsHelp us find opportunities in both established and greenfield reporting including RMNs newest key product: advertisingWho We Are:We value diverse perspectives and believe this translates into stronger products and a better workplaceWe have an open, casual, fun and upbeat environment where you are given a lot of responsibility and the freedom to make a huge impactWe have lots of intelligent people to work with and learn fromWe have a great open vacation policyWe'll provide you with food, food, and more foodWe believe in giving prizes, bonuses, and recognition for doing what you loveRewardsWe offer an opportunity to be an integral part of a company that eagerly pursues disruption in its space to continue to drive innovation and lead the competition. Benefits of being an employee of RetailMeNot, Inc. include, but are not limited to the following:- Competitive base & bonus packages; salary negotiable- Long Term Incentive Plan- Performance based rewards & recognition for your hard work and service- Very competitive benefits packages, including best-in-class parental leave- Open & flexible PTO- Cell phone & gym membership reimbursements- Fully stocked break room & onsite catered breakfasts & lunches multiple days/weekAbout UsRetailMeNot, Inc. is a leading digital savings destination connecting consumers with retailers, restaurants and brands, both online and in-store. The company enables consumers across the globe to find hundreds of thousands of digital offers to save money while they shop or dine out. U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Information Individuals seeking employment at RetailMeNot, Inc. are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation. You are being given the opportunity to provide the following information in order to help us align with federal and state Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action record keeping, reporting, and other legal requirements.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Drives the transition from business requirements to functional stories for the development of new software applications or enhancements to existing systems. Represents Product as member of agile development team. Consults with users to identify current business processes and clarifies application objectives. Research problem reports, resolve issues with users or business owners, and send stories to software development or program management for resolution. Participates in the testing process through test plan development, test review and analysis. Creates stories and tasks in JIRA for team members. Loves to meet with users, understand their pain, and write user storiesLoves to write technical documentation on features and processesLoves to build detailed process maps using tools like draw.ioWrites stories supporting the development of new API productsTranslate and implement Engineering product structure and configuration rules into the softwareMeet with multiple stakeholders, which may include end users, customers, marketing, consultants and engineers in the design as well as the performance of the softwareThoroughly research and test UI elements to assure ease of use and friendliness of the applicationSkillfully applies influence, negotiates, and mediates discussions needed to make progress towards achieving business goals and objectivesLeads the development and review (from content to final draft) of user guides, training classes, and other end user documentation for applications and processesParticipate in the review and execution of software testing plans to ensure quality and accuracy. Assure that designs meet business requirementsWorks with other functional groups in order to develop tests that simulate the requirements of the customers. Evaluates test data and makes software revisions to solve identified problemsScope: Has thorough understanding of technical concepts required for specialized field. Uses knowledge, creativity and company practices and priorities to obtain solutions to complex problems. Exercises judgment in developing methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining result Supervisory Responsibilities: Y or N? No 4+ years as a systems analyst or equivalent for projects relating to custom software developmentExperience writing functional stories based on an understanding of business needExperience with user focus sessions and voice of the customerExperience with Agile software development and ScrumExperience with building web-based applicationsExperience with Swagger API framework, Open API frameworkFamiliarity with API technology, design, and terminologyExperience working with supply chain technology, such as conveyors, transportation, parcel carriersFamiliarity with testing methodologiesUnderstanding of data modelingPolished presentation skillsExceptional listening, written and verbal communication skillsExcels in an innovative and collaborative environmentComfortable interacting with executive teamsStrong sense of urgency and the ability to embrace a changing landscapeExtensive product and process knowledge, planning abilities, problem solving, and organizational skillsExperience with JIRA and ConfluenceBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business, or Supply Chain

Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: Description As part of the WebCenter Content (WCC) team, the Business Analyst will work with stakeholders from all Emerson Business Units and World Areas to ensure business requirements are written clearly so the technical staff can respond with design and implementation details that meet the needs of the customer. The employee must be a skilled multitasker, able to handle multiple projects in various states across different teams. They will drive project teams to the agreed upon schedules and ensure any impediments are escalated quickly and appropriately. The incumbent will be the key liaison between the business owners and the WCC technical staff, ensuring business owners understand the WCC processes and standards to be followed. The Business Analyst will often serve as the WCC team representative during interactions with our internal customers. The candidate should be able to stay focused on the positions fundamental goals and identify/drive activities and deliverables to meet them. ResponsibilitiesIdentify, analyze, and validate key business requirements and business objectivesInterview business owners for clarification on business requirements and generate process flows and unit test cases to support the projectEducate business owners about WCC system, standards, and processesCollaborate and build relationships between IT and business organizationsManage acceptance testing, documentation, and prioritizationContribute to project plans driven by Project Manager and own project plans for smaller implementations to ensure projects remain on track and within budgetInvestigate and resolve both project and production issues as neededFollow a prescribed Software Development Life Cycle to manage project and changes. Knowledge of Serena Business Manager a plus.Analyze risks and constraints involved in project/change requests, working with business to get buy in and signoffAdditional Information This position is located in Round Rock, Texas. Travel could be requested, but typically limited to one trip a year.

Name: Business Analyst, Global Partner Success
Description: About HomeAway:HomeAway, a world leader in the vacation rental industry, is the place to book beach houses, cabins, and condos with more than two million places to stay in 190 countries. The site makes it easy to find and book the perfect vacation rental for any getaway, often for less than the cost of traditional hotel accommodations. HomeAway is part of the Expedia Group family of brands. What youll do: As member of a team of four expert commissions analysts that owns the global commission process from portfolio creation, quota setting, attainment calculation, processes and procedures, analysis and recommendations. The team is self-sufficient, has high energy and utilizes an agile methodology approach to business challenges. Since the responsibility is immense, the organization implements regular peer reviews and partnerships with other business units to deliver excellent and accurate work. Feedback and retrospectives are a crucial input to our process to improve and continuously refine our work product.  The Commissions team is one of the three pillars of Global Partner Success Operations (GPSO), and the culture we champion is based on collaboration, cross-functionality, and openness. We strive to deliver quotas and compensation that is accurate, on-time, and insightful while maintaining a fun work environment. Striving towards a deep understanding of the subject matter as we use the scientific methodology to test and learn from our operations and decisions. Day-to-day responsibilitiesYou will be responsible for designing, managing and communicating processes of administration, documentation, and payment of monthly/quarterly/annual Partner Success (PS) commissions globally including conducting formal meetings with PS managers and directors for monthly reviewLead the full cycle of the companys variable compensation process, including documentation, calculations, and sign-off workflowYou will support monthly/quarterly Net Book Value and New Listings quota striving towards archiving company top line objectives.Enthusiastically utilize your quantitative and qualitative analytics and advanced technical skills and technology to extract data from multiple sources and provide clear output for decision-making.Maintain procedural documentation while collaborating with the GPSO partners and the internal teams to drive consistency and clarity as there are communicated to the rest of the organization.Who you are: Are you someone that loves working with data, building and maintaining models, reports and solving challenges? Are you passionate about data-driven decisions based on meaningful analysis? HomeAway is looking for a dynamic Commissions Analyst on the Global Partner Success Operations (GPSO) team to dive in and provide expertise in attainment, commissions calculations and quota setting modeling. This role reports to the Senior Manager, Global Partner Success Operations and collaborates actively with the Partner Success management teams, Human Resources, and Finance to ensure alignment of plans, policy, and adoption. The commissions analyst also works closely with our reporting and analytics team to develop and deliver a robust quota and technology infrastructure. Highly proficient in portfolio creation, modeling for quota setting, commissions calculations and compensation plan implementation (5+ years experience)Proficient in global labor laws principals and payroll processesAdvanced Excel knowledge a requirement.Proficient written and verbal skills to deliver results and methodologies to global senior leadership.Proficient in SQL, Tableau, Qubole, Salesforce specifically for data querying, model creation, and analysis content and message creation.Knowledgeable on statistical analysis and modeling design based on Trending, Account planning, Business insight and Regression models for quota creation and portfolio allocation methodologiesAbility to be self-sufficient and work in an agile environment thats dynamic and evolving constantly towards achieving best in class processes, tools, technologies and outputAbility to lead and established relationships with peers, cross-functional team members, and product usersShown history of workplace flexibility and continued desire to learnUnderstanding of basic GAAP principlesStrong organization skills, time management and ability to multi-taskBenefits & Perks:Competitive health and insurance benefits.Competitive salary.Annual target bonus or commission.Parental leave for up to 20 weeks (dependent on eligibility).Paid vacation and sick time.Employee Stock Purchase Program.Free snacks and beverages.Frequent company update talks with our leadership team.Free listing on HomeAway.com.Electronic, adjustable stand-up desk.Discounted Metro & Rail pass.Casual dress.Why join us: Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them to tools to do so.  Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.  Our family of travel brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Egencia®, trivago®, HomeAway®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Wotif®, lastminute.com.au®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Hotwire®, Classic Vacations®, Expedia® Media Solutions, CarRentals.com, Expedia Local Expert®, Expedia® CruiseShipCenters®, SilverRail Technologies, Inc., ALICE and Traveldoo®.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description: About GoDaddy GoDaddy powers the world's largest cloud platform dedicated to small, independent ventures. With nearly 18 million customers worldwide and over 77 million domain names under management, GoDaddy is the place people come to name their idea, build a professional website, attract customers and manage their work. Our mission is to give our customers the tools, insights and the people to transform their ideas and personal initiative into success. To learn more about the company visit www.GoDaddy.com.  What is the opportunity?  We are looking for a savvy individual who is part analyst, part data expert, and part strategic business partner. If you enjoy using data to answer key business questions, while building systems that scale and enable both business owners and fellow analysts, this may be the job for you! Your goal as a Senior Business Analyst will be to use your unique skill set to create leverage through repeatable reporting and analytics that can be used by the entire organization.  Here’s a sampling of what you’ll tackle in this role: Build Data Sets and Dashboards that Fulfill Real Company Needs: Consult with fellow analysts and leaders in sales, marketing, and customer operations to define data needs, and build/validate shared Tableau data sets that meet needs. Build out initial dashboards to prime the pump and minimize time to value. Gather Insights from Data: Use data to tell a story. Routinely analyze operational data, share insights, and make recommendations for additional KPIs.Become a Thought Leader: Be the subject matter expert on the BI team for all things related to data infrastructure, data governance, SQL skills, and smart Tableau buildout. Uplevel the team by guiding us through particularly complex report building or data modeling problems.Influence Business Intelligence Roadmap: Consolidate input from analysts and business owners across the company to make recommendations on next areas of engineering investment. Roadmap could include additional Tableau data sets, enhancements to existing PostgreSQL reporting database, or integration of entirely new data sources.Maintain Partnerships: Maintain relationships with product management, engineering, and customer facing groups. Work closely with these groups to define requirements, project manage initiatives, and troubleshoot problems with existing data ecosystem.Represent BI in Future Data Integration/Migration Activities: Work with Godaddy engineering teams to define prioritization and timing of future migration to GDDY data infrastructure. Implement integration/migration as needed.Ad hoc Modeling/Analysis: We are all analysts at heart. We pride ourselves in our flexibility and are able to dive in to tackle urgent modeling and analysis needs. In addition to building out our reporting infrastructure. You will have ample opportunity to solve one-off analysis problems through models and visualizations.What will it take to succeed?5+ years of experience as a business analyst, data analyst, or in a similar data-focused capacityAdvanced Excel and SQL skillsExperience with business intelligence software, particularly TableauDemonstrated analytical skills and problem-solving acumenStrong written and oral communication skillsExperience consulting with business owners to identify reporting needs and translate needs to automated, scalable systemsHighly motivated self-starter able to take ownership of analysis projects from start to finishPassion for working in a fast-paced environment, with an ability to adapt quickly to changing prioritiesProject management skillsEnthusiasm for local businesses and a fit with GoDaddy valuesBonus points for: Exposure to CRM (Salesforce.com preferred) and other business systemsExperience with local or SMB recurring revenue modelWhy is it exciting?You will work with leaders around the organization to define and build out our reporting infrastructure. We have taken steps to decrease our reliance on Excel, but you will be a driving force in taking us to the next level of driving automated insights and analysis deeper in the organization.This role will report directly to the VP Finance, with close relationships to both customer facing and product teams. You’ll collaborate with executives to instrument and analyze the engine of the company.What are the benefits and perks?Mission-driven, values-based culture.Unlimited paid time off, plus company holidays.100% paid medical, dental, and vision option.401(k) match.Employee Stock Purchase Program. GoDaddy is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of age, race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, medical condition, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status or civil partnership/union status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, childbirth, genetic information, military and veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state or local law. GoDaddy will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with local and federal requirements.  If you need assistance completing an application for a position with us, please reach out to our Recruiting Team at Recruiting@godaddy.com  To submit your application to this position, please click Apply . On the next screen, after you click Apply, click Create to establish your candidate account. If you have previously created a candidate account, please slick Sign-In and use that account to complete your application.

Name: Sales Business Process Analyst
Description: Job Description At Atlassian, we are on a mission to reinvent B2B selling. We have built a $874M fast-growing business without traditional sales tactics. By focusing relentlessly on high-quality products and converting free trials into happy customers, we have created a prolific "Flywheel" delivering over 125,000 customers to date. We believe we can proactively engage with our customers through "Smart Touch" - specific, value-added outbound engagements that generate higher conversions and incremental bookings throughout the customer lifecycle. The Sales Business Process Analyst will drive continuous improvements to the way our Field Operations teams get things done.  Here's an idea of the kinds of things you'll get to do: Manage defects and enhancements including identification, resolution, and communication to business partners in the Sales organizationDrive process and technology improvements for Enterprise Advocate sales teamsConduct preliminary investigation for all project requests to ensure they are in line with business objectivesFacilitate workshops, uncover business requirements and process documentationWork with business owners and IT to prioritize change requestsParticipate in user acceptance, smoke testing, and implementation activitiesManage escalations and exceptions utilizing a ticketing systemIdentify process improvements to reduce critical issues and increase efficiencyTrack metrics across improvements, defects, and escalated issuesManage business unit expectations of ITTrain end users On your first day, we'll expect you to have: 2-6 years of experience in Sales Operations, Sales Technology, or Customer SupportThe ability to recommend new ways Atlassian can better use SalesforceAn in-depth understanding of what it takes to get IT projects deliveredA strong sense of ownership, self-motivation, and ambition More about our team  The Sales Operations team is staffed with committed and smart people helping our sales organizations understand current performance, forecast the future, and improve process. Within Sales Operations, the Analytics team is responsible for building reporting for the global and regional sales leadership. The Deal Desk helps ensure that we process our biggest contracts in the most efficient manner possible. You'll work on a Systems and Processes Team that designs the methods needed to scale our customer interactions.  More about our benefits  Our offices are open, highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some fantastic perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, flexible working options, five paid volunteer days a year to support your favorite cause, plenty of food and beverages, ergonomic workstations with sit/stand desks, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years, generous employer-paid insurance coverage (medical, dental, and vision) for you and your family, 401k matching and more.  More about Atlassian  Software is changing the world, and we're at the center of it all. With a customer list that reads like a who's who in tech and a highly disruptive business model, we're advancing the art of team collaboration with products like Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, Trello, and now Stride. Driven by honest values, an amazing culture, and consistent revenue growth, we're out to unleash the potential of every team. From Amsterdam and Austin to Sydney and San Francisco, we're looking for people who are powered by passion and eager to do the best work of their lives in a highly autonomous yet collaborative, no B.S. environment. Additional Information We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.SDL2017

Name: Business Analyst -
Description: Job ID : TH11018_9000 Posted on: 31st of October, 2018Job DesignationConsultant-Core JavaJob PositionImmediate requirement of Java professional having at least 3-5 years of experience.  Duties and Responsibilities  Rapid design and implementation of complex solutions  Translate application storyboards and use cases into functional applications  Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Java code  Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applicationsJob Location : Noida Job Description Mandatory requirements  Proficient in Java, with a good knowledge of various frameworks  Solid understanding of object-oriented programming  Familiar with various design and architectural patterns  Skill for writing reusable Java libraries  Knowledge of concurrency patterns in Java  Familiarity with concepts of MVC, JDBC, and RESTful  Experience with Spring, Spring MVC, Spring Boot, Spring Integration, Spring Data and Spring Batch  Experience with both external and embedded databases  Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application  Experience in building applications using microservices architecture  Creating database schemas that represent and support business processes  Basic understanding of JVM, its limitations, weaknesses, and workarounds  Implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests  Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git SkillsSkill Category: Java Primary Skill: Core Java ExperienceExperience: 3 - 5 years Recruiter InformationName: Jaya Gupta Email Address: Jaya.Gupta@infogain.com About the CompanyInfogain is a Silicon Valley headquartered company with software platform engineering and deep domain expertise in travel, retail, insurance, automotive, and high technology. We accelerate the delivery of digital customer engagement systems using digital technologies such as cloud, microservices, robotic process automation and artificial intelligence to our clients.  Our unique engagement approach of “Listen-Curate-Deploy” helps to accelerate the innovation journey of 5 of the world’s largest 50 companies and 24 of the Fortune 500, with several relationships of over 10 years.  We deliver positive business outcomes using rapid prototyping and a solid foundation of DevOps-based software platform engineering that ensure high-quality and on-time delivery.  Our 3,500 global employees across the US, UK, Singapore, Middle East and India focus on client value creation, delivery excellence and innovation.

Name: Sr. Analyst, Business Operations
Description: Are you a problem solver? Do you enjoy getting to the root cause of an issue, developing a business plan to test assumptions, collect and analyze data, and work with cross-functional teams to implement an idea to market and scale?RigUp is the fastest growing tech startup in the oil & gas industry. We're seeking experienced business operations analyst of all backgrounds to become key members of our product development team. If you're ready for new challenges, we'd love to hear from you.Our team has great people from all over the US and beyond, from all sorts of industries and all walks of life. Consult inter-functional projects and process improvements.Analyze and prioritize reactive executional needs optimized for the best of the business.Gather and analyze quantitative and qualitative data used as a framework for making strategic decisions. Present high value presentations internally and externally.Implement process for handoff to program or functional managers.What We're Looking For5+ years of business operations experience or experience in a financial or operational analytical roleEntrepreneurial ability to discover root cause issues and propose optimal solution setsHave a track record of high performance within previous roles and organizational structures, consistently exceeding individual and team goalsAbility to draw influence and achieve buy-in across multiple functional owners and contributorsAble to solve problems, handle difficult questions, and skillfully navigate objections with limited supervision.Willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic; self-directed, coach-able & resourcefulHighly driven individual with an execution focus and a strong sense of urgencyCustomer facing experience with the ability communicate effectively to extract and implement a data driven analysisExperience working in an early stage or growth stage software companyStrong track record of crafting roadmaps and delivering products well-aligned with business strategyMust be willing to travel 10-20% domestically on averageBonus PointsExperience in the energy industry is a plus but not required, you must have at least an interest in the energy industryHave experience in highly volatile environmentsExperience growing online marketplacesBenefits and PerksCompetitive salary with 100% company-paid health insurance401k with generous company matchFlexible work schedule and vacation policyGreat office in downtown Austin with fully stocked kitchen and optional standing desksCatered team meals

Name: Business Analyst, Customer Operations
Description: What is the opportunity? The Business Intelligence team is looking for an experienced analyst to focus on customer operations and retention. As a business analyst, your goal will be to use data analysis to yield new insights about our customer base and make recommendations for increasing revenue and operational efficiency.  Here's a sampling of what you'll tackle in this role: Own reporting for our Customer Operations team: Identify key performance indicators and design reporting for stakeholders across all levels (individual contributors to the COO) and functions (customer success, onboarding, content, operational excellence). Build both xls and Tableau reports that deliver actionable insights to the team.Dive deep into customer data:You will be tasked with developing a deep understanding of key retention drivers like customer demographics, pricing and product selectionBuild models to forecast retention and operations:You will build a variety of models to answer operational and financial questions. For example, these models will help us to assess retention impact of operational initiatives, project hiring needs, evaluate new opportunities, and create long range operational and financial forecasts.Dive deep into our Customer Operations organization: As the key data partner for our Customer Operations organization, you will need to develop an intimate knowledge of the inner workings of our business processes and the customer life cycleInterface with Product Team: Use your customer retention expertise to help inform the roadmap for our Product teams by being a thought partner for new product and process roll-outsWhat will it take to succeed?3-5+ years of experience as a data analyst or in a similar data-focused capacityDemonstrated analytical skills and problem-solving acumenHighly motivated and able to take ownership of analysis projects from start to finishPassion for working in a fast-paced environment, with an ability to adapt quickly to changing prioritiesStrong communication skills, and the ability to translate the results of complex analysis into a simple and actionable explanationAn exemplary work ethic, a "get it done" attitude, and high personal accountabilityEnthusiasm for local businesses and a fit with Main Street Hub valuesExcellent Excel and SQL skills are a mustExperience with business intelligence software, particularly Tableau, is a plusBonus points for:Exposure to CRM and marketing automation systems (Salesforce.com preferred).Familiarity with the Local/SMB spaceWhy is it exciting?You will play an integral role in shaping growth strategy across the entire companyThis role will report directly to the Vice President of Finance, with close relationships with the Customer Operations and Product teams. You'll get a well-rounded view into the inner-workings of the organization, and build relationships with key individuals across the companyWhat are the benefits and perks?Mission-driven, values-based culture.Unlimited paid time off, plus company holidays.100% paid medical, dental, and vision option.401(k) match.Employee Stock Purchase Program.

Name: Senior Management Consultant - Austin/San Antonio
Description: Point B is an employee-owned management consulting firm looking for experienced consultants who want to be part of a dynamic, growing firm and make an impact with world-class clients.What makes Point B different? An employee-ownership model that gives you a voice in directing your career and building our firm. Diverse leadership opportunities to expand your skills, along with the support needed to deliver great results. A unique culture that recognizes the importance of flexibility and collaboration.It’s no wonder that Point B has been consistently recognized as one of the best places to work by Fortune® magazine, The Wall Street Journal, Consulting® magazine, Vault.com® and many others.What you’ll get to do:Lead critical business and technology initiatives with top clients, from start-ups to Fortune 500 companiesBroaden your leadership skills working across a variety of industries and functional areasHave a voice in identifying the projects you work on and clients that interest youExercise your entrepreneurial spirit and contribute to the firm’s growth as an employee-ownerWhat we offer our Senior Associates:The ability to chart your individual career path based on your expertise and passionsAn environment that encourages you to identify new opportunities and provides the support to make it happenThe chance to have a balanced lifestyle by working with local or national clients in a flexible consulting modelThe opportunity to build and be part of a fun and collaborative culture with teams that are as passionate about their communities as they are about their clientsA comprehensive, flexible Total Rewards program that supports and recognizes each individual’s unique needs and contributions to the firmWhat we expect you’ve already done:A minimum of 8 years of demonstrated success as a leader of complex business or technology initiatives, preferably in a consulting environmentLed systems implementation, program execution, operations and/or process improvement engagementsDeveloped skills and expertise in organizational transformation, change management, and/or organizational designWorked as an effective leader across multiple industries and functional areasEstablished expertise in project management methodologies, approaches, and toolsEarned a B.A. or B.S. degree and preferably an MBAThis role is an opportunity to be involved in developing our growing Austin market. Travel within Texas may be required for consulting engagements as we continue to develop this marketThe kind of people we look for:Versatile consultants who thrive on variety and challengeInnate problem-solvers who want to grow in a flexible, collaborative cultureEngaging leaders who make a positive impact on their firm, clients, and communitiesTalented consultants with a growth mindset who want to use their networking and relationship-building skills to help grow the firmEqual Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability

Name: Business Analyst (Salesforce Service Cloud)
Description: Job DescriptionWe live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity. Data and technology are transforming industries, society, and even the workplace by creating professions that did not exist before the emergence of data, cloud, social, and mobile technologies.  As the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, IBM is a leader in this global transformation and is just the place to continue your career. Network in an open, friendly and flexible work environment where diversity is embraced, while new and creative ways of thinking are encouraged and supported. As an IBMer, you can change the way the world works. Join this IBM team and be part of a diverse and global company of thinkers and doerspeople who want to make an impact, cultivate their expertise and collaborate with some of the worlds top business and technology professionals.  The Client Support IT team is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our high-performing application development team. Our portfolio of applications spans electronic support, call/problem management, and entitlement systems. We operate and transform the capabilities for IBM worldwide technical support which is key to IBMs growth.  IBM is focused on the client experience. A key measurement of client satisfaction is the Net Promoter Score (NPS). In this role, you will be responsible for driving NPS improvements for clients as well as IBM support professionals. Youll work with the support and transformation leadership teams to gather, analyze and drive change using client satisfaction data, direct client interaction, and executives from across the IBM support organization. Working with the development teams, you will develop actions to improve NPS scores and communicate the progress to executive leadership as well as the IBM support teams. This position will require the ability to work across management matrices and also leverages strong Agile and iteration management skills. Name: Watson Health - Business Analyst Lead
Description: Job Description As a Lead Business Analyst, you will provide subject matter expertise both internally and externally to the data warehouse center of excellence and customers alike. You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You must enjoy spending time in the market to understand their problems, and find innovative solutions for the broader market. You must be able to communicate with all areas of the company. You will work with an engineering counterpart to define product release requirements. You may be asked to travel as is necessary. You will oversee day-to-day activities of the business analyst team responsible for specifying business requirements to support the technical design and application development of healthcare reporting solutions. Essential Responsibilities:Lead a multi-disciplinary team of Business Analysts in a rapid and ever changing business environment.Lead the customer through steps of Agile/Iterative Methodology associated with the delivery of BI solutions; Requirements, Design, Development, System Test, User Acceptance Test and OperationsResponsible for facilitating customer Requirement Analysis Sessions (RAS) and is responsible for capturing and documenting customer business process models (BPM)Acts as a representative from the business area and to identify and refine their requirements for information, informing the creation of a warehouse data modelInteracts with functional users and data stewards/SME to ensure that all the proper questions have been identified and answered satisfactorilyClarify issues relating to scope and business requirements for project team (including technical implementation team, project management and client management)Assists Quality Assurance team with development, execution, and documentation of test casesWorks to identify and document data quality issuesAssists Data Modelers and Data Analysts in assuring requirements are traceable between the source data and target tables/entities in the respective data modelsLeads RAS sessions with clientsWorks with Implementation and Development leads to translate and map business requirements to technical requirements/specificationsDefines scope of work for work proposed to meet business requirementsDefine business requirements for change requests, investigate issues/defects and define remediation requirementsOversee the day to day activities of the Business Analysis team including but not limited to assignments, scheduling, performance evaluationPlays a role in the accounts leadership team, communicating across technical and delivery towers, in support of the Account Executive's ability to deliver on the contract requirements. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Ability to work on site in Santa Fe, NM 5 days a week3-5+ years of experience with Medicaid10+ years experience as business analyst for data warehouse OR business intelligence projects.Experience with large scale system development.Demonstrated ability to understand industry issues and problems, relate them to clients' needs, and propose appropriate solutionsExcellent organization skills, ability to take initiative and work independently or as a member of a small team.Excellent interpersonal skills and relationship building, ability to collaborate and build consensusDesire to continue learning more about healthcare and the technologies supporting healthcare dataStrong presenter, comfortable presenting in front of customers, conveying status, answering Q&ADemonstrated ability to convey complex ideas in an easily understood manner to guide audience through written or verbal communications Preferred Tech and Prof Experience PREFERRED Skills and Experience:Previous experience as a business analyst working with software developersKnowledgeable in technology, specifically data warehousingCompetent in at least one BI technology (e.g. Cognos, Business Objects, Tableau)Competent in at least one analytics technology (e.g. SAS, R, SPSS)Competent in at least on geospatial technology (e.g. mapinfo, ESRI)Understanding of both technical and business process MITA requirements EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Name: Geospatial Project Manager / Business Analyst
Description: Map out your career at WSB, recognized as a top workplace for the sixth consecutive year and the Zweig Group Hot Firm List for the fifth consecutive year.  WSB s GIS Group has been taking on increasingly complex and innovative GIS projects. We have an immediate need for a Geospatial Project Manager/Business Analyst to bring creative and technical solutions to our clients. This position can be located in any WSB office. A Small-Scale View of Your Role: As a Geospatial Project Manager/Business Analyst, you will work closely with internal and external clients to create GIS solutions. The Project Manager/Business Analyst will:  Work with clients to define, understand, and analyze business requirements and develop functional/technical specifications  Work with the development team to design and deliver GIS solutions using the entire ArcGIS platform  Build GIS solutions using the ArcGIS platform  Manage a variety of projects including agile development projects  You will also work with end users, create mapping products, and perform complex GIS analyses using the ArcGIS Platform. While project oriented, you will be required to understand WSB s core business and be able to see how GIS fits into our Information and Technology strategy. Your Attributes: A Bachelor's or Master s degree in GIS, Computer Science, or Geography and three years of applicable experience is required. Our preferred candidate will have at least seven years of applicable experience. Additional requirements include a thorough working knowledge of the ArcGIS platform, strong analytical and quantitative skills, the ability to effectively communicate with both business and technology experts, and knowledge of the software development life cycle. Excellent technical skills in SQL, MS Excel, JIRA, MS Project, SharePoint, Visio, and MS Project, Smartsheet, or Primavera P6 are also required. A valid driver's license and a clean driving record are required as well as strong project management skills, collaboration and the ability to work effectively in a team environment.  Expertise in AutoCAD Civil 3D, Asset Management Systems, SAP, GPS, and drone technology is preferred. Who We Are: WSB is a professional consulting and design firm with offices in Minnesota, North Dakota, Texas, and Colorado. WSB has over 400 staff members who provide diverse engineering, planning, environmental, and construction services to clients in the government, energy, and commercial markets. Our services also include GIS, landscape architecture, right of way, and surveying.

Name: Senior Business Data Analyst
Description: Req ID: 36046     At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.     NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Senior Business Data Analyst to join our team in Austin, TX. Candidates local to Austin, TX are strongly preferred.       The individual will be responsible for the following:   Eliciting requirements using tasks such as: facilitated workshops with business subject matter experts, interviews, document analysis, prototyping, and interface analysisSpecifying and analyzing business goals/requirements, functional requirements, system interface requirements, reporting requirements, data requirements, non-functionalFacilitates meetings with the business subject matter experts or end users to formulate business strategies and requirements and translate client needs into actionable system requirements.Coordinates, conducts, and documents requirements gathering sessions with end users, project stakeholders and development team(s)Critically evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconciles conflicts, decomposes high-level information into details - abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguishes user requests from the underlying true needsDevelops high quality documentation including business requirements documents, use cases, software requirements specifications, report specifications, epics, user stories, screen and interface designs, conceptual page flows, business process models, user acceptance test plans, and training manuals / user guidesIdentifies, plans and estimates level of effort for business analysis related tasksLeading/hosting large, cross functional meetings to elicit requirements from subject matter experts and build consensusAnalyzing requirements from several functional areas to determine potential conflicts /other requirements that may exist in other areas.Participate in Quality Assurance and User Acceptance.Performs functional testing as needed to ensure adherence to requirementsCoordinates/executes the development of test cases.Successfully engages in multiple initiatives simultaneously   Basic Qualifications:   Minimum of 5 years work experience with business process analysisPreferred skills:   Extensive experience and skills in business data analysisUnderstanding business process management and business requirements of the customers and translating them to specific software requirementsExceptional communication, presentation, organization and time management skillsExceptional written and verbal communication skillsAbility to participate in various phases of testing (Execution of Plan, Design, Strategy, Coordination, Development, Quality Assurance and Execution)Ability to participate in release and implementation processes            This is a Temporary Employee of NTT DATA role. This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.About NTT DATA Services    NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.     NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.     NTT DATA, Inc. (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Overview Allied Consultants, Inc. is an Austin-based firm which has for 25 years been a premier provider of technical and business professionals to clients in Texas. We are currently seeking an experienced Business Systems Analyst to be a key resource on a technical services team. Allied Consultants offers its family of consultants excellent rates, a local support staff, and an attractive benefits package which includes medical insurance (Allied shares a percentage of the cost), life insurance, a matching 401(k) plan and a cafeteria plan. Candidates selected for interview will be required to undergo criminal background checks and may be required to complete a drug screen in accordance with Federal and State Law. Offers of Employment are contingent on a successful background check Allied Consultants is an equal opportunities employer. Responsibilities The BSA will assist in the assessment and documentation of business opportunities, benefits, risks, and success factors of potential applications. Elicits and clearly defines and documents client needs and associated requirements. The BSA’s specific responsibilities: Gather and document requirements, create and update use cases for the current project. Understand the business requirements of the existing system Coordinate and participate in the review of test plans, scripts and results of user acceptance test plans with business and technical groups. Develop complex test scenarios, test scripts and test plans using testing tools for software specifications. Execute test plans and script reviews and assist team members in performing and completing test activities. Coordinate, monitor, and perform all phases of user acceptance testing. Identify, analyze and document software defects and assist developers in analyzing and resolving defects. Review documents and assist with quality assurance of the application, the artifacts and the processes of the project. Assist in developing and monitoring project plans and schedules; and assist project managers in making assignments and managing project tasks. Qualifications Required Skills/Experience: 6 yrs. Performing duties as a business systems analyst (BSA) on complex application development. projects for all phases of the software development life cycle. 6 yrs. Planning and conducting user and technical team meetings to elicit business requirements of the client. 6 yrs. Creating user requirements and software design documents. 6 yrs. Identifying, analyzing, and documenting software defects. 6 yrs. Creating test plans, test data, executing test cases, and validating results - provided by DiceBusiness Analyst, Testing, test plans, software documentation, test cases
