Name: Analyst I, Business
Description: TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance. TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR. GENERAL REQUIREMENTS:• You thrive in fast-paced environments, are flexible and able to roll with changing business and technology environments. • You are a change agent: see ‘ambiguity’ as an opportunity as opposed to a hurdle, thrive on challenging yourself to push beyond conventional thinking. • You are a problem solver: make things happen & work well with others to build constructive & effective relationships. • You seek initiative: volunteer readily; undertake self-development activities; seek increased responsibilities; takes independent actions and calculated risks. • You are detail-oriented, someone who rolls up their sleeves and gets the job done. • You have the intellectual curiosity to surface insights & implications and use this knowledge to think creatively about solutions. ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:• Make solution recommendations that align to short- and/or long-term strategic plans and roadmaps. • Articulate solution alternatives and employ data-based recommendations and influence decision makers to ensure business outcomes will be achieved. • Work closely with business and development teams to analyze and develop the best solution design and approach as a hands-on analyst or PM. • Mentor other team members, ensure adherence to SDLC practices, including scoping, analysis, design, and testing standards via Agile and/or Waterfall methodologies (desired). • Expertise and Experience in SalesForce features and functionality, including Strategic Partners such as Apptus, FinancialForce desired. • Expertise and Experience in Lead-to-cash related applications desired. • Expertise and Experience in BI & Analytics related applications desired. • Expertise and Experience in Financial processing and related applications desired. • Expertise and Experience in Enterprise Workflow and Application Integration desired. • Maintain Industry-wide and/or best practices through research and communities memberships (desired). • Develop, evaluate, and implement improved processes, methods and tools to continually improve software analysis, project management, and delivery (strongly desired). • Communicate effectively and consistently with other Technology and business team members and management. • Produce designs and functional specifications for custom development, package configuration, and/or system integration requirements. Ensure design/specification properly address business requirements, follows architecture standards and appropriately leverages native Salesforce capabilities (desired). • Demonstrated high-quality, high velocity, measureable project execution expertise (desired). • Provide hands-on issue resolution alternatives and takes ownership of assigned deliverables (desired). • Provide high-quality consultation to technology and business partners, demonstrating a high level of functional and/or project management expertise in their assigned domain (CRM, Lead-to-cash, Marketing, Finance, HR, and/or Legal). Must demonstrate good judgment and pragmatic approach to delivering solutions or project plans that optimizes project activities across company needs, business constraints and technological realities (desired). • Assist in Move-to-Production, Release, Business Deployment plan creation and transition knowledge to application production support teams for major projects/changes (desired). • Facilitate improvements to enterprise development and design standards, guidelines and processes (desired). • Conduct frequent business reviews to ensure solutions and projects deliver the expected business outcomes while continuing to raise the bar on quality standards and best practices for solution development and project management (desired). • May act as a liaison or primary point of contact for communicating solution within and outside the team (desired). • Other projects and responsibilities may be added at the manager’s discretion. JOB REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS:• Bachelor’s degree desired, or equivalent education and/or related work experience.• 2-5 years’ previous experience in a similar role required. • Hands-on, extensive experience with requirements analysis, solution design, and/or project management across diverse applications including Enterprise workflow and integration strongly desired. • Experience in SFDC with end-to-end implementation experience in Sales, Service and Force.com Cloud is a definite plus. • Demonstrated Capability Roadmap and Enterprise-level Service-Oriented Architecture Articulation and Implementation skills strongly desired. • Demonstrated ability to understand business objectives and requirements and convert them into solution designs and/or project plans strongly desired. • Experience managing expectations when balancing alternatives against business and financial constraints strongly desired. • Strong Object-Oriented analysis and design skills from a customer-in vantage point strongly desired. • Should be well-versed in Agile (Scrum) project methodologies and development practices, particularly sprint planning and assessment, and test driven development and continuous integration. • Peoplesoft HR and Financials Experience is a definite plus. • Demonstrated experience with multiple Software Development Lifecycle methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, etc.) strongly desired. • The ideal candidate also has hands-on analysis and/or project management expertise in multiple of the following technologies: Force.com, APEX, VisualForce, Workflows, OBM, Integration/EAI technologies (e.g. Mulesoft, Pervasive, Informatica, Jitterbit, ESB, etc.), Java, JavaScript, ASP,C++Java/J2EE, including SOAP, RESTful, .NET and related technologies (JSON, XML, etc), common frameworks such as struts, spring, hibernate, etc. and database technologies (Oracle, MySQL, JDBC, SQL, PL/SQL, stored procedures). Experience using Salesforce data tools (e.g., Data Loader, DemandTools, Eclipse Force.com IDE). KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:• Excellent senior executive and team-level presentation, verbal and written communication, and facilitation skills strongly desired; Ability to communicate with employees at all levels of the organization; Excellent interpersonal skills • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills strongly desired. • Strong problem solving, communication and relationship building skills strongly desired. • Strong collaboration skills strongly desired. Works well in a team environment where team members may be distributed (not collocated). • Ability to manage multiple, concurrent work streams and tasks strongly desired. • Excellent thinker with deep hands-on analytical and/or project management expertise • Sales, Sales Operations, Service Management, Finance, HR (Employee management, Performance Management, Talent Management, Payroll, and/or Benefits), Legal business domain experience a plus. • A demonstrated commitment to high professional ethical standards and a diverse workplace strongly desired. TriNet is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants based on race, religion, color, disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), age, veteran status or other legally protected characteristics. Any applicant with a mental or physical disability who requires an accommodation during the application process should contact a company manager, a company officer or a TriNet HR representative to request such an accommodation.#LI-JJ1

Allied Consultants offers its family of consultants excellent rates, a local support staff, and an attractive benefits package which includes medical insurance (Allied shares a percentage of the cost), life insurance, a matching 401(k) plan and a cafeteria plan. Name: Business Analyst, Senior
Description: About Blackbaud:Leading uniquely at the intersection point of technology and social good, Blackbaud provides software, services, expertise, and data intelligence that empowers and connects people to advance the social good movement. We serve the entire social good community, which includes nonprofits, foundation, corporations, education institutions, and the individual change agents who support them. We work with over 40,000 organizations, helping them realize their goals, fund their missions, manage their operations, and develop long-lasting supporter relationships. Our customers are passionate about making the world a better place, and we’re inspired by the opportunity to help them.As a Senior Business Analyst, you will identify and research business needs and then determine solutions to business problems. Solutions often include a software-systems development component but may also consist of process improvement, organizational change or strategic planning and policy development. You will work closely with business and technical teams and understands the business needs as to ensure there is integration between business and technology. The Senior Business Analyst also understands development processes (SDLC) and/or business workflow processes and is very analytical with problem-solving and conflict resolution skills to help identify, communicate and resolve issues.A Senior Business Analyst may perform any of the following activities: Feasibility analysis, scope projects, and work with the project management team to prioritizes deliverables and negotiate on product functionality; create detailed Business Requirement Document (BRD) or Business Process documentation (as applicable) and translate it into functional specifications; provide analytic support by coordinating data extraction from various databases and data interpretation; partner with development and analytic teams to provide reporting on software solutions; participate in Integration Testing, User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing.Key activities that will ensure client and project success include:Ability to influence others to gain consensus on a desired outcomeAbility to assume the responsibilities of an overall solution owner, with limited advising: gathers and analyzes information and uses it to develop effective solutions to difficult problems or situations; devises workable solutions or consults with secondary resources to devise solutions; proactively raises risks and implements fixes and changes as needed to keep small problems from becoming big problems.Investigates and acts to meet customers’ current and future needs. Gives customer needs priority and responds quickly to customer concerns. Builds positive and fruitful customer relationships.Effectively uses systems and processes to measure, monitor, manage, or impact performance. Puts resources and or processes into logical, comprehensible order.Creative and critical thinker with the ability to develop original ideas, approaches, and solutions to typical, unusual or difficult situations and problems. Exhibits constructive, non-traditional thinking. Creates, from scratch or from plans, high-quality designs or work products.Negotiates or mediates sound agreements in business or organizational situations where there is disagreement or difference in interest. Successfully closes negotiations achieving best possible outcomes. Creatively approaches negotiations. Writes, speaks, and presents information effectively and persuasively across communication settings.Ability to present in various group settings with or without the use of technology. Exhibits composure while in the spotlight and conveys information eloquently. RequirementsPreferably 3-5 years of experience in consulting, software/technology, or non-profitCan effectively connect with a variety of audiences both internal and customer.Ability to mentor, coach, and guide Associate and Staff Business Analysts as neededExperience with direct marketing, accounting, or fundraising campaigns highly desirableKnowledge of Blackbaud products and the non-profit industry are a plusCBAP certification or PMI-PBA desirable but not requiredAbility to travel up to 75%Why you’ll want to come work here: Competitive salary (commission/bonus based on type of role), 4 weeks paid time off, great benefits (medical, dental, vision, FSA), 401K matchGift matching, volunteer for vacation program, and endless community involvement opportunitiesNamed to Forbes’ Fast Tech 25 and Fortune’s Change the World List; we are growing and offer incredible opportunity for advancementTremendous company culture and office perks as well as a new cutting-edge new headquarters completed in 2018Stay up to date on everything Blackbaud, follow us on Linkedin, Twitter and Facebook. Blackbaud is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.To all recruitment agencies: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Name: Business Analyst - Applied Insights
Description: We're seeking a truly exceptional, driven and creative Business Analyst that will join our growing product team to support the definition, delivery and success of our initial predictive product offerings from our groundbreaking Applied Insights initiative. This position is integral to our success in utilizing our massive data set to deliver innovative, best-in-class solutions to our 10,000 customers and achieve our mission of changing healthcare for the better. The Business Analyst will become an expert in the process of defining, analyzing, and documenting product insights for the healthcare industry, and will work closely with our VP of Analytics, our product manager, our data scientist and our engineering teams to drive the product life cycle for a new suite of our company's products to fruition. You will have the opportunity work with products that create dramatic improvements in both clinical care and businesses outcomes. To succeed in this role you should have a collaborative mindset mixed in with creativity and analytical thinking.  The preferred locations for this position are Austin TX or Kansas City, MO Specific Responsibilities Include:Work directly with internal and external stakeholders to listen to and document processes and identify opportunities for improvementContinually look for new ways to evaluate data and follow trends to discover actionable opportunities to improve the customer experienceGather and document market requirements for current and future products by conducting market research supported by on-going visits to customers and non-customers.Effectively communicate your insights to stakeholders to arrive at a consensus for each user story/projectClear verbal and written communication of product enhancements and new feature development to stakeholders based on a detailed understanding of predictive analytics needs, requirements and resources.Adept knowledge in prioritizing requirements and creating user stories through expert understanding of product strategy, plans and roadmaps.In depth analysis of product features, including user behavior analysis, A/B test result analysis, segmentation/funnel studies, product success metrics development, KPI and other product performance metric definitionUnderstand the software development lifecycle and how to collaborate effectively with Software Engineers to deliver amazing features from your detailed requirements and prototypesCross-team general product supportCandidate Background:High-potential future leaderPassionate about technologyStrong interest in the future of healthcare2+ years of experience working for a software company preferredExceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skillsFirst-rate planning, organizational, and time management skillsDetailed eye for user experience and designDesire to be an expert in an industry through curiosity, drive and experimentationCreative thinker who thrives solving challenging problemsStrong presentation and writing skills to communicate your visionClear and concise technical documentation skillsFamiliarity with Agile & Scrum development methodologiesExperience with predictive analytics is a plusHealthcare IT market experience is a plusAbility to travel domestically to customer and non-customer sites (about 20% of the time initially)Meet WellSky WellSky is a technology company advancing human wellness worldwide. Our software and professional services address the continuum of health and social care helping businesses, organizations, and communities solve tough challenges, improve collaboration for growth, and achieve better outcomes through predictive insights that only WellSky solutions can provide. A portfolio company of TPG Capital, WellSky serves more than 10,000 customer sites around the world including the largest hospital systems, blood banks and labs, home health and hospice franchises, government agencies, and human services organizations. Informed by more than 30 years of providing software and expertise, WellSky anticipates providers' needs and innovates relentlessly to help people thrive. Our purpose is to empower care heroes with technology for good, so that together, we can realize care's potential and maintain a healthy, flourishing world. For more information, visit www.WellSky.com. WellSky provides equal employment opportunities to all people without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, age, disability, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category.Applicants for U.S. based positions with WellSky must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Req ID: 36047     At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.     NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Senior Business Analyst to join our team in Austin, TX. Candidates local to Austin, TX are strongly preferred.       The individual will be responsible for the following:    Eliciting requirements using tasks such as: facilitated workshops with business subject matter experts, interviews, document analysis, prototyping, and interface analysisSpecifying and analyzing business goals/requirements, functional requirements, system interface requirements, reporting requirements, data requirements, non-functionalFacilitates meetings with the business subject matter experts or end users to formulate business strategies and requirements and translate client needs into actionable system requirements.Coordinates, conducts, and documents requirements gathering sessions with end users, project stakeholders and development team(s)Critically evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconciles conflicts, decomposes high-level information into details - abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguishes user requests from the underlying true needsDevelops high quality documentation including business requirements documents, use cases, software requirements specifications, report specifications, epics, user stories, screen and interface designs, conceptual page flows, business process models, user acceptance test plans, and training manuals / user guidesIdentifies, plans and estimates level of effort for business analysis related tasksLeading/hosting large, cross functional meetings to elicit requirements from subject matter experts and build consensusAnalyzing requirements from several functional areas to determine potential conflicts /other requirements that may exist in other areas.Ability to participate in Quality Assurance and User Acceptance.Performs functional testing as needed to ensure adherence to requirementsCoordinates/executes the development of test cases.Successfully engages in multiple initiatives simultaneously   Basic Qualifications:   Minimum of 5 years work experience with business process analysis   Preferred Skills:   Business analysis - requirements management and gatheringUnderstanding business process management and business requirements of the customers and translating them to specific software requirementsExceptional communication, presentation, organization and time management skillsExceptional written and verbal communication skillsAbility to participate in various phases of testing (Execution of Plan, Design, Strategy, Coordination, Development, Quality Assurance and Execution)Ability to participate in release and implementation processes         This is a Temporary Employee of NTT DATA role. This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.About NTT DATA Services    NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.     NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.     NTT DATA, Inc. (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result.

This position will leverage business and process experience, combined with technology and project delivery savviness, to represent both program and business priorities. This role will provide dedicated business representation to the program to ensure iterative and rapid decision making with our strategic software and system implementation partners.Primary ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities will initially focus on the Information Management capability area of the project, with opportunities in the future to also support other capability areasResponsible for creating and maintaining the Whole Foods Market functional user storiesCollaborate on grooming of functional user storiesCreate process designs to support new business processes implemented as part of the programCreate functional release test cases and execute test cases as requiredWork within a product team to act as the business representation during the implementation of the Infor Retail ERPSupport the business decision making process to ensure win-win partnerships across the various stakeholders of the programContribute to the communication and collaboration across all levels of the program to ensure strategic vision and priority settingWork alongside our strategic software partners as they engage in user research, user testing, and user experience analysis, to guide fact-based design and developmentWork across additional product teams to collaborate with the product owners to ensure priorities and business capabilities best align to both program and business objectivesQualifications2+ years of experience with defining user stories, business processes, strategic plans, roadmaps, or communication plans preferred2+ years of related experience with third party ERP software, or supply chain or merchandising systemsExcellent oral and written communication skills. This includes the ability to explain technology concepts to business partners, as well as business concepts to technologistsFunctional experience with programs/projects related to at least two of the following capability areas: Item ManagementProduct Life-cycle ManagementRecipe ManagementNutri-facts & Ingredient ManagementItem, Supplier, & Logistics Cost ManagementRetail Purchasing & OrderingInventory Management & ControlRetail Financial ManagementCategory & Assortment ManagementRetail Sales Audit & Invoice MatchingPrice ManagementAllocation & ReplenishmentTrade ManagementMaster Data ManagementExperience working with projects or programs that involved cloud-based software-as-a-service solutions a plusExperience with grocery or retail business area activities a plusExperience and knowledge in Agile development practices and toolsEmpathy for and identification with the team members in the organization affected by changes in the digital workplaceAnalytical skills. Outstanding analytical and problem-solving abilitiesAbility to work collaboratively with people, process and technology change in a dynamic and complex operating environmentA deep affinity with Whole Foods Market culture, processes, and a passion for envisioning changeLocation & Travel Located in Austin, TX with up to 25% time spent traveling between Austin, Minneapolis, regional offices and/or store locations.  At Whole Foods Market we provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all team members and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. Whole Foods Market hires and promotes individuals solely on the basis of their qualifications for the position to be filled.

Name: Agreements Business Systems Analyst
Description: SummaryAppleCare Specialty Operations is looking for a Business Analyst to support daily operations in our Agreement Operations team. This role is an opportunity for a self-driven individual to utilize his or her business acumen, systems knowledge and apply analytical skills to deliver creative, valuable solutions to AppleCare. You will be responsible for operational management and administrative tasks related to Agreements with a main focus on analysis of AppleCare coverage and system issues. You will also be expected to operate with a high degree of initiative, creativity and leadership within division or department policy guidelines using independent judgment in achieving assigned objectives. The Agreements Business Systems Analyst will play a key role in producing measurable improvements for the Specialty Operations team by improving the customer experience, dedicatedly identifying solutions and mitigating risk. This will be achieved through process mapping, root cause analysis, issue ticket resolution, business recommendations, execution of operational strategies and overseeing support of our vendor transactions teams. 3-5 years of comparable work experience Solid experience with SAP required Strong to advanced knowledge of Excel (i.e. Pivot tables, Formulas, Filters, etc.) Solid experience in reporting, data mining and ad hoc analysis Experience performing audits & root cause analysis Strong written and verbal communication skills Experience documenting processes & working with a vendor support team Adaptive and flexible to changing technologies, process and environments Ability to work and make decisions with minimal supervision Team player, reliable and dependable Exemplary professional demeanor, resourcefulness, flexibility, and self-motivated Ability to maintain a positive attitude in high stress/fast paced work environment Strong leadership skills & project management experience a plus Achieve and maintain a comprehensive understanding of AppleCare Agreement Operations business, transaction handling, procedures and important metrics Examine and analyze transactions errors & trends in SAP & using visual analytics; Resolve coverage issues and address partner concerns adhering to SL Isolate and identify gaps and errors in system functionality as it relates to business process and programs; raise issue & enhancement tickets and drive them to resolution Establish, document, stage and transition processes as needed Ensure seamless implementation of new processes and procedures by validating completeness of training materials and process documents, hosting calibration sessions regularly Recognize and act on opportunities for automation, integration and standardization of global processes Make sound decisions based on a mixture of analysis, experience and judgment Work cross functionally with other Apple departments to ensure business needs are addressed Provide data as required by management for periodic status reporting. Meet minimum team standards and understand the goals of the entire organization and actively participate in achievement of those goals. Participate in user acceptance testing Education & ExperienceBA/BS degree or equivalent experience required

Name: Associate Business Analyst
Description: Associate Business Analyst Full Time  Austin, TX Begin your journey at Gensuite LLC If you are looking for a variety of challenging projects with global reach, Gensuite LLC is right for you. Our team members enjoy a dynamic, positive work environment with opportunities that challenge and reward. Successful candidates demonstrate excellent communication and cross-functional team skills as well as a strong record of initiative and creativity and above all, a passion to create value for the customer.  We offer all our full-time employees a competitive package of compensation and benefits, including vacation and paid-time-off; Company-sponsored group healthcare and life insurance plans. About Gensuite LLC Gensuite LLC provides digital solutions to companies with global compliance process needs. Our innovative, Web-based applications are developed on a patented architecture to help our customers turn complex compliance requirements into digitized and actionable processes. Gensuite Subscribers Worldwide: Access Midstream, Amazon Fulfillment, AngloGold Ashanti, Cactus Wellhead, Comcast, Dubois Chemicals, General Electric, Grainger, Hill-Rom, Ingersoll Rand, Luxottica, NBCUniversal, Perrigo, US Silica Responsibilities:Gathering & understanding requirements from the customers.Drafting Business Requirement Documentation for project specifications.Develop a critical understanding of clients operations and systemsAct as liaison with product developers to ensure technical compatibility and user satisfactionCommunicate business requirement specifications to the development team and work with them to scope feasibility of required change; communicate the same to customers.Participate in the User Acceptance Testing for various updates in Gensuite applications if requiredProvide Application Specific training to Gensuite subscribersTroubleshoot / escalate the user inquiries timely via email, phone or other tracking tools.Education:B.E / B.Tech degree in information systems/computer science, engineering/science fields, communications, and computer-related trainingQualifications & Experience:Bachelors degree in information systems/computer science, engineering/science fields, or equivalent experience1-3 years relevant experience, highly desiredExcellent written and verbal communication skillsStrong time management, organization, and project skillsProficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, PowerPoint, and WordBasic computer troubleshooting skillsKnowledge of HTML and web-based software solutionsExperience writing queries involving multiple tables from MS Access, SQL Server, etc., highly desired

Name: Data Analyst
Description: OverviewThis position will serve as the data analysis lead for the City of Austin’s Bloomberg Philanthropies-funded Innovation Team (i-Team). The i-Team is the City of Austin’s incubator for solving complex social problems. Our first year focused on researching and designing solutions for homelessness. See info here.As the i-Team’s data analysis lead, you will work with a team of designers, researchers, analysts, and city staff to identify gaps and prototype service-oriented solutions for residents at risk of displacement and/or experiencing homelessness. Your work will include data analytics, performance measurement, and data architecture – all in service of sharing information and producing insights for decision makers. You will work with teammates, stakeholders, and community members to quickly generate data and results, and translate them into program and policy recommendations that inform implementation in other city departments.This position is currently Grant Funded through calendar year 2019.Applications close November 26, 2018SalaryCommensurate with experienceWhat we’re looking forDemonstrated professional experience in data analysis, systems analysis, policy analysis, or related fieldsExperience collecting, analyzing, synthesizing, and communicating both quantitative and qualitative data, including performance measuresKnowledge of City of Austin, state, and federal statutes, ordinances and codes relevant to social services, housing, planning, and related domainsKnowledge of methods for research, cost/benefit analysis, statistical analysis, and financial modelingExperience in data architecture, including assessing the structure of data systems to share data and informationInterpersonal skills to engage all stakeholders and facilitate accurate requirements to capture and manage stakeholders’ expectationsExperience collaborating on multidisciplinary teams; flexibility and openness to adapting data gathering and analysis methods to fit the needs of a multidisciplinary teamAbility to zoom in and out on a project; ability to shift from focusing on small details to understanding large system relations and understanding the relationships betweenAwareness of modern practices for human-centered designAbility to professionally and productively respond to unexpected hurdlesA passion for public service and a commitment to doing the hard work that’s necessary to improve our city servicesMinimum qualificationsGraduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major course work in a related fieldThree (3) years experience related to the job.Application requirementsPlease submit the following with your application:RésuméCover LetterA work sample or visualization that demonstrates your skill in data analytics or data architecturePlease be sure to detail on the application all previous employment that you wish to be considered as part of your qualifications. Be sure to include your specific work experience that relates to the minimum and preferred qualifications for the position on your application. Please do not use phrases like “see resume” within your online application. The information provided in your resume must match the information in the job application. Your resume will not substitute for a complete employment application.

Name: Marketing Analyst
Description: What we're looking for: Are you a self-motivated critical thinker who is driven to succeed? Our downtown office has an open floor plan that encourages collaboration. We take care of our team as well; a solid benefits package, quarterly bonuses, regular company outings, free beverages & snacks, music, and great co-workers are all included with employment at Modernize.  In this position, you will be tasked with turning data into insight and action by providing thorough web and mobile measurement, analytics and a/b testing. You consider yourself a strong critical thinker, have the ability to navigate various data environments, hands-on technical ability in data, and a strong drive to understand our business. The role involves daily collaboration with product management, user design, data warehouse developers, data architects, and software development teams. Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Arrive Logistics is seeking a highly-motivated Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team. Our strong, data-driven culture offers a unique opportunity for a BI Analyst looking to make an immediate impact across all functions and at all levels of the organization. As the fastest growing logistics brokerage in history, Arrive needs someone who will thrive in a fast paced and evolving environment. In this role, you will:Develop an understanding of the logistics industry as well as Arrives core business functions and processes.Work closely with key business stakeholders to identify analytical and reporting needs and document requirements. Invest in your future with our matching 401K program.Leave the suit and tie at home; our dress code is casual. Eat for free on Fridays...lunch is on Arrive!Sweat it out using our local gym discounts.Recharge your batteries at our fully-stocked caffeine bar.Soothe aches and pains with our monthly in-office massages!

Name: Digital Marketing Data Analyst
Description: Effective Spend is looking for a data analyst with experience working in marketing analytics, specifically. The Digital Marketing Data Analyst works hand in hand with our PPC and SEO departments to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of our client services teams. The Marketing Data Analyst helps to clearly quantify performance objectives, implement data tracking, and automate data reports and repetitive tasks.  The Marketing Data Analyst will join our Business Intelligence team – a team that re-imagined our data analytics from the ground up. We started with web tracking and attribution (Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager), then moved into reporting automation (SQL and Power BI) and are now driving a shift from descriptive reporting to actionable and insightful dashboarding. These initiatives directly impact almost every aspect of our company and are critical to driving our continued growth.  We are looking for a highly motivated individual that is excited by new opportunities and the potential to have a large impact. Ideal candidates will be detail-oriented, organized, and professional with the desire to take ownership of multiple projects simultaneously. Key Responsibilities:Google Tag Manager – Implement and troubleshoot tracking pixels for our various platforms on client websites using this software. Basic exposure is preferred, experience with advanced functionality like custom javascript variables, tracking events, and cross-domain tracking is a plus. The best candidate will have light understanding of HTML/Javascript/CSS to be able to QA tracking configuration.Google Analytics – Dig into the data presented in GA and understand what is happening with a website. Use segmented traffic and historical analysis to forecast goals and overall knowledge of data available in GA for analysis by our SEM and SEO teams for reporting.Reporting Automation – Use existing web-based tools to query data from our sources (Kenshoo, Adwords, Facebook, etc) and assisting developing new tools for pulling data from other sources (LinkedIn web scraping, CRMs, etc). Automate reports using SQL, Power BI, and formulas & pivot tables in Google SheetsReport Creation – Work with account teams to create custom reports for high value clients that focus on their unique KPIs and reporting needs. Use experience with the above to drive the next generation of insightful and actionable dashboards for all clients in Microsoft Power BI.Qualifications & Skills Requirements:4-year Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, statistics, MIS, analytics, data science, business intelligence, or a related field.1+ years of experience in marketing-related analytics is required.Experience with PPC, SEM or SEO marketing analytics is a strong plus.Proficiency in Google Analytics.Excellent mathematical, problem solving, analytical, and communication skills.A passion for data visualization. Experience utilizing tools such as Power BI or Tableau is a strong plus.Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, with advanced knowledge of Excel formulas, Pivot Tables and Macros.Experience with SQL is a strong plus.Experience with HTML/Javascript/CSS is a plus.Experience with a programming language such as Python or Java is a plus.Benefits: Effective Spend is proud to be named a Top 10 Best Places to Work by the Austin Business Journal. Here are some of the ways we support an awesome company culture: Competitive paid time offAdditional volunteer PTOMedical, dental and vision healthcare plans401k with company matchingBonuses for employee and client referralsFun team outings and social sports like soccer, cornhole and kickballFoosball, chess, and other games in the office for a quick breakGreat office location within walking distance of the hike and bike trail and numerous coffee shops and lunch spotsSnacks, fresh fruit, drinks and plenty of fresh-ground coffee Read More About Our Company CultureHow to Apply: Please send your resume and a cover letter explaining your interest and related qualifications to careers@effectivespend.com. Your cover letter is an opportunity to show off your writing skills, highlight your relevant experience, and prove your attention to detail. So show us what you’ve got! We look forward to hearing from you.

Name: Senior Tolls Business Analyst
Description: SNC-Lavalin Atkins seeks an energetic and highly motivated self-starter to join our team in Austin, TX as a Senior Tolls Business Analyst supporting the Texas Department of Transportation (TxDOT).  The ideal candidate will have a background in business and/or revenue collection operations management as a business analyst, systems manager or financial manager/analyst.  MAJOR FUNCTION / ROLE  Under direction, applies technical professional competency in Toll Systems, Toll Operations and relevant Toll related Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) technology to the investigation of transportation planning, engineering and operational needs and problems, the coordination of Toll project activities, and the preparation of plans and documents. Expected to take the lead in project-specific teams. Applies broad knowledge of leading-edge information and communication technologies, planning, and engineering processes to the planning, development, design, and operation of Toll systems. Expected to carry out job functions within small project-oriented multidisciplinary teams of Toll professionals and be able to support direct interaction with clients within the context of project progress meetings, design reviews, operations, and project production and delivery. Major results expected include high-quality written, verbal, and graphical deliverables in the form of progress reports, operational concepts, technology reviews, designs, and specifications.  JOB DUTIES  Applies general financial, planning and operational principles to solve specific toll-related problems.  Assists in the design and development of toll financial concepts and analyses, including requirements analysis, as well as development and communication of concepts.  Researches feasibility of alternative approaches, other toll implementations and cost analyses.  Writes reports, delivers or participates in presentations, discusses concepts and deliverables with clients, and participates in quality-control checks.  Supports and coordinates the development of toll operations budgets.  Prepares toll cost analyses  Analyzes the information that is generated from the roadside (toll equipment) to troubleshoot issues.  Develops and analyzes business rules and procedures (roadside and back office) to optimize revenue collection and/or minimize negative customer impacts.  Manages and analyzes business rules and procedures for interagency agreements to optimize revenue collection and/or minimize negative customer impacts.  Coordinates with various departments within the organization (both client and consultant staff) to complete approved recommendations, ensuring that all parties understand the proposed solution, document requirements accurately and execute the implementation plan in a timely manner.  Prepares monthly dashboard performance measure reports.  Supports preparation and monitoring of contract and subcontract documents.  Compiles data and prepares contract progress reports.  Supervises Toll team members.  May manage Toll efforts in one or various concurrent projects.  Performs such assignments and duties as the Supervisor may deem necessary from time to time.  EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE  B.S. degree in Civil Engineering or a toll-related subject such as Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Transportation Planning, Accounting, Economics, Business, Law, or Information Technology. Toll-related Master’s degree/MBA can substitute for one year of experience.  This level may be achieved by candidates with seven (7) years’ experience since Bachelor’s or six (6) years since Masters. Relevant work experience would provide exposure to information and communication technologies, toll operations, and/or intelligent transportation systems (ITS), including fiber-optic communication design, video systems, computer hardware & software, toll collection systems and sub-systems, toll infrastructure, electronic payment, or traffic management.  Without a degree, a minimum of thirteen (13) years of relevant experience is required.  SPECIAL SKILLS  Position requires strong analytical ability, good communication/interpersonal skills, organizational skills, and technical accounting skills.  Strong personal computer skills and ability to work in Microsoft Office applications, including Outlook, Excel, Word and Access, are required. SQL skills are preferred.  Proven ability to lead analyst teams successfully.  Completion of relevant Toll Training and Project Management Programs within the first 24 months of employment is highly desirable Position requires ability to deal effectively and harmoniously with people at all levels of the organization and to represent the firm professionally. Good interpersonal skills are essential to interact effectively.  Strong personal computer skills and proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office products, including Word, Power Point, Excel, And Access is required. SQL skills are desirable.  PMP certification is preferred.  PROFESSIONAL REGISTRATIONS  Not required.

Name: Business Controls Analyst
Description: Business TitleBus Controls Analyst-Cust Ops26-Nov-2018Posting LocationUnited States - Texas - Austin Posting Job DescriptionJOB SUMMARYThe Business Controls Analyst will provide direct support to achieve company performance and financial objectives for our customer service call centers. This individual will be responsible for assisting in the preparation and development of operating and capital budgets, forecasts, short and long-term business plans, variance and trend analysis and will also be responsible for overseeing and coordinating the consolidation and distribution of daily, weekly and monthly statistical and financial reports and analysis. Additionally, the Business Controls Analyst will assist in cost analysis and special projects as required. Description: Why Us?With a mantra of Empowering Human Potential, Hanger, Inc. is the world's premier provider of orthotic and prosthetic (O&P) services and products, offering the most advanced O&P solutions, clinically differentiated programs and unsurpassed customer service. Hanger's Patient Care segment is the largest owner and operator of O&P patient care clinics nationwide. Through its Products & Services segment, Hanger distributes branded and private label O&P devices, products and components, and provides rehabilitative solutions to the broader market. Built on the legacy of James Edward Hanger, the first amputee of the American Civil War, Hanger is steeped in 150 years of clinical excellence and innovation with a vision to be the partner of choice for products and services that enhance human physical capability. Collectively, Hanger employees touch thousands of lives each day, helping people achieve new levels of mobility and freedom.
