Name: Business Analyst - FiveOut
Description: *Position Summary:** The primary purpose of this position is to serve as a supporting liaison between members of the technical team and the business user community to analyze business and user needs, elicit and document requirements, identify system enhancements, and determine impacts to current processes. This is a client facing, consulting role, and as such, will require up to 80% travel.*Primary Duties & Responsibilities:** + Elicits requirements, defines business requirements, use cases and user stories, and performs analysis on a solution implementation  + Implements techniques for eliciting and validating requirements including: Brainstorming, JAD Sessions, RAD Sessions, Interviews, Surveys, Nominal Group Technique, and/or Structured Walkthroughs  + Conducts functional specification review sessions with cross-functional team members  + Conducts structured walkthroughs of process flow diagrams to establish ?As-Is? and ?To-Be? states  + Ensures business requirements are met, optimal system design is achieved and differences between business requirements and systems capabilities are resolved  + Leverages business experience and analytical skills to define recommendations and process improvements through industry best practices and personal line of business knowledge.  + Identifies potential solutions and evaluates them for both technical and business suitability  + Serve as a liaison between business users and developers  + Contributes to the adoption services/efforts of an implementation project  + Develops training materials for end users *Basic Qualifications:** + Bachelor?s Degree in Systems Analysis, Information Technology, Business, or related field  + At least three (3) years? full software lifecycle development experience in a Business Analyst or similar role *Other Position Requirements:** + Demonstrated ability to work autonomously on BA-related tasks/activities to develop end-customer deliverables  + Experience with various project methodologies including Agile and Waterfall implementation approaches  + Experience with requirements management through a requirements tracking tool (e.g., Jira, SpiraTeam)  + Demonstrated ability to understand and explain both technical material & business-oriented consulting  + Demonstrated communication and presentation skills  + Demonstrated skills in establishing interpersonal relationships with all levels, including business and end-user stakeholders *Preferred Requirements:** + Experience with one or more of the following: Adobe Experience Manager, Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, Adobe Audience Manager, Adobe Campaign, ecommerce, web, mobile & digital marketing platforms and projects  + Consulting experience  + Experience delivering projects on Cloud platforms *Data Privacy & Security:** + All Sirius employees are responsible to safeguard the information and information systems that they use or handle in the execution of their duties. Employees are obligated to know and perform their duties in accordance with Sirius policies, standards, and procedures related to security and report security violations to the appropriate Sirius authority.  + Participate at hire and annually in the Information Security Awareness training as well as other required training identified by the Human Resources department. Other data privacy and data security related regulatory training may be required based on your role or assignment. *_Essential Functions:_** _This position exists to provide consulting solutions to customers a_ _nd as such requires the ability to travel to and from customer sites and interact with customers on an ongoing and regular basis._ The above primary duties, responsibilities, and position requirements are not all inclusive.  Sirius is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. As a government contractor, Sirius takes affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans; maintains a drug-free workplace; and participates in E-Verify.  Individuals who receive job offers will be required to complete pre-employment screening that includes a background check verifying name, residences, education, work experience, and criminal convictions consistent with the Fair Credit Reporting Act; and a drug test for controlled substances consistent with the Drug-Free Workplace Act and the Americans with Disabilities Act.  Sirius will not sponsor work eligibility for this position.

Name: Quality Business Systems Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce is immediately adding two full-time Quality Business Systems Analysts to our existing Development team in support of our technology client's internal custom asset services development team in Austin, Texas (TX). The Analyst will join a high-tech manufacturing and services group where the Analysts will apply software quality assurance and process engineering improvement to maximize our client's efficiency across the platform.  Position impact:  The core team is responsible for internal customer OS Imaging software development, asset tagging, and processes support. As part of the team, the Quality Business Systems Analysts will perform UAT testing, answer tickets, and provide documentation. Ideal candidates will have some technical experience where they were required to perform discovery of a technical platform or element within the systems they were testing/documenting.  Day to day Responsibilities:  The Quality Business Systems Analyst's day to day will require work with QA, BA and dev, and members of other teams as required, to inventory existing artifacts, understand the application functions, and develop an approach to better business processes Inventory existing artifacts and develop a matrix of all inputs and functions processed by this team Resources will work with PET QA, BA and dev, and members of other teams as required, to understand the application functions, and develop an approach to create the above matrix Assist in creating standard operating procedures and metrics around QA best practices Document software support processes Analyze support trends and recommend resolutionREQUIREMENTS: 5+ years of QA experience in both operational and cross device, cross browser application testing 1 - 3 years of QA managerial experience Mastery of software QA methodology and industry best practices and how it fits into Agile software development practices Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of testing tools Technical acumen from prior development or QA experience Ability to analyze, troubleshoot and solve technical problems Ability to create and execute test cases for UAT testing Ability to analyze systems support queue and recommend and prioritize actions for process improvement Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Business Intelligence Analyst  Amherst Residential, is a vertically integrated residential real estate platform making ownership of single family homes seamless for investors and home owners. The platform has raised over $6 billion of capital since inception, manages ~20,000 homes, and is growing its team as it rolls out new investments and business lines.  Amherst Residential is hiring a Jr. Business Intelligence Analyst whose primary responsibility will be to work on the Corporate Growth and Executive Management team to provide data analytics and reporting to the various functions within Amherst Residential. This includes implementing solutions for optimizing and automating existing reporting as well as leveraging tools such as SQL and Tableau to create and monitor new key performance indicators and operational metrics. This is a great opportunity for someone who is interested in working alongside a fast-paced, data-driven team to help the organization achieve its strategic objectives. Duties and Responsibilities:Tackle complex business problems by converting raw data into meaningful and actionable business insights. Collaborate directly with peers and business leaders to transform ideas into actions.Utilize Microsoft SQL Server for extraction and analysis of data from multiple sources with demonstrated ability to effectively decipher, analyze and report dataDevelop reports and dashboards using Tableau and/or Excel for internal and external customersLeverage analytic problem-solving skills in working with large disparate, datasets to report portfolio operational metrics and performanceAssist with preparation and automation of recurring /ad-hoc reporting assignmentsRequired Experience:Bachelor's degree in Management Information Systems, Finance, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering or related quantitative discipline1-2 years' experience analyzing data, drawing conclusions and making recommendations; consulting or financial services industry experience is a plusStrong SQL query writing skills required. Experience working in a Microsoft SQL Server environment is preferred.Experience with creating and presenting management dashboards and reportsExperience with data visualization/business intelligence tools. Experience with Tableau is a huge plus.Strong Microsoft Excel skillsAbility to be flexible and work in a fast paced environmentExcellent written and verbal communicationAbility to meet established timelinesAnalytical mindset and passion for gleaning actionable insights from raw dataBonus Skills:Knowledge of at least one other programming language such as Python is a plusKnowledge of data warehousing and ETL concepts is a plusWhat we offer: Amherst is a privately held corporation located in West Austin with beautiful views of Lake Austin and the loop 360 bridge in a modern workspace with open floor plans. A competitive compensation package, annual bonus, 401k matchFlexible PTO, 11 paid holidays, accrued sick/personal timeEmployer paid benefits (medical, dental, vision, health savings account)Professional career development and reimbursementOn-premise fitness center, locker roomsDaily catered lunches, fully stocked kitchen with snacks/drinksRelaxed casual environment and weekly/quarterly office events!SDL2017

Name: CRM Business Analyst
Description: #LifeIsSweet The people. The passion. The success. You will frequently see Sugas huddled around a desk or whiteboard collaborating, cranking out ideas, or solving the latest industry problem. Are you ready to play a key role in influencing how companies create extraordinary relationships with their customers? We’d love to hear your ideas! We’re going places… join us for the ride, experience sweet success and show us your passion.Where do you fit? The Business Analyst is a CRM subject matter expert, with the ability to lead discussions and draw functional requirements out of business subject matter experts. As a member of SugarCRM's Professional Services organization, you will be responsible for identifying and organizing customer needs into requirements and working with the project team to successfully implement those requirements. Impact you will make in the role:Collaboratively work with customers, project team members and partners in the definition of business requirementsLead CRM functional discussions and leverage your knowledge of CRM best practicesWork with the project team to translate requirements into project deliverablesPerform as the product owner during scrum meetingsWork with customer to prioritize project requirementsActively work with customers and the project team to resolve issuesCommunicate customer priorities to Core product management for inclusion in Core product roadmapCoordinate requirements work with Solution Architect, Project Manager and Engagement Director at SugarExpertise you will bring in:BA/BS degree, MS/MBA preferred5+ years of experience in a software professional services organization or consulting firm (Accenture, Deloitte, E&Y, etc.) with Business Analysis responsibilityAttention to detail and key and deadlinesStrong background of career achievementExcellent communicator (written and verbal) with ability to maintain open communication with all levels of the organization. Comfortable leading discussionsMust be goal-driven, a self-starter able to thrive in a fast-paced environmentMust have the ability to cut through the ambiguity and identify the core issuesStrong understanding of enterprise software and enterprise software implementation/projects. CRM or ERPExperience with Agile methodologyExperience implementing cloud/SaaS software solutionsMust develop a good understanding of SugarCRM product capabilities and best practices. Become Sugar certifiedExperience facilitating requirements sessions with business users, IT and senior managementStrong experience with business process definition and designExperience estimating work effortExperience creating detailed project documents – project plan, functional design, use cases, test plans, etc.Experience managing projects – timeline, resources and financialsExperience in end user trainingHistory of successful project completion (on time, on budget) for projects where you have worked on the requirementsGeneral office skills are required. Familiarity with project management and/or other tracking tools is requiredProject management cert. (e.g. PMP) desired but not essentialAbility to travel to customer locations and work from customer offices as requiredRespect and expect accountabilityLocation: Cupertino, CA, Raleigh, NC or Remote-U.S. We are an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. Minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.Benefits and Perks: Beyond a stellar work environment, friendly people, and inspiring work, we have some great benefits and perks: Competitive salariesExcellent medical, dental and vision coverage for you and your family, along with other benefit plans like 401(k) matchGenerous paid time off policyWeekly catered lunch & learns, fully stocked kitchens, and nearby access to Cupertino’s newest restaurants and stores at Main Street CupertinoHealth/Wellness: Quarterly chair massages, Wellness Reimbursement, and Workforce Fitness ProgramOnsite Programs such as Dry Cleaning, Car Washes, Massage, Yoga, and moreCareer & Personal Development Program – multi-platformNew Hire Onboarding for all new employees worldwide – at Corporate Headquarters in Cupertino, CaliforniaRegular social events and birthday celebrations (yes, sweet treats are a big deal at SugarCRM)Ownership is the greatest self-identity at SugarCRM - you are making an impact nowWe are a merit-based company - many opportunities to learn, excel and grow your careerLearn more on LinkedIn and Twitter @LifeAtSugarNote to Recruiters and Placement Agencies: SugarCRM does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website or to any SugarCRM employee. SugarCRM will not pay fees to any third-party agency or firm and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered property of SugarCRM and will be processed accordingly.

Name: Senior Business/Systems Analyst
Description: Job Description CACI is looking to hire multiple Senior Business/System Analysts to join our growing VA Team. We are looking for individuals that have Momentum or similar COTS system experience (e.g., SAP or Oracle). Individual must have 11-15 years of experience with implementing COTS software. Must be able to work in Arlington Austin location. Responsibilities: Individual will implement a COTS financial system and provide system and federal financial expertise relative to the organizations requirements. Provide advice and recommendations on process best practices.Individual will be responsible for analyzing As-Is processes and analyzing and configuring the To-Be business processes for a new federal COTS financial system.Perform analysis on business or systems processes to identify improvements. Work with team members and client to understand and define needs and develop and recommend solutions.Document configuration requirements, functional design specifications, business processes, and user stories based on requirements.Be a subject matter expert and provide functional guidance to team members, demonstrate expertise in the COTS financial system, federal financial management business processes, and ERP implementation best practices.Lead a team, coaches, review, and delegate work to other team members.Individual must be able to work independently solving issues related to system or business processes.Requires ability to communicate with leadership regarding matters of significant importance (status, risks, etc.) to the organization.Develop schedules and report progress against them.Reviews requirements by business process area and develops test scenarios. Executes tests based on Test Plan, records results, analyzes results to assign Pass/Fail status, and creates detailed and well written Test Reports.Elicits and documents business intelligence requirements and conceptual designs for new reports, metrics, and dashboards.Required Skills:  Good analytical skills, written and oral communication skills. Ability to work well in a team environment. Desired Skills:  Individual should be knowledgeable with Momentum or similar COTS software, systems analysis, and financial accounting is a plus. Bachelor's degree with a concentration in Computer Science, MIS or related field, or Accounting/Finance is desired but not required.  What We Can Offer You: Weve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post.Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nations highest priorities.For over 55 years, the principles of CACIs unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success. Job Location US-Austin-TX-AUSTIN  CACI employs a diverse range of talent to create an environment that fuels innovation and fosters continuous improvement and success. At CACI, you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. CACI is proud to provide dynamic careers for employees worldwide. CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Name: Global Sales Ops - VMC Senior Business Analyst
Description: Business Summary:VMware accelerates digital transformation through a software-defined approach to business and IT. The trusted platform provider of choice for more than 500,000 customers globally, VMware is the pioneer in virtualization and an innovator in cloud and business mobility. A proven leader, VMware allows customers to run, manage, connect and secure applications across clouds and devices in a common operating environment.  Our team of 20,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today.  Job Role and Responsibilities:This Senior Analyst will play a leadership role in the design and deployment of processes and systems supporting VMwares cloud offerings. You will report to the Global Cloud Sales Ops Director and will be the subject matter expert on VMC sales processes and systems. You will set direction, support system updates and drive enablement activities. They will collaborate with the Sales Operations team, Sales leaders, process leaders for other offerings and corporate IT staff. The main task is act as Process Owner for certain VMware cloud processes and systems, including:Partner with Sales Ops and Sales leaders to understand cloud sales motionsLead discussions/decisions on strategic and tactical direction on optimizing cloud sales motions through process improvements, system enhancement and automationCollaborate w/ other process owners and IT resources to design process and system changesManage and prioritize system enhancements in Salesforce.com and other automation projects, including user acceptance testingCoordinate and conduct enablement and training effortsBe a domain expert and trusted strategic advisor on subscription-based operational processesSupport regional teams with queries, analysis and problem solving Required Skills:Leadership experience in process design and system requirement definitionExperience with direct and indirect sales motions, including partnering with sales management in operational or other rolesRecent experience with Salesforce and order management processesProven operations experience gained within a fast-paced high-tech organizationConfident working independently and with remote teamsInternal transfers preferred Preferred Skills:Do you have experience in Software, Cloud, or Infrastructure such as Compute, Network, Storage?

Name: Business Analyst (Non-IT) - Intermediate
Description: JOB DESCRIPTION: " Local candidates preferred.  Sr. HRIS Analyst - CONTRACTOR  The Human Resources Technology team at AMD is recognized as technical experts in providing creative, value added systems and solutions to meet Human Resources business needs. We are looking for a Sr. HRIS analyst to join our team to provide functional support for a variety of project and enhancement requests related to SAP HCM, 3rd Party interfaces, and some internal custom applications. The Sr. HRIS Analyst will report to the Manager, HRIS as part of our AMD HR Technology team.  Job Responsibilities:  Works with the HRT Project/Enhancement Lead to identify and prioritize projects/enhancements requested by the COE  Primary HR Functional Lead on projects and enhancements and works with the HR Technology team, IT HR Support Team and COE Subject Matter Experts to:  o Facilitate and document business requirements to align business demand with IT understanding  o Translate requirements into system solutions (either through direct system configuration where applicable, or partnering with IT or a third party for advanced configuration)  o Develop business acumen to properly manage and document business requirements, build use cases, and testing scenarios  o Assist in execution of project life cycle, including as-is and to be analysis, scope definition, process improvement and testing  o Assist with problem solving and issue resolution including escalation and prioritizations  o Test and document system changes  o Ensure successful rollout and ongoing support of projects/enhancements  Provides frequent status update on projects/enhancements and escalates issues/risks as necessary  Functions as a team member within the department and organization, and performs assigned duties that best serve the company  A successful candidate will have the following skills:  Knowledge of and hands-on experience with SAP HCM (OM, PA, Benefits) and 3rd Party interfaces is strongly desired  Strong ability to read, analyze, and interpret HR systems technical and procedural documentation  Strong problem solving, analytical, and effective solution design skills  Strong attention to detail and data analysis skills  Ability to execute deliverables in a timely and efficient manner, with quality results  Effective interpersonal skills across various levels of the organization  Excellent customer service and communication skills (both written and verbal)  Strong documentation skills are required  Ability to work independently, and possesses strong organizational skills and ability to handle multiple projects and work in high-volume, fast-paced environment  Ability to work effectively, professionally, cooperatively and efficiently within a team environment  Expertise in Microsoft office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio)  Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience"EMAIL TO APPLY: Don dsemple@xpeerant.com RETURN TO JOB LIST RETURN TO Xpeerant HOME PAGE

Name: Senior Oracle Business Analyst - US
Description: Apply Now  Senior Oracle Business Analyst - US Austin, TX, USA  Req #498 Friday, November 16, 2018 We envision a Luminex solution in every lab around the world seeking to obtain timely and confident answers. We aim to lead with transformative solutions that uniquely accelerate reliable answers while reducing the overall cost of advancing health. The Senior Business Analyst - provides functional and technical Product Lifecycle Management expertise, with emphasis in Agile PLM, Oracle and similar applications for Luminex personnel. This position is responsible for delivering and continuously improving business applications and processes. Responsibilities include business requirements gathering, functional analysis, deployment, and sustaining support, both locally and globally as required.  ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES  • Provide both functional and technical expertise and direction as it relates to Manufacturing business systems and processes.  • Organize and lead projects of varying scope and complexity. Projects may pertain to new functionality, process improvement, problem resolution, new business model requirements, upgrades, etc.  • Provide Agile PLM Oracle and similar applications vision and roadmap guidance.  • Interact daily with manufacturing personnel, i.e. engineers, planners, managers, technicians, inspectors and assemblers, providing sustaining support as required.  • Support business processes in Austin and around the globe as required.  JOB REQUIREMENTS  Competencies:  •Building Effective Teams—builds a team with high morale and spirit; encourages open dialog  •Business Acumen—knowledgeable about current and future issues that could affect the organization  •Customer Focus— dedication to the customer and earns their trust and respect  •Dealing With Ambiguity— makes decisions and takes action without having the full picture  •Learning on the Fly—learns quickly/open to change  •Planning—sets specific goals and objectives, ability to plan for the length and difficulty of assignments, ability to break down projects into specific tasks/steps  •Problem Solving— identifies complex problems and reviews related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions  Required Education/Training:  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, business, or similar field of study, and five years’ relevant experience.  • In the absence of a degree, candidates with minimum seven years relevant experience will be considered.  Required Certifications/License/Special Skills:  •Highly organized with proven time management and prioritization skills  •Ability to work independently and with minimal supervision  •Ability to handle the pressure of meeting tight deadlines  Required Work Experience:  • 10 years relevant experience, including at least 5 years as a business analyst in a manufacturing environment or similar professional setting, preferably medical device.  • Oracle EBS applications including INV, BOM, WIP, ASCP, PO, OM, QA, ALR and Agile PLM – modules PC, PG&C preferred  • Experience in a medical device or similar regulated environment preferred.  • Extensive experience performing process development/improvement.  • Project lead experience, demonstrated ability to drive change.  • Supply chain/ MRP/ASCP planning experience preferred.  • Extensive experience performing process development/improvement.  • Salesforce.com experience nice to have, specifically Sales Cloud, Service Cloud.  • Testing methods development and test script generation.  • Familiarity with relevant database tables, SQL tools experience is a plus.  • Discoverer report experience, preferably development and support.  • Oracle release experience desired, current version is a plus.  • Excellent written, oral and interpersonal skills.  WORKING CONDITIONS  • Must work onsite at Luminex office  • Travel may be required approximately:  • Work situations include dealing with people; working alone; making judgments and decisions     Luminex Corporation is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability status of an otherwise qualified individual, citizenship status, membership or application for membership in a uniformed service, or any other protected characteristic or category protected by applicable law.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Req ID: 36047     At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.     NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Senior Business Analyst to join our team in Austin, TX. Candidates local to Austin, TX are strongly preferred.       The individual will be responsible for the following:    Eliciting requirements using tasks such as: facilitated workshops with business subject matter experts, interviews, document analysis, prototyping, and interface analysisSpecifying and analyzing business goals/requirements, functional requirements, system interface requirements, reporting requirements, data requirements, non-functionalFacilitates meetings with the business subject matter experts or end users to formulate business strategies and requirements and translate client needs into actionable system requirements.Coordinates, conducts, and documents requirements gathering sessions with end users, project stakeholders and development team(s)Critically evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconciles conflicts, decomposes high-level information into details - abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguishes user requests from the underlying true needsDevelops high quality documentation including business requirements documents, use cases, software requirements specifications, report specifications, epics, user stories, screen and interface designs, conceptual page flows, business process models, user acceptance test plans, and training manuals / user guidesIdentifies, plans and estimates level of effort for business analysis related tasksLeading/hosting large, cross functional meetings to elicit requirements from subject matter experts and build consensusAnalyzing requirements from several functional areas to determine potential conflicts /other requirements that may exist in other areas.Ability to participate in Quality Assurance and User Acceptance.Performs functional testing as needed to ensure adherence to requirementsCoordinates/executes the development of test cases.Successfully engages in multiple initiatives simultaneously   Basic Qualifications:   Minimum of 5 years work experience with business process analysis   Preferred Skills:   Business analysis - requirements management and gatheringUnderstanding business process management and business requirements of the customers and translating them to specific software requirementsExceptional communication, presentation, organization and time management skillsExceptional written and verbal communication skillsAbility to participate in various phases of testing (Execution of Plan, Design, Strategy, Coordination, Development, Quality Assurance and Execution)Ability to participate in release and implementation processes         This is a Temporary Employee of NTT DATA role. This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.About NTT DATA Services    NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.     NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.     NTT DATA, Inc. (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result.

Name: Senior Business Analyst - Customer Success
Description: Headquartered in the Bay Area with offices in Jaipur, India and Austin, Texas, venture-funded, Punchh is the world leader in innovative digital marketing products for brick and mortar retailers, combining AI and machine learning technologies, mobile-first expertise, and omni-channel communications designed to dramatically increase lifetime customer value. Leading global chains in the restaurant, health and beauty sectors rely on Punchh to grow revenue by building customer relationships at every stage to becoming brand loyalists, including more than 100 different chains representing more than $12B in annual spend, 30,000 locations globally, 26M+ consumers, and 1M+ transactions daily. Punchh boasts a customer list that includes Pizza Hut, Quiznos, Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf and many more. JOB REQUIREMENT The business analyst position is reporting directly to the head of data science, and will develop a close work relationship with the senior members of our Customer Success (CS) org. He/she will leverage prior industrial experience in business analytics, and help solve the most relevant business problems from our clients.  He/she will not only become our business domain expert, but also play a critical role in defining Punchh's best practices in data-driven decision making. This is a challenging role that requires strong project management, time management and communication skills. The job responsibilities include: Participate in client calls with senior marketing executives to understand business needs and define reporting solutionsWork with the CS managers to develop insightful analytic report for our clients. Make actionable business recommendations. Define performance measurement / KPI / recurring reports.One of the key owners of the quarterly business review process that highlight the relevant business opportunities.Be a key liaison between the data and CS teams to:Quantify technical and business requirements of our data productsEnsure high quality of our data warehouseRepresent company's expertise in advanced analytics in a variety of media outlets such as client interactions, conferences, blogs and interviews.Occasional business travels are required.QUALIFICATIONSStrong business acumen, presentation and client communication skills. This role requires excellent written, verbal and presentation skills. Candidates must be able to articulate well the requirements and solutions to business clients.5+ years of experience in business analyst role with proven analytic skills.Advanced degree in business, economics, statistics or other related fields, with a strong interest in marketing technology.Must have excellent statistical / analytical skills with advanced knowledge in data visualization, Tableau, Excel, etc.Exceptional client relationship management skills.Must have extensive experience as a super user of big data technologies, i.e. relational, NoSQL or Hadoop.BENEFITSHealth benefits - medical, vision and dental401K plan without a wait periodWe have a PTO programCompetitive salaries, bonus and stock optionsWe help you master your craft and grow your careerFree lunch every day, plus a well stocked refrigerator

Name: Reporting Analyst
Description: Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.  Do you love thinking analytically? Are you passionate about using your financial knowledge to navigate complex challenges? Just as our customers find value in Apple products, the Finance group finds value for both Apple and its shareholders. As part of this group, you’ll play an integral role in ensuring our day-to-day financial health. You and your team will support Apple’s growth, both top and bottom line, by applying the same level of innovation toward financial matters as we do toward our products and services. You’ll also collaborate with Apple teams across the world to develop more effective investment strategies and risk management. Finance is essential to upholding our global commitment to excellence, and it is directly responsible for shaping the company’s future. Join us, and you’ll have an important role in continuing Apple’s legacy of efficiency and success.  Apple’s Global Business Solutions organization (GBS) supports Apple employees, customers and vendors around the world. We provide guidance and significant solutions to problems that come up on any possible topic daily.  We are seeking a Reporting Analyst to support the monthly Corporate Card program, and will work closely with partners, and cardholders to support a best-in-class global organization.  This position is based in Austin, TX.  Sound understanding of the purchase-to-payment process including applications, reconciliations, policy, and auditing  Detailed and meticulous, with strong analytical and problem-solving skills  Ability to perform robust business process analysis, recommend and execute solutions  Understanding of purchase to pay processes preferred  Real passion for business process excellence  Ability to recognize issues within processes and organizations, whilst considering functional interdependencies  Strong technical skills: Proficient use of data systems, automation tools, and web-based dashboard reporting (SQL, Tableau preferred)  Mature, responsible, driven and able to work independently with minimal direct supervision  Customer-oriented with excellent interpersonal and communication skills,  Ability to meet deadlines and quickly adjust to changing business priorities and timelines  Experience working with global teams  Experience with large ERP systems, preferably SAP Drive processes within the Corporate Card program including reporting, improvements in execution, and metrics Develop and manage appropriate SLAs and metricsCreate scheduled and ad hoc global business review forums with stakeholdersWork with internal customers and business partners to provide data, metrics, and reportsMonitor and maintain adherence to Corporate Card policy and complianceEducation & ExperienceBachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or related fieldCPA Preferred

Name: Channel Service Support Business Analyst
Description: SummarySummaryThe AMR AppleCare Channel Service Support team is looking for a dynamic and motivated Business Analyst. This role is an opportunity for a motivated individual to utilize his or her business insight, enhanced process knowledge, and analytical skills to deliver creative, valued solutions to the AMR and WW Channel Service Support (CSS) teams. To perform this job, you should have strong analytical, presentation skills and able to effectively communicate findings and analyses to the highest levels of the company. Possessing good public speaking/presentation skills, and a commanding presence are a requisite. Experience with Service Strategies and support operations for US, Canada, ALAC and Brazil is desired. Extensive experience in KPI reporting, analysis and data mining. Experience with Tableau a plus. SAP Experience required. Exemplary professional demeanor, resourcefulness, flexibility, and self-motivation. Ability to maintain a positive attitude and multitask in a high stress and remarkably dynamic environment. The responsibilities of the Channel Service Support Business Analyst include: - Achieve and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the business, and work on significant issues where analysis of situations or data requires evaluation of intangibles. - Evaluate opportunities in aging repairs and support the Repair Operations Center for AMR. - Proactively seek out expertise from SMEs to assist in making sound decisions. - Present findings in a clear and concise manner, and offer recommendations based on key insights uncovered. - Analyze and evaluate the performance of key business metrics, e.g. repair turn-around-time and aging. Be able to interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets. - Develop and implement data collection systems that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality, including statistical analyses for projects, reports, and dashboards. - Coordinate and standardize current regional reporting requirements, to include Quarterly Business Reviews. Deliver consistency and precision among various types of reports and reporting tools. - Review and synthesize information across Regional Service Ops and CSS to provide leaders with a holistic view of key contributors to business performance and areas of opportunity. - Possess the ability to drive for results through others to improve aging of repairs and general business insight. Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants. Education & ExperienceBS/BA required, MS/MBA preferred Additional Requirements5+ years of analysis experience, preferably within consulting, manufacturing quality, service/support, or supply chain. A BS/MS in supply chain, statistics, engineering, operations research, or related quantitative field is ideal. Executive exposure is high in this position. Six Sigma experience/certification is desired, as well as experience in a quality management environment.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Ref#: R0013397 Our mission.  As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers. The team.  Our Marketing team helps job seekers and employers around the world to discover Indeed. Whether creating impactful advertising, coding bidding algorithms, or looking for the news stories in Indeed's labor data, Indeed marketers bring diverse skills to help shape and share Indeed’s story. Every month, over 200 million people count on us to help them find jobs, publish their resumes, process their job applications, and connect them to qualified candidates for their job openings. Simply put, we help people get jobs, and we want to share our story with you. Your job. We are builders, we are integrators. Tech Services creates and optimizes solutions for a rapidly growing business on a global scale. We work with distributed infrastructure, petabytes of data, and billions of transactions with no limitations on your creativity. You don’t have to wait for some architect or manager to tell you what you can work on - you decide the priorities. With tech hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo and Hyderabad, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job at a time.ResponsibilitiesUnderstanding your business stakeholders’ objectives, the metrics that are the most important to them, and how they measure their performance.Turning business requirements into data-driven solutionsFinding and understanding the correct data sources for a given analysis.Coding reports, dashboards, and visualizations using Python, Pandas, Numpy, SQL, and Tableau to help your stakeholders improve their performance, often diving deep to decipher why and how questions, and what the business action should be.Learning from, and sharing knowledge and skills with your teammates to grow BI’s total impact to the organization. About you. Requirements:5+ years of relevant experience in a data science, business analytics, business intelligence or comparable data engineering role, including data warehousing and business intelligence tools, techniques and technologyEager to learn in a fast-paced environmentEnjoys collaborating with others in a team environment Willingness to question the validity and accuracy of dataCreativity to determine the best solution for a real-world problem with quantitative dataCuriosity and passion for data and data visualizationAbility to explain complicated or technical information in a simple way to non-technical audiencesExcellent verbal and written communication skills, and comfortable interacting with employees ranging from entry-level to senior vice presidentsProven track record demonstrating an aptitude to analyze trends, compile data into comprehensive reports, and making recommendations based on findingsProgramming experience, preferably in Python (particularly Pandas and Numpy) and R.Indeed provides a variety of benefits that help us focus on our mission of helping people get jobs.  View our bounty of perks: http://indeedhi.re/IndeedBenefits

Name: Marketing Analyst
Description: W2O Group is a healthcare communications & PR firm with over 700 people worldwide. Ranked #1 to work for among large agencies by The Holmes Report, W2O Group is on the forefront of applying digital analytics to communications. With a demonstrated 132% revenue growth in five years, W2O Group is on fire with new business and clients. Working with us is a great opportunity to make an impact in an entrepreneurial culture, working directly with clients and all levels of staff. The role We are looking for a marketing analyst who has a passion for uncovering data-driven insights. Our analytics team designs custom methodologies to deliver consultative research for clients. This process involves both quantitative and qualitative data analyses, using a variety of different social and digital analytics platforms. As an analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing market trends and developing competitive analyses, across web, search, media and social channels.  Analysts are an integral part of the story-telling process, assisting in everything from research design development to insights synthesis and delivery. Curiosity and a willingness to think outside the box are a must, as we are often tasked with answering age-old communications and marketing questions in a new way. ResponsibilitiesAggregate, clean and organize data across various digital and social analytics platforms (e.g. Sysomos, Facebook Analytics, Crimson Hexagon, Google Analytics)Work with larger project team to synthesize research into a strategic narrative that will guide our clients' communications and marketing strategiesManage daily social and online media monitoring and activationAssist on monthly and quarterly listening, measurement and trends reportsConduct influencer assessments to inform client/influencer engagement programsBuild keyword-based queries to collect dataAdditional Areas of OpportunityWork with our data visualization team to create cutting-edge data visualizationsWork with our data sciences team to further explore proprietary tools and data managementAssist in employee on-boarding, training and community outreachPreferred Skills & QualificationsBachelor's degree in advertising, public relations, marketing, PR/communications or businessPrevious experience or internship in the healthcare or technology industriesGeneral understanding of the digital and social media landscape and passion for social media analysisFamiliarity with basic keyword development and/or Boolean query buildingExperience navigating digital and social media monitoring tools like Sysomos, TrendKite, Crimson Hexagon, Google Analytics, Radian 6Competence in Microsoft Excel and PowerPointStrong reading comprehension and writing skillsSelf-starter with the ability to ask questions, brainstorm solutions, and think outside the box W2O Group offers a comprehensive benefit program and perks, including unlimited and flexible PTO, expanded paid leave for new parents and a 4th Trimester program that helps new parents transition back to work, and a five-week sabbatical program. Other perks include Income Protection, Retirement plans/401(k) match, and cell phone savings plans. Learn more about our great benefits and perks at: http://www.w2ogroup.com/ W2O Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We foster an environment that embraces diversity. We are stronger with a wider range of opinions, strengths, and backgrounds to achieve our goals.

Name: Retail Systems Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe Retail Systems Business Analyst will work within a growing and highly visible retail systems portfolio, which is undergoing transformational change. The position will be responsible for driving and defining requirements to enable solutions that align to Whole Foods business objectives and are built for scalability, maintainability, and operability. While defining effective requirements is a key part of the position, the Business Analyst will lead and participate in all phases of projects. The position will serve as a subject matter expert within capabilities being delivered. We are looking for people with strong initiative, drive for results, and passion for delivering value to our stores, team members, and customers.Responsibilities:Drives, and participates in, gathering and progressive elaboration of requirements under direction of product owner. Ensures requirements have acceptance criteria, are testable and traceable.Facilitates work with the architects, and impacted teams, to translate requirements into detailed functional designs for development, testing, and implementation. Subject matter expert on the business requirements/capabilities being delivered. Identifies and communicates risks and issues impacting business rules, functional requirements, and specifications. Creates solution options for issues and risks.Assists quality assurance with functional test scenario reviews. Participates in the creation of training materials and may assist with user orientation and training. Effective vendor collaboration to deliver project results.Participates in the development of new business process.At times leads ad hoc solution efforts.Qualifications:At least 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst.At least 3 years working experience with SDLC and associated deliverables within each phase, as well as adherence to change control.At least 1 year of experience in either Retail or POS Systems.Experience working on a highly visible, complex, and business critical portfolio.Must have analytical/elicitation skills to ask the right questions of business partners, dissect, organize, translate and cross reference requirements.Negotiation skills.Must have strong problem solving and analytical skills, and be detail orientated.Great communication skills and best practices, leveraged while communicating across executive leadership, business and technical teams.Ability to lead various efforts across teams.Knowledge of PCI and SOX regulations, as well as applicable data privacy practices and laws.Experience with payment processing and integration across various forms of tenders.Experience operating within large program, managing multiple priorities in a fast paced and date driven environment.Experience delivering enterprise-minded, holistic solutions within the store systems space.Strong initiative and strength in delivering results.Able to articulate complex technical topics for non-technical audiences.Embrace Whole Foods Market’s Values.Bring a breadth of business and technology experience.Be resilient and curious: keep learning and growing.At Whole Foods Market we provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all team members and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. Whole Foods Market hires and promotes individuals solely on the basis of their qualifications for the position to be filled.

Name: Business Analyst- Sales Ops
Description: Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization*s financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.  Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.  Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. May have project lead role. Attention to detail critical. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. For this, relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills to interact with management and possible clients desired. 5 plus years relevant work experience.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.  The Key Account Operations Analyst is a part of the Sales Operations organization supporting multiple Key Account VPs. This Key Account Operations Analyst drives programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization's business, financial and tactical objectives. The role will work closely with Key Account VPs on a daily basis, acting as a trusted business advisor on all aspects of Key Accounts. Responsibilities will include:Advise Key Account VPs and Key Account Directors on policy and processesDrive pipeline management and forecasting processes for Key Account VPsDevelop strategic reporting & analysisDefine and allocate Key Account quotasResearch & resolve compensation exceptionsProvide support in the research & review of account structures for global alignmentDrive plan acceptance and various compliance activities across Key Account teamsAdditional responsibilities may be defined depending on individual candidate's areas of expertise

Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job Description Summary:We are seeking a Senior Business Systems Analyst to manage and support data maintenance, configuration, reporting and analytics activities for the Finance organization at PayPal.Job Description:The person we are seeking must be self-motivated and have proven experience influencing and communicating effectively across all levels of the company, from individual business users to executive management. He or she should have proven ability to build relationships/partnerships and work cross-functionally to drive time sensitive deliverables, issues tracking and reporting. The Senior Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for executing and managing the following: Manage all internal Bank Analyzer needsDevelop and execute to the Bank Analyzer roadmapMaintain and manage the Bank Analyzer portfolioEnsure all documents are maintained and updated timelySupport production defect resolutionDefine user stories for new product development and enhancement requestsSupport special projects and initiatives: special projects vary from strategic initiatives to day to day operations. Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Business Intelligence AnalystAmherst Residential, is a vertically integrated residential real estate platform making ownership of single family homes seamless for investors and home owners. The platform has raised over $6 billion of capital since inception, manages ~20,000 homes, and is growing its team as it rolls out new investments and business lines.Amherst Residential is hiring a Jr. Business Intelligence Analyst whose primary responsibility will be to work on the Corporate Growth and Executive Management team to provide data analytics and reporting to the various functions within Amherst Residential. This includes implementing solutions for optimizing and automating existing reporting as well as leveraging tools such as SQL and Tableau to create and monitor new key performance indicators and operational metrics. This is a great opportunity for someone who is interested in working alongside a fast-paced, data-driven team to help the organization achieve its strategic objectives.Duties and Responsibilities:Tackle complex business problems by converting raw data into meaningful and actionable business insights. Collaborate directly with peers and business leaders to transform ideas into actions.Utilize Microsoft SQL Server for extraction and analysis of data from multiple sources with demonstrated ability to effectively decipher, analyze and report dataDevelop reports and dashboards using Tableau and/or Excel for internal and external customersLeverage analytic problem-solving skills in working with large disparate, datasets to report portfolio operational metrics and performanceAssist with preparation and automation of recurring /ad-hoc reporting assignmentsRequired Experience:Bachelors degree in Management Information Systems, Finance, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering or related quantitative discipline1-2 years experience analyzing data, drawing conclusions and making recommendations; consulting or financial services industry experience is a plusStrong SQL query writing skills required. Experience working in a Microsoft SQL Server environment is preferred.Experience with creating and presenting management dashboards and reportsExperience with data visualization/business intelligence tools. Experience with Tableau is a huge plus.Strong Microsoft Excel skillsAbility to be flexible and work in a fast paced environmentExcellent written and verbal communicationAbility to meet established timelinesAnalytical mindset and passion for gleaning actionable insights from raw dataBonus Skills:Knowledge of at least one other programming language such as Python is a plusKnowledge of data warehousing and ETL concepts is a plusWhat we offer: Amherst is a privately held corporation located in West Austin with beautiful views of Lake Austin and the loop 360 bridge in a modern workspace with open floor plans. A competitive compensation package, annual bonus, 401k matchFlexible PTO, 11 paid holidays, accrued sick/personal timeEmployer paid benefits (medical, dental, vision, health savings account)Professional career development and reimbursementOn-premise fitness center, locker roomsDaily catered lunches, fully stocked kitchen with snacks/drinksRelaxed casual environment and weekly/quarterly office events!

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Company: Texas Health and Human Services Commission
Description: Posting Type: Open to All Applicants Category: Computer and Mathematical FLSA Exempt/Non-Exempt: Exempt Agency: Dept of Family & Protectve Svc Department: IT Support Job Title: Business Systems Analyst Posting Number: 401687 Full Time/Part Time : Full Time Regular/Temporary: Regular Job Location: 2323 RIDGEPOINT DR City: AUSTIN Contact: AccessHR Service Center Telephone: 888-894-4747 Salary Range: $4,917.00 - $5,666.66 Salary Group: B24 Shift: Days (First) Travel: 5% Closing Date:Job Description: This position serves as a Business Systems Analyst within the DFPS Information Resource Management Organization (IT). Under the direction of the Quality Management Services (QMS) Director, this position supports tasks related to quality management, business process management, key performance measure definition and reporting and strategic planning. Specific tasks may include (but are not limited to): defining business processes, defining key performance indicator metrics, architecting and implementing technical solutions to collect and report on key performance indicator metrics, providing training on the department’s Quality program, and managing change management activities. This position will primarily focus on systems and technology planning including software data modeling for business intelligence and reporting, software workflow and work process modeling, business process engineering, and supporting strategic planning and change management initiatives. This position works under limited supervision of the QMS Director, with general latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. This position is classified as a full-time position (40 hours a week). Work outside of regular business hours may be required. Travel to other work locations may be required. Performs special projects and other duties as assigned. Essential Job Functions: • Assist management with business, functional, technical and operational requirements elicitation for system owners. • Develop requirements documentation including models, use cases, business process maps, and specifications and provide technical clarification to both business and technical staff. • Evaluate compatibility and interoperability of commercial off-the-shelf or in-house technology systems. • Define, collect, and translate both functional and technical requirements into draft business process diagrams, workflow models, use cases, UML diagrams and similar documentation for software development. • Develop and finalize model workflows in Microsoft Office® applications like Visio, SmartDraw®, and/or similar tools. • Research, analyze, and recommend the technical direction for the IRM’s Quality Management System including but not limited to: completing needs analyses, requirements gathering and analysis, solution modeling, solution evaluation, solution acquisition or development, solution testing, solution integration, and solution maintenance. • Identify, research, and score workflow management and business intelligence tools for use within the QMS team including review and analyzing the effectiveness and efficiency of current tools. • Conduct research on software and hardware products and technology services to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts. • Compose and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential risk areas across the organization. • Develop Intranet sites using website development software as well as SharePoint 2010, 2013, and/or SharePoint 2016. • Collect requirements for building SharePoint site(s) and manages related layouts, structure and content requirements through implementation and ongoing maintenance. • Document and manage SharePoint architecture, workflow configuration, permissions, and security for sites and sub-sites. • Develop and deploys custom developed and third-party SharePoint solution packages • Develop and configure SharePoint dashboards to illustrate and report on department performance measures. • Develop and deliver comprehensive SharePoint-based IT Quality training to staff at all levels of IRM as well as external users as needed. • Document business processes, policies and procedures as well as associated performance metrics throughout the IT organization (IRM Program). • Work with IRM leadership to design and implement the IRM program’s quality management and process improvement initiatives. • Serve as point of contact for the QMS business process improvement and strategic planning projects, while also providing subject matter expertise for the QMS initiatives and processes. • Develop project plans and project work breakdown structures for process improvement efforts. • Collect, document, and organize IT business process information into a comprehensive business process library. • Manage the collection and reporting of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across the IRM program areas to assist IRM leadership with developing and measuring performance metrics. • Benchmarks performance metrics and operational metrics against similarly sized and scoped IT organizations to assist the IT leadership with best practices for setting and measuring the IT program’s organizational success. • Participate and assist with IRM strategic planning activities including documenting goals, objectives, and performance measures for the IT strategic plan and develops appropriate methods for measuring the IT programs results against the plan. • Coordinate and conduct some staff training relating to quality management systems, business process improvement, and effective KPI creation. • Conduct routine and ad-hoc audits, assessments, and functional reviews of IT work teams to determine and document operational efficiency, issues, operational risks, and other related information. • Establish, document, and maintain a comprehensive issues and risk registry to ensure effective execution of risk management activities. • Develop and recommend business process, organizational, and/or performance measurement changes based on analysis and findings. • Conduct routine audits of processes, performance-to-target, risks, accomplishments, and areas of improvement. Knowledge Skills Abilities: • Working knowledge of Microsoft SharePoint® including familiarity with workflow modeling, document library management, version control and management, list management, view management, security management, etc. • Working knowledge of large scale-computer systems and administration of business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau, Looker, Cognos, Qlikview, etc.) • Working knowledge of quality management systems, the process approach to quality management, and business process design and re-engineering • Working knowledge of change management methodologies and techniques • Knowledge of time and resources databases used in an IT environment for tracking IT project resources. • Advanced skill/proficiency with productivity software including the Microsoft (MS) Office Suite; especially Microsoft Project, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint, and Visio including integrations between these applications. • Advanced skill with written and oral communication and the ability to communicate with all levels of an organization in a variety of formats. • Advanced skill with creating and prioritizing quality improvement-focused business or technical recommendations and manage the implementation of these recommendations. • Skill analyzing and interpreting program and technical information including regulations, policies, and business rules to aid in DFPS IT program goal and priority setting; • Skill with comprehending, interpreting, and applying various project, quality, and model-based methodologies, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills to complex issues within a fast-paced, deadline-driven, information technology environment. • Ability to work independently as well as lead diverse teams through complex projects and initiatives from idea through the project and into ongoing operations. • Ability to simultaneously manage multiple assignments using project management methodology best practices. • Ability to evaluate and install technical solutions to improve business processes. • Ability to troubleshoot issues, identify root cause of issues, and permanently resolve issues. Registration or Licensure Requirements: • Proven SharePoint administrative experience including workflow development and maintenance, permissions management, and data analytics and visualization. • Proven website content development and maintenance experience. • Prefer previous experience in Federal, State, or local government in a quality management-related position. • Prefer familiarity with Six Sigma, DMAIC, and/or ITIL concepts. Initial Selection Criteria: • Graduation from an accredited four-year university or college with major coursework in quality management, public administration, information technology, business, computer information systems, management information systems, or a related field; equivalent experience and education may be substituted for one another on a year-for-year basis; • Minimum of two years of technical experience with Microsoft SharePoint workflow creation and maintenance. • Minimum two years’ experience creating, organizing, and managing content located on online internet or intranet websites; • Documented experience with Microsoft (MS) Office Suite; including project planning software (e.g., MS Excel or Project); • Minimum two years’ experience with business intelligence software (e.g., Tableau®, Looker®, Cognos®, Microstrategy® Qlikview®, etc.) • Prefer certification in at least one quality management methodology, e.g., ISO 900x, Lean Quality Management, Six Sigma, etc.; • Prefer ITIL Foundation Certification. Additional Information: • Candidates selected for interviews must bring two different writing samples relevant to the position and composed entirely by the applicant to demonstrate the candidate’s writing and analysis abilities. • Candidates selected for interviews must provide transcripts (official or unofficial) at time of interview. Note: All active duty military, reservists, guardsmen, and veterans are encouraged to apply if qualified to fill this position. Military occupation(s) that relate to the initial selection criteria and registration or licensure requirements for this position may include: 25A, 25D, 2R, 2R0X1, 255A, 181X, 182X, 25B, IT, 25, 275, 89A, IT, 275, 3A1X1, 3A, 681X, 682X, 781X, 782X, 26, C4|10, C4|11, 030, ISM, 8846, 8848, 8858, & 3D0x1. For more information see the Texas State Auditor’s Military Crosswalk at http://www.hr.sao.state.tx.us/Compensation/JobDescriptions.aspx. In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), HHS agencies will provide reasonable accommodation during the hiring and selection process for qualified individuals with a disability. If you need assistance completing the on-line application, contact the HHS Employee Service Center at 1-888-894-4747. If you are contacted for an interview and need accommodation to participate in the interview process, please notify the person scheduling the interview. MOS Code: 25A, 25D, 2R, 2R0X1, 255A, 181X, 182X, 25B, IT, 25, 275, 89A, IT, 275, 3A1X1, 3A, 681X, 682X, 781X, 782X, 26, C4|10, C4|11, 030, ISM, 8846, 8848, 8858, & 3D0x1. HHS agencies use E-Verify. You must bring your I-9 documentation with you on your first day of work.I-9 Form - Click here to download the I-9 form.In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), HHS agencies will provide reasonable accommodation during the hiring and selection process for qualified individuals with a disability. Name: Financial Analyst

Name: Business Analyst - Legal
Description: Ref#: R0013802 Our mission. As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.  The team. We are builders, we are integrators. Tech Services creates and optimizes solutions for a rapidly growing business on a global scale. We work with distributed infrastructure, petabytes of data, and billions of transactions with no limitations on your creativity. You don’t have to wait for some architect or manager to tell you what you can work on - you decide the priorities. With tech hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo and Hyderabad, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job at a time.  Your job.  p.p1 {margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545} p.p2 {margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545; min-height: 14.0px} li.li1 {margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545} span.s1 {font: 10.0px Menlo} ul.ul1 {list-style-type: disc} Business Analysts work together with Project and Program Managers on projects throughout the organization with the goal of understanding current business processes, creating efficiencies, supporting large scale team initiatives, and driving team success.
