Name: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob description Sr. Business Systems Analyst: At a senior level, serves as a liaison between technical staff and end-users of software application(s) to ensure functionality and efficient use of systems to support moderately complex business processes. This position may specialize in a particular business process and the related enterprise application (such as PeopleSoft, Maximo, etc.) or may be involved in the implementation of various applications to support multiple business processes. Formulates and defines information technology systems scope and objectives based on both user needs and an understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements. Analyzes business processes and user needs, documents requirements and processes and translates into system requirement specifications. Designs new or modified processes and procedures to solve complex problems considering technology system capacity and limitations and form of desired results.  Leads application upgrade/enhancement efforts and communicates changes. When specializing in a particular enterprise application, designs related training materials, tests application for errors, writes documentation and trains end-users in the use of the application. This position works at the highest technical level of most phases of systems analysis while considering the business implications of the application of technology to the current and future business environment. Utilizes in-depth knowledge of best practices and experience in own discipline to provide and improve services. Takes a new perspective to solve complex problems. Works independently and receives minimal guidance. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. May direct the work of other staff members.  - Acts as the liaison between business departments and technical staff to enable technical solutions to business needs, either through development of new software or through purchase and configuration of software. Develops business cases for technical solutions and participates in build vs. buy decisions on technology project teams. Analyzes business operations to understand process strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate/improve processes and functions. Designs new or modified processes to enable technical solutions and process automation.Documents business requirements to be used in developing technical solutions. Manages changes to system requirements from project initiation to final implementation to ensure that requirements have been met.When specializing in a particular enterprise application, partners with technology staff and vendors as needed in software development, configuration and/or upgrade/enhancement efforts. Leads project planning and communicates status to management. Configures purchased software to desired functionality.When specializing in a particular enterprise application such as PeopleSoft or Maximo, supports end-users of the application in areas such as: assigning user access with appropriate level of security, coordinating review and audit of user access, designing training materials, training end-users, designing and delivering complex reports in support of business operations, maintaining online system documentation, researching and correcting moderately complex system errors and tracking system issues and resolutions. Performs testing to ensure proper operation of the system. May develop test plans and test cases.May lead the development and implementation of standardized procedures for business systems analysis, business process mapping and business requirements documentation.May utilize business process management tools to translate process maps and process measurements into system level implementation. May provide recommendations on selection/upgrades of these tools. This general overview only includes essential functions of the job and does not imply that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to follow any other job-related instruction and to perform any other job-related duties requested by supervisor or management. Minimum Qualifications: Nine or more years of experience in developing and documenting business requirements and serving as a liaison between business partners and IT. A degree(s) in business, computer science, information systems or relevant field may be substituted per LCRA guidelines for certain years of experience. Location and Salary Information: Work location: Austin, TX. 40 hours per week.  Salary range: $68,652-$102,978 (midpoint $85,815). Pay will be dependent on years of experience.

Name: SAP Business Systems Analyst - SAP SD/APO
Description: As a Business Systems Analyst in Cirrus Logics IT Enterprise applications team, you will partner with multi-functional teams in Sales, Supply Chain and Finance to design, deliver and support systems used for end to end business processes. You will hone your skills in the SAP ECC 6.0 environment by partnering with business users to design, configure and implement best-in-class solutions in SD, APO and other sales-related applications. ResponsibilitiesDetermine scope, capture requirements and develop implementation plan for new projectsDesign creative solutions that meet business requirements, ensuring full integration of end to end processesConfigure SAP SD and APO to meet agreed business requirementsWork closely with the technical teams to implement customizations and required changesCoordinate with Business Intelligence team to deliver data analysis solutionsDevelop process diagrams, use cases and test plansPerform system testing and facilitate user acceptance testingDocument and control all changes made to the SAP production systems via change control processResolve production support issues as they ariseRequired Skills and QualificationsBachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field and 5+years of experience in SAP SD ECC version 6.0Excellent knowledge of Order to Cash and other common sales processesWorking knowledge of SD master data in the areas of Sales, Shipping/Logistics, Billing, and Transportation, especially customer master dataSuperior problem solving and critical thinking skillsGood communication, interpersonal and meeting facilitation skillsAbility to work and communicate with various levels of managementAbility to scope, plan and manage projectsExperience with SAP security design in SD related transactionsPreferred Skills and QualificationsDetailed understanding of Forecasting processes and hands on experience working with APO Demand PlanningKnowledge and experience with SAP IBP including S&OPExperience with CRM and channel management solutionsExperience integrating B2B transactions with SD across EDI protocols (e.g. ANSI X12, EDIFACT)Skilled in successful user experience designFull life-cycle implementation experience including HANA technologiesExperience working for semiconductor or other high-tech companies This position is located in Austin, TX  Cirrus Logic is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We strive to select the best qualified applicant for any opening and to reward employees based on their skills, experience and performance. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, pregnancy status, marital status, gender, age, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law.

Name: Business Analyst 3 Emerging
Description: The Department of Information Resources (DIR) requires the services of one Business Analyst, hereafter referred to as Worker(s), who meets the general qualifications of a Business Analyst 3 Category, Emerging Technology Type and the specifications outlined in this document for the Texas Health and Human Services Commission (HHSC).  The Business Analyst position is an Information Technology (IT) position and will be a part of the Enterprise Data Governance (EDG) team working in collaboration with the Center for Analytics and Decision Support (CADS) program within the Health and Human Services System's business domain. The mission of EDG is to ensure HHS system data is visible, accessible where appropriate, understandable in context, trusted by users, and uniformly governed in order to advance data quality and data analytics. This enables data-driven decision making across the HHS system. The HIP Business Analyst:Refines and defines requirements for master data solutions for a multi-terabyte Master Data Management (MDM) implementation.Has an excellent understanding of MDM principles, goals, and tools and how these relate to overall HHS data quality.Is responsible for gathering and refining requirements for MDM capabilities, using the Informatica application tool stack.Works collaboratively with EIM program staff, HHSC Information Technology resources, and MDM business analysts with a goal of mastering critical agency data, providing identity resolution, creating trusted attribution, and enhancing governed reference data. The applicant will be able to demonstrate extensive experience in: Gathering and refining requirements from business and technical users of HHS master data.Collaborating with MDM developers to enhance MDM application capabilities for healthcare provider and managed care member domains (using an Informatica tool stack).Testing enhancements to MDM databases and application layer(s) before production deployments.Working closely with EIM data architects, HHS subject matter and technical experts, and HHS system data models in order to accurately represent as-is and to-be process models that involve HHS master data.Communication with project stakeholders and governing councils.Collaboration in MDM project lifecycle deployment using agile methods.Logical and physical data modeling of the MDM databases (using ER Studio).Developing training documentation and demonstration content of enhanced functions (for existing user base) and potential MDM solution uses (for new internal partners).Meeting MDM project deliverables, goals and milestones.Understanding of Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) compliance policies and HHS security requirements.Face-to-face interview required.Minimum Requirements:8 years' Experience within HHS system (or other large healthcare or insurance entity) as a business analyst7 years Proven ability to work successfully with technical and non-technical groups, and manage multiple responsibilities5 years' Experience and understanding of Enterprise Information Management best practices4 years' Experience in MDM program implementation, particularly using Informatica suite toolsStrong Communication, analytical and interpersonal skills at all levelsPreferences:4 years' Experience facilitating productive meetings to formulate business requirements and communicate stakeholder needs to technical staff3 years' Experience working with full agile system development lifecycle (SDLC)Bachelor's Name: Sr. Salesforce Business Systems Analyst –
Description: Job ID: BH58339  Category: Business Analyst, IT  Industry: PharmaceuticalJob Description:  The Business Systems Analyst for Salesforce implementation will play a key role on a project team by partnering with the business to understand their business needs, document business process flows, define requirements, and partner with IT counterparts and project team to ensure a successful delivery using Agile principles of IT solutions. Leads department level projects or provides assistance to Program or Project Managers on phases of larger projects.  • Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and procedures.  • Applies and executes standard information systems theories, concepts and techniques and assists in the development of standards and procedures.  • Works directly with business unit clients to understand specific business processes and needs and opportunities for improvement; identifies IT capabilities and information required to support the business processes and collaborates in the development of appropriate information management strategies, developing them as an integrated part of the business strategy  • Strong analytical capabilities and attention to details.  • Analyzes business processes; elicits, analyzes, and documents business requirements; identifies alternative solutions, assesses feasibility and makes recommendations typically seeking to exploit and leverage new or existing IT technology components.  • Demonstrates an innovative approach to solving business problems.  • Identify process disconnects and translate them into improvement opportunities with cost savings or avoidance, productivity improvements, or revenue generating business benefits.  • Understands System Life Cycle process.  • Software Life Cycle documentation creation (i.e. Project Charter, Process Flows, User/Functional Requirements, User Acceptance Tests).  • Prepares testing plans to confirm that requirements and system design are accurate and complete.  • Translates business requirements into user and functional requirements; performs data and process modeling; manages change; and leads, coordinates / performs testing, verification, and validation of requirements.  • Develops information systems strategies that meet the requirements of the business. Identifies the business benefits of alternative strategies. Ensures compliance between business strategies and technology directions.  • Partners with business to ensure the appropriate business procedures, training and communications are developed per project. Conducts training when appropriate.  • Delivers projects on-time and within budget constraints and provide accurate and timely communications to management.  • Understands the core business systems and how the integrate with upstream and downstream systems.  • Manages and provides expert advice on, the selection, design, justification, implementation and business use of information systems.  • Develops business relationships and integrates activities with other IT departments to ensure successful implementation and support of project efforts. Manages relationships between clients involved and IT organizations to assure effective communication between the groups is occurring. Brokers services within IT community on behalf of customers; coordinates system solutions. Allies with other IT functional areas to remain current on project status, and inform customer management of progress; conversely, keeps IT managers aware of user issues and resolves conflicts.  • Manages medium to highly complex work activities covering technical, financial and quality aspects and contributing to formulation of IT strategy. Work involves creative application of wide range of technical and / or management principles. Establishes organizational objectives and manages multiple assignments.  Education & Experience:  • Bachelor’s Degree plus 4-7 years’ experience, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.  • 4-7 years’ experience.  • Working knowledge of Salesforce platform.  • Experience implementing Continuous Deployment.  • Hands on experience with SDLC methods and tools (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum) Type:  Direct  Location:  Austin, TX, USA Apply Now

Name: Strategic Operations & Business Analyst Lead
Description: Leads activities related to enterprise, divisional, and departmental level strategies by consulting with management and presenting research and developing programs for the organization. Works independently with guidance in only the most complex situations. May lead functional teams or projects. Provides strategic insights and recommendations for enhancing and developing new programs to senior managementEnsures that strategic planning initiatives and projects are effectively implemented by forming teams to evaluate and implement. Performs complex business case analysis and/or feasibility analysis on multiple projects. Assists with research for, and development of, cost benefit analysis for various maintenance, rehabilitation and/or replacement options for specific assets, related to the strategic planDefines scope, recommends approach, and leads execution of major strategic projects. Ensures project results meet requirements regarding technical quality, reliability, schedule and cost and ultimately achieve the desired outcome. Develops data-driven insights for delivery to an executive/Board level audienceDevelops and implements operating plans, goals, objectives, priorities and procedures that are in alignment with the established strategic goals and objectives of the department.  Works with senior management on long range planning projects Applies creative problem-solving skills to strategic issuesFormally tracks and reports progress toward established goals and milestones for delivery of results.Ensures appropriate records are maintained for budget requirements, management systems, policies and procedures.Participates in cross-training activities, cross-departmental sharing of knowledge and, when appropriate, cross-departmental developmental assignments.May develop and lead focused training as needed to support organizational needs and requirements.This general overview only includes essential functions of the job and does not imply that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to follow any other job-related instruction and to perform any other job-related duties requested by supervisor or management. Twelve or more years experience in capital planning, decision-making modeling, operations and maintenance planning, financial management, project management and strategic business support. A degree(s) in business, economics, engineering, finance, math, science or relevant field may be substituted per LCRA guidelines for certain years of experience. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability status of an otherwise qualified individual, citizenship status, membership or application for membership in a uniformed service, or any other protected characteristic or category protected by applicable law.

Name: Senior Business Analyst - Customer Success
Description: Headquartered in the Bay Area with offices in Jaipur, India and Austin, Texas, venture-funded, Punchh is the world leader in innovative digital marketing products for brick and mortar retailers, combining AI and machine learning technologies, mobile-first expertise, and omni-channel communications designed to dramatically increase lifetime customer value. Leading global chains in the restaurant, health and beauty sectors rely on Punchh to grow revenue by building customer relationships at every stage to becoming brand loyalists, including more than 100 different chains representing more than $12B in annual spend, 30,000 locations globally, 26M+ consumers, and 1M+ transactions daily. Punchh boasts a customer list that includes Pizza Hut, Quiznos, Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf and many more. JOB REQUIREMENT The business analyst position is reporting directly to the head of data science, and will develop a close work relationship with the senior members of our Customer Success (CS) org. He/she will leverage prior industrial experience in business analytics, and help solve the most relevant business problems from our clients.  He/she will not only become our business domain expert, but also play a critical role in defining Punchh's best practices in data-driven decision making. This is a challenging role that requires strong project management, time management and communication skills. The job responsibilities include: Participate in client calls with senior marketing executives to understand business needs and define reporting solutionsWork with the CS managers to develop insightful analytic report for our clients. Make actionable business recommendations. Define performance measurement / KPI / recurring reports.One of the key owners of the quarterly business review process that highlight the relevant business opportunities.Be a key liaison between the data and CS teams to:Quantify technical and business requirements of our data productsEnsure high quality of our data warehouseRepresent company's expertise in advanced analytics in a variety of media outlets such as client interactions, conferences, blogs and interviews.Occasional business travels are required.QUALIFICATIONSStrong business acumen, presentation and client communication skills. This role requires excellent written, verbal and presentation skills. Candidates must be able to articulate well the requirements and solutions to business clients.5+ years of experience in business analyst role with proven analytic skills.Advanced degree in business, economics, statistics or other related fields, with a strong interest in marketing technology.Must have excellent statistical / analytical skills with advanced knowledge in data visualization, Tableau, Excel, etc.Exceptional client relationship management skills.Must have extensive experience as a super user of big data technologies, i.e. relational, NoSQL or Hadoop.BENEFITSHealth benefits - medical, vision and dental401K plan without a wait periodWe have a PTO programCompetitive salaries, bonus and stock optionsWe help you master your craft and grow your careerFree lunch every day, plus a well stocked refrigerator

Name: Staff Business Systems Analyst
Description: TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance.TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR.JOB SUMMARY/OVERVIEWThe IT Governance and Compliance Analyst is responsible for managing, supporting, and optimizing the IT regulatory and SOX ITGC compliance programs (including compliance activities, framework, policies and processes). This role will also be the point of contact for internal and external audit parties. The Analyst will audit and assess risk on new and existing information system applications and processes to ensure that appropriate controls exist, that processing is efficient and accurate, and that procedures are in compliance with corporate standards.ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES• Coordinate across control owners in the Technology Department to ensure SOX process documentation is current and accurate for all IT areas• Help define and implement process IT General Controls (ITGC), procedures, and improvement initiatives supporting the IT organization• Plan, implement, coordinate, and execute Technology audit plans and policies, standard operations procedures, controls including testing to ensure adherence with established controls and reporting possible deficiencies • Partner and manage 3rd party vendors to ensure controls are in place, effective, and auditable, including evaluating SOC1/2 reports for compliance with IT General Controls • Establish and manage monthly Compliance performance scorecard • Lead / Coordinate IT departments self-audits of varying scopes and complexity; Provide quality assurance of all SOX and IT General Controls through assessment, walkthroughs, and audits to ensure operational effectiveness of those security controls.• Conduct risk/scoping analysis, IT policy management, process documentation, artifact collection, audit-readiness assessment for scope of SOX, and internal and external coordination with IT and audit resources • Communicate findings and recommendations to managers verbally and via written reports. • Evaluate general and specific training needs; deliver training to support the control environment & associated control framework; communicate governance & compliance objectives, fostering a compliance & risk aware culture • Collaborate and serve as Point of Contact to work with company's internal & external auditors to ensure continued compliance with regulatory requirements and internal control standards, serving as central point of data gathering • Communicates IT control impacts, issues, and strategic direction to team and to company stakeholders. • Collect, analyze, and interpret information to assess and conclude on assigned audit areas; keep detailed and well organized audit records. • Identify risks and gaps and facilitate remediation.• Provide risk metrics to management regarding audit performance and findings.• Assist control owners with root cause analysis and track risk management action plan progress.• Guide efforts to create common control framework and uniform compliance reporting standard.• Implement and supervise the issue tracking and resolution process.• Review the audit assessments conducted by both internal and external audit teams.• Review and audit the Active Directory security group; Perform weekly evaluations of new and additional user access to ensure compliance with provisioning policies; Review and validate the Quarterly User Access Reviews; Help in auditing the identity and Access Manager (IAM), process.JOB REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS• Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Information Systems and 5 to 7 years of relevant experience in IT SOX experience; 3-5 years of implementing effective ITGC controls, performing internal IT Assessment and Risk Mitigation Experience: • Ability to work with all levels of internal and external auditor and collaborate with subject matter experts and team members to complete compliance delivery requirements • Maintain technical competence in current auditing practices, compliance policies, and government regulations. • Strong project management skills and the ability to supervise or escalate others in the completion of projects within timelines. • Strong attention to deliverables with accuracy and efficiency; strong business acumen, including responding and articulating processes and issues related to IT SOX • Possess the documented and referenceable experience with IT delivery services, process improvements, and assessment of IT control environment. • Experience developing and managing IT SOX policy, controls, and training programs • Experience developing and maintaining IT control documentation – control matrices, narratives, process flows…• Strong ability to identify and provide solution to mitigate potential IT SOX related risks • Proven ability to collaborate and liaise with all Technology groups and vendors. • Demonstrated analytical skills applicable to subject areas of varying degrees of complexity • Experience with auditing software/ERP Systems (e.g. PeopleSoft, SAP, or similar)• Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of applications. • Excellent oral and written communication skills• Adept at troubleshooting and persistent at achieving results. • Goal-oriented with the ability to multi-task under pressure in fast-paced environments with deadlines • Preferred knowledge and experience in at least one the area of SOX, PCI, COBIT, ISO, ITIL, COSO, NIST, or ITIL frameworks as related to IT delivery services • Certified Risk and Information System Control (CRISC), or Certified in the Governance of Enterprise IT (CGEIT) is a plusOther Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: • Exceptional interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills. Ability to communicate with courtesy and diplomacy, efficiently follow written and verbal instructions, provide information, and maintain effective relationships with a diverse group of functional contacts at all levels.• Strong analytical and problem solving skills • Strong collaboration skills. Works well in a team environment where team members may be distributed (not co-located).• Excellent multi-tasking skills - concurrent work streams and tasks• POISE ambassador - values in work assignments and business relationships (already in SuccessFactors).• Able to manage complexity across multiple domains/functions• Experience managing expectations when balancing alternatives against business and financial constraints. • Quick adapter within fast-paced environments, flexible and able to roll with changing business and technology environments• Change agent: see ‘ambiguity’ as an opportunity as opposed to a hurdle, thrive on challenging yourself to push beyond conventional thinking• Exhibit high degree of initiative in managing multiple priorities simultaneously in a fast-paced, deadline-driven, detail-oriented work environment utilizing excellent judgment, administrative abilities, and decision-making skills. Proactive with excellent troubleshooting, problem resolution, and follow-through skills.• Dependable team player who works collaboratively and cooperatively with others in a team-oriented environment. Ability to act independently and make decisions within scope of the position’s responsibilities. JIRA issues updated in advance of the daily scrum WORK ENVIRONMENT/OTHER INFORMATION (Travel required, physical requirements, on-call schedules, etc.)• Minimal Travel Required. Travel limited to training, occasional team meetings, and projects.• On call after hours or weekend support may be required, as needed • Collaborative and inclusive work environment with opportunities for personal growth.• Professional, pleasant, and comfortable office setting • The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee Please Note: TriNet reserves the right to change or modify job duties and assignments at any time. The above job description is not all encompassing. Position functions and qualifications may vary depending on business necessity.

Name: Reporting Analyst
Description: Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.  Do you love thinking analytically? Are you passionate about using your financial knowledge to navigate complex challenges? Just as our customers find value in Apple products, the Finance group finds value for both Apple and its shareholders. As part of this group, you’ll play an integral role in ensuring our day-to-day financial health. You and your team will support Apple’s growth, both top and bottom line, by applying the same level of innovation toward financial matters as we do toward our products and services. You’ll also collaborate with Apple teams across the world to develop more effective investment strategies and risk management. Finance is essential to upholding our global commitment to excellence, and it is directly responsible for shaping the company’s future. Join us, and you’ll have an important role in continuing Apple’s legacy of efficiency and success.  Apple’s Global Business Solutions organization (GBS) supports Apple employees, customers and vendors around the world. We provide guidance and significant solutions to problems that come up on any possible topic daily.  We are seeking a Reporting Analyst to support the monthly Corporate Card program, and will work closely with partners, and cardholders to support a best-in-class global organization.  This position is based in Austin, TX.  Sound understanding of the purchase-to-payment process including applications, reconciliations, policy, and auditing  Detailed and meticulous, with strong analytical and problem-solving skills  Ability to perform robust business process analysis, recommend and execute solutions  Understanding of purchase to pay processes preferred  Real passion for business process excellence  Ability to recognize issues within processes and organizations, whilst considering functional interdependencies  Strong technical skills: Proficient use of data systems, automation tools, and web-based dashboard reporting (SQL, Tableau preferred)  Mature, responsible, driven and able to work independently with minimal direct supervision  Customer-oriented with excellent interpersonal and communication skills,  Ability to meet deadlines and quickly adjust to changing business priorities and timelines  Experience working with global teams  Experience with large ERP systems, preferably SAP Drive processes within the Corporate Card program including reporting, improvements in execution, and metrics Develop and manage appropriate SLAs and metricsCreate scheduled and ad hoc global business review forums with stakeholdersWork with internal customers and business partners to provide data, metrics, and reportsMonitor and maintain adherence to Corporate Card policy and complianceEducation & ExperienceBachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or related fieldCPA Preferred

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Ref#: R0013397 Our mission.  As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers. The team.  Our Marketing team helps job seekers and employers around the world to discover Indeed. Whether creating impactful advertising, coding bidding algorithms, or looking for the news stories in Indeed's labor data, Indeed marketers bring diverse skills to help shape and share Indeed’s story. Every month, over 200 million people count on us to help them find jobs, publish their resumes, process their job applications, and connect them to qualified candidates for their job openings. Simply put, we help people get jobs, and we want to share our story with you. Your job. We are builders, we are integrators. Tech Services creates and optimizes solutions for a rapidly growing business on a global scale. We work with distributed infrastructure, petabytes of data, and billions of transactions with no limitations on your creativity. You don’t have to wait for some architect or manager to tell you what you can work on - you decide the priorities. With tech hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo and Hyderabad, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job at a time.ResponsibilitiesUnderstanding your business stakeholders’ objectives, the metrics that are the most important to them, and how they measure their performance.Turning business requirements into data-driven solutionsFinding and understanding the correct data sources for a given analysis.Coding reports, dashboards, and visualizations using Python, Pandas, Numpy, SQL, and Tableau to help your stakeholders improve their performance, often diving deep to decipher why and how questions, and what the business action should be.Learning from, and sharing knowledge and skills with your teammates to grow BI’s total impact to the organization. About you. Requirements:5+ years of relevant experience in a data science, business analytics, business intelligence or comparable data engineering role, including data warehousing and business intelligence tools, techniques and technologyEager to learn in a fast-paced environmentEnjoys collaborating with others in a team environment Willingness to question the validity and accuracy of dataCreativity to determine the best solution for a real-world problem with quantitative dataCuriosity and passion for data and data visualizationAbility to explain complicated or technical information in a simple way to non-technical audiencesExcellent verbal and written communication skills, and comfortable interacting with employees ranging from entry-level to senior vice presidentsProven track record demonstrating an aptitude to analyze trends, compile data into comprehensive reports, and making recommendations based on findingsProgramming experience, preferably in Python (particularly Pandas and Numpy) and R.Indeed provides a variety of benefits that help us focus on our mission of helping people get jobs.  View our bounty of perks: http://indeedhi.re/IndeedBenefits

Name: Channel Service Support Business Analyst
Description: SummarySummaryThe AMR AppleCare Channel Service Support team is looking for a dynamic and motivated Business Analyst. This role is an opportunity for a motivated individual to utilize his or her business insight, enhanced process knowledge, and analytical skills to deliver creative, valued solutions to the AMR and WW Channel Service Support (CSS) teams. To perform this job, you should have strong analytical, presentation skills and able to effectively communicate findings and analyses to the highest levels of the company. Possessing good public speaking/presentation skills, and a commanding presence are a requisite. Experience with Service Strategies and support operations for US, Canada, ALAC and Brazil is desired. Extensive experience in KPI reporting, analysis and data mining. Experience with Tableau a plus. SAP Experience required. Exemplary professional demeanor, resourcefulness, flexibility, and self-motivation. Ability to maintain a positive attitude and multitask in a high stress and remarkably dynamic environment. The responsibilities of the Channel Service Support Business Analyst include: - Achieve and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the business, and work on significant issues where analysis of situations or data requires evaluation of intangibles. - Evaluate opportunities in aging repairs and support the Repair Operations Center for AMR. - Proactively seek out expertise from SMEs to assist in making sound decisions. - Present findings in a clear and concise manner, and offer recommendations based on key insights uncovered. - Analyze and evaluate the performance of key business metrics, e.g. repair turn-around-time and aging. Be able to interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets. - Develop and implement data collection systems that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality, including statistical analyses for projects, reports, and dashboards. - Coordinate and standardize current regional reporting requirements, to include Quarterly Business Reviews. Deliver consistency and precision among various types of reports and reporting tools. - Review and synthesize information across Regional Service Ops and CSS to provide leaders with a holistic view of key contributors to business performance and areas of opportunity. - Possess the ability to drive for results through others to improve aging of repairs and general business insight. Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants. Education & ExperienceBS/BA required, MS/MBA preferred Additional Requirements5+ years of analysis experience, preferably within consulting, manufacturing quality, service/support, or supply chain. A BS/MS in supply chain, statistics, engineering, operations research, or related quantitative field is ideal. Executive exposure is high in this position. Six Sigma experience/certification is desired, as well as experience in a quality management environment.

Name: Business Analyst- Sales Ops
Description: Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization*s financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.  Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.  Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. May have project lead role. Attention to detail critical. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. For this, relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills to interact with management and possible clients desired. 5 plus years relevant work experience.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.  The Key Account Operations Analyst is a part of the Sales Operations organization supporting multiple Key Account VPs. This Key Account Operations Analyst drives programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization's business, financial and tactical objectives. The role will work closely with Key Account VPs on a daily basis, acting as a trusted business advisor on all aspects of Key Accounts. Responsibilities will include:Advise Key Account VPs and Key Account Directors on policy and processesDrive pipeline management and forecasting processes for Key Account VPsDevelop strategic reporting & analysisDefine and allocate Key Account quotasResearch & resolve compensation exceptionsProvide support in the research & review of account structures for global alignmentDrive plan acceptance and various compliance activities across Key Account teamsAdditional responsibilities may be defined depending on individual candidate's areas of expertise

Name: Retail Systems Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe Retail Systems Business Analyst will work within a growing and highly visible retail systems portfolio, which is undergoing transformational change. The position will be responsible for driving and defining requirements to enable solutions that align to Whole Foods business objectives and are built for scalability, maintainability, and operability. While defining effective requirements is a key part of the position, the Business Analyst will lead and participate in all phases of projects. The position will serve as a subject matter expert within capabilities being delivered. We are looking for people with strong initiative, drive for results, and passion for delivering value to our stores, team members, and customers.Responsibilities:Drives, and participates in, gathering and progressive elaboration of requirements under direction of product owner. Ensures requirements have acceptance criteria, are testable and traceable.Facilitates work with the architects, and impacted teams, to translate requirements into detailed functional designs for development, testing, and implementation. Subject matter expert on the business requirements/capabilities being delivered. Identifies and communicates risks and issues impacting business rules, functional requirements, and specifications. Creates solution options for issues and risks.Assists quality assurance with functional test scenario reviews. Participates in the creation of training materials and may assist with user orientation and training. Effective vendor collaboration to deliver project results.Participates in the development of new business process.At times leads ad hoc solution efforts.Qualifications:At least 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst.At least 3 years working experience with SDLC and associated deliverables within each phase, as well as adherence to change control.At least 1 year of experience in either Retail or POS Systems.Experience working on a highly visible, complex, and business critical portfolio.Must have analytical/elicitation skills to ask the right questions of business partners, dissect, organize, translate and cross reference requirements.Negotiation skills.Must have strong problem solving and analytical skills, and be detail orientated.Great communication skills and best practices, leveraged while communicating across executive leadership, business and technical teams.Ability to lead various efforts across teams.Knowledge of PCI and SOX regulations, as well as applicable data privacy practices and laws.Experience with payment processing and integration across various forms of tenders.Experience operating within large program, managing multiple priorities in a fast paced and date driven environment.Experience delivering enterprise-minded, holistic solutions within the store systems space.Strong initiative and strength in delivering results.Able to articulate complex technical topics for non-technical audiences.Embrace Whole Foods Market’s Values.Bring a breadth of business and technology experience.Be resilient and curious: keep learning and growing.At Whole Foods Market we provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all team members and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. Whole Foods Market hires and promotes individuals solely on the basis of their qualifications for the position to be filled.

Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job Description Summary:We are seeking a Senior Business Systems Analyst to manage and support data maintenance, configuration, reporting and analytics activities for the Finance organization at PayPal.Job Description:The person we are seeking must be self-motivated and have proven experience influencing and communicating effectively across all levels of the company, from individual business users to executive management. He or she should have proven ability to build relationships/partnerships and work cross-functionally to drive time sensitive deliverables, issues tracking and reporting. The Senior Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for executing and managing the following: Manage all internal Bank Analyzer needsDevelop and execute to the Bank Analyzer roadmapMaintain and manage the Bank Analyzer portfolioEnsure all documents are maintained and updated timelySupport production defect resolutionDefine user stories for new product development and enhancement requestsSupport special projects and initiatives: special projects vary from strategic initiatives to day to day operations. Support needs will vary by project and will require strong analytical and problem solving skills, excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi-task and prioritize effectivelyResponsibilitiesBridge business users and the technology organizations. Lead collaborations and discussions among cross-functional teams for effective solution-building or issue-resolution.Starting with business questions, leverage strong analytical skills, critical thinking capabilities, and in-depth understanding of our data to collaborate with business users and engineers, brainstorm and strategize the “right” solution, initiate and document the requirements and associated functional specifications.Design, maintain and update PayPal’s Bank Analyzer financial system strategy.Understand impact various projects and products have on the financial application and associated requirements. Understand, manage and maintain: product development, inbound interface impacts, outbound interface maintenance and development as well as transformations of source data into the Bank Analyzer and BW on HANA environments.Create detailed product requirements, working closely with product development and project teams, managing implementation and user acceptance testing, provide post-launch support, and adhere to key business metrics post-launch and sound project methodologies.Preferred Qualifications8-10+ years of SAP and analytics experience in payment industry, financial services and/or management consulting firmsExperience with SAPData-warehouse skills in data modelling, ETL, or BIJob Requirements Advanced Microsoft excel, SQL and Business Objects skillsMust be self-motivated, detail-oriented, conscientious, thorough and accurateStrong interpersonal skills, diplomacy, and client service oriented attitude and mind-set.Excellent communication skills (written, oral, presentation skills)Proven ability to function well independently as well as in a teamAbility to prioritize deliverables and projects to meet timelines efficiently, to adapt to changes in priorities quickly and manage multiple initiatives simultaneously to drive projects to completion and deliver quality materials under tight deadlinesSubsidiary:PayPalTravel Percent:0Primary Location:Omaha, Nebraska, United States of AmericaAdditional Locations:Austin, ScottsdaleWe're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. Name: Principal Business Analyst - Pricing
Description: Job DescriptionWhole Foods Market has embarked on a transformational Supply Chain & Merchandising initiative with Infor Retail that will deliver market leading capabilities to Whole Foods Market and 365 by Whole Foods Market. This position will leverage their business and process experience, combined with technology and project delivery savviness to represent both program and business priorities. This role will provide dedicated business representation to the program to ensure iterative and rapid decision making with our strategic software and system implementation partners. The Pricing Principal Business Analyst is the person who owns the pricing technology products on behalf of the company. The individual is responsible for the success of the products and is empowered to make necessary decisions. The Pricing Principal Business Analyst understands the user and customer needs and the business goals, and collaborates with the development team and stakeholders.In early development lifecycle stages, when the product is developed and introduced to the WFM ecosystem, the principal business analyst should act as an intrapreneur and an entrepreneur within the enterprise. As the product matures, the entrepreneurial aspect of the business capability lead work lessens and a focus on maximizing return on investment (ROI) is usually required. The Pricing Principal Business Analyst is critical to the success of the pricing technologies and the business teams that leverage them. The principal business analyst role is a multi-faceted job that requires a broad range of skills. But it provides the exciting opportunity to develop new products and features that benefit the users across the organization.Responsibilities:People:Understand the needs of business and technology users and customers.Collaborate with Whole Foods Market and third-party development teams.Manage relationships with varied business and technology stakeholders.Lead Pricing Business Analyst(s).Strategy:Develop the Pricing business capability and technology product roadmap.Document the user experience and product features.Define future state Pricing business processes.Partner with other Business Capability Leads on project to create an integrated product strategy roadmap across functional areas.Delivery:Write detailed User Stories and acceptance criteria.Manage the functional scope of a given Program phase and represent the scope to dependent phases.Validate user stories created by product development team(s) and trace stories through project lifecycle (i.e. design/build/test/deploy).Prioritize stories and work items for product development team(s).Create detailed business process(es).Manage stakeholder expectations throughout project lifecycle.Support of all functional activities, such as testing, training, deployment.Partner with Enterprise and Solution Architecture and application design teams to ensure product user stories are represented in solution documentation.QualificationsTen or more years of related experience preferred.Five or more years of experience with defining user stories, business processes, strategic plans, roadmaps, or communication plans preferred.Five or more years implementing or using a retail merchandising ERP or supply chain ERP preferred.Extensive experience with Price Management. Alternatively, functional experience with programs/projects related to at least two of the following capability areas:Item ManagementProduct Life-cycle ManagementRecipe ManagementNutri-facts & Ingredient ManagementItem, Supplier, & Logistics Cost ManagementRetail Purchasing & OrderingInventory Management & ControlRetail Financial ManagementCategory & Assortment ManagementRetail Sales Audit & Invoice MatchingPrice ManagementAllocation & ReplenishmentTrade ManagementMaster Data ManagementExperience within the grocery business area a plus.Experience working with projects or programs that involved Infor or other cloud-based software-as-a-service solutions a plus.Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work across business lines at senior levels to influence and effect change to achieve common goals.Empathy for and identification with the leaders and employees in the organization affected by changes in the digital workplace.Strategic technology planning experience -- experience in strategic technology planning and execution, as well as policy development and maintenance.Ability to effectively drive people, process and technology change in a dynamic and complex operating environment.Fearless — not afraid to suggest or back big ideas. Tenacious — able to push back and focus the discovery process.Excellent oral and written communication skills. This includes the ability to explain digital concepts and technologies to business leaders, as well as business concepts to technologists, and the ability to sell ideas and processes internally at all levels.Proven record of effective leadership. This includes the ability to balance team and individual responsibilities by building teams and consensus, and getting things done through others not directly under the leader's supervision by working ethically and with integrity.Location & TravelLocated in Austin, TX with up to 25% time spent traveling between Austin, Minneapolis, regional offices and/or store locations. At Whole Foods Market we provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all team members and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. Name: Business Systems Analyst
Company: Texas Health and Human Services Commission
Description: Posting Type: Open to All Applicants Category: Computer and Mathematical FLSA Exempt/Non-Exempt: Exempt Agency: Dept of Family & Protectve Svc Department: IT Support Job Title: Business Systems Analyst Posting Number: 401687 Full Time/Part Time : Full Time Regular/Temporary: Regular Job Location: 2323 RIDGEPOINT DR City: AUSTIN Contact: AccessHR Service Center Telephone: 888-894-4747 Salary Range: $4,917.00 - $5,666.66 Salary Group: B24 Shift: Days (First) Travel: 5% Closing Date:Job Description: This position serves as a Business Systems Analyst within the DFPS Information Resource Management Organization (IT). Under the direction of the Quality Management Services (QMS) Director, this position supports tasks related to quality management, business process management, key performance measure definition and reporting and strategic planning. Specific tasks may include (but are not limited to): defining business processes, defining key performance indicator metrics, architecting and implementing technical solutions to collect and report on key performance indicator metrics, providing training on the department’s Quality program, and managing change management activities. This position will primarily focus on systems and technology planning including software data modeling for business intelligence and reporting, software workflow and work process modeling, business process engineering, and supporting strategic planning and change management initiatives. This position works under limited supervision of the QMS Director, with general latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. This position is classified as a full-time position (40 hours a week). Work outside of regular business hours may be required. Travel to other work locations may be required. Performs special projects and other duties as assigned. Essential Job Functions: • Assist management with business, functional, technical and operational requirements elicitation for system owners. • Develop requirements documentation including models, use cases, business process maps, and specifications and provide technical clarification to both business and technical staff. • Evaluate compatibility and interoperability of commercial off-the-shelf or in-house technology systems. • Define, collect, and translate both functional and technical requirements into draft business process diagrams, workflow models, use cases, UML diagrams and similar documentation for software development. • Develop and finalize model workflows in Microsoft Office® applications like Visio, SmartDraw®, and/or similar tools. • Research, analyze, and recommend the technical direction for the IRM’s Quality Management System including but not limited to: completing needs analyses, requirements gathering and analysis, solution modeling, solution evaluation, solution acquisition or development, solution testing, solution integration, and solution maintenance. • Identify, research, and score workflow management and business intelligence tools for use within the QMS team including review and analyzing the effectiveness and efficiency of current tools. • Conduct research on software and hardware products and technology services to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts. • Compose and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential risk areas across the organization. • Develop Intranet sites using website development software as well as SharePoint 2010, 2013, and/or SharePoint 2016. • Collect requirements for building SharePoint site(s) and manages related layouts, structure and content requirements through implementation and ongoing maintenance. • Document and manage SharePoint architecture, workflow configuration, permissions, and security for sites and sub-sites. • Develop and deploys custom developed and third-party SharePoint solution packages • Develop and configure SharePoint dashboards to illustrate and report on department performance measures. • Develop and deliver comprehensive SharePoint-based IT Quality training to staff at all levels of IRM as well as external users as needed. • Document business processes, policies and procedures as well as associated performance metrics throughout the IT organization (IRM Program). • Work with IRM leadership to design and implement the IRM program’s quality management and process improvement initiatives. • Serve as point of contact for the QMS business process improvement and strategic planning projects, while also providing subject matter expertise for the QMS initiatives and processes. • Develop project plans and project work breakdown structures for process improvement efforts. • Collect, document, and organize IT business process information into a comprehensive business process library. • Manage the collection and reporting of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across the IRM program areas to assist IRM leadership with developing and measuring performance metrics. • Benchmarks performance metrics and operational metrics against similarly sized and scoped IT organizations to assist the IT leadership with best practices for setting and measuring the IT program’s organizational success. • Participate and assist with IRM strategic planning activities including documenting goals, objectives, and performance measures for the IT strategic plan and develops appropriate methods for measuring the IT programs results against the plan. • Coordinate and conduct some staff training relating to quality management systems, business process improvement, and effective KPI creation. • Conduct routine and ad-hoc audits, assessments, and functional reviews of IT work teams to determine and document operational efficiency, issues, operational risks, and other related information. • Establish, document, and maintain a comprehensive issues and risk registry to ensure effective execution of risk management activities. • Develop and recommend business process, organizational, and/or performance measurement changes based on analysis and findings. • Conduct routine audits of processes, performance-to-target, risks, accomplishments, and areas of improvement. Knowledge Skills Abilities: • Working knowledge of Microsoft SharePoint® including familiarity with workflow modeling, document library management, version control and management, list management, view management, security management, etc. • Working knowledge of large scale-computer systems and administration of business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau, Looker, Cognos, Qlikview, etc.) • Working knowledge of quality management systems, the process approach to quality management, and business process design and re-engineering • Working knowledge of change management methodologies and techniques • Knowledge of time and resources databases used in an IT environment for tracking IT project resources. • Advanced skill/proficiency with productivity software including the Microsoft (MS) Office Suite; especially Microsoft Project, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint, and Visio including integrations between these applications. • Advanced skill with written and oral communication and the ability to communicate with all levels of an organization in a variety of formats. • Advanced skill with creating and prioritizing quality improvement-focused business or technical recommendations and manage the implementation of these recommendations. • Skill analyzing and interpreting program and technical information including regulations, policies, and business rules to aid in DFPS IT program goal and priority setting; • Skill with comprehending, interpreting, and applying various project, quality, and model-based methodologies, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills to complex issues within a fast-paced, deadline-driven, information technology environment. • Ability to work independently as well as lead diverse teams through complex projects and initiatives from idea through the project and into ongoing operations. • Ability to simultaneously manage multiple assignments using project management methodology best practices. • Ability to evaluate and install technical solutions to improve business processes. • Ability to troubleshoot issues, identify root cause of issues, and permanently resolve issues. Registration or Licensure Requirements: • Proven SharePoint administrative experience including workflow development and maintenance, permissions management, and data analytics and visualization. • Proven website content development and maintenance experience. • Prefer previous experience in Federal, State, or local government in a quality management-related position. • Prefer familiarity with Six Sigma, DMAIC, and/or ITIL concepts. Initial Selection Criteria: • Graduation from an accredited four-year university or college with major coursework in quality management, public administration, information technology, business, computer information systems, management information systems, or a related field; equivalent experience and education may be substituted for one another on a year-for-year basis; • Minimum of two years of technical experience with Microsoft SharePoint workflow creation and maintenance. • Minimum two years’ experience creating, organizing, and managing content located on online internet or intranet websites; • Documented experience with Microsoft (MS) Office Suite; including project planning software (e.g., MS Excel or Project); • Minimum two years’ experience with business intelligence software (e.g., Tableau®, Looker®, Cognos®, Microstrategy® Qlikview®, etc.) • Prefer certification in at least one quality management methodology, e.g., ISO 900x, Lean Quality Management, Six Sigma, etc.; • Prefer ITIL Foundation Certification. Additional Information: • Candidates selected for interviews must bring two different writing samples relevant to the position and composed entirely by the applicant to demonstrate the candidate’s writing and analysis abilities. • Candidates selected for interviews must provide transcripts (official or unofficial) at time of interview. Note: All active duty military, reservists, guardsmen, and veterans are encouraged to apply if qualified to fill this position. Military occupation(s) that relate to the initial selection criteria and registration or licensure requirements for this position may include: 25A, 25D, 2R, 2R0X1, 255A, 181X, 182X, 25B, IT, 25, 275, 89A, IT, 275, 3A1X1, 3A, 681X, 682X, 781X, 782X, 26, C4|10, C4|11, 030, ISM, 8846, 8848, 8858, & 3D0x1. For more information see the Texas State Auditor’s Military Crosswalk at http://www.hr.sao.state.tx.us/Compensation/JobDescriptions.aspx. If you need assistance completing the on-line application, contact the HHS Employee Service Center at 1-888-894-4747. If you are contacted for an interview and need accommodation to participate in the interview process, please notify the person scheduling the interview. Name: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob description Sr. Business Systems Analyst: At a senior level, serves as a liaison between technical staff and end-users of software application(s) to ensure functionality and efficient use of systems to support moderately complex business processes. This position may specialize in a particular business process and the related enterprise application (such as PeopleSoft, Maximo, etc.) or may be involved in the implementation of various applications to support multiple business processes. Formulates and defines information technology systems scope and objectives based on both user needs and an understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements. Analyzes business processes and user needs, documents requirements and processes and translates into system requirement specifications. Designs new or modified processes and procedures to solve complex problems considering technology system capacity and limitations and form of desired results.  Leads application upgrade/enhancement efforts and communicates changes. When specializing in a particular enterprise application, designs related training materials, tests application for errors, writes documentation and trains end-users in the use of the application. This position works at the highest technical level of most phases of systems analysis while considering the business implications of the application of technology to the current and future business environment. Utilizes in-depth knowledge of best practices and experience in own discipline to provide and improve services. Takes a new perspective to solve complex problems. Works independently and receives minimal guidance. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. May direct the work of other staff members.  - Acts as the liaison between business departments and technical staff to enable technical solutions to business needs, either through development of new software or through purchase and configuration of software. Develops business cases for technical solutions and participates in build vs. buy decisions on technology project teams. Analyzes business operations to understand process strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate/improve processes and functions. Designs new or modified processes to enable technical solutions and process automation.Documents business requirements to be used in developing technical solutions. Manages changes to system requirements from project initiation to final implementation to ensure that requirements have been met.When specializing in a particular enterprise application, partners with technology staff and vendors as needed in software development, configuration and/or upgrade/enhancement efforts. Leads project planning and communicates status to management. Configures purchased software to desired functionality.When specializing in a particular enterprise application such as PeopleSoft or Maximo, supports end-users of the application in areas such as: assigning user access with appropriate level of security, coordinating review and audit of user access, designing training materials, training end-users, designing and delivering complex reports in support of business operations, maintaining online system documentation, researching and correcting moderately complex system errors and tracking system issues and resolutions. Performs testing to ensure proper operation of the system. May develop test plans and test cases.May lead the development and implementation of standardized procedures for business systems analysis, business process mapping and business requirements documentation.May utilize business process management tools to translate process maps and process measurements into system level implementation. May provide recommendations on selection/upgrades of these tools. This general overview only includes essential functions of the job and does not imply that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to follow any other job-related instruction and to perform any other job-related duties requested by supervisor or management. Minimum Qualifications: Nine or more years of experience in developing and documenting business requirements and serving as a liaison between business partners and IT. A degree(s) in business, computer science, information systems or relevant field may be substituted per LCRA guidelines for certain years of experience. Location and Salary Information: Work location: Austin, TX. 40 hours per week.  Salary range: $68,652-$102,978 (midpoint $85,815). Pay will be dependent on years of experience.

Name: Junior Business/Systems Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionDescription: CACI is looking to hire multiple Business/System Analysts to join our growing VA Team. We are looking for individuals that have Momentum or similar COTS system experience (e.g., SAP or Oracle). Individual must have 3-5 years of experience with implementing COTS software. Must be able to work in Austin location. Responsibilities: Individual assists with implementing a COTS financial system and will be responsible for analyzing, documenting, and configuring the To-Be business processes for a new federal COTS financial system.Provide functional support and assist with documenting configuration requirements, functional design specifications, business processes, and user stories based on requirements.Under the guidance of more senior subject matter experts, develop expertise in the COTS tool, Federal financial management business processes, and ERP implementation best practices.Collaborate with other analysts to understand the organizations business processes and legacy systems environment.Responsible for identifying and reviewing requirements by business process area and develops test scenarios.Reviews requirements by business process area and develops test scenarios. Executes tests based on Test Plan, records results, analyzes results to assign Pass/Fail status, and creates detailed and well written Test Reports.Elicits and documents business intelligence requirements and conceptual designs for new reports, metrics, and dashboards.Required Skills:  Good analytical skills, written and oral communication skills. Ability to work well in a team environment. Desired Skills:  Individual should be knowledgeable with Momentum or similar COTS software, systems analysis, and financial accounting is a plus. Bachelor's degree with a concentration in Computer Science, MIS or related field, or Accounting/Finance is desired but not required.  What We Can Offer You: Weve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post.Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nations highest priorities.For over 55 years, the principles of CACIs unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success. Job Location US-Austin-TX-AUSTIN  CACI employs a diverse range of talent to create an environment that fuels innovation and fosters continuous improvement and success. At CACI, you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. CACI is proud to provide dynamic careers for employees worldwide. CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Name: Business Analyst 3 Emerging
Description: The Department of Information Resources (DIR) requires the services of one Business Analyst, hereafter referred to as Worker(s), who meets the general qualifications of a Business Analyst 3 Category, Emerging Technology Type and the specifications outlined in this document for the Texas Health and Human Services Commission (HHSC).  The Business Analyst position is an Information Technology (IT) position and will be a part of the Enterprise Data Governance (EDG) team working in collaboration with the Center for Analytics and Decision Support (CADS) program within the Health and Human Services System's business domain. The mission of EDG is to ensure HHS system data is visible, accessible where appropriate, understandable in context, trusted by users, and uniformly governed in order to advance data quality and data analytics. This enables data-driven decision making across the HHS system. The HIP Business Analyst:Refines and defines requirements for master data solutions for a multi-terabyte Master Data Management (MDM) implementation.Has an excellent understanding of MDM principles, goals, and tools and how these relate to overall HHS data quality.Is responsible for gathering and refining requirements for MDM capabilities, using the Informatica application tool stack.Works collaboratively with EIM program staff, HHSC Information Technology resources, and MDM business analysts with a goal of mastering critical agency data, providing identity resolution, creating trusted attribution, and enhancing governed reference data. The applicant will be able to demonstrate extensive experience in: Gathering and refining requirements from business and technical users of HHS master data.Collaborating with MDM developers to enhance MDM application capabilities for healthcare provider and managed care member domains (using an Informatica tool stack).Testing enhancements to MDM databases and application layer(s) before production deployments.Working closely with EIM data architects, HHS subject matter and technical experts, and HHS system data models in order to accurately represent as-is and to-be process models that involve HHS master data.Communication with project stakeholders and governing councils.Collaboration in MDM project lifecycle deployment using agile methods.Logical and physical data modeling of the MDM databases (using ER Studio).Developing training documentation and demonstration content of enhanced functions (for existing user base) and potential MDM solution uses (for new internal partners).Meeting MDM project deliverables, goals and milestones.Understanding of Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) compliance policies and HHS security requirements.Face-to-face interview required.Minimum Requirements:8 years' Experience within HHS system (or other large healthcare or insurance entity) as a business analyst7 years Proven ability to work successfully with technical and non-technical groups, and manage multiple responsibilities5 years' Experience and understanding of Enterprise Information Management best practices4 years' Experience in MDM program implementation, particularly using Informatica suite toolsStrong Communication, analytical and interpersonal skills at all levelsPreferences:4 years' Experience facilitating productive meetings to formulate business requirements and communicate stakeholder needs to technical staff3 years' Experience working with full agile system development lifecycle (SDLC)Bachelor's This position will focus on updating CMBHS help documentation and guides. Improved help documentation will reduce the number of calls to the tier one Helpdesk and provide a better-quality user experience for our stakeholders.
