Name: Business Systems Quality Analyst
Description: IGT is the global leader in gaming. We enable players to experience their favorite games across all channels and regulated segments, from Gaming Machines to Lotteries to Interactive. We have a well-established local presence and relationships with governments and regulators in more than 100 countries around the world, and create value by adhering to the highest standards of service, integrity, and responsibility. IGT has over 12,000 employees. The Business Systems Analyst identifies and validates business needs to create well-defined software requirements associated with the Texas Lottery Account. The Business Systems Analyst applies a systematic, disciplined, quantifiable approach to the design, development, implementation, operation and maintenance of customer solutions through software requirements management. This role will interface with multiple disciplines within the Texas Lottery, IGT, and 3rd Party Vendors. Business Analysis:Identify, document and analyze business and user requirements such as objectives, business, and information flows.Write new application requirements and write enhancements to existing systems.Document, analyze and interpret business policies and processes, write Test Plans, Test Cases and requirements, conduct Test Plans.Identify issues and risks related to requirements.Perform gap analyses.Demonstrate understanding of System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and requirements management methodologies.Quality Assurance:Analyze business requirements to identify testing needs.Provide inputs into test plans, operating scenarios, business processes, and test approach.Maintain the test environments and provide inputs to identify gaps.Perform test design, construct test scenarios, and execute tests to plan.Complete all test documentation.Record, report, and track defects to accurately depict the status of the system.Apply principles and techniques to evaluate systems during the development lifecycle.Present information clearly to the Texas Lottery. Respond to requests in a timely and accurate manner.QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor’s degree preferred in a systems/ software technical field or equivalent required.2-3 years related experience in software requirements specification (SRS) management and/or quality assurance testing.Strong customer relationship building skills.Analytical skills to develop solutions to business issues.Excellent communication skills; both written and verbal - able to bridge communication between technical staff, non-technical staff and customer.Strong problem resolution and conflict resolution skills.Working knowledge of MS Office and MS Project. Preferred: Proficiency with a Requirements Management Tool (i.e., DOORS).Proficiency in System Development Lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies, extending to requirements definition, testing and implementation.Business Process Modeling & experience with Quality Center 10.0 or higher or JIRA. #LI-AD1  #di  IGT is committed to sustaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of the global customers and communities we serve, creating a fair and inclusive culture that enables all our employees to feel valued, respected and engaged. IGT is an equal opportunity employer. We provide equal opportunities without regard to sex, race, color, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity or expression, and any other personal attributes protected by federal, state, or other laws. We thank all applicants for applying; however, only those selected to interview will be contacted.  In addition to our competitive benefits package, we offer employees a 401(k) Savings Plan with Company contributions, tuition reimbursement, and free identity theft insurance.  IGT (NYSE: IGT) is the global leader in gaming. For more information, please visit www.igt.com.

Name: Sr. Salesforce Business Systems Analyst –
Description: Job ID: BH58339  Category: Business Analyst, IT  Industry: PharmaceuticalJob Description:  The Business Systems Analyst for Salesforce implementation will play a key role on a project team by partnering with the business to understand their business needs, document business process flows, define requirements, and partner with IT counterparts and project team to ensure a successful delivery using Agile principles of IT solutions. Leads department level projects or provides assistance to Program or Project Managers on phases of larger projects.  • Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and procedures.  • Applies and executes standard information systems theories, concepts and techniques and assists in the development of standards and procedures.  • Works directly with business unit clients to understand specific business processes and needs and opportunities for improvement; identifies IT capabilities and information required to support the business processes and collaborates in the development of appropriate information management strategies, developing them as an integrated part of the business strategy  • Strong analytical capabilities and attention to details.  • Analyzes business processes; elicits, analyzes, and documents business requirements; identifies alternative solutions, assesses feasibility and makes recommendations typically seeking to exploit and leverage new or existing IT technology components.  • Demonstrates an innovative approach to solving business problems.  • Identify process disconnects and translate them into improvement opportunities with cost savings or avoidance, productivity improvements, or revenue generating business benefits.  • Understands System Life Cycle process.  • Software Life Cycle documentation creation (i.e. Project Charter, Process Flows, User/Functional Requirements, User Acceptance Tests).  • Prepares testing plans to confirm that requirements and system design are accurate and complete.  • Translates business requirements into user and functional requirements; performs data and process modeling; manages change; and leads, coordinates / performs testing, verification, and validation of requirements.  • Develops information systems strategies that meet the requirements of the business. Identifies the business benefits of alternative strategies. Ensures compliance between business strategies and technology directions.  • Partners with business to ensure the appropriate business procedures, training and communications are developed per project. Conducts training when appropriate.  • Delivers projects on-time and within budget constraints and provide accurate and timely communications to management.  • Understands the core business systems and how the integrate with upstream and downstream systems.  • Manages and provides expert advice on, the selection, design, justification, implementation and business use of information systems.  • Develops business relationships and integrates activities with other IT departments to ensure successful implementation and support of project efforts. Manages relationships between clients involved and IT organizations to assure effective communication between the groups is occurring. Brokers services within IT community on behalf of customers; coordinates system solutions. Allies with other IT functional areas to remain current on project status, and inform customer management of progress; conversely, keeps IT managers aware of user issues and resolves conflicts.  • Manages medium to highly complex work activities covering technical, financial and quality aspects and contributing to formulation of IT strategy. Work involves creative application of wide range of technical and / or management principles. Establishes organizational objectives and manages multiple assignments.  Education & Experience:  • Bachelor’s Degree plus 4-7 years’ experience, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.  • 4-7 years’ experience.  • Working knowledge of Salesforce platform.  • Experience implementing Continuous Deployment.  • Hands on experience with SDLC methods and tools (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum) Type:  Direct  Location:  Austin, TX, USA Apply Now

Name: Senior Analyst, Corporate Communications
Description: W2O Group is a healthcare communications & PR firm with over 700 people worldwide. Ranked #1 to work for among large agencies by The Holmes Report, W2O Group is on the forefront of applying digital analytics to communications. With a demonstrated 132% revenue growth in five years, W2O Group is on fire with new business and clients. Working with us is a great opportunity to make an impact in an entrepreneurial culture, working directly with clients and all levels of staff. The role: Our award-winning analytics group of 100+ analysts is seeking a Senior Analyst to join our team. As part of a broader cross-PESO analytics team, the Senior Analyst will focus: Primarily on: supporting and evolving W2O's proprietary Corporate Relevance Index (blog, podcast)Secondarily on: agile analytics to support the earned media strategy team by identifying influencers, understanding audiences, shaping narrative, optimizing execution, and measuring resultsWho You Are:You're naturally curious and a critical thinkerYou spot patternsYou like to blend science and artYou need to explain why something happened not just that it did happen; and you like to explain what could or should happen going forwardYou have a passion for telling stories fueled by data and insightsYou are equally adept and happy at dealing with internal account teams as external clientsYou are open, approachable, a listener and able to translate a request into an approachYou understand the intricacies of healthcare or other similarly regulated environmentsYou set the standard for delivering value and are motivated to make a positive impactYou thrive in an environment that requires constant learning, innovation, and experimentationYou like to try new thingsYou get the importance of staying on top of the details and believe in exceeding expectations when it comes to timeline and budget managementWhat You'll Do:Serve as an analytics partner to account teamsServe as an actively engaged member on a broad cross-PESO analytics teamServe as a subject matter expert on W2O's proprietary Corporate Relevance Index to analysts, account teams, and clientsNurture long-lasting relationships with internal and external stakeholdersServe as lead day-to-day and typically manage 2-3 ongoing analytics projects with support from senior managementFocus on analytics to help understand audiences, shape narrative, optimize execution and content, and measure resultsBridge previous experiences with 3rd party analytics platforms and the application of W2O-proprietary platforms, methods and approachesExtract multiple types of data from multiple sources to draw inferences, conclusions, and insightsPartner with account teams to develop actionable recommendationsPresent reports to clients that bring a story to lifeWhat You'll Bring:Minimum 3-5 years of experience with majority in at least one of the following areas: healthcare/pharmaceutical marketing/PR/advertising, investor relations, employee communications, brand and reputation tracking, strategic planning, digital/social strategy, earned media analytics, digital/social analytics, social listening, primary/syndicated research, or account managementYou have experience with at least a few of the following: Traditional media monitoringSocial media monitoringText miningContent analysisBrand and reputation trackingFinancial analyst reportsEmployee ratings and reviewsSearch analyticsBasic statisticsOwned social channel analyticsPaid social analyticsWeb analyticsInfluencer network analysisSocial audience profiling, segmentationPR measurementScorecards and dashboardsYou have strong oral and written communication skillsYou are proactive and efficient communicator across internal teamsYou have excellent project management skillsYou are able to think critically (conceptualizing, analyzing, applying, evaluating) to guide accurate, clear and sound recommendations & actionsYou are able to initially prepare well-crafted decks that tell a story, have a clear POVYou are competent with Microsoft Office, particularly PowerPoint, Excel, and WordYou have a college degree (BA or equivalent), with relevant concentration such as market research, marketing, communications, public relations, or social sciences; Master's degree a plus W2O Group offers a comprehensive benefit program and perks, including unlimited and flexible PTO, expanded paid leave for new parents and a 4th Trimester program that helps new parents transition back to work, and a five-week sabbatical program. Other perks include Income Protection, Retirement plans/401(k) match, and cell phone savings plans. Learn more about our great benefits and perks at: http://www.w2ogroup.com/ W2O Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We foster an environment that embraces diversity. We are stronger with a wider range of opinions, strengths, and backgrounds to achieve our goals.

Name: Strategic Operations & Business Analyst Lead
Description: Leads activities related to enterprise, divisional, and departmental level strategies by consulting with management and presenting research and developing programs for the organization. Works independently with guidance in only the most complex situations. May lead functional teams or projects. Provides strategic insights and recommendations for enhancing and developing new programs to senior managementEnsures that strategic planning initiatives and projects are effectively implemented by forming teams to evaluate and implement. Performs complex business case analysis and/or feasibility analysis on multiple projects. Assists with research for, and development of, cost benefit analysis for various maintenance, rehabilitation and/or replacement options for specific assets, related to the strategic planDefines scope, recommends approach, and leads execution of major strategic projects. Ensures project results meet requirements regarding technical quality, reliability, schedule and cost and ultimately achieve the desired outcome. Develops data-driven insights for delivery to an executive/Board level audienceDevelops and implements operating plans, goals, objectives, priorities and procedures that are in alignment with the established strategic goals and objectives of the department.  Works with senior management on long range planning projects Applies creative problem-solving skills to strategic issuesFormally tracks and reports progress toward established goals and milestones for delivery of results.Ensures appropriate records are maintained for budget requirements, management systems, policies and procedures.Participates in cross-training activities, cross-departmental sharing of knowledge and, when appropriate, cross-departmental developmental assignments.May develop and lead focused training as needed to support organizational needs and requirements.This general overview only includes essential functions of the job and does not imply that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to follow any other job-related instruction and to perform any other job-related duties requested by supervisor or management. Twelve or more years experience in capital planning, decision-making modeling, operations and maintenance planning, financial management, project management and strategic business support. A degree(s) in business, economics, engineering, finance, math, science or relevant field may be substituted per LCRA guidelines for certain years of experience. Experience in long-term strategic planningDegree(s) in business, finance, economics or relevant field

Name: Staff Business Systems Analyst - Compliance
Description: TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance.  TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR. JOB SUMMARY/OVERVIEW The IT Governance and Compliance Analyst is responsible for managing, supporting, and optimizing the IT regulatory and SOX ITGC compliance programs (including compliance activities, framework, policies and processes). This role will also be the point of contact for internal and external audit parties. The Analyst will audit and assess risk on new and existing information system applications and processes to ensure that appropriate controls exist, that processing is efficient and accurate, and that procedures are in compliance with corporate standards. keep detailed and well organized audit records.Identify risks and gaps and facilitate remediation.Provide risk metrics to management regarding audit performance and findings.Assist control owners with root cause analysis and track risk management action plan progress.Guide efforts to create common control framework and uniform compliance reporting standard.Implement and supervise the issue tracking and resolution process.Review the audit assessments conducted by both internal and external audit teams.Review and audit the Active Directory security group; Perform weekly evaluations of new and additional user access to ensure compliance with provisioning policies; Review and validate the Quarterly User Access Reviews; Help in auditing the identity and Access Manager (IAM), process.JOB REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONSEducation: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Information Systems and 5 to 7 years of relevant experience in IT SOX experience; Name: (USA-TX-Austin) Business Operations Analyst, Google Fiber
Description: Minimum qualifications:Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.2 years of experience in management consulting, investment banking, or corporate strategy.2 years of relevant experience in an analytical role, such as business intelligence, corporate strategy, or quantitative research.Preferred qualifications:Ability to take initiative, adapt quickly to changing priorities and work with effective business judgment and thought leadership.Distinctive problem-solving and analytical skills.Effective written and verbal communication skills, along with excellent interpersonal and presentation skills. Business Analysts ensure that Google makes effective business and operational decisions. As a Business Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios, tracking performance metrics or building metrics that matter, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. Working on multiple projects at a time, you'll focus on the details while finding creative ways to tackle big picture challenges. You'll lead individual projects to transform planning, tracking and control processes, as well as provide senior level management with insightful recommendations, planning and reporting support.  As a Business Operations Analyst for Google Fiber, you will be the subject matter expert (SME) across the business, helping assess the operational and financial viability of deployment opportunities, develop operational plans and mitigations against risk, continuously evaluate and optimize planning processes and facilitate operational reviews to report progress and outcomes to leadership. Additionally, you'll work closely with cross-functional teams to accelerate progress, provide analytical support and bridge communications between teams and business partners. Work with supporting analysts and cross-functional stakeholders to develop and continuously refine planning processes and analytical models to centrally illustrate the deployment strategies across Google Fibers portfolio.Work closely with Network Deployment Operations (NDO) leadership to automate the roll-up of key performance metrics against approved plans for dissemination to Google Fiber executives. Provide regular updates to NDO leadership on the status of approved projects under management.Expand engagement with teams across Google Fiber to capture new business operations efforts from all corners of the business. Build consensus among cross-functional teams and influence decision making amongst leadership.Drive the rollout, planning and strategy of successful business operations processes in partnership across Google Fiber.Gather and analyze information and synthesize that information to develop compelling, insightful recommendations.

Name: Strategy Analyst
Description: Ref#: R0012778 Our mission.  As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers. The team.  Our Finance team ensures that Indeed complies with the highest standards of business, law and ethics, while providing Indeed's clients with excellent customer service and Indeed's management with the information and guidance required to succeed around the world. Every month, over 200 million people count on us to help them find jobs, publish their resumes, process their job applications, and connect them to qualified candidates for their job openings. Simply put, we help support the people who help people get jobs. Your job. As a Strategy Analyst, you will be working on the most important strategic and operational projects for Indeed's global markets with a forward-looking view. This specific role will focus on financial analysis of Indeed's global expansion. You will be performing financial and data analysis to guide strategic decision making on new market expansion, supporting Indeed’s continued long term growth.  About you. Responsibilities Conduct financial analysis and modeling to project Indeed's global revenue and headcount growthAnalyze financial statements to create company benchmarking reports for LeadershipResearch HR-related market space for competitive intelligence and product trendsConduct competitor and market analyses to determine Indeed’s market opportunity by region and product offeringLeverage market analyses to strategically influence Indeed’s product offerings and key product features within the HR tech verticalDevelop and implement go-to-market sales strategy for key global marketsCollaborate with Legal, Finance, Accounting, and HR to guide setup process of new offices Requirements Bachelor's degree (Finance/Economics preferred); MBA welcomed3+ years of work experience (preferably in strategy, consulting, and/or corporate development in the technology sector)Passionate about technology and internet industryExperience in financial analysis and modeling is requiredSavvy in data analysis and problem solvingStrong business acumen and structured thinking with a global perspective; international experience is preferredAdept at multitasking, with great attention to detailSelf-directed with a positive "can-do" attitudeExcellent written and oral communication How to Apply:  Please submit your application with a cover letter, which should include brief answers to the following questions: From your current understanding of the company, explain how Indeed generates revenue.Which factors would you consider when determining in which country Indeed should open its next office?Briefly highlight your experience with financial research and analysis.Indeed provides a variety of benefits that help us focus on our mission of helping people get jobs.  View our bounty of perks: http://indeedhi.re/IndeedBenefits

Name: SAP Retail Functional Analyst
Description: SummarySummaryImagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Are you deeply accountable for your work? Your passion for product ownership and track record will prove critical to your success on our team. SAP Retail Functional Analyst is a position within the corporate Information Systems and Technology (IS&T) SAP team and this position will be key to our SAP Retail application space. You are self-directed and motivated with strong SAP IS Retail and SAP R/3 business process and configuration experience. You will be required to have both business process skills as well as technical leadership skills, to be able to design and implement secure, scalable and sustainable solutions. It also requires the ability to create process flows, functional specifications and work with both onsite and offshore resources to build and test solutions, solve problems and resolve issues under pressure to meet timelines and present solutions to multiple levels of management. This is a tremendous opportunity for someone who has the ability to own and drive initiatives and a passion to work in a highly integrated global solution platform. Be ready to make something great when you come here. Dynamic, inspiring people and innovative, industry-defining technologies are the norm at Apple. The people who work here have reinvented and defined entire industries with our products and services. The same passion for innovation also applies to our business practices - strengthening our commitment to leave the world better than we found it. You should join Apple if you want to help deliver the next amazing Apple product Eight plus years of experience with SAP ECC and/or IS Retail Two plus complete full life-cycle implementations of SAP Retail, Sales and Distribution in a functional lead capacity Experience with Design and development of SAP Forecasting and SAP Replenishment for Retail In-depth technical knowledge of SAP Retail as well as supporting business processes SAP project leadership including selection, implementation, and support of application-packaged solutions including SAP IS retail, SAP Procure to Pay module, and SAP Sales and Distribution model Experience in handling localization and translation Ability to stay focused and prioritize a heavy workload while achieving extraordinary quality You are upbeat, adaptable, and results oriented with a positive attitude You have excellent judgment and integrity with the ability to make timely and sound decisions As the Functional Analyst you will be required to: Design and develop SAP Retail IT solutions for Apple Retail logistics. Perform detailed system analysis, develop functional and technical specifications, and make recommendations for SAP retail applications. Work closely with Point of Sale (POS), Data Warehouse, ABAP, Basis and other teams during design and implementation of SAP Retail functionalities to support Apple Retail Business. Work with key business users in developing detailed requirements and providing conceptual design of proposed solution. Perform system configuration, modification and set-up for new projects as well as enhancements to existing projects and perform system testing and integration validations. Support User Acceptance Testing (UAT) with business clients and provide project status updates and documentation of designs, processes and configurations. Interact with business users and other IS&T teams to ensure that business requirements are met through proper system configuration. The role will require strong influence and persuasion skills along with excellent configuration and development skills in order to seamlessly integrate SAP Retail and front end solutions. Education & ExperienceBS or MS degree with a minimum 5-7 years experience of SAP Retail functional experience Additional RequirementsREQUIRED GENERAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: Demonstrable ability to complete multiple tasks under pressure without direct supervision. Excellent planner and team leader Superb communication, presentation and facilitation skills Experience or exposure to SAP SD (Sales and Distribution) SAP MM (Materials Management) module configuration within ECC and SAP IS Retail High Tech industry experience SOH or S/4 HANA experience with be an added advantage

Name: Business Operations Analyst
Description: Global Resale is looking for a Business Operations Analyst! ABOUT GLOBAL RESALE: Headquartered in Austin, Texas and Essex, UK, Global Resale is a full-service, international resell and reverse logistics business focused on the IT, enterprise, and mobility sectors. Global Resale partners with the leading manufacturers, carriers, lessors, retailers, resellers, and large corporate accounts to handle their worldwide reverse logistics needs. With best-in-class, processing centers in Austin, Texas (Global Headquarters) and Essex (European Headquarters), Global Resale serves as a single-source solution for its partners, offering the full range of reverse logistics capabilities, including take-back, collection, inventory, data sanitization, repair, harvesting, and resell. Overview The Business Operations Analyst role is responsible for applying strong process design and data analysis skills to a fast-paced and dynamic manufacturing and sales organization. This is a position of high visibility and impact with the ability to influence the shape of processes, how measurements are designed, and how systems and processes merge. The role is evenly split among daily duties involving data manipulation tasks and project work that the Analyst will be expected to manage and drive to completion while working across different business functions. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND FUNCTIONS Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Assist in the development, implementation, and maintenance of a product pricing model and the input of product prices into the operating databasePrepare and present business intelligence reports utilizing Microsoft PowerBIWork with the Sales and Procurement functions to improve data qualityDrive process improvement in the areas of Manufacturing, Purchasing, and Inventory Management through automation of data collection and analysisAid in the design of manufacturing processes that allow for the transformation of data into information Be willing and excited about learning new skills and techniques including but not limited to SQL, advanced MS Excel, MS Power BI, and statistical methods/six sigmaCOMPLEXITIES OF THE ROLE include the following: Projects and initiatives are strategic in nature and must develop practical action plans to accomplish themIdentifies and drives opportunities for process improvements.Ability to work comfortably with all levels of management and employees throughout the companyQUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must possess the following: Demonstrated intermediate to advanced MS Excel skillsMultitasking skills and the ability to manage changeTeamwork skills and the ability to drive a project through to completionFocus on business process development & improvementClear and concise communication skillsADVANTAGEOUS PREVIOUS EXPERIENCEA history of proven success in a manufacturing company working with dataExperience in designing processes, controls, and measurementsA strong knowledge of SQL and database design methodologiesEDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCEBachelor's Degree from an accredited university, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.At least three years work experience in a related functionCOMPANY BENEFITS OFFERED:100% Company-paid Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability coverage for all employeesGenerous PTO policyEmployee Discount on products sold Located in North-Central Austin, near the Domain.

Name: Content Analyst
Description: What makes Gartner Research & Advisory a GREAT fit for you? When you join Gartner Research & Advisory, youll be part of a leading-edge team that values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage. Youll deliver must-have research through compelling client interactions, and contribute to our double-digit growth by providing our clients worldwide the unbiased insight they need to make the right decisions on their key initiatives. Through constant learning, discovery and collaboration youll not only help clients deliver on their mission critical priorities, youll grow your career and the scope of your impact across industries. Our culture demands hard work and rewards it with exceptional opportunity. If youre always looking for whats next in business and technology, Gartner is looking for you.  We are looking for a Content Analyst to research and write compelling content for Gartners Digital Markets research group. This research group assists business leaders of small and medium sized companies in finding and selecting the right software. The Gartner Digital Markets business is comprised of three internet brandsSoftware Advice, Capterra and GetAppwho are market leaders in this space.  For qualified candidates exploring the technology space as their next opportunity, Gartner Digital Markets can offer the excitement of working in a start-up atmosphere, combined with the stability and power of Gartner, and the opportunity to be on the front lines of innovation in a fast-growing business.  The Role  Gartners Digital Markets research team is looking for a passionate and experienced content analyst to produce high quality, insightful articles to help small businesses make the right software choices. As a content analyst, you will be responsible for growing traffic to our sites and improving user engagement by delivering must-have editorial content about business software and technology trends.  Working as part of Gartner Research, you will have access to vast amounts of market data and analysis to help you create great content.  Were looking for someone who: Loves to write.Has a native level of English proficiency.Has a passion for technology, ideally with a background in IT or tech journalism.Enjoys researching and analyzing markets to identify relevant topics.Has excellent communication and collaboration skills.Is highly organized and used to working to deadlines. What youll do all day: Stay on top of trends and identify important topics ideas using search engine keyword research.Research the important issues small businesses face in their selection and adoption of information technology.Produce high-quality editorial content and in-depth primary research to engage audiences and drive traffic.Master several software markets/categories to be able to write authoritatively to readers in that space and provide actionable advice that helps them solve pressing business challenges.Tailor your content to specific buyer personas and funnel stages within those software markets/categories.Work closely with Gartner Research colleagues to leverage relevant research to illuminate articles for small business software buyers.Collaborate with key industry influencers to produce high-quality content.Promote your content in online communities aimed at small businesses. What we offer: A collaborative, positive culture. Youll work with people who are as enthusiastic, smart and driven as you are. Youll be managed by the best, too.Limitless growth and learning opportunities. We offer the excitement of a fast-paced entrepreneurial workplace and the professional growth opportunities of an established global organization.Outstanding compensation. We offer a competitive salary and generous benefits, including a robust time off allowance and great perks. Job Requirements  Education BA in English or BS in Computer Sciences or equivalent fields of study. Professional Experience 3+ years of content writing experience.Prior experience in corporate/software environment and/or for a content marketing organization highly desired. Technical / Professional Skills & Competencies Exceptional writing skills across different content topics and formats. Proficiency in AP Style.Strong analytical abilities in researching topics and distilling out the critical issues.Experience with Google Docs, WordPress and other Content Management Systems (CMS). Job Requisition ID:25423  By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.  Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: The Company  JetRock is a fast growing analytics company serving the oil and gas industry, based in Austin, Texas. We work with private equity-backed and public O&G companies to enhance their business development efforts, using our proprietary data system and face-to-face client interaction. We are doers that value results over time-in-seat.  The Job  We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to Create analysis deliverables in the form of slide decks, maps, and presentations, using our data system. The content typically revolves around A&D deal evaluations, area intelligence updates, etc.Expand and maintain our client-facing Spotfire projects.Wrangle data to keep the data pipeline flowing smoothly.Present their work at client meetings, once the analyst has mastered the subject matter. The position will be based in Austin, Texas. Some travel, on the order of a few days a month, may be required.  Desired Skills Experience in the upstream O&G industry, or related financial industry (private equity, investment banking, etc.), in business development, engineering, land, geology, or a similar field.Experience with the following software: Spotfire, Excel, and PowerPoint (optional understanding of R and SQL).Ability and desire to work independently - no micromanaging.Comfort with making round-table presentations to an audience of 5-10 people. Why should you apply? A chance to have a major impact as part of a small and growing team.Get exposure to just about every aspect of the O&G business and make a lot of connections throughout the industry.A friendly, flexible, non-bureaucratic work environment. Job Type: Full-time  Work authorization: United States (Required)

Name: Business Analyst - Global Support Services
Description: Why NI?  For 40 years, National Instruments has worked with engineers and scientists to provide answers to the most challenging questions. Through these pursuits, NI customers have brought hundreds of thousands of products to market, overcome innumerable technological roadblocks, and engineered a better life for us all.  Historically, National Instruments has been a top 100 employer of choice as ranked by several different sources, including the Just 100 from Forbes Magazine, which recently named NI one of the top corporate citizens and best places to work. Maybe it is our fantastic work/life balance, or the Employee Stock Purchase Program and grants, or matching 401K, or picturesque campus with ponds, hiking trails, beach volleyball courts, and collaborative meeting spaces. If you want to work on cool stuff at a cool company, you're in the right place! Here's a snippet of some of our core industry leadership. 5 G Setting world records in spectral efficiency using MIMOInternet of Things (IoT) - With NI's technology providing unmatched capabilities in measurement, control, ruggedness, and connectivity, along with our expert ecosystem, you can realize the benefits of the Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) today.Semiconductor - NI semiconductor test customers report 10X improvement in test times while maintaining measurement and performance requirements.Autonomous Automotive - As vehicles advance towards autonomous operation, test engineers face drastically increasing system complexity while dealing with ever present cost and time pressure.Aerospace & Defense - NI provides industry-leading performance and accuracy with best-in-class synchronization for large systems, so you can get to the right decision faster. More @: www.ni.com  POSITION OVERVIEW - Sr Business Analyst - Global Support Services  The NI Business Insights and Analytics team is seeking a Sr. Business Analyst - Global Support Services, who will be responsible for the role of a trusted advisor to various global support services functions by delivering actionable insights through data and analytics into the day-to-day and strategic decision making process. Key functional areas include marketing measurement, ops, digital media, ni.com and contact nurturing. This is an extremely high visibility role to drive global support services transformation and will involve tremendous learning in a fast paced environment.  The analyst will also work on collecting, storing, processing, transforming and analyzing large sets of data from multiple, often disparate, systems, including data warehouse, source systems, and external third-party data.  Responsibilities include Building effective partnerships with business stakeholdersDeveloping scalable data/reporting/analytics solutionsExtracting, transforming, and analyzing large sets of dataGathering and effectively communicating insightsPassionate towards driving positive business impact through insights Expectations Interact with business leaders to identify key challenges and identify how data can be used to help resolve themConsult with business leaders to evaluate, identify, and implement actionable business performance measuresLeverage traditional SQL (or SQL-based tools) to develop scalable, non-production data sets required to meet business reporting and analysis needsWrite complex queries that profile, clean, extract, transform and merge a variety of data (e.g. customer, product, financial and web data)Working knowledge and experience with big data technologies and tools (NoSQL, Hadoop, Python etc.) would be a plusLeverage the data/reporting solutions to provide proactive insights that support company objectivesPrepare adhoc analysis for management/executives Basic requirements Bachelor's degree from an accredited university is required4 years' experience in marketing analyticsExperience analyzing large data sets using statistical and data mining techniques (data profiling, sampling, exploratory analysis)Experience running complex SQL (or other programming language) queries Preferred requirements Masters degree is a plus (Computer Science or Information Management preferred)Experience with BI reporting and analytics tools is a plus (Tableau, Oracle BI, Sales Force)Experience analyzing data and effectively communicating findings that clearly address strategic business questionsProven experience in influencing data analytics programs using customer insights to drive pipeline & revenue growth National Instruments is an Affirmative Actionand Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receiveconsideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexualorientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, maritalstatus, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any otherprotected status. We are committed to inclusion and diversity.SDL2017

analytical skills with keen attention to detailExcellent verbal and written communication skillsBenefits For more than 20 years, Moser Consulting has been the go-to source for exceptional IT talent with the ability to self-manage. At Moser Consulting, our people are our #1 asset. We hire the best people, welcome them like family, connect them with opportunities, and let them do what they do best: produce innovative solutions to technology problems.  Our culture gives us a competitive advantage by keeping our employees happy, healthy, and by lowering stress levels in a very demanding industry. It is no accident that we are recognized as one of the Best Places to Work in Indiana. Name: Senior Analyst, Business Operations & Strategy
Description: Senior Analyst, Business Operations & StrategyBungalo is seeking a Senior Analyst for the Strategic Finance and Business Operations team. The Senior Analyst will be a cross-functional player working on strategic projects across every piece of the value chain for Bungalo, from initial home acquisition to post-sale warranties. He/she will also play a role in designing analytics packages and using data to support and drive business decisions.Our ideal candidate has a roll up your sleeves attitude and attacks problems thoughtfully and head-on. He/she is hungry, inquisitive, proactive, energetic and driven. The role will not only require an analytical mindset, but also an operations focus to execute on initiatives ownership from ideation, decision making, to implementation. Were looking for someone who can wear lots of hats and be the ultimate utility player.  Depending on candidates experience, were open to an associate-level position.RESPONSIBILITIESPartner with business units across Bungalo to identify problems, design solutions, and drive operational changesLead strategic and financial business reviews, including budgeting, planning, and board materialsCommunicate findings to senior management and to the broader organizationProvide analytical rigor and bring a strategic mindset to operational initiativesConduct ad hoc analysis to better understand drivers of business success and key growth leversDevelop and monitor critical success metrics, and communicate actionable insights to relevant stakeholdersQUALIFICATIONSMinimum 2-4 years of experience in business operations, analytics, and/or strategyPrior experience in management consulting, investment banking, private equity, or venture capital; experience at high-growth companies a plusStrong analytical skills and with data driven approach to problem solvingTeam player, but also a self-starter and capable of driving business results without significant supervisionExperience and confidence to project manage across cross-functional teamsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsStrong Excel and data modeling skillsSQL proficiency a plusWillingness to travel as required for projectsABOUT BUNGALOBuying a house is the American Dream; it represents independence and financial stability. But its also an intimidating, incredibly stressful and opaque experience. In most US markets, you face an aging housing stock with limited move-in ready inventory, making it extremely difficult to find and purchase a home that wont require a ton of work. And, if you do find a house, every single step is a headache. We are building a brand, Bungalo, which will deliver consistent and beautifully renovated move-in ready pre-owned homes in hot markets. Plus, we make the whole process of buying and selling easy! With Bungalos seamless and guided online experience, you can shop, tour, finance, make an offer and even close - all under one roof. You can check us out at bungalohomes.com.The Bungalo brand is being built within our parent company, Amherst Residential, which has a lot of experience acquiring and rehabbing single family homes at scale. In 5 years weve acquired, rehabbed and sold 20k single family homes to institutional investors across 20 major US metros. All powered by proprietary technology, data and boots on the ground.Join our team as we move the industry forward.

Name: Business Systems Analyst - SSIS
Description: Job ID: 270598  Business Systems Analyst - SSIS  Austin, Texas  Regular  /  DayApply NowWe Are Hiring Business Systems Analyst - SSIS -Austin,TX - Quarry Lake - ACO Member Svcs 001 - Full-Time, Day, 40 hours, Weekly Why Join Ascension?At Seton, we’re using the power of purpose to change healthcare for the better. As part of Ascension's Texas Ministry Market we do this through collaboration. Seton brings great minds and proven results from the across the nation together. From the best hires and strategic plans for growth, to the proactive connections we make within our community, we reach out to move ahead. Now, partnering with the University of Texas to build the new Dell Seton Medical Center, our future looks brighter than ever. We do this in force. With more than 12,800 associates, Seton is the leading healthcare service provider in Central Texas as well as its second largest employer. We serve an eleven county area of more than 1.8 million people. We have five urban acute care hospitals, two rural hospitals, a mental health hospital, three primary care clinics for the uninsured, and an increasing number of storefront care locations. We do this with vision. Since our founding in 1902, Seton has led the way in Austin --- expanding thoughtfully and with purpose; caring for our neighbors, because we know them so well. As a non-profit with a mission --- rather than a bottom line --- guiding us, improving health at a community level is our number one priority. Austin.It’s our home, and our heart. Located at the center of Texas hill country --- just a few hours from Dallas, Houston, and San Antonio --- Austin offers an appealing blend of hometown comfort and high-tech care. Whether you are looking for a vibrant nightlife and live music, recreational areas and activities, family-friendly fun, or educational offerings, Austin is a city that not only calls to you, but gently encourages you to sit down and stay awhile.  With cultural diversity, a mild climate (and truly great outdoors), attractive and affordable housing options, and no state income tax, Austin is a feel-good choice for a rewarding way of life. The way we connect,the lives we affect. The Seton Healthcare Family is always looking for dedicated, talented professionals willing to share their hearts with those we serve. Being part of our close-knit team means performing to a higher standard. Embracing innovation, while understanding the importance of individual connections. And continually collaborating, learning and growing to realize new levels of personal and professional satisfaction.What You Will DoJob Summary: Evaluates, implements and maintains assigned business systems and applications. Affirmative Action policies and programs are required to overcome the present effects of past discrimination and to achieve equal employment opportunity for members of groups that are or have been formerly under-represented. Name: SAP FICO Business Analyst
Description: RGP is a global consulting firm helping some of the most recognized companies in the world work differently. Our success comes from a shared belief in rolling up our sleeves and doing the hard work of solving complex challenges, executing plans and implementing technology to help transform organizations.  Working as a consultant you will be connected to work that matters, putting your expertise to its best use while developing skills for the future. The result is a career defined by you, supported by RGP and built on tangible accomplishments.  As we continue to grow and deepen our impact on organizations around the world, we are looking for the right people to join us on our mission. If you are interested in being part of our team, there a few things you should know:  + We are energized by challenges and the effort needed to solve them.  + We like working with people who are positive, adaptable and growth-minded.  + We care how work gets accomplished and are deeply invested in the success of our clients and our colleagues.  If this sounds like you, we invite you to read on and learn more. *THE RGP CONSULTING EXPERIENCE** RGP has a unique consulting model that provides opportunities for consultants to work in different ways. Most consultants work in a model where they have the flexibility and autonomy to choose projects aligning to their experience, skills and desired lifestyle. Other opportunities exist in team-based, strategy and solutions work. In all models, you will feel the full support of RGP to assist you in your work and guide you on your chosen path. *PURPOSE OF THE ROLE** As an SAP FICO Business Analyst, you will help our clients evolve their SAP S4 HANA platform within the Financial and Controls areas of the business. In this role, you may work closely with cross-functional IT peers and Finance business partners to gather requirements and to provide standard, simple yet robust SAP solutions. You will also lead and/or support the improvement of IT and administrative system and business processes. *ATTRIBUTES OF CONSULTANTS AT RGP** + Respect for people and opinions and confidently offer your point-of-view with clients and among colleagues  + A drive for proactively cultivating relationships with clients and colleagues  + Optimism when faced with challenges and complex situations, coupled with the drive to solve client issues  + Dedication to continuous improvement and development of your skillset and talents  + A strong personal identification with RGP?s values ? loyalty, integrity, focus, enthusiasm, accountability and talent *KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE** + Serve as a subject matter expert associated with content, processes, and procedures associated with most SAP FICO modules i.e. Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, General Ledger Accounting, Enterprise Controls, Treasury and Risk Management, etc  + Act as an internal consultant and design architect for a SAP FI/CO global solution. Partner with peers in the IT and Finance organization to determine business process and solution design, leveraging the capabilities of the SAP Finance and Control modules  + Experienced with all aspects of a SAP implementation, including business process analysis, system configuration, testing, documentation, end-user training, and production support  + Support the identification of opportunities to standardize processes and system configuration globally, and ensure compliance across all implementation to these standards  + Working knowledge of Ariba and how it?s integrated with the S4 HANA system  + Demonstrated ability to analyze and provide effective problem solving, assessing for standard functionality (interfaces, IDocs and configurations) and identifying reasonable custom solutions where needed  + Analyze business/technical requirements and translate process into practice through the current SAP Finance and Controls functionality  + Identify opportunities to enhance existing business operations using new SAP functions as a replacement of legacy systems and manual effort  + Develop, prototype, test and implement solution improvements to increase stability, usability and functionality, to enable end users to meet business objectives  + After the implementation, lead and support project initiatives to expand the usage of the SAP solution to improve and expand FI/CO processes across the enterprise  + Conduct knowledge transfer and training of end-users, including sharing best practices  + Understand the role and importance of new SAP technologies improving user experience i.e. Fiori and SAP Screen Personas  + Experienced in complex implementations that include custom solutions around SAP (user exits, enhancements, customer programs)  + Open to learning and keeping current on next generation applications in the SAP ecosystem *DESIRED EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS**+ REQUIRED: + Bachelor?s Degree in MIS, Computer Science, Engineering, Technology, Business Administration or related discipline  + Minimum of seven years? experience in Information Technology  + Deep understanding of integrating systems via middleware + PREFERRED: + Master?s degree  + SAP FI Certification  + Any other IT Specific certifications (ITIL, Six Sigma, PMP) *Equal Opportunity Employer** RGP is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or veteran status, and encourage all applicants to apply.

Name: Business Intelligence Technical Analyst Lead
Description: Merck & Co., Inc. Kenilworth, N.J., U.S.A. known as Merck in the United States and Canada, is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where Merck has codified its legacy for over a century. Merck?s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.  Merck?s Information Technology organization partners with colleagues across the business to help serve our patients and customers around the world. Ours is a high energy team of dynamic, innovative individuals dedicated to advancing Merck?s contribution to global medical innovation by leveraging information and technology to efficiently advance the business by driving revenue and productivity.  How will you invent the future?  As our US CIM (Commercial Information Management) Business Intelligence Technical Analyst Lead at Merck?s Austin IT HUB, you will be part of inventing tomorrow. Our Innovative centers are where great people come together and deliver solutions that save and improve lives.  We are seeking motivated talent interested in solving problems to improve tomorrow.  The primary responsibility of the technical analyst lead is to define the functional, technical and data requirements needed to deliver business focused BI solutions and ensure that delivery of this solution meets the quality requirements of the Business teams. This will include the following:  + Manage the Technical Analyst team to ensure all technical deliverables meet necessary standards and team is striving or innovative, high quality and cost effective solutions for our Commercial Business  + Actively participate in project scoping and/or business requirement sessions as a means of assisting the Business Analyst in crafting such artifacts  + Lead the development of project outputs such as solution vision and design, functional/user requirements, solution mockup, prototypes, and technical architecture (if needed), test cases, and deployment plans  + Communicate business requirements to and work closely with development teams to ensure accurate understanding and implementation  + Responsible for ensuring quality and understanding of E2E solution for all BI analytics projects  You will work and learn more about:  + US Commercial strategy  + Enabling BI capability to support business strategy  + Working within the market and leveraging the hub network  Education Minimum Requirement: - B.S. or M.S. in IT, Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. Required Experience and Skills: + 6 years of relevant work experience, with demonstrated expertise in the BI and Analytics space including strong technical understanding of BI tools and architecture  + Demonstrated experience in the pharmaceutical commercial BI space  + 2 years of Qlik development and design experience  + Experience with leading teams and eliciting requirements for complex systems  + High Proficiency in Information Management, Data Analysis and Reporting Requirement Elicitation Preferred Experience and Skills: + Deep understanding of data management best practices and data analytics  + Ability to lead requirements sessions with clients and project teams  + Strong leadership, verbal and written communication skills with ability to articulate results and issues to internal and client teams  Your role at Merck is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we?re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. At Merck, we?re inventing for life.  If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request to staffingaadar@merck.com . Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully: Merck & Co., Inc. is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Merck via email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Merck. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Merck as a result of the referral or through other means.  Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.  For more information about personal rights under Equal Employment Opportunity, visit:  EEOC Poster at http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf  EEOC GINA Supplement at http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_gina_supplement.pdf  OFCCP EEO Supplement at https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf  Merck is an equal opportunity employer, Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran ? proudly embracing diversity in all of it?s manifestations. *Job** _Business/Technical Analysis_*Title:** _Business Intelligence Technical Analyst Lead_*Primary Location:** NA-US-TX-Austin*Requisition ID:** _BUS003165_

Name: Senior Business Analyst - Manufacturing SW and Process
Description: Why NI?For 40 years, National Instruments has worked with engineers and scientists to provide answers to the most challenging questions. Through these pursuits, NI customers have brought hundreds of thousands of products to market, overcome innumerable technological roadblocks, and engineered a better life for us all. Historically, National Instruments has been a top 100 employer of choice as ranked by several different sources, including the Just 100 from Forbes Magazine. If you want to work on cool stuff at a cool company, you’re in the right place! Here’s a snippet of some of our core industry leadership.Watch Video: 40 Years of NI Success5 G – Setting world records in spectral efficiency using MIMOInternet of Things (IoT) - With NI’s technology providing unmatched capabilities in measurement, control, ruggedness, and connectivity, along with our expert ecosystem, you can realize the benefits of the Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) today.Semiconductor - NI semiconductor test customers report 10X improvement in test times while maintaining measurement and performance requirements.Autonomous Automotive - As vehicles advance towards autonomous operation, test engineers face drastically increasing system complexity while dealing with ever present cost and time pressure.Aerospace & Defense -NI provides industry-leading performance and accuracy with best-in-class synchronization for large systems, so you can get to the right decision faster.More @: www.ni.com | Facebook | LinkedIn | Twitter | YouTubePOSITION OVERVIEW - Business Analyst - Manufacturing Software & ProcessThe NI Manufacturing team is seeking an experienced Business Analyst, skilled in solution design.The position will be responsible for driving and defining requirements to enable scalable and maintainable solutions aligned to NI business objectives. While defining effective requirements is a key part of the position, the Business Analyst will lead all phases of projects from project initiation through implementation and post-support and will serve as a subject matter expert for tools and processes leveraged in R&D and Manufacturing. These solutions may consist of new or changed processes, people, or technologies. We are looking for someone with strong initiative, drive for results, and passion for delivering value to our internal customers. Responsibilities Include:-Develop effective Problem Statements- Assist in cost/benefit analysis and process modeling- Perform as-is and to-be analysis- Provide recommendations for process and system improvements- Negotiate Project Scope, Schedule, and Resource requirements- Implement projects using PMLC and SDLC methodologies and practices- Gather and document business, functional, and reporting requirements- Compose effective cross-team and inter-departmental communications- Prepare test cases and perform functional, acceptance, and regression testing- Document and deliver effective end user training- Define system supportability and assist in providing long-term production support- Assist with management, prioritization, troubleshooting and escalation of issuesBasic Qualifications- Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution- 5 years' experience as a Business Analyst and/or Project Manager- Project Management experience in large complex lifecycles and multiple smaller project environments- Experience communicating / presenting to middle and senior management, including executives- Willing and Able to travel up to 15", including international to NI sites in Hungary, Malaysia, etc.- The position requires occasional unconventional schedules - after hours and weekendsPreferred Qualifications- Self-starter - multi-task 2-4 projects independently and in a team environment, often in ambiguity- Excellent communication skills – both written and verbal- Solution-driven - identify/analyze problems and develop solutions- Experience with Oracle eBusiness applications preferred- Project management certifications preferred, but not required- Understanding of the full lifecycle of SDLC

Name: Developer Analyst 2 Core
Description: Developer Analyst 2 Core I. DESCRIPTION OF SERVICESThe Department of Information Resources (DIR) requires the services of one or more Developer Analysts, hereafter referred to as Worker(s), who meets the general qualifications of a Developer Analyst 2 Category, Core Technology Type and the specifications outlined in this document for the Texas Education Agency (TEA).   All work products resulting from the project shall be considered “works made for hire” and are the property of the TEA. TEA may include pre-selection requirements that potential Vendors (and their Workers) submit to and satisfy criminal background checks as authorized by the Texas law. TEA will pay no fees for interviews or discussions, which occur during the process of selecting a Worker(s). Worker(s) will be expected to perform analysis, design, development, testing and implementation of reports using Crystal Reports / SAP Business Objects. Work involves developing, maintaining, enhancing and supporting reports and stored procedures. Worker will engage closely with the program areas to participate in gathering and documenting requirements, discuss design considerations, provide programming and support services, and to coordinate testing efforts through deployment to production. Worker must be able to analyze proposed software enhancements and make recommendations that optimize performance of report generation. II. WORKER SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS Minimum Requirements: Years Skills/Experience 5 Crystal Reports 8.5/9/10/XI R2/2008 5 Crystal Enterprise 8.5/9/10 5 Oracle 8i/9i/10g 5 SQL Performance Tuning 2 Crystal Designer 2013Preferences: Years Skills/Experience SAP BOBI certification III. TERM OF SERVICEWorker will be required to work approximately 680 hours during the approximate time period from January 20, 2016 through May 30, 2016. This service may be amended, renewed, and/or extended providing both parties agree to do so in writing.  IV. WORK HOURS AND LOCATIONA. Services shall be provided during normal business hours unless otherwise coordinated through the TEA. Normal business hours are Monday through Friday from 9:00AM to 5:00PM, excluding State holidays when the agency is closed. B. The primary work location(s) will be at 1701 North Congress Avenue, Austin, Texas 78701. Any and all travel, per diem, parking, and/or living expenses shall be at the Worker’s and/or Vendor’s expense.C. TEA will provide pre-approved, written authorization for travel for any services to be performed away from the primary work location(s). Pre-approved travel expenses are limited to the rates and comply with the rules prescribed by the State of Texas for travel by its classified employees, including any requirement for original receipts. D. The Worker(s) may be required to work outside the normal business hours on weekends, evenings and holidays, as requested. Payment for work over 40 hours will be at the hourly rate quoted and must be coordinated and pre-approved through TEA.  RESPONSE DEADLINE for consideration and should be received by January 7, 2016 @ 5:00 PM (CT).

Name: IT Business Analyst SFDC and CPQ
Description: Forcepoint is transforming cybersecurity by focusing on what matters most: understanding people's intent as they interact with critical data and intellectual property wherever it resides. Our uncompromising systems enable companies to empower employees with unobstructed access to confidential data while protecting intellectual property and simplifying compliance. Based in Austin, Texas, Forcepoint supports more than 20,000 organizations worldwide. For more about Forcepoint, visit www.Forcepoint.com and follow us on Twitter at @ForcepointSec. The successful candidate will provide structure and leadership to process improvement projects as well as expertise in developing new or improved workflows. This individual must have strong verbal and written communications skills and like leading cross-functional project teams. The IT Business Analyst is also responsible for understanding the Forcepoint business and translating business needs across Sales (Direct & Indirect), Legal, and Customer Success into technical solutions, overseeing the delivery of IT services and projects, and ensuring internal business partner satisfaction. You will need to anticipate the needs of the business and to stay ahead of the curve. This role will lot of visibility and a direct impact to the future of a rapidly growing company. Are you ready? technology options, cost and constraints, and proposes alternatives to the businessTeams with business leadership, internal/external development resources and suppliers to ensure timely, accurate and cost effective delivery of IT solutionsInterfaces with the application development team to validate test results for new applications verifying that they meet the requirements of the business groupEducates business partners on how to successfully engage and work with ITWrite UAT and Test Cases Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree in the field of computer science or information systems preferred4+ experience in IT analysis, design and implementation of complex, global CRM/CPQ/CLM solutions2-3 years of administration and project management experience on the Salesforce and CPQ certifications are a plusAdvanced in Microsoft Office such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and OutlookProven history of thriving in a fast-paced environment, while dealing with ambiguitySDL2017
