Name: SAP HCM Analyst - Payroll Production
Description: Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.  Do you love thinking analytically? Are you passionate about using your financial knowledge to navigate complex challenges? Just as our customers find value in Apple products, the Global Business Solutions (GBS) group finds value for both Apple and its shareholders. As part of this group, you will play an integral role in ensuring our day-to-day financial health. You and your team will support Apple’s growth, both top and bottom line, by applying the same level of innovation toward financial matters as we do toward our products and services. You’ll also collaborate with Apple teams across the world to develop more effective investment strategies and risk management. Finance is important to upholding our global dedication to perfection, and it is directly responsible for shaping the company’s future. Join us, and you’ll play a role in continuing Apple’s legacy of efficiency and success.  Join the Apple GBS organization and make a positive impact, where you will share in a dedication to perfection by partnering with teammates, all with one unified vision—creating innovative products that delight customers. Finance is about “fueling innovation”. We do this by hiring quality individuals with integrity and personal accountability, who value collaboration and forward thinking. If you share these values and want to be part of something big, contact us today.  The GBS team is looking for a SAP HCM Analyst focused on Payroll Production.  The role is based on site in Austin, Texas.  Technical knowledge of WFM systems and processes relevant to system functionality being supported Apple Employee Systems, Kronos, ADP Global view Payroll, Payroll and relevant interfaces such as GL Postings, Stock, Benefits, Banking and other 3rd party  High level of hands on experience with the SAP Payroll module  Support complex Global Payroll systems for technical defects, enhancements or regular maintenance for Payroll Operations/Processing teams on system issues  Managing G2 (Global Gateway) Interfaces: Manual G2 creation for massive uploads and Maintain G2 configuration interface (internal and external)  Create system issues tickets as needed, hold regular calls with IS&T, ADP and business’s partner to communicate & monitor issue closure  Maintain and monitor Merlin/Kronos/TAP Tables per functional needs (i.e. new work schedules, new Jobs, new pay schedules, new Leaves, new Wage Types, etc)  Participate in cross-functional testing by creating scenarios, executing test cases, help signing-off and moving changes to production  Providing consulting in system behavior queries and configuration support as needed for Comp services  Engage with GPO in: knowledge sharing of new functionalities, warranty review sections and ER for impact/work-around, as needed  Provide input and perform complex tests for scenarios/scripts created by Compensation Service and ADP quality assurance team, as requested and needed  Review, analysis and provide professional judgment decision on Apple systems and ADP CRMs solutions and quotes  Communicate closely and independently with ADP, IS&T, People Team, Payroll Operations, Global Payroll Processing, Comp Services, and Accounting for production support resolution of process failures and improvements  Manage timely communications and critical issues to leadership regarding system and customer impacts  Take on team initiatives to drive improvement and consistency globally  Develop and contribute content for training materials and conduct user training  Participate on customer focused, continuous improvement projects that enhance our customer experience and bring value  Engage, react and find solutions under high-pressure environments  Availability to work outside business hours to support payroll processing times Responsibilities include:Experience with SAP Application, Business Intelligence (BI), and Success factors which includes Portal, Time, Payroll, Data Management, Business Warehouse, and CloudWorking with business users, payroll managers, and vendors to gather, define, and document functional requirements for SAP technical solutionsSchema, Personnel Calculation Rule (PCR), Wage Types, Garnishments, Tax Reporting, Database, and Interface inbound and outbound with SAPProviding technical strategic and tactical requirements on Apple BRDs or/and 3rd party vendor solution documentsMaster data management and data auditsDaily support of SAP HR and Finance System on monitoring, testing, and performance issuesExpertise with the SAP payroll module is requiredEducation & Experience Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Statistics, Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related field and 2 years of relevant experience.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Texas Association of Counties (TAC) is seeking a highly qualified, team member for its Business Systems Analyst position. This position is responsible to analyze and validate complex technical business analysis and support including gathering requirements, building, testing and deploying software and reporting solutions to end users. Serves as a liaison between business users and technical team members in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs. The successful candidate will translates high level organization requirements into functional technical specifications. Position is based in Austin, TX at TAC headquarters. Local candidates only, please. The Business Systems Analyst will be expected to:Interface and collaborate with business users and technical team members in the design of new programs, processes, projects and software. Conducts analysis, design, validation, testing, training and maintenance. Assist with application testing and product defect tracking. Interface with development team to assist in all aspects of requirements and testing activities. Analyze, draft, validate and finalize business and technical requirements. Participate in the coordination and monitoring of development activities. Establish test procedures and debug programs.Resolve day-to-day technology needs with a focus on the analysis of processes, dissecting problems and suggesting solutions. Reviews business processes, analyzes existing procedures and systems and makes recommendations for improvements.Work with manager to recommend change request options, business impact, process improvements and decisions involving effective implementation such as staff involvement versus consultation.Assist in the maintenance of production, development and test database systems to meet user needs and provides systems support and security for various databases. Provides end-user and system support for specified department applications and functions.Assist with training efforts of new systems implementation, including documentation, instruction and hands-on training of others.Assist in implementation of new software initiatives including evaluation of the following:Hosted on-siteand/or needing custom developmentand/or needing data conversionand/or needing integration with data in other TAC softwareResearch department data and recommend effective use of business information. Assist in the mockup and design of custom reports and dashboards for TAC platforms, currently IBM Cognos and iMIS Rise, or custom software.Create SQL code to generate queries, views or common table expression (CTE), and stored procedures for data analysis and report purposes, including testing and quality control.Responsible for translating user needs into technicalities that can be implemented as company improvements while also acting as a filter in determining what is truly needed.Understand and support TACs IT strategies. Proactively learn technology trends for emerging security threats, data analysis, integration, reporting and other information technology categories.Perform other duties as assigned.Experience / Education RequirementsBachelors degree in computer science, management information systems, mathematics or related area required.A minimum of five years experience including leading full implementation lifecycle for delivery of systems solutions (analyze, design, build, test, implement, support).A minimum of three years experience working on IT projects, business and systems analysis or quality assurance required.Experience and proficiency in insurance, government or financial industries preferred.Proficiency in use of personal computer and Microsoft Office products including: Word, Excel, and PowerPoint and SharePoint Online required.Other Skills & AbilitiesPosition requires strong technical knowledge of the following tools/software applications: SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS), SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), Visual Studio, IBM Cognos, and iMIS.Willingness to learn, be flexible, have integrity, have the ability to quickly identify solutions and deliver exceptional follow-through.Ability to identify and analyze end-user problems and develop practical technological solutions.Must function independently with minimum supervising, including researching and solving technical issues, and be able to handle multiple simultaneous projects with deadlines.Must demonstrate strong organizational, analytical and problem solving skills in evaluating situations, making recommendations and taking prompt, effective corrective action including the ability to develop and maintain detailed project plans that include milestones, tasks, and target dates of completion.Excellent time management and prioritization skills required. Must be highly organized and pay attention to detail.Must demonstrate understanding of data warehouse concepts, software quality assurance testing, and the systems development life cycle process.Position requires skill with understanding front-end applications and their associated databases associated, research, and data analysis and reporting.Position requires the ability to work independently and manage complex workload with minimal direction from management.Position must have the ability to quickly figure things out (strong analytical skills) and get things done.Position requires ability to establish strong working relationships with all teams and management.Position requires excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and the ability to relate to persons with a variety of cultural, economic and educational backgrounds. Please send cover letter, salary requirement and resume. No phone calls, please.  Job Type: Full-time  Education: Bachelor's (Required)

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst- Go-to-Market Analytics
Description: Are you excited by the prospect of using analytics to drive customer retention? Do you possess exceptional technical chops, and are passionate about telling stories with data? Do you want to work in a challenging but fun environment, in an entrepreneurial but well-resourced and supportive environment? We are looking for a super smart and passionate individual to join our Business Analytics team. As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will own the delivery of customer data insights to improve customer retention, and promote the data quality of business metrics and reporting to increase efficiency of our operations.WHAT YOU'LL DOYou will help deliver a world class customer experience by owning data requests from our customers, delivering custom insights into how they're using our product.You will use analytics to answer questions about how our customers are buying or using our product, with the goal of improving sales, product adoption, and customer retention.You will own thedata integrityof our internal BI reporting, instituting governance policies and best practices with the end goal of increasing data consumption and efficiency.You will work cross-functionally with data engineers and business stakeholders to ensure we're delivering quality insights to the business and our customer.s WHO WE'RE LOOKING FORYou're a "data ninja". You enjoy digging into the details of data models to answer questions, and you enjoy finding ways to enable people to access data to drive decisions.Your analytics skills are strong, including 2+ years of experience in an analytics role. You have significant experience with SQL or experience in a major software engineering language (Python, C++, Java) or statistical packages (Alteryx, Matlab, SAS, R). Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Looker, Domo, etc.) would be helpful.You've proven yourself as a trusted business partner. You've got excellent communication skills and can translate between technical and functional requirements. You have experience working with business stakeholders to clarify questions and prioritize asks.You've got a strong education. You have a Bachelor's in an analytical field (statistics, computer science, etc.) If you just read the above and got a chill down your spine because of how well it described you, then we definitely need to talk!

Name: Analyst
Description: Position Description:  Analyst  Can work remotely Ampler Group, a private equity funded growing set of companies offers an exciting opportunity with a fast-growing company with locations across the US. We seek a self-motivated, detail oriented, problem solver, with strong organizational skills.  As part of our aggressive growth, we are looking to add a Financial Analyst to our team. We seek candidates with a positive, motivated attitude that would love to grow with the company.  The Analyst will work with executive management:  Report on current performance (daily, weekly, monthly reports) as well as business investment decisions relating to current and future projects. Consolidate and analyze financial data (budgets, income statement forecasts, etc) considering the companys goals and financial standing. Report on changes in financial position or budget variances. Develop financial models and conduct benchmarking along with assisting in driving process improvement. Prepare reports and projections on future investment opportunities Provides top management with creative alternatives and recommendations to reduce costs and improve financial performance Responsible for cost analysis of any potential corporate events, including unplanned shut downs, various promotions, and what-if scenarios for financial projections and financial modeling. Assist in other duties and projects as assigned.Qualifications At least 2 years-experience as a Financial Analyst BS degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or related field experience High level of proficiency in excel. Experience in MS Office, and financial software Ability to prioritize and multitask, Strong organizational skills, Deadline and detail-oriented, Ability to organize and manage your own time Candidates must successfully pass a background check. Hands on experience with statistical analysis and statistical packages Restaurant industry experience preferred Proven knowledge of financial forecasting and diagnosis, corporate finance (Accounts Payable, Treasury, Payroll, CapEx), and information analysis. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Name: Data Analyst - Magento Business Intelligence
Description: Job Description Who You Are  Being a data analyst at Magento Business Intelligence is all about problem solving. If you are often driven to ask more of data, this is the perfect role for you. Interest in eCommerce and online technology is a given.  What You'll Do  Your top priority will be working with internal data sets to deliver valuable insights. You will use your academic and work experience to quickly learn the ins and outs of our software so you can help our customers understand their data and create actionable analyses that can productized. Ultimately, you are charged with making our clients love us by making their analytics accessible and understandable.  Examples of your specific responsibilities may include: Analyzing and extracting insights from large, unstructured datasetsHelping users (internal & external) understand and analyze their data effectivelyManaging client data warehouses to support analysisValidating data replication and diagnosing data discrepanciesEvangelizing analysis best-practicesImproving internal processes to maximize efficiencyCreating reusable reports and dashboards that will get bundled with the product What You Will Need  This is a demanding position where only highly-motivated, self-driven candidates will excel. Qualified candidates should have 1-2 years of relevant professional experience. All applicants must possess the following qualities: Bachelor DegreeProficiency with a database language (e.g. PostgreSQL, MongoDB)Aptitude for problem solvingStrong quantitative analysis skillsExcellent written and spoken communication skillsGood presentation skillsTrack record of learning new skills and putting them to use immediatelyHunger for continued learningSense of ownership and pride in your performance and that of the company Things That Will Impress Us Experience with eCommerce, Magento Commerce, and/or Magento BIKnowledge of Google AnalyticsExperience with data analysisCustomer-facing experience At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.  If you're looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the and explore the meaningful we offer.  Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.  Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Name: Senior Product Analyst
Description: Do you love analysis? Really love analysis? How about vacations, do you love vacations too? Want a job where you can swipe right for both analysis and vacations? If so, then HomeAway has a Senior Product Analyst role for you! The Senior Product Analyst is someone who is passionate about learning our business using data, technology and analytics to provide valuable data insights to drive the companys critical business decisions. What youll do:Day-to-Day Responsibilities include:Partner with Traveler product managers and internal teams to address complex business questions and provide insightful analysis and strategic recommendations to both technical and non-technical colleaguesBe a HomeAway data guru - be the point of contact for all data questions and insightsTurn data-based observations and insights into hypotheses through analytical rigor, leading to A/B tests that will confirm or deny those hypotheses and ultimately improve the performance of our sitesMonitor engagement and conversion trends across the HomeAway worldwide network, identify breaks in trends, understand underlying drivers, and surface opportunities and threatsDevelop self-service reporting for product and development teams, by collecting and integrating data from various sources, including web analytics tools and internal databasesParticipate in Product Line Team weekly meeting to ensure insight-based decision-makingWho you are:Dedicated in solving business questions that data could potentially answer by producing top down data driven solutions to address themStrong product development mindset and focus on actionable analytics: e.g. Ability to surface signals in our data and work with Product/Engineering to transform these into concrete testsProven experience of using relational databases and big data via writing performant queries in SQL against multi-terabyte and billion row datasets in EDW, AWS and Hadoop environmentsUnderstanding of Clickstream data and ability to extract and analyze event dataInnovative, global thinker & great teammateStrong SQL skills are required (MSSL, BQ, Hive)Strong skills in Tableau, R, Python required for data analysis, structuring, transforming and visualizingStatistical knowledge and modeling is an added bonusBackground and Experience:  Bachelor's in an analytical field (e.g. Marketing Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics) and 5+ years of experience OR Masters in an analytical field and 3+ years of experience Ability to work independently with high-level direction, willingness to engage with partners across many disciplines Proficient at analyzing and interpreting data and being open to mentor other analysts from other internal teams Consistent ability to produce quality, accurate and highly detailed work products Experience in a relevant area travel, ecommerce, or real estate is a strong plus. Inquisitive and curious minds only need to applyBenefits & Perks:Competitive health and insurance benefits.Competitive salary.Annual target bonus or commission.Parental leave for up to 20 weeks (dependent on eligibility).Paid vacation and sick time.Employee Stock Purchase Program.Free snacks and beverages.Frequent company update talks with our leadership team.Free listing on HomeAway.com.Electronic, adjustable stand-up desk.Discounted Metro & Rail pass.Casual dress.Why join us: Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them to tools to do so.  Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.  Our family of travel brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Egencia®, trivago®, HomeAway®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Wotif®, lastminute.com.au®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Hotwire®, Classic Vacations®, Expedia® Media Solutions, CarRentals.com, Expedia Local Expert®, Expedia® CruiseShipCenters®, SilverRail Technologies, Inc., ALICE and Traveldoo®. About HomeAway:HomeAway, a world leader in the vacation rental industry, is the place to book beach houses, cabins, and condos with more than two million places to stay in 190 countries. The site makes it easy to find and book the perfect vacation rental for any getaway, often for less than the cost of traditional hotel accommodations. HomeAway is part of the Expedia Group family of brands.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst - Go-to-Market
Description: Are you excited by the prospect of using analytics to drive business growth and customer retention? Do you possess exceptional business smarts, and are passionate about Big Data? Do you want to work in a challenging but fun environment, in an entrepreneurial but well-resourced and supportive environment? We are looking for a super smart and passionate individual to join our Business Analytics team. In this role, you will own the relationship with senior leaders across Sales / Customer Success, driving analytical insight into business recommendations and actions.WHAT YOU'LL DOYou will use analytics to drive business decisions, with the goal of increasing sales, increasing win rates, improving product adoption, and strengthening customer retention.You will test your recommendations in a hypothesis-driven, data-tested manner. This includes 1) performing analytical deep-dives to identify problems, opportunities and actions required; 2) leveraging large amounts of disparate data sources by using SQL or other scripting and statistical tools, and 3) designing and managing test/pilot programs.You will report against your initiatives by identifying key metrics and building executive-facing dashboards to track business progress and assess core initiatives.You will serve as the thought partner for senior executives to translate insights into actions and business priorities. WHO WE'RE LOOKING FORYou're a "business thought partner", not just a "data monkey". Your analytical kung fu is strong, but what you really enjoy is finding ways to improve the business. It just so happens that you use data analytics as the tool to prove that your suggestions are the right ones.Your analytics skills are strong, including 2+ years of experience in an analytics role. You have significant experience with SQL or experience in a major software engineering language (Python, C++, Java) or statistical packages (Alteryx, Matlab, SAS, R). Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Looker, Domo, etc.) would be helpful.Your business judgment is strong. You've got work experience in Sales or Customer Success, and you've got the ability to take ambiguous business problems and solve them in a structured, hypothesis-driven, data-supported way.You've proven yourself as a trusted business partner. You've got exceptional business and communication skills. Strategy consulting experience or other client-facing professional services experience is a strong plus.You've got a strong education. You have a Bachelor's in an analytical field (statistics, computer science, MIS, economics, etc.). If you just read the above and got a chill down your spine because of how well it described you, then we definitely need to talk!

Name: Business Analyst (Software Quality Assurance)
Description: Note to applicants: Resumes are required as part of your application. When applying from a mobile device or tablet, you may not be able to attach a resume. If you cannot attach a resume at the time of your application, you will receive a follow up email asking you to attach your resume from a computer. Job Description: The Client Systems team delivers technology driven solutions to support the Institutional Sales, Financial Advisor Services, and Marketing departments at Dimensional. This position will interface with internal business customers and stakeholders on quality assurance and software testing efforts for digital transformation initiatives. Work will include all aspects the software testing lifecycle such as requirements analysis, test planning, functional and non-functional test case development, test execution and defect management. This position will have the ability to propose improvements to our existing processes and software testing tools to improve the team's speed, quality and efficiency. This position will have a significant impact in the quality and delivery speed of our digital initiatives, our business, and most importantly our clients. The successful candidate will be hands-on with a strong background in full software product lifecycle implementations. ResponsibilitiesConduct requirements and user story analysis to determine the right approach for software testing of a given digital productOwn the authoring, management and execution of functional and non-functional test casesCollaborate closely with product owners, developers, and other QA staff to ensure the products we deliver to our clients are of utmost qualityExecute test cycles such as System and Integration testing (SIT) and Regression testingSupport the business with test planning and execution of User Acceptance testing (UAT) and ensure what is delivered to our clients is of the utmost qualityPeriodically report on QA efforts to management with an emphasis on identifying and utilizing optimal metrics to measure product qualityWork closely with developers on instrumentation of the software development workflow in Jira to build a comprehensive picture of velocity, test coverage and code quality.Provide production support for certain products in the application portfolio.Minimum QualificationsBachelor's degree in a technical field requiredAt least 5 years of hand-on software testing experience on teams delivering software productsKnowledge of software testing methodologies and strategies to influence better software design, promote strong engineering practice, bug prevention strategies, accessibility, testability, privacy, and other quality conceptsExperience with collaboration and testing tools such as Confluence, Jira, Adaptivist, FitNesse, Selenium, Lighthouse etc.Strong understanding of Agile software development practices and ceremoniesAbility to work effectively in a fast-paced environment with minimal oversightDetail oriented with a proven ability to self-motivate and follow-through on tasksStrong problem solving, analysis and communication skills, both verbal and written. It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. The Company does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, ancestry, medical condition, marital status, covered veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, or any other protected status. This policy applies to all areas of employment including recruitment, hiring, training, job assignment, promotion, compensation, benefits, transfer, discipline, termination, and social and recreational programs.SDL2017

Name: Sales Operations Analyst - Dev Tools
Description: Job DescriptionIDERAs developer tools business is looking for an experienced sales operations analyst to support a global, diverse sales team. This role will interact with other many other teams include marketing, finance, and business systems and requires excellent communication skills, strong follow-up skills and outstanding problem solving and analytical skills. This role will strive to elevate data quality and structure in order to leverage metrics and KPIs on sales performance and trends to meet business goals. RESPONSIBILITIESMonitor Salesforce.com data quality to maintain the highest class possibleProactively evaluate Salesforce.com processes and data by offering recommendations to improve as well as implementing solutionsSupport weekly, monthly, quarterly and ad hoc sales, marketing and customer analytics to support strategic changeMaintain territory assignments, incentive plans, and quotasLead integration efforts on recent and future acquisitionsQUALIFICATIONSBachelors requiredExperience in sales operationsExpert-level Excel skillsExperience working with a wide variety of Salesforce.com functionality including workflows, custom fields and data loaderStrong technical aptitude and analytical skillsAbility to prioritize multiple tasks and manage against deadlines An Equal Opportunity Employer - Females, Minorities, Veterans, Disabled and Other Protected Groups  Idera, Inc and it's subsidiaries are committed to respecting and protecting the privacy of its customers, job applicants, partners and website visitors. Name: Merchandising Analyst Intern
Description: What is SpreetailSpreetail is an ecommerce company that currently operates VMInnovations, a multi-marketplace retailer that sells thousands of awesome products through major marketplaces like Amazon, eBay, and Walmart. Spreetail is currently in the middle of building something big, new, and exciting due to launch in 2019 with a simple mission: to make customers lives better through exceptionally fast service, great products, and community impact.Originally from Lincoln, Nebraska, Spreetail has recently expanded into two new offices based in Omaha, NE and Austin, TX with rapidly growing teams. We currently have hundreds of employees across the company, and are searching for crazy smart, talented, visionary people.Who is a SpreetailerSpreetailers are collaborative go-getters who say bring it on when faced with a challenge. We build technology, run warehouses, market products, recruit top-notch talent, and create original community-focused programs that make a real-world impact. No day is the same and we thrive in a dynamic, innovative environment. We aren't part of your typical company and we're proud of that.Our culture is based on opportunity, openness, relationship building, and hard work. We believe this is what makes everyone happy and fulfilled with their positions in the long run. These internships will run from mid-May to mid-August 2019, ending with our annual company trip. Spreetail is building a merchandising analyst team. As an analyst intern, you will have the opportunity to focus on pricing, inventory or business intelligence. We are data-driven, and all of our decisions need to have numbers that help support that decision. The analyst team helps provide those insights by manipulating complex data and providing insights. As a merchandising analyst intern, you are analytical, insightful, and love using large sets of data. You are willing and able to learn, meticulous and can convey complex ideas to all knowledge levels. You work well with ambiguity and can solve complex problems using data. As a merchandising analyst intern, you will work with very large data sets and use them to solve complex problems that the company is facing. You will convey complex ideas to all knowledge levels. It is your job to find solutions to problems using data and then provide your recommendation in a way that is concise and easy to understand. You will discover and resolve inefficiencies and develop systems to improve processes. You should have: Ability to utilize and manipulate large data sets in Microsoft Excel Some SQL background Understand PowerPivot Mastery of data analysis steps Creative thinking and problem solving Spreetail isnt just a job or career, its a lifestyle that isnt for the faint of heart. Expect to put in the necessary hours each week to get the job done and break out of your comfort zone to tackle problems and pursue innovative solutions. If youre looking for a challenge and a career you can grow with, Spreetail is the opportunity youve been waiting for.We'll reward you with: Competitive hourly pay and time and a half for anything over 40 hours Leadership training and development support Opportunity to own projects from start to finish - including a community initiatives project Invitation to the annual company trip, with flight and hotel stay paid for by SpreetailEqual Opportunity EmployerSpreetail is an equal opportunity employer that hires based on stellar qualifications, positive attitude, and exemplary work ethic rather than factors like age, gender, race, nationality, religion, or sexuality.

Name: Principal Business Analyst - Assortment & Space Planning
Description: Job DescriptionWhole Foods Market has embarked on a transformational Supply Chain & Merchandising initiative with Infor Retail that will deliver market leading capabilities to Whole Foods Market and 365 by Whole Foods Market. This position will leverage their business and process experience, combined with technology and project delivery savviness to represent both program and business priorities. This role will provide dedicated business representation to the program to ensure iterative and rapid decision making with our strategic software and system implementation partners. The Assortment & Space Planning Principal Business Analyst is the person who owns the pricing technology products on behalf of the company. The individual is responsible for the success of the products and is empowered to make necessary decisions. The Assortment & Space Planning Principal Business Analyst understands the user and customer needs and the business goals, and collaborates with the development team and stakeholders.In early development lifecycle stages, when the product is developed and introduced to the WFM ecosystem, the principal business analyst should act as an intrapreneur and an entrepreneur within the enterprise. As the product matures, the entrepreneurial aspect of the business capability lead work lessens and a focus on maximizing return on investment (ROI) is usually required. The Assortment & Space Planning Principal Business Analyst is critical to the success of the assortment & space planning technologies and the business teams that leverage them.The principal business analyst role is a multi-faceted job that requires a broad range of skills. But it provides the exciting opportunity to develop new products and features that benefit the users across the organization.Responsibilities:People:Understand the needs of business and technology users and customers.Collaborate with Whole Foods Market and third-party development teams.Manage relationships with varied business and technology stakeholders.Lead Assortment & Space Planning Business Analyst(s).Strategy:Develop the Assortment & Space Planning business capability and technology product roadmap.Document the user experience and product features.Define future state Assortment & Space Planning business processes.Partner with other Business Capability Leads on project to create an integrated product strategy roadmap across functional areas.Delivery:Write detailed User Stories and acceptance criteria.Manage the functional scope of a given Program phase and represent the scope to dependent phases.Validate user stories created by product development team(s) and trace stories through project lifecycle (i.e. design/build/test/deploy).Prioritize stories and work items for product development team(s).Create detailed business process(es).Manage stakeholder expectations throughout project lifecycle.Support of all functional activities, such as testing, training, deployment.Partner with Enterprise and Solution Architecture and application design teams to ensure product user stories are represented in solution documentation.QualificationsTen or more years of related experience preferred.Five or more years of experience with defining user stories, business processes, strategic plans, roadmaps, or communication plans preferred.Five or more years implementing or using a retail merchandising ERP or supply chain ERP preferred.Extensive experience with Price Management. Alternatively, functional experience with programs/projects related to at least two of the following capability areas:Item ManagementProduct Life-cycle ManagementRecipe ManagementNutri-facts & Ingredient ManagementItem, Supplier, & Logistics Cost ManagementRetail Purchasing & OrderingInventory Management & ControlRetail Financial ManagementCategory & Assortment/Space ManagementRetail Sales Audit & Invoice MatchingPrice ManagementAllocation & ReplenishmentTrade ManagementMaster Data ManagementExperience within the grocery business area a plus.Experience working with projects or programs that involved Infor or other cloud-based software-as-a-service solutions a plus.Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work across business lines at senior levels to influence and effect change to achieve common goals.Empathy for and identification with the leaders and employees in the organization affected by changes in the digital workplace.Strategic technology planning experience -- experience in strategic technology planning and execution, as well as policy development and maintenance.Ability to effectively drive people, process and technology change in a dynamic and complex operating environment.Fearless — not afraid to suggest or back big ideas. Tenacious — able to push back and focus the discovery process.Excellent oral and written communication skills. This includes the ability to explain digital concepts and technologies to business leaders, as well as business concepts to technologists, and the ability to sell ideas and processes internally at all levels.Proven record of effective leadership. This includes the ability to balance team and individual responsibilities by building teams and consensus, and getting things done through others not directly under the leader's supervision by working ethically and with integrity.Location & TravelLocated in Austin, TX with up to 25% time spent traveling between Austin, Minneapolis, regional offices and/or store locations. At Whole Foods Market we provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all team members and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. Name: COST ECONOMIC ANALYST
Description: Videos  Duties  Help Help Duties Summary About the Position: This is a career ladder position which at the full performance will be responsible for review and coordination of Research, Development, Test, and Evaluation (RDTE) resources; tracks spending and monitors and evaluates programs; and developing analytical tools and methods to identify current and future trends with the end result been reports and presentations to AFC command and staff for investments and acquisition of AFC programs. Learn more about this agency  Responsibilities Provides authoritative review and guidance on methodologies used ensuring compliance with established criteria, sound principles, and standard practice of system modeling databases for the analysis of AFC budget.Evaluates resources to formulate and provide justifications for AFC?s recommended areas of investments in science and technology through analysis of current modeling procedures and problem-solving skills.Designs and develops analytical models and forecasting tools to assist Army appropriation sponsors in tracking financial trends and developing accurate budget plans.Researches, gathers, and interprets data of state-of-the-art technologies across academia, industry and other Government agencies to provide recommendations of Army-niche areas. Travel Required Occasional travel - You may be expected to travel for this position. Supervisory status  No  Promotion Potential  13  Job family (Series)  1501 General Mathematics And Statistics  Requirements  Help Help Requirements Conditions of Employment Appointment may be subject to a suitability or fitness determination, as determined by a completed background investigation.Secret ClearanceBusiness travel (TDY) may be required up to 10% of the time.May be subject to a two year probationary period. Qualifications Who May Apply: Only applicants who meet one of the employment authority categories below are eligible to apply for this job. You will be asked to identify which category or categories you meet, and to provide documents which prove you meet the category or categories you selected. See Proof of Eligibility for an extensive list of document requirements for all employment authorities.Interagency Career Transition Assistance Plan In order to qualify, you must meet the education and/or experience requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application. Additional information about transcripts is in this document. Basic Requirement for Cost Economic Analyst: A. Degree: Bachelor's degree (or higher degree) in mathematics, statistics, or actuarial science. The degree must be in a major field of study (at least at the baccalaureate level) that is appropriate for the position. OR B. Combination of Education and Experience: Courses equivalent to a major field of study as shown in paragraph A above, plus additional education or appropriate experience. In addition to meeting the basic requirement above, to qualify for this position you must also meet the qualification requirements listed below: Specialized Experience: One year of specialized experience which includes 1) Applying basic analytics and problem-solving techniques; 2) applying statistics to interpret financial and programmatic data; and 3) developing basic mathematical algorithms. This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the second lower grade/level position in the federal service (GS-07). OR Education: Master's or equivalent graduate degree or 2 full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to such a degree in a field which demonstrates the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to do the work of the position, such as: [insert applicable field(s) of study]. OR Combination of Education and Experience: A combination of education and experience may be used to qualify for this position as long as the computed percentage of the requirements is at least 100%. To compute the percentage of the requirements, divide your total months of experience by 12. Then divide the total number of completed graduate semester hours (or equivalent) beyond the first year (total graduate semester hours minus 18) by 18. Add the two percentages. You will be evaluated on the basis of your level of competency in the following areas: Time in Grade Requirement: Applicants who have held a General Schedule (GS) position within the last 52 weeks must have 52 weeks of Federal service at the next lower grade or equivalent (GS-07). Education FOREIGN EDUCATION: If you are using education completed in foreign colleges or universities to meet the qualification requirements, you must show the education credentials have been evaluated by a private organization that specializes in interpretation of foreign education programs and such education has been deemed equivalent to that gained in an accredited U.S. education program; or full credit has been given for the courses at a U.S. accredited college or university. For further information, visit: http://www.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ous/international/usnei/us/edlite-visitus-forrecog.html. Once the announcement has closed, a review of your application package (resume, supporting documents, and responses to the questionnaire) will be used to determine whether you meet the qualification requirements listed on this announcement. If you are minimally qualified, your résumé and supporting documentation will be compared against your responses to the assessment questionnaire to determine your level of experience. If, after reviewing your résumé and/or supporting documentation, a determination is made that you have inflated your qualifications and/or experience, you may lose consideration for this position. Name: HR Business Analyst Workday UK and Canada Payroll
Description: The Workday Systems Analyst - Payroll is responsible for the becoming an expert in configuration, testing, documentation, and audits related to one or more HR modules in Workday. With minimal supervision, the analyst must be able to perform detailed, analytical and technical tasks. This position will focus primarily on Payroll for US, UK and Canada.Responsibilities: Assist the exploration, evaluation, recommendation, and design of new features and functionalities with WorkdayAssist in performing fit and gap analysis on Workday processes and upcoming new features / functionality that impact international Payroll and suggest enhancements and present proposals to leadership.Be a key SME to provide input to determine the right technology solution to meet the strategic Business Initiatives. As you define the technology, be responsible for delivering the Feature Roadmap adoption to the Business PartnersWork closely with the Workday Payroll lead to support and understand new functionality and features within Workday, participating in user acceptance testing during system upgrades and deploymentsProvide operational and project support to lead analystsDevelop and enhance working knowledge through training, independent research and experimentation to become a subject matter expert (SME) for at least one distinct business process and applicationProactively find inefficiencies in processes and suggest enhancements and present proposals to leadershipIdentify change management issues as they pertain to process improvement and proactively address themSupport in leading projects as defined by leadership, which includes leading meetings, providing regular project updates, and adhering to project deadlinesDevelop, manage, and maintain positive relationships with vendors and consultants to address support and project activitiesMaintain strict confidentiality of employee information Requirements 2+ years of Workday Payroll experience2+ years of experience in project management, project scheduling, quality assurance testing, preparing documentation and specifications, and technical writingUnderstanding of Payroll, Tax and Settlement Banking operations including Payroll process requirements,Understanding of UK, US, and Canadian Court Order process, tax forms and termination processWorkday report writing, and dashboards are preferredAmazing communication skills and ability to collaborate with teamsExperience in working in an Agile environmentProblem identification, analysis and solving skillsProficiency in making decisions by consistently proposing quality solutions and answers to issues by gathering extensive data, conducting research and presenting a recommended solution to all parties involvedAbility to quickly react and adapt to changing prioritiesAbility to translate the technical requirements to business needs and vice versaKnowledge of Microsoft Excel, including how to use Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, and other functions necessary to conduct ad-hoc data auditsBachelors degree in Business, Information Systems or a related area preferred At Whole Foods Market we provide a fair and equal employment opportunity Name: Sr. Tolls Business Analyst - System Operations Focus
Description: SNC-Lavalin’s Atkins business is one of the world’s most respected design, engineering and project management consultancies. SNC-Lavalin’s Atkins business has been providing infrastructure planning, engineering, construction, environmental consulting, urban planning, architecture, and program management services to public and private clients across the United States for more than 50 years.  SNC-Lavalin’s Atkins business was ranked as the world’s 3rd largest global design firm by ENR in 2018 with nearly 55,000 employees worldwide. We have the depth and breadth of expertise to respond to the most technically challenging and time-critical infrastructure projects and the urgent transition to a low-carbon economy.  SNC-Lavalin Business seeks an energetic and highly motivated self-starter to join our team in Austin, TX as a Senior Tolls Business Analyst -System Operations Focus supporting the Texas Department of Transportation (TxDOT).  The ideal candidate will have a background in business and/or revenue collection operations management as a business analyst, systems manager or financial manager/analyst.MAJOR FUNCTION/ROLEUnder supervision, applies business and system operations knowledge to the investigation of transportation financial planning and operational needs and problems, coordination of Toll project activities, and the preparation of reports and documentation. Carries out job functions within small, project-oriented, multidisciplinary teams of toll professionals and supports direct interaction with clients within the context of project meetings, financial reviews, operations- and system-related activities, and project production and delivery. Major results expected include high-quality written, verbal and graphical deliverables in the form of technical reports, progress reports and other related documentation.JOB DUTIESApplies system knowledge and operational principles to solve specific toll-related problems.Assists in the design and development of toll system / operational concepts and analyses, including requirements analysis, as well as communication of concepts.Researches feasibility of alternative approaches, other toll implementations and cost analyses.Writes reports, participates in presentations, discusses concepts and deliverables with clients, and participates in quality-control checks.Facilitates activities between client and other vendors, including software/system vendors and operations vendors.Coordinates with various departments within the organization (both client and consultant staff) to implement approved recommendations, ensuring that all parties understand the proposed solution, document requirements accurately and execute the implementation plan in a timely manner.Monitors operational and software systems, providing feedback to client and vendors on the result of changes to business processes or software systems.Analyzes information that is generated from the roadside (toll equipment) and back office system (BOS) to troubleshoot issues.Analyzes business rules and procedures (roadside and back office) to optimize revenue collection and/or minimize negative customer impacts.Proposes solutions, quantify expected results and present recommendations to the client's senior management team.Analyzes solutions provided by client or other vendors, providing thoughtful analysis and recommendations.Prepares and maintains appropriate documentation for project analyses.Compiles data and prepares progress reports.Performs such assignments and duties as the Supervisor may deem necessary from time to time.EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCEB.S. degree in Business, Information Technology or another subject related to Toll Revenue Collection Business Operations / Systems (incl. Back Office and/or Customer Service Center), such as Accounting, Finance, Computer Science, or Engineering. Toll-related Master's degree / MBA can substitute for one year of experience.This level may be achieved by candidates with four (4) years’ experience since Bachelor's or three (3) years since toll-related Master's/MBA. Relevant work experience would provide exposure to toll revenue collection operations, including toll collection systems and sub-systems, electronic payment, or information and communication technologies.Without a degree, a minimum of ten (10) years of relevant experience required.SPECIAL SKILLSPosition requires strong analytical ability, organizational skills, and technical troubleshooting skills.Strong technical writing and communication skills essential, including ability to present concepts verbally.Strong personal computer skills and proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office products, including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Access is required. SQL skills are preferred.Position requires ability to deal effectively and harmoniously with people at all levels of the organization and to represent the firm professionally. Good interpersonal skills are essential to interact effectively.PROFESSIONAL REGISTRATIONSNone required Atkins offers its employees a robust rewards package which includes: a competitive salary; a broad benefits package including medical/RX, dental, vision, life, disability, legal, hospitalization and other valuable voluntary options; generous time-off programs; flexible work schedules; 401(k) with employer match; professional and career development opportunities through our corporate university, as well as a highly-regarded tuition reimbursement program; and an unmatched culture focused on client-service, quality, and tireless pursuit of excellence in all we do. Atkins is an equal opportunity, drug-free employer committed to diversity in the workplace. EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability.  Please view Atkins Equal Opportunity Statement here:http://careers.atkinsglobal.com/File.ashx?path=Root/Documents/north-america-welcome-new-employee/Equal_Opp_Stmt.pdf

Name: Business Intelligence Manager
Description: What is SpreetailSpreetail is an ecommerce company that currently operates VMInnovations, a multi-marketplace retailer that sells thousands of awesome products through major marketplaces like Amazon, eBay, and Walmart. Spreetail is currently in the middle of building something big, new, and exciting due to launch in 2019 with a simple mission: to make customers lives better through exceptionally fast service, great products, and community impact.Originally from Lincoln, Nebraska, Spreetail has recently expanded into two new offices based in Omaha, NE and Austin, TX with rapidly growing teams. We currently have hundreds of employees across the company, and are searching for crazy smart, talented, visionary people.Who is a SpreetailerSpreetailers are collaborative go-getters who say bring it on when faced with a challenge. We build technology, run warehouses, market products, recruit top-notch talent, and create original community-focused programs that make a real-world impact. No day is the same and we thrive in a dynamic, innovative environment. We aren't part of your typical company and we're proud of that.Our culture is based on opportunity, openness, relationship building, and hard work. We believe this is what makes everyone happy and fulfilled with their positions in the long run. As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will:Ensure pricing strategies are being designed, implemented, and improved. Formulate/test new pricing strategies to help drive revenue/increase profitability.Day to Day Management of pricingAnalyze and proactively act on current market trends and future market opportunitiesDemonstrates ability to creatively design and facilitate the building of critical department tools, that are simple and efficient, and designed to scale into the future.Willing to meet time demands of the position to ensure we are staying ahead of our competitionStrategizes with AM/Marketplace team to ensure we our prices our inline to maximize profitability and minimize inventory position.Successful implementation of new pricing strategies. Including idea origination, implementation of the design, and executing the improvementPartner with Software to improve our time to act on pricing changes, determine automation programs and work with software to implement those changes. Perform financial evaluation to assess pricing actions effectiveness.Define new business procedures, evaluate resource requirements and stimulate implementation or maintenance of pricing system.Analyze financial impact of price approach in view of overall history as well as profitability of customer.Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies. We look forward to learning more about your experience with:Strong Microsoft Excel SkillsPower BI or TableauSQL, Oracle, MySQLWe believe in making employees lives easier with benefits that enhance their quality of life. To reward your hard work and dedication, Spreetail offers:Generous Vacation Time. Hourly team members enjoy 20 days of PTO each year and salaried employees are granted untracked PTO.Health Insurance. Spreetail pays your full monthly premium.Home Owner Bonus. After 2 years, Spreetail supports your purchase of a home with a $5k bonus.Company Trips. Each time we hit our goals, we fly to a new destination.3 Year Island Getaway. You and a guest get a 5-star beach vacation.5 Year Sabbatical. Take 10 days off to reward your time in the office.Donation Match. We match you dollar-for-dollar up to $250/year, and up to $1,000/year after 5 years.Stock Appreciation Rights. As Spreetail grows, so does your bank account.Leadership Development. We invest in making you a stronger team member.Equal Opportunity EmployerSpreetail is an equal opportunity employer that hires based on stellar qualifications, positive attitude, and exemplary work ethic rather than factors like age, gender, race, nationality, religion, or sexuality.

Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst - Data Quality
Description: Description:Austin - TX, AUS1, 2309 Gracy Farms Lane, 78758  Jeanie Lynn Bannon  20180829-5592 We believe that, when done right, investing liberates people to create their own destiny. We are driven by our purpose to champion every clients goals with passion and integrity. We respect and appreciate the diversity of our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve. We challenge conventions strategically to create value for our clients, our firm and the world. We live and bring to life the concept of own your tomorrow every day. We champion our employee strengths, guide their development, and invest in their long-term success. We hire optimistic, results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people with the desire to help our clients and one another succeed.  As a company, we were established by Chuck over 40 years ago to champion Main Street over Wall Street, and to help Americans transform themselves from earners to owners. Through advocacy and innovation, we work to make investing more affordable, accessible and understandable for all. As we enter our fifth decade, we are looking for talented, innovative and driven people who believe they can help themselves, and our clients, create a better future. Our Opportunity: The Schwab organization is looking for an experienced and highly motivated Senior Business Systems Analyst with extensive experience gathering, documenting and maintaining data quality requirements. The role will be an integral part of the Data Quality team within Schwabs Data Management Technology department which is responsible for the delivery of data quality tools and services. She or he will act as the lead business systems analyst supporting the delivery of our growing suite of data quality tools available for enterprise use. The Senior Business Systems Analyst will define and maintain requirements that adhere to the defined data quality management standards, upholding the defined data quality service model developed in partnership with Global Data Solutions Data Governance Office standards. The selected candidate will establish and sustain solid relationships with key partners in the organization, partner with development team members to deliver data quality projects and act as a mentor to other business systems analysts. The Data Quality Senior Business Systems Analyst will report to the Data Quality Senior Manager as part of Global Data Technology - Data Management Technology Team. What youll do:Maintain an in-depth knowledge of Schwabs data quality servicesLead efforts to gather business and functional requirements leading to the delivery of data quality services.Create/maintain requirements documentation and communication artifacts throughout the SDLC.Represent the data quality team as a liaison to key business and technology partners to ensure their data quality needs are met.Serve as a thought leader to influence Schwab data quality standards.What you have:8+ years of experience delivering technology solutions5+ years of experience gathering and documenting business/functional requirements3+ years of experience in a data quality technology environmentProven track record of being an integral team member of large, cross-division or enterprise Name: Senior Data Analyst
Description: ABOUT SOCIALWITHIN Based in Austin, SocialWithin is helping build some of the best e-commerce brands in the world. Our mission is to create more value for others. Our core values inspire us to over-deliver on expectations and to create more success for the partners we serve. Join our team of smart, passionate, collaborative, results-driven do-ers. We work hard every day to deliver remarkable experiences to our clients, and ultimately, their customers. WHO YOU ARE In short, you have unparalleled analytical skills, ability to own our data operations and passion for solving complex problems.  If you have hands-on experience in data extraction, dashboard creation, data analysis with some marketing mix modeling, multi-touch attribution and full funnel reporting, then we want to hear from you! WHAT YOU'LL DO As a Senior Data Analyst, you will oversee our reporting operations, data infrastructure, processes, tools and act as a connective tissue for client strategy and the performance our Account Management team drives. The desired outcome is to minimize reporting downtime for real-time insights and maximize customer happiness, team happiness, and operational efficiency.  You will drive cross-functional initiatives across Account Management, Performance Marketing and the client side to ensure our reporting and analysis is not only data-driven, but data-informed.  The successful candidate will combine a passion for innovative analysis with attention to detail and a tenacity to overcome difficult and complex analytical challenges. Ideally, this person has worked in a similar role (operations, support, analytics), and will feel comfortable interacting with other stakeholders and senior management on a regular basis. RESPONSIBILITIES Own our data infrastructure and use Supermetrics and Google Spreadsheets to ensure uptime on all client reporting Bring new and innovative ideas to the table to help us become the best in the world at sharing insights with our clients; source new business intelligence tools like Tableau, Looker, Periscope, etc. Develop dashboards, spreadsheets and visualizations for all clients Work cross-functionally with Account Management team and client side to bridge reporting gaps and drive meaningful insights Spearhead campaign reporting and tracking - working closely with Account Managers and Account Directors to ensure reporting reflects client strategy efforts Participate in client discussions, recommend custom analytical solutions, develop compelling analyses and present findings. Collaborate with internal and external client teams to create innovative, data-driven analyses using BI tools. Use Tableau and other tools to create data visualizations that allow us to tell interesting stories Create, modify, and assemble Tableau reports to satisfy evolving data requirements, with a focus on measuring marketing campaigns Performing ad-hoc statistical analysis (logistic regression, IV regression and quasi-experimental methods, and difference-of-means testing)QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree required, with major in analytical or technical field strongly preferred 4+ years of analytical experience, ideally in product / BI analytics, business operations (Customer Success specifically is a plus), or consulting Creative problem-solving skills and a can-do attitude to overcome any obstacle and get things done Willingness to take on big challenges and own the results from brainstorming solutions to execution Strong communication skills and ability to work collaboratively across functions including product, client services and engineering Posses a track record of delivering zero-defect models and have the ability to catch and correct errors Strong familiarity with Tableau (Plus but not mandatory) Expertise in marketing attribution modeling & measurement, across multiple channelsPERKS AND BENEFITS Incredible company culture - our team looks forward to Monday mornings vs. Friday evenings. Free lunches catered daily Performance bonus available every half if you hit goals and exceed expectations Health benefits100% company paid medical, dental and vision coverage Great career growth opportunityyoull have direct access to agency leadership Awesome office space near downtown Austin thats stocked with snacks and munchies Taco Tuesdays, free barista coffee (daily), company off-sites and industry conferences Free products (and discounts) from premier clients Complimentary 24-hour gym membershipPLEASENOTE: as a company, we take hiring very seriously. Interviewing with SocialWithin may include phone/video interviews, written projects, and/or on-site interviews. Although we are unable to follow-up with each and every applicant, we do our best to run a thorough process for candidates with whom we identify a potential fit.

Name: Systems Analyst IV
Company: Texas Health and Human Services Commission
Description: Posting Type: Open to All ApplicantsCategory:FLSA Exempt/  Non-Exempt: ExemptAgency: Health & Human Services Comm Department: Claims Management (50/50)Job Title: Systems Analyst IV Posting Number: 401973Full Time/Part Time : Full Time Regular/Temporary: RegularJob Location: 701 W 51ST ST City: AUSTINContact: AccessHR Service Center Telephone: 888-894-4747Salary Range: $4,301.16 - $7,039.91 Salary Group: B22Shift: Days (First) Travel: 5%Closing Date: 12/13/2018Job Description: Systems Analyst IV  Performs business analysis and research for the Electronic Visit Verification (EVV) section of the Claims Management Division (CMD). Researches and analyzes data within State Medicaid Claims Administrator Contractor (TMHP) Medicaid Management Information System (MMIS) to identify and resolve issues impacting EVV. Coordinates and performs user acceptance testing for EVV and TMHP prior to completion and implementation of projects involving EVV. Provides operations and support for EVV – monitoring the TMHP system and troubleshooting issues, defects, and enhancements, providing technical EVV support and communicating business needs/issues to management and TMHP. Oversees EVV projects and works with EVV business analysts in monitoring TMHP EVV related technical issues. Liaisons with EVV staff on automation changes that may impact their business activities.Essential Job Functions: Analysis and Research - Performs advanced business analysis and research for the EVV section of CMD. Researches and analyzes data within MMIS to identify and resolve issues that impact EVV. Researches and analyzes business requirements, business plans, or initiatives for enhancements and modifications for MMIS systems impacting EVV. Determines, develops, and documents business requirements, timelines, and scope for enhancements and modifications for projects that affect EVV. (30%).  Business User Acceptance Testing - Coordinates and performs user acceptance testing within EVV MMIS systems prior to completion and implementation of projects impacting EVV. Coordinates the development of business scenarios that test changes made to automated systems. Monitors the incorporation of system changes into the applications to be tested in the test environment and the testing of those changes to ensure that business requirements have been met. Monitors business end user testing and reviews feedback from users and results to ensure required system modifications meet business requirements. Tracks progress and status of testing and communicates risks and issues to management. (20%)  Operations and Production Support - Coordinates with other business analysts to perform the daily operational business activities of monitoring the EVV systems, troubleshooting, and solving problems related to EVV. Researches and analyzes EVV issues, identities the root cause, and engages the necessary resources to resolve the issues. Communicates to TMHP the business needs and issues from EVV and CMD staff; and provides technical EVV support assistance to EVV and program staff. Provides technical assistance to EVV and other HHSC program staff. (25%)  Project Management/Assignments – Oversees EVV technical projects and leads business analysts on assigned projects. Coordinates with EVV programs and TMHP to determine priorities of project tasks, activities required to complete tasks, resource allocation for tasks, and critical impact on end uses through risk analysis. Plans scope, develops benchmarks/timelines, consolidates business user requirements, and manages communications across CMD and HHSC Programs. Manages and completes all aspects of projects and/or assigned tasks according to schedules and project work plans. (15%)  Liaison - Acts as a liaison between CMD and program staff, HHSC IT, and TMHP to facilitate the analysis and determination of business needs and requirements for enhancements and modifications to complex automated MMIS systems and applications. Coordinates with business analysts to meet with impacted business users to gather and document user needs and translates into business user requirements. Facilitates analysis meetings with business users to determine the business needs that can be translated into the business system requirements and works with business users to establish system modification priorities. (10%)Knowledge Skills Abilities:Knowledge of program management processes and techniquesKnowledge of information technology for business applicationsSkill in coordinating and solving complex problemsSkill in leading and supporting projects including project planning, tracking, and coordinating project activitiesSkill in developing business user requirements and compose technical documentsSkill/experience in conducting/reviewing user testing for automated systemsAbility to write and revise standards and proceduresAbility to develop, evaluate, and interpret policies and proceduresAbility to prepare reportsAbility to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing, with clients/customers to gather requirements and/or explain technical informationRegistration or Licensure Requirements:N/AInitial Selection Criteria:Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university. Graduation from an accredited high school or GED plus 4 years of relevant full time work experience may substitute for degree. Four years work experience developing test case scenarios, conducting UAT and evaluating results and findings.Four years conducting detailed analysis and documenting business and technical requirements.Minimum of four years experience researching and analyzing business system issues and communicating findings to managementAdditional Information: Note: Military occupation(s) that relate to the initial selection criteria and registration or licensure requirements for this position may include, but not limited to: 25B, IT, 275, 0171, 3D0X2. All active duty military, reservists, guardsmen, and veterans are encouraged to apply if qualified to fill this position. For more information see the Texas State Auditor’s Military Crosswalk at http://www.hr.sao.state.tx.us/Compensation/JobDescriptions.aspx.MOS Code: 25B, IT, 275, 0171, 3D0X2HHS agencies use E-Verify. You must bring your I-9 documentation with you on your first day of work.  I-9 Form - Click here to download the I-9 form.
