If you need assistance completing the on-line application, contact the HHS Employee Service Center at 1-888-894-4747. If you are contacted for an interview and need accommodation to participate in the interview process, please notify the person scheduling the interview.View similar jobs

Name: Sr Analyst - Security Technology
Description: Sr Analyst - Security Technology Austin - Northland Dr  IHS Markit harnesses deep sources of information, analytics and expertise to forge solutions for the industries and markets that drive global economies. Our company partners with clients in business, finance and government to provide the unrivaled insights and perspectives that lead to well-informed, confident decisions. We call this The New Intelligence. IHS Markit serves more than 50,000 key customers in more than 140 countries, including 80 percent of the Fortune Global 500. We help decision makers apply higher-level thinking to daily tasks and strategic issues across a host of industries and disciplines including energy, finance, automotive, engineering, technology, maritime and trade, aerospace and defense, chemical, and economics and country risk.  Headquartered in London, IHS Markit (Nasdaq: INFO) is committed to sustainable, profitable growth.  Summary  The role encompasses the research, analysis and reporting of physical security technologies with a particular focus on Safe City projects, City Surveillance, AI analytics, Cloud Computing and Video Surveillance. This will be achieved through original research with C-level executives focused on manufacturing, product development, and thought leadership. Results will be conveyed to a business audience via a suite of assets comprising data, written analysis, infographics and presentations.  Key Responsibilities Primary research to identify physical security organization and strategies, technology developments, and micro economic influences.Research, understand, interpret, and explain new and evolving technologies within the physical security industry.Analyse and report findings via the maintenance of a suite of assets comprising data, written analysis, infographics and presentations.Cover international industry shows and events and interview senior industry executives, specifically programme managers, product specialists, and tier one supplier executives.Support the sales team with business development activities.Interface with and support clients subscribing to HIS Markit services. Essential Requirements A successful candidate would usually have more than 5 years' experience executing market research activities. This will have been gained within a competitive analysis / market research job role.The minimum requirement is a university undergraduate degree in business, economics or a form of mechanical/electrical engineering. Business and economics would be preferable.Fluency in written and spoken English at a business level a must.Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office to include expertise in Excel and well-practiced in PowerPoint.Advanced communication skills to include writing, interpersonal and listening as well as presentation skills gained with large and small audiences.Organizational skills that demonstrate the ability to handle multiple tasks and to effectively prioritize under pressure towards tight deadlines.Strong analysis skills and the ability to assess and interpret information.Flexibility and the ability to creatively problem-solve.Well-developed relationship building skills.Global travel : Typically 10-15% in a year. It is the policy of IHS Markit to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, IHS Markit will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. We maintain a drug-free workplace. For candidates in the US, we are a participant in E-Verify (see link below).  EEO is the Law  EEO is the Law Supplement  Right to Work  Pay Transparency Policy  E-Verify  Current ColleaguesIf you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.SDL2017

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Square Root is built on understanding our customers’ data more deeply than they do. We’re looking for a Data Analyst to be an integral part of that equation. You’ll spend your days nose-deep in data, supporting and learning from a Senior Data Scientist. You’ll collaborate with our Customer Success team, investigating technical issues and data discrepancies. Along the way, you’ll get to work with innovative technologies and great people in a startup culture.Sound like your jam? Keep reading! The GigAssist in rapid customer implementations and data integrations to allow for minimal customer investment and maximum data quality and consistencySupport our Senior Data Scientists in uncovering insights during customer data explorationCollaborate with the Customer Success team to ensure operational stabilityWork directly with our customers to understand business logic and integrate dataGain a deep understanding of the automotive and retail industriesLearn to use cutting edge auto-scaling serverless databases and Elastic Map ReduceImplement and automate customer deliverables to include Excel and LookerAbout YouYou love to dive deep into numbers and statisticsYou understand the importance of patience and attention to detail in partnershipsYou’ve got 1+ years experience working in complex databases using formulas and algorithmsYou’ve got experience using SQL to query, update large databases, and build OLAP structuresYou have experience in customer supportYou’re comfortable in Python and have worked with Bash or other shell scripting languagesTableau or similar experience with visualization tech will serve you wellYou’re able to articulate data insights to non-technical customersYou’re innately curious and fanatical about learningBasicsPlease apply with a cover letter that details why you’re a fit for the role and Square Root!Our Radical Culture Our culture is at the core of everything we do. We have fun, but we work hard. So, as we grow we’re not only looking to hire the best and brightest, but we’re also looking for people that share our values. This is the code we live by: Think big. Do bigger. Big ideas are meant to be pursued. We have a bias for action, iteration, and impact.Be Customer Inspired. Our customers’ toughest challenges inspire us to build innovative software. We delight them by deeply understanding their business and driving results.Partner. We’re approachable, dependable, and collaborative. We go above and beyond to help our customers, our partners, and one another succeed.Thrive. We revere personal and professional growth. We recognize individuality, embrace authenticity, and celebrate each other’s success.The Good Stuff Founded in Austin, Texas, we’ve been bootstrapped and profitable since our start in 2006. Along the way we’ve added a slew of benefits + perks inspired by our team of Radicals. Here’s a sample: Flexibility: no dress code, office hours, or vacation policyCompetitive benefits and compensationCozy campus of five 1920’s craftsman homes in downtownRadicals get $3,000 a year to learn anything (seriously!)Team lunches, stocked kitchen + bar, coffee-snob compliant coffee machinesSquare Root is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. APPLY

Name: M&A Corporate Development Analyst
Description: Ref#: R0013595 Our mission.  As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers. The team.  Our Corporate Development team is responsible for driving the short and long term growth of Indeed in tandem with our organic growth efforts. Members of Corporate Development work closely with multiple departments within the organization to identify and evaluate acquisition, investment and partnership opportunities. Every month, over 200 million people count on our company to help them find jobs, publish their resumes, process their job applications, and connect them to qualified candidates for their job openings. Simply put, we help bring more partnerships, products and services inside Indeed that help people get jobs. Your job. Responsibilities Responsible for evaluating acquisition and investment opportunitiesScope of role is varied and complex and requires independent judgmentAssist in all aspects of the deal, including sourcing and screening, financial modeling, due diligence and closing & integration activitiesIdentify and research industry trends, competitive landscape and internal product development effortsHelp drive Senior Leadership Team decisions and interface with cross functional teams About you. Requirements Bachelor's degree in Finance or a closely related Business field.Strong ability to build complex financial modelsPrevious relevant experience/internships including corporate development, investment banking, private equity or venture capital a plusAble to effectively prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously, as well as deal with ambiguityProactive and action oriented, results driven with excellent business judgment

Name: Data Analyst, Retail Business Intelligence
Description: The Retail Business Intelligence group is looking for a Data Analyst to define, develop and maintain easy-to-use data objects and reporting tools that will support downstream dashboards and analysis.  Acting as the data SME for multiple subject areas, your tasks will include working closely with IT and business groups, to create the required logic and drive the implementation in the analytic environment.  A passion to understand the process of data creation, from the front end users through to reporting objects is critical.  BS Computer Science or Mathematics, or relevant experience. Advanced degree a plus.  Proficient with data access/preparation methods using Teradata SQL, Oracle and other relational databases  5+ years of data extraction and front end report building (PHP, Python, Tableau or similar)  Strong analytical skills; should have the ability to evaluate, analyze and present data  Excellent verbal and written communication skills  Attention to detail; initiative, follow-up, and a desire for end-to-end ownership of deliverables  Flexibility to handle directional changes and ability to support multiple deadline-specific projects while maintaining day-to-day business support  Self-motivated, driven individual who is comfortable working in a global, matrixed, fast-paced environment  Expert at connecting to data sources and normalizing data for reporting  Ability to build effective relationships in a cross-functional team environment  Working in a centralized organization, this position plays a significant role in defining how data is structured, organized and evaluated for consistent understanding and interpretation. A key success factor for this role is the ability to understand diverse stakeholder needs, dive deep into the data, analyze complex elements in a multi-dimensional fashion and deliver meaningful insights to senior management and business partners in a comprehensive and persuasive manner.  Develop PHP or Tableau reports to support Retail leadership and engage with IS&T and project teams to ensure reporting requirements are covered  Engage in business initiatives and capital projects to ensure the planned impact of changes will be measurable  Plan and execute unit integration and UAT (user acceptance testing) to support system implementations and upgrades  Develop and implement web reports and analytical tools for data quality, data capture rates and monitoring data quality  Define how data is structured, organized and interpreted by building semantic layers and master data sets for consistent analytics and reporting  Provide consultation and training to users of analytical tools and data sets  Define, create and deploy meaningful metrics and perform ad hoc analyses","standardWeeklyHours":40,"highJobTitle":"Data Analyst 4","lowJobTitle":"Data Analyst 3

Name: Product Analyst
Description: Product Analyst - Tasktop Technologies If you are interested in a career in Product Management join our growing team where you will be exposed to all aspects of what it takes to deliver a high-quality product!  The Product Development Team sits at the middle of stakeholders across the company, and is tasked with one seemingly simple, but very difficult to achieve, mission: deliver a great product that meets customer use cases and works toward the product vision. The team is responsible for product strategy, concept development, and defining and executing these initiatives in collaboration with our key stakeholders and partners. We specialize in translating high level ideas and requests that come from multiple groups into concrete features to be implemented by our development teams.  We think of product development not as a science, but rather a sometimes chaotic and imperfect artone that, if done well, brings to life innovative and creative solutions to real business problems. Working closely with product management, this role requires someone who can enthusiastically research unfamiliar topics and succinctly report on them, enforce processes, and be a jack of all trades to help the Product Team provide Engineering and the Business the best plan forward. In this role you will:Partner with the Product Manager and internal teams to address complex business questions and provide insightful analysis and strategic recommendations through strong storytelling capabilities to both technical and non-technical stakeholdersConduct detailed analysis to support feature developmentWork with stakeholders to scope features for a given release cycleCollaborate with development team, UX designer, and Product Manager during feature development to answer questionsIdentify potential delivery risks and create strategies for contingency planning and risk mitigationRun major initiatives to support full adoption of our new product by existing customersDevelop internal content and/or demonstrations on product features to educate internal and external audiences on the value of upcoming features/productsWork with stakeholders to understand their feedbackDo a number of other things as needed to help satisfy our department's primary objective of building a solid productWhat will the work and team be like? As a Product Analyst, you'll work on a product team that drives many aspects of Tasktop's core business, talking to various stakeholders and facilitating cross-team and cross-departmental collaboration to help everyone work toward unified goals. The environment is both fast-paced and fun. You will work on a cross-functional team that encompasses product management, product ownership, business analysis, UX design, full-stack development, and QA roles/responsibilities. Great candidates have:Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical staff at all levels of the organizationStrong interpersonal skills with a focus on teamwork and the ability to foster/maintain relationships internally and externallyThe ability to self-direct yourself and work well in a fluid, fast-paced environmentA keen eye for detailStrong analytical aptitudeHigh level of professionalismThe ability to organize and synthesize a large volume of informationIf you know some of the following, thats even better:1+ years of experience as a product owner on an agile team1+ years of experience as a business analyst1+ years of experience working for a B2B Enterprise Software organizationExperience facilitating communication and collaboration between multiple groupsExperience making compromises based off a combination of data and intuitionStrong visual communication skillsLocation Were looking for a candidate to work in our Austin, TX or Vancouver, Canada office. Interested in becoming a Tasktopian? Please send your resume to careers(at)tasktop.comwith the subject heading Product Analyst". We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. About Tasktop Tasktop powers the worlds largest Agile and DevOps transformations. Were transforming large-scale IT by enabling organizations to unify previously disconnected activities into an integrated software delivery value stream. This allows organizations to increase the velocity of business value delivery and overcome the pitfalls of siloed Agile and DevOps deployments.  We are looking for highly-motivated individuals who have a passion for innovation and excellence as we help software development and delivery teams take their innovation to a new level.  Our culture emphasises teamwork, openness, professional development and quality of life. Our global head office is located in Vancouver, Canada and our US headquarters are in Austin, TX.  Job Type: Full-time  Experience: working for a B2B Enterprise Software: 1 year (Preferred)business analyst: 1 year (Preferred)being a product owner on an agile team: 1 year (Preferred)

Name: Project Analyst
Description: Job ID: 289861  Project Analyst  Austin, Texas  Regular  /  DayApply NowWe Are Hiring Analyst-Project - Executive Support 001 - Full-Time, Day - Seton Administrative Offices - Austin, TX Why Join Ascension?At Seton, we’re using the power of purpose to change healthcare for the better. As part of Ascension's Texas Ministry Market we do this through collaboration. Seton brings great minds and proven results from the across the nation together. From the best hires and strategic plans for growth, to the proactive connections we make within our community, we reach out to move ahead. Now, partnering with the University of Texas to build the new Dell Seton Medical Center, our future looks brighter than ever. We do this in force. With more than 12,800 associates, Seton is the leading healthcare service provider in Central Texas as well as its second largest employer. We serve an eleven county area of more than 1.8 million people. We have five urban acute care hospitals, two rural hospitals, a mental health hospital, three primary care clinics for the uninsured, and an increasing number of storefront care locations. We do this with vision. Since our founding in 1902, Seton has led the way in Austin --- expanding thoughtfully and with purpose; caring for our neighbors, because we know them so well. As a non-profit with a mission --- rather than a bottom line --- guiding us, improving health at a community level is our number one priority. Austin.It’s our home, and our heart. Located at the center of Texas hill country --- just a few hours from Dallas, Houston, and San Antonio --- Austin offers an appealing blend of hometown comfort and high-tech care. Whether you are looking for a vibrant nightlife and live music, recreational areas and activities, family-friendly fun, or educational offerings, Austin is a city that not only calls to you, but gently encourages you to sit down and stay awhile.  With cultural diversity, a mild climate (and truly great outdoors), attractive and affordable housing options, and no state income tax, Austin is a feel-good choice for a rewarding way of life. The way we connect,the lives we affect. The Seton Healthcare Family is always looking for dedicated, talented professionals willing to share their hearts with those we serve. Being part of our close-knit team means performing to a higher standard. Embracing innovation, while understanding the importance of individual connections. And continually collaborating, learning and growing to realize new levels of personal and professional satisfaction.What You Will Do As an Associate with Seton Family of Hospitals-TX, you will have the opportunity to Analyze, review and document the requirements of a project throughout its lifecycle. You will:Supports the project team with analytical data and information.Serves as the liaison for the project's technical and functional needs and requirements.Analyzes data and reports key trends, milestones and errors.Creates project documentation for both internal and external communication.Ensures all project reporting metrics are accurate.What You Will NeedEducation:Diploma High school diploma/GED with 2 years of experience, or Associate's degree, or Bachelor's degree requiredWork Experience:None required.Equal Employment Opportunity Seton Healthcare Family is an equal employment opportunity / Affirmative Action employer and complies with all applicable federal, state and local equal employment regulations and laws. It is the policy of the Seton Healthcare Family to afford equal employment opportunities to all employees and prospective employees without regard to their race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, citizenship status, veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic or status that is protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all personnel actions, such as hiring, promotion, transfer, demotion, termination, layoff and all other conditions and privileges of employment in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.Affirmative Action goes beyond the concept of equal employment opportunity. Affirmative Action policies and programs are required to overcome the present effects of past discrimination and to achieve equal employment opportunity for members of groups that are or have been formerly under-represented. Affirmative Action policies and programs are tools whereby additional efforts are made to recruit, employ and promote qualified members of formerly excluded groups, even if that exclusion cannot be traced to particular discriminatory actions. Through specific and result-oriented activities, Seton Healthcare Family’s goals are to ensure that every person is given full consideration through equal employment opportunity policies and practices and to achieve a representative workforce through its affirmative action efforts.It is further the policy of the Seton Healthcare Family to encourage vendors, contractors, affiliate institutions and others doing business with the Seton Healthcare Family to observe the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action.Seton Healthcare Family is an EEO/AA employer: M/F/Disabled/Vet.  For further information regarding your EEO rights, click on the following link to the “EEO is the Law” poster:  http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdfEEO is the Law Poster Supplementhttp://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/ofccp_eeo_supplement_final_jrf_qa_508c.pdfPlease note that Ascension will make an offer of employment only to individuals who have applied for a position using our official application. Be on alert for possible fraudulent offers of employment. Ascension will not solicit money or banking information from applicants.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Favor Finance is growing! Favor is seeking an experienced Financial Analyst who has a deep passion for working at high-growth companies. We're looking for a detail oriented, roll-up-your-sleeves, smart and energetic person to provide analytical and strategic support to our Executive, Operations and Sales leaders. This individual will be a key business partner supporting strategic decision making and execution at the functional group level and assist in achieving their goals while adhering to budget guidelines. ResponsibilitiesMonitor and communicate to leadership team key operational metrics insights and trends on a daily basisPerform monthly analysis to identify trends and explain month over month variances as well as performance to plan/forecastCreate and maintain revenue reports and models from various data sources as needed by business units, markets, marketing channel, and/or merchantsAssist internal teams understand financial impact of key performance metricsReconcile forecasts and budgets to internal accounts and financial statement reporting to ensure financial information has been recorded accuratelyResponsible for preparation and consolidation of monthly, quarterly and annual forecasts for external reportingAssist in developing company-wide budget policies and processes as well as the creation of reports to analyze and track budgets and expenses by departmentBuild, maintain and enhance financial models and forecasting processes used by executive and leadership teams for planning and reporting purposesSupport additional accounting and finance initiatives and projects as neededRequirementsBachelor's degree or higher in Finance or Accounting2-4 years of experience in Corporate Finance, Investment Banking, Consulting or relevant fieldExperience building financial models and providing financial analysis is requiredSelf-starter with the ability to work independently and effectively in a team environmentStrong, consistent work ethic with a keen attention to details and ability to focus on the big pictureAbility to multi-task, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity and passion, be agile and work well in a dynamic environmentEnthusiastic team player with a positive attitude; must be able to communicate with confidence and tact across all levels within the companyAdvanced level of Microsoft Excel knowledge is requiredModerate level of accounting concepts and familiarity with relational database concepts and SQL query scripting are a plusSDL2017

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: At Pitney Bowes, we do the right thing, the right way.  As a Financial Analyst in the Global Commerce Services Finance group, you will be supporting the Global Financial Services business at Pitney Bowes.  We have amazing people who are the driving force, the inspiration and foundation of our company. Our thriving culture can be broken down into four components: Client. Team. Win. Innovate. We actively look for prospects who:Are passionate about client success.Enjoy collaborating with others.Strive to exceed expectations.Move boldly in the quest for superior and best in market solutions. If this sounds like you, then you may be a great fit for Pitney Bowes You are: A self-motivated individual with attention to detail, possessing strong initiative and analytical/accounting skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities. The candidate should be a self-starter, able to work independently in a fast-paced environment and possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills. You will: In this role, youll join our Global E-Commerce team in Austin TX and report in to the Director of Finance. You will: Support the Budgeting, Forecasting, Operating Plan and Financial Modeling for our expanding Fulfillment, Delivery, and Returns BusinessPartner with product teams and business development to help assess the financial and strategic implications of potential product enhancements or new productsPrepare, analyze, and review quarterly and monthly financial reports with management.Analyze current and past trends in key performance indicators including all areas of revenue, cost of sales including unit economics, volume / price mix analysis, operating expenses and capital expendituresWork with various business application tools such as Hyperion Essbase, Salesforce.com, Tableau and the financial system to mine financial dataAd-Hoc Reporting and AnalysisYour background: As a Financial Analyst, Global Commerce Services, you have: B.S. in Finance, Accounting, or EconomicsFinancial and Data Management Systems experience preferred - Microsoft SQL, Oracle Hyperion Essbase, Salesforce, Tableau.Technical capability to prepare, analyze and interpret financial dataExperience in financial systems a plusEquivalent education or experience may be substituted for any of the aboveWe will: Provide the opportunity to grow and develop your career  Offer an inclusive environment that encourages diverse perspective and ideas  Deliver challenging and unique opportunities to contribute to the success of transforming organization  Offer comprehensive benefits globally (pbprojectliving.com) Our Team Pitney Bowes Global Ecommerce provides a comprehensive range of global ecommerce and cross-border shipping solutions that help U.S. U.K. and Australian retailers and online marketplaces reach consumers around the world. Pitney Bowes, a market leader in global ecommerce solutions, continues to expand and grow its digital commerce businesses and payments. If you are the right fit, apply now.Pitney Bowes is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that values diversity and inclusiveness in the workplace. W/M/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/LGBT are encouraged to apply. All interested individuals must apply online. Individuals with disabilities who cannot apply via our online application should refer to the alternate application options via our Individuals with Disabilities link.

Name: Implementation Analyst
Description: Do you have a passion for turning data into actionable information that helps drive real business value? Do you want to be part of establishing the configuration best practices and insights that make a company successful? Do you want a career with a leading, entrepreneurial company driven to be the best? If so, the Lattice Implementation Analyst role may be right for you. As an "IA", you will work with cross-functional teams to implement and maintain Lattice solutions for our customers. You will become a subject matter expert in working with client data and configuring the Lattice suite of applications. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, a team player, and have a passion for data analytics.  Lattice is the global leader in delivering artificial intelligence (AI) applications for marketing and sales. Our software is used by over a hundred leading firms and many Fortune 500 companies including Dell, EMC, Thompson Reuters, PayPal, Staples, and Amazon. Backed by Sequoia Capital and New Enterprise Associates, Lattice has a proven leadership team with backgrounds from companies such as McKinsey, Bain, BCG, Accenture, Oracle, Siebel, Salesforce.com, and Eloqua. Key responsibilities include:Work closely with implementation teams to support application data updates and configuration needsManage, monitor, and provide metrics on data refreshes and software updates across various customersWork with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot data quality issues and drive the resolution of discrepanciesImplement new features, functions, and enhancements for customer-specific Lattice solutionsWork from the Lattice Austin office The best candidates have the following qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Finance, Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Supply Chain Management, or a related fieldExperience working with dataAdvanced Excel skills (e.g. pivot tables, VLOOKUP, charts), with SQL experience a bonusHigh attention to detailWillingness to learn and a passion for driving successful software implementationsStrong work ethic, comfort with ambiguity, and a problem-solving orientationAbility to multi-task effectively and be comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment without close guidance or supervisionExcellent verbal and written communication skillsSDL2017

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: This role will be primarily responsible for accurate and timely financial reporting and for supporting the forecasting, financial analysis and decision analysis efforts for the Global Procurement and Merchant Teams. This position will work closely with the Director of Merchandise Finance, be deadline driven, and possess intermediate modeling & analytical experience. Role requires strong communication skills, collaborative abilities and excellent problem solving expertise. ResponsibilitiesSupport the quarterly and annual business forecasting process, working with merchant teams, Regional and Global partners to establish goals and timelinesContribute to sales and margin models to incorporate mid to long range strategic initiativesPartner with merchant teams and leadership to drive a periodic review process of financial performance, including benchmarking, promotional activity and labor productivityAnalyze and review weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual financial performanceRecognize inconsistencies in financial data and initiate and manage the appropriate corrective actionsDeliver product and store teams with actionable analysis and reporting. Deliver insight on trends within sales and margin as well as their components. Use a variety of tools including customer and basket metrics, market penetration trends, inventory levels & turns and other analysis as requestedSupport partnership with merchant teams across the Global and Regional organizations to provide decision support related to margin and labor investments, including but not limited to new stores, remodels, venue analysis, pricing and competitive impact, supply chain and sales promotion event reviewPrepare various financial reports and ad hoc analysis as requested Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities Strong attention to details, delivering relevant, accurate and timely information to business partnersAdvanced financial modeling experienceAbility to interpret and analyze the following: financial reports, spreadsheet models, legal documents, process maps and project plansAbility to deliver effective written correspondence, procedure manuals, reports and instructions for specific financial processes and tools including but not limited to planning, forecasting and GM/EVA estimating toolsAbility to influentially present information and respond to questions in one-on-one interaction, meeting/group participation/presentation situations involving Team Members, Team Leaders, Store/Facility Leadership, Regional Leadership and Global LeadershipAbility to use Microsoft office Suite at an advanced levelThorough understanding of the key drivers of retail profitability, including experience providing analysis with actionable steps for operations to act upon Desired Work Experiences Bachelor's degree in Accounting or FinanceMBA strongly preferredRetail Finance experience (4 years)Experience working in merchandise finance organization preferred At Whole Foods Market we provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all team members and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. Whole Foods Market hires and promotes individuals solely on the basis of their qualifications for the position to be filled.

Name: Macro Space Senior Analyst
Description: Responsible for delivering data-driven, actionable macro space recommendations that improve the satisfaction and experience of our customers. This position requires experience drawing conclusions from imperfect and incomplete data, application of various analytical techniques, and influencing decision makers using quantitative arguments. Above all, you will drive execution of company goals through design and execution of high quality data discovery, analysis, and the successful communication of macro space recommendations. ResponsibilitiesProvide quantitative-based category space allocation recommendations to business partners in order to best serve customersContribute to design and consensus building for macro space analytical methodologies and recommendations to be applied within the context of category management and new store/remodel designTest and iterate various statistical methods (multivariate regression, ANOVA, cluster analysis, outlier detection, etc.) to define the best method of evaluating space productivityMaintain a thorough understanding of WFM purchasing and merchandising processes to effectively support merchandising decisionsLead and contribute to productive conversations with global and regional leadership to proactively plan, problem solve, and evolve space analytics strategy over timeIn cross functional conversations, serve as the subject matter expert on macro space analysis and processes and participate in the discussion of business requirementsProactively manage changes in scope, identify potential risks to data accuracy or project completion, and devise contingency plans.Close projects by gathering feedback, documenting lessons learned/best practices, and applying those best practices to subsequent projectsDevelop new organizational capabilities in a decentralized structure where results are based on cooperation with and influence of others. Ability to work with partners who have a wide range of analytical understanding Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities 4-year degree or equivalent experience and at least 2 years of Retail Analytics (assortment, space or category), Space Planning, Retail Ops, Merchandising or other applicable retail experienceProficient skill level in tools/languages for data analysis, visualization, engineering, or mining (e.g., SQL, Alteryx, R, SAS, Tableau or similar tools)Experience with implementation of retail merchandising basics (i.e., category management), and merchandising organizational structures and processesExperience with analyzing, reporting and visualizing data to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and find solutionsExperience with identifying data needs and ability to articulate business case and needs to data engineersDemonstrated ability to manage and prioritize multiple assignments, and ability to reset and communicate new priorities in response to ad hoc requests with short deadlinesAbility to develop effective working relationships with cross functional teamsCustomer service oriented with ability to maintain positive attitude in all situationsProficient skill level in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPointOvernight travel approximately 2% of time At Whole Foods Market we provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all team members and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. Whole Foods Market hires and promotes individuals solely on the basis of their qualifications for the position to be filled.

Name: Rapid Response Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob Summary:Reporting to the Senior Coordinator of Issues Management & Store Support, the Rapid Response Analyst serves as the key PR contact for regional and store level issues at Whole Foods Market.The Rapid Response Analyst will work as part of a larger Rapid Response Team to provide 24/7 PR support to WFM stores, dealing with a variety of customer and media issues.The Rapid Response Analyst will work quickly to identify and respond to emerging issues and media inquiries.Primary Responsibilities:Alongside Rapid Response team members, serves as the key contact for all regional and store level issues at Whole Foods Market.Provides guidance to regional and store leadership on handling a range of issues, including customer experience.Works collaboratively with customer care and social media teams to manage customer or store issues.Identifies and monitors emerging issues or trends. Helps to guide public response, including development of messaging, ensuring consistent response across all regions.Creates messaging and responds to local media inquiries on various store and customer issues.Shares on-call responsibilities with Rapid Response Team in order to provide 24/7 support to WFM stores.Education and Experience Requirements:Bachelor's degree in journalism, marketing, public relations, communications, or a related field preferred.3-5 years’ relevant experience in-house or at agency; newsroom experience is a plus.Ability to react quickly and work against tight deadlines.Knowledge of operations and communication procedures at store level in order to execute realistic SOPs.Collaborative and highly motivated with the ability to work effectively in a dynamic, fast-moving environment; high ethical standards and integrity; ability to stay calm in high-pressure situations.Outstanding communication and writing skills, presents clear and compelling arguments, demonstrates sound judgment, impeccable follow through, able to see big picture and immediate business needs simultaneously.Sound project management skills with the ability to manage multiple missions in a fast-paced environment, prioritizing effectiveness with efficiency.Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills, to interact with a range of people at various levels.Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills; team player; welcomes feedback; inquisitive nature.Ability to be available and on-call 24/7 to respond to issues and crises as they arise. At Whole Foods Market we provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all team members and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. Whole Foods Market hires and promotes individuals solely on the basis of their qualifications for the position to be filled.

Name: Senior IT Developer & Program Analyst
Description: Develops and/or modifies large, scalable Web and Desktop solutions that support Whole Foods Supply Chain IT applications. This individual will work across multiple projects as a project leader or technical leader/consultant. Supports and designs interfaces between custom in-house and 3rd party systems in support of our Distribution, Purchasing and Inventory Control environments. This position will work closely with our purchasing teams in deploying a transportation management system and developing interfaces between our systems and Amazon to support shipments to Amazon fulfillment centers.  Completes complex tasks, projects or issues that involve a high degree of risk, impacts business performance and makes use of the individuals' high level of knowledge within one or more areas of specialty.Candidate should be able to perform the following duties: Lead the design, development, and maintenance of custom Java and Web applications in a Linux environment.Investigate and understand the underlying structure, design, and interrelationship of the software applications and business objectives.Interact with the users/business partners of the system as needed, in order to answer questions, identify problems, and design solutions.Analyze business requirements to determine specifications, and the most efficient design approach for assigned project.Evaluate and Integrate 3rd party solutions.Provide accurate development estimates.Write/implement unit tests. Implement load/stress tests as needed.Design solutions for scalability, maintainability, performance and integration with other components and systems.Ongoing education and learning of new programming techniques and technology.Requirements:Minimum 5 years relevant application development and/or systems experience using Java for web application development, SQL, JSP, HTML, JavaScript, CSS, Linux/Unix, script developmentA strong understanding of Oracle databases, tables and data structuresAbility to work in agile team environmentAbility to multi-task, prioritize and meet deadlinesStrong problem solving skillsWillingness to learn and share new technologies with fellow technology team members Additional experience in the following areas is a plus: Supply Chain, Purchasing and Inventory Control applications business experience At Whole Foods Market we provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all team members and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. Whole Foods Market hires and promotes individuals solely on the basis of their qualifications for the position to be filled.

Name: Senior Programmer Analyst
Description: The Senior Developer role will lead the development of enhancements and integration solutions for our custom .NET web and desktop Supply Chain Application suite. They will work on complex tasks, projects or issues that involve a high degree of business impact risk. They will also coach and mentor associate and professional team members, as well as work closely with peers and business partners to provide exceptional software solutions.  The ideal candidate should be able to perform the following duties: Design, develop and modify custom .NET Web and Windows desktop applicationsImplement solutions to consume and publish to our Enterprise Service BusPartner with the Business Analysts, business stakeholders, and IT integration teams, in order to identify issues, design solutionsAnalyze business requirements and user stories, specifications, and the most efficient and effective design approachWrite and Interface with Web ServicesIntegrate and support 3rd party solutionsAbility to Debug and performance tune .Net solutionsWrite and Implement Unit Tests based on acceptance criteria with TDD in mindWrite code with scalability, maintainability, performance and integration with other components and systems in mindOngoing education and learning of new programming techniques and technologyMentor Associate and Professional DevelopersMust Have:Minimum 5 years of experience developing Windows and Web-based applications using C#/VB.net and ASP .NET (3.5, 4.0, 4.5)Minimum 3 years of experience with WCF or other Web Services/Technologies (WSDL, SOAP, etc.)4 yrs experience with MS SQL Server 2008 /2012 (Queries, Stored Procs)4 yrs experience using Visual Studio Online and/or TFSGreat interpersonal, verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work in agile team environmentAbility to multi-task, prioritize and meet deadlinesStrong Debugging and Problem solving skills4 yrs working knowledge of Entity framework and MVC Preference given to those with the following: Tibco ESB/BWRetail Supply Chain experience At Whole Foods Market we provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all team members and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. Whole Foods Market hires and promotes individuals solely on the basis of their qualifications for the position to be filled.

Name: Analyst, Strategic Finance
Description: ABOUT SOCIALWITHINAt SocialWithin, we ignite performance for consumer brands. Our mission is to build and scale brands that people love. Our deep expertise in paid acquisition enables us to drive strong performance for clients across e-commerce, retail and CPG verticals. Join our team of smart, kind, passionate, collaborative, results-driven do-ers. We work hard every day to deliver remarkable experiences to our clients, and ultimately, their customers.WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR  Were looking for a smart and highly motivated contributor to provide financial analysis and oversee our accounting and finance division. You will help upper management make strategic and operational decisions. The ideal candidate brings quantitative and analytic support to decision-making. They will focus their efforts on modeling results of the future, analyzing trends, and looking out for possible challenges emerging in the business before it fully impacts the financials. They will also manage the partnership with our CPA firm, ensure all AR/AP efforts are in-place and on-time, and drive controls across the organization to ensure company stays under budget.You will help us transition from a startup to an enterprise. Candidate will report directly to CEO.RESPONSIBILITIES Own the company financial model (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow and Equity statements) including forecasting, budgeting and long-range planning Build models from scratch, improve existing models, and break complex models down into components that consolidate Manage and monitor performance against business and financial plans, ensuring that operating infrastructure, processes, and tools are in place to achieve financial targets. Develop monthly forecast updates based on performance assessment and input from management team Drive insightful analyses to determine opportunities within reported financial data. You will enhance our metrics capabilities and provide external benchmarks and analytics to inform decision-making Provide comprehensive variance analysis, highlighting trends and assessing results. Tracks risks and opportunities and develop recommendations to mitigate risks and/or capitalize on opportunities Support business decisions with detailed financial models incorporating assumptions, expectations and known risks. Identify business improvement opportunities leading to higher revenue, increased efficiencies, or cost savings. Develop insightful recommendations for forward financial planning and presents business cases to senior management Connect into the day-to-day operations of the companys operating units to stay on top of developments and gather timely and actionable insight. You will develop and present to our CEO and senior management the most current information, analysis, and insights to help them understand company's short and long term financial positionAdditionally, you will: Build pricing models for new services the company rolls out  Participates in the development of and support the companys strategic plans Do retention analysis on clients that are part of our portfolio and inform on any risks to our VP of Operations Own AR and AP; ensure financial controls are in-place and that the company is operating under budget Prepare annual operating budgets for monthly, quarterly and annual time periods Improve forecasting on monthly recurring revenue Coordinate and manage company's relationship with the CPA firm Ad hoc management reporting Create and send invoices to clients QUALIFICATIONS Elite Excel skills - Best practices are second-nature, your models are efficient, scalable, and intuitive Excellent communication and people skills - numbers are key, but a business is built with people Self-starter - You will take initiative, be dedicated, set and drive toward goals Strong working knowledge of GAAP Humble and kind with a great personality BS/BA in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or similar 2+ years experience in Investment Banking and/or Corporate finance /operational FP&A at either a high-growth company or a large, well-established organizationPERKS AND BENEFITS  Incredible company culture - our team looks forward to Monday mornings vs. Friday evenings Free lunch catered daily Health benefits100% company paid medical, dental and vision coverage Great career growth opportunityyoull have direct access to agency leadership Awesome office space near downtown Austin thats stocked with snacks and munchies Taco Tuesdays, free barista coffee (daily), company events and industry conferences Complimentary 24-hour Fitness gym membershipJOB TYPE: Full-Time in Austin, TX.PLEASENOTE: as a company, we take hiring very seriously. Interviewing with SocialWithin may include phone/video interviews, written projects, and/or on-site interviews. Although we are unable to follow-up with each and every applicant, we do our best to run a thorough process for candidates with whom we identify a potential fit.

Personalization is a new capability for Dell and the Dell CSB CRM team and the role will be supporting a global enterprise transformation in customer design. Apply for Position

Name: Accounting Process Analyst
Description: ScaleFactor is on a mission to transform the way small business owners and operators understand and grow their businesses. Our Strategy team is looking for a Accounting Process Analyst to focus on ScaleFactor's top prioritiessolving complex business problems, providing critical business insights to our executive team, and ensuring cross functional alignment in furtherance of our strategic initiatives. This role will have a direct impact on how effective we are at achieving ScaleFactor's mission to transform the way small businesses grow. Come join a creative team of fun, diverse people dedicated to this common goal.JOB TITLE: ACCOUNTING PROCESS ANALYSTABOUT YOU: The Accounting Process Analyst has a direct impact on the way ScaleFactor runs and operates its business from sales to customer support, focused on identifying, documenting, and improving business processes across the company. Your ideas help drive changes across the organization, increasing the performance of our Sales, Product, Engineering, and Customer Experience teams. You maintain a positive attitude, representing ScaleFactor's culture and values to those around you. Responsibilities: Your day to day as a Accounting Process Analyst consists of, but is not limited to the following: Utilizing ScaleFactor's tools and methodologies to outline business processes and communicate proposed improvementsCollaborating cross functionally to draw out business processes and align the efforts of each team to improve business performanceDeveloping and helping implement changes to increase efficiency and effectiveness of the Company's day-to-day operations utilizing data driven decisionsFocusing on the strategic priorities of ScaleFactor's executives, carrying out your day-to-day activities to support those prioritiesServing as an example of ScaleFactor culture and valuesQualifications:Bachelor's degree with any concentration/major or equivalent work experienceTwo or more years of combined experience in public accounting or management consulting focused on finance and accounting operationsExperience communicating with and presenting to a wide range of audiences, including senior executivesBonus Points:Experience developing, optimizing, and implementing improved business processesExperience with cloud-based finance and accounting tools, including Xero, QBO, Gusto, Bill.com, Expensify, Abacus, etc.PERKS:Join an Amazing Place to Work, as Voted by Austin Business Journal's Best Places to Work (2017 and 2018) and Glassdoor (Rated 4.9 of 5 Stars)Health, Dental, and Vision BenefitsUnlimited Vacation, Flexible Schedules, and Off-SitesDog and Cat Friendly Offices Located in Hip East AustinWeekly Catered Lunches, Cold Brewed Coffee, and Office SnacksCompetitive Salary and Bonus PackagesStock Options for Full Time EmployeesJOIN US! Apply online if this role describes you!

Name: Workforce Management Scheduling Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionOurclient, the world largest social media company, is looking for a WorkforceManagement Scheduling Specialist. This is a full-time/perm roledirect with our client and based out of Austin, TX. Our client offers generousrelocation packages for candidates who are willing to relocate to Austin.  As a WorkforceManagement Scheduling Specialist, you will use your deep WFM experience toexecute resource planning efforts such as scheduling and global coordination ofresource alignment against forecast requirements for multiple markets and staffgroups that will help inform an ever-changing operational model. Youll also providesubject matter expertise for Aspect tools and software, as company continues tobuild its Workforce Management capabilities at scale. Youll need a passion foroperations and data to identify opportunities, and an eye for scaling processesand workflows. Your ability to build relationships on a global basis, and yourversatility to switch between strategic thought leadership, and tactical,detailed work outputs will be crucial. RESPONSIBILITIES · Develop, administer and maintain schedules and otherresource planning outputs across multiple sites and partners, while ensuringthe reliability and quality of underlying data.  · Identify and execute against opportunities to optimizeoperational metrics through creative scheduling analysis and recommendations.  · Measure and incorporate appropriate scheduleshrinkage, inflexibility, and other real-life factors influencing staffingagainst forecast requirements.  · Support our high-performing Community Operations Teamthrough understanding operational metrics and optimizing the communityexperience.  · Analyze trends and provide input on improving metricsincluding service levels, adherence, forecast versus actual variances, review timesand occupancy.  · Be an advocate and ambassador for WFM enablement ofoperational excellence.  · Work with our internal and external partners, ensuringour support centers operate in the most efficient manner possible whilecreating a foundation through resource planning that protects our business andenables operational excellence.  · Share your expertise in Facebooks WorkforceManagement solution, as well as the associated process governance and othersupportive responsibilities in order to guide and develop Operations, and trainother team members. MINIMUMQUALIFICATIONS · 3+ years of workforce management and/or back-officeoperations management  · 2+ years of experience developing schedules and otherresource planning outputs with Aspect Workforce Management  · Experience gathering unstructured data to produceinsights and reporting using Excel  · Problem solving and analytical experience RequirementsMINIMUMQUALIFICATIONS · 3+ years of workforce management and/or back-officeoperations management  · 2+ years of experience developing schedules and otherresource planning outputs with Aspect Workforce Management  · Experience gathering unstructured data to produceinsights and reporting using Excel  · Problem solving and analytical experience  BenefitsBonus + equity. Relocation package

Name: Cloud Analyst
Description: GovernmentCIO is seeking a Cloud Analyst for the Enterprise Services contract who will work collaboratively with stakeholders and Agile Scrum team members to serve as an infrastructure technical expert to liaison with other teams as appropriate in support of the Enterprise Services and Cloud Support Initiatives for the Department of Veterans Affairs. A cloud focused analyst must have extensive experience in the coordination of program and project leaders to identify requirements for system architecture. The candidate should extensive experience in taking program requirements and creating an architecture vision to support high volume and high availability network systems that will be hosted in a cloud environment. The successful candidate will collaborate with the team to ensure a high standard of technical excellence is maintained across all project activities and make recommendations for the most effective application of technology to meet the customer’s needs.  The successful candidate will be a proactive, forward-leaning self-starter able to work in a fast-paced organization spread across diverse technical areas using Agile/Lean software development methodologies. The successful candidate will bring a strong cloud computing background with demonstrated technical aptitude to quickly understand new programming languages and technical concepts to communicate effectively to non-technical people via discussions, brown bag sessions, white papers, and visual diagrams.  The Analyst will work with Project Managers, DAS Leads and Team Members to engage with the customer and help the architcts to develop a high-level operational architecture and system architecture that meets their enterprise needs. The successful candidate will be responsible for dictating design choices to DAS and partner organization software developers, architects and engineers, including but not limited to: an understanding of enterprise computing, cloud-based architecture design patterns, especially as they apply to middleware using various platforms, technologies, and programming languages including Python, Redis, Ruby, and Linux Shell scripts.  Someone with a passion for working in a customer support role, has attention to detail, able to multi-task, and can work with multiple project leads to understand and communicate program information will thrive in this environment. It is desired to have cloud-based computing experience at the Department of Veterans Affairs or in another scientific or regulatory environment. Advanced Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or equivalent5+ years of expert experience with modern Cloud technologies such as infrastructure as a service, (IaaS), platform as a service (PaaS), and software as a service (SaaS).Experience with Node.js, and Red Hat Linux, Containers: Docker / OpenShift, Java Jetty/WebLogic, MongoDB, Redis, REST, SOAP, FHIR, HL7, Microservices Architecture, Middleware Development. (e.g., 5 or more years).Ability to obtain a public trustAbility to set, evaluate, implement and support best practices in system and data architecture and system design as well as other technology standardsProvide expertise to the customer in defining environment needs and fostering progress in establishing System Environments and oversee configurations to ensure they will meet the needs of the development teamPartner with business analysis and functional teams with technical oversight to ensure IT solutions meet end user needs as well asExperience with supporting teams utilizing Agile development methodologyAbility to work independently and as a member of an integrated teamAbility to work and communicate effectively with programmers and other IT staff and non-IT functional areasStrong communication skills, problem-solving, and leadership skillsExperience with enterprise Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) solutionsDesired Certifications:AWS or Microsoft Azure Cloud related certification is highly desired.MCSA - Microsoft Certified Solution Developer, Clouderra CCDH, Oracle OCP/OCM/OCEData Analytics - Hadoop, CAP, SAP

Name: Business Systems Analyst - Campus Recruiting
Description: Category: Business Analysis (functional and technical)  City: Austin, Texas, United States  Position ID: J0818-2270  Employment Type: Graduate  Position Description:CGI is seeking students interested in careers in the Information Technology field. CGI is more than just an IT consulting company; we are a global organization offering a world of opportunities. Become part of a unique culture that gives you the freedom to innovate, to make decisions, to achieve your full potential and to chart your own career.Our Business System Analysts typically have a demonstrated interest in technology and business, strong problem-solving abilities, and excellent interpersonal skills. Business System Analysts will be placed on one of our many projects and provide technical/functional expertise in identifying, evaluating, and developing basic systems. Your future duties and responsibilities:What you’ll do (assignments may include responsibilities in one or more of the following areas):• Business Analysis: Developing knowledge of a client’s industry, customers, organization and business objectives in order to help the client in a problem-solving role. Assessing user requirements, procedures and problems to create or improve a system.• User Support Analysis: Providing quality client support by answering client questions, researching possible solutions to problems, and fostering open communication between the client and the CGI project team. Tracking software and documentation defects, performing application maintenance, and providing onsite consulting and training as required.• System Testing: Working with system developers and designers to identify, diagnose, and document problems and errors in specific components of a system. Assessing how well a product adheres to its design, standards, as well as its usability and ability to meet business needs.• Decision Analysis: Applying quantitative methods to study and make recommendations regarding various business issues, including credit risk management, customer profitability, resource allocation and optimization, and customer segmentation.What you’ll gain:• Involvement in a team oriented atmosphere• Exposure to business issues and challenges• Opportunity to leverage your computer knowledge and analytical skills Required qualifications to be successful in this role:What you’ll need:• Bachelors degree required in a relevant field (i.e.: Business Majors to include Finance, Accounting, Management Information Systems, IS/IT and other majors that include consulting and technology coursework)• A great attitude and hunger for learning • Excellent analytical, written and oral communication skills• Flexibility and ability to deal with ambiguity• Ability to work within a team environment • 3.0 GPA strongly preferred• Ability to work in the U.S. for an indefinite period of time with ability to obtain a US Government clearance What you can expect from us:Build your career with us.It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities. At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.No unsolicited agency referrals please.CGI is an equal opportunity employer.Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics.CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at US_Employment_Compliance@cgi.com. You will need to reference the requisition number of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a requisition number will not be returned.We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here to be directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service members.All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US government security clearance held. CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI’s legal duty to furnish information.

Name: Financial Analyst - Business Dining
Description: *Overview:***About Aramark** Aramark (NYSE: ARMK) proudly serves Fortune 500 companies, world champion sports teams, state-of-the-art healthcare providers, the world?s leading educational institutions, iconic destinations and cultural attractions, and numerous municipalities in 19 countries around the world. Our 270,000 team members deliver experiences that enrich and nourish millions of lives every day through innovative services in food, facilities management and uniforms. We operate our business with social responsibility, focusing on initiatives that support our diverse workforce, advance consumer health and wellness, protect our environment, and strengthen our communities. Aramark is recognized as one of the World?s Most Admired Companies by FORTUNE, as well as an employer of choice by the Human Rights Campaign and DiversityInc. Learn more at www.aramark.com at http://www.aramark.com/ or connect with us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/Aramark/ and Twitter at http://www.twitter.com/aramark . *Description:** The Financial Analyst is responsible to analyze all aspects of finance, including budget and critiques. *Responsibilities Include:** + Responsible for providing analytical support to the National Account Director.  + AR; Weekly AR Updates, AP Management for status, Submittal of Invoices, Support all client locations for accounting for  + Overhead Account Management; Payroll, AP, T&E Expenses  + Point of Sale Support  + End of Month; Balancing TDR updates in Metrics  + Prepare and lead the monthly financial review with the client; provide custom reports as needed, and responds quickly to questions and requests. Assist in nurturing the relationship with the client.  + Prepare monthly bank account reconciliations, ensuring that discrepancies are resolved in a timely manner.  + Complete weekly, monthly and annual operating reports, all sales reports, special events sales billings and cash register audits for facility in a timely manner. This includes summary reports, variance reports and all food, labor and direct costs statistical reports.  + Supervise all accounting office functions including cash disbursements, payroll, cash receipts and general ledger accounting.  + Coordinate financial audits of component with internal and external auditors.  + Maintain compliance with Aramark's standard of operation, client contract and within Aramark's Business Conduct Policy.  + Manage and communicate cash flow related issues. This includes accurate and timely preparation of cash flow statements, management of receivables, payables, cash balance, control mechanism and timely deposits of all funds (weekly).  + Generate Period critique reports for client and attending Accounting and Finance meetings.  + Responsible for addressing any operational or financial issues in Budgeting and Forecasting.  + Review financial measures of effectiveness daily. Develop methods of tracking financial performance. *Qualifications:** + Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business or a related subject  + 3+ years of financial planning & analysis experience  + Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and written and verbal communication skills  + Ability to interact and effectively communicate to senior management and teams of diverse nationalities  + Ability to coordinate a number of projects and prioritize accordingly  + Strong collaboration skills and the ability to influence and drive results without formal authority  + Sound judgment and ability to learn quickly and adapt to new situations  + Strong working knowledge of Excel, Word and PowerPoint;  Aramark is an EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY/AFFIRMATIVE ACTION employer ? Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran

Name: Senior Analyst II - Media
Description: Senior Analyst II - Media Austin - Northland Dr  Senior Analyst, Media  IHS Markit is seeking a Senior Analyst to join the Home Entertainment team within IHS Markit Technology.  Senior Analyst will have day-to-day responsibility for tracking the international Home Entertainment market across digital and physical formats. Home Entertainment has long been one of the most important parts of the movie and TV business, it has evolved rapidly as consumer embraced digital distribution of content through transactional business such as Apple iTunes Store and subscription services like Netflix, as well as traditional formats DVD and Blu-ray Disc.  General Job Duties: To be a subject area expert in the international home entertainment industry, representing IHS Markit with clients, sales prospects and within the media. Primary responsibility is to maintain industry contacts, produce written reports and data analysis on the international home entertainment market (i.e. purchase, rental and subscription of content via both physical and digital platforms). In addition, the candidate will simultaneously engage in high-intensity consulting projects to address our clients' most pressing strategic and technical business challenges. This position requires regular travel to Los Angeles area to develop and maintain studio contacts base. Specific Job Duties:Researching and forecasting the international home entertainment market. Includes a quantitative assessment of market developments in both physical and digital media.Producing a regular flow of written work on key strategic issues in home entertainment which take a true cross platform view of the market combining physical with digital analysis.Developing and extending research areas within the home entertainment scope to develop existing products and create new ones.Interacting with clients. The successful candidate must be able to converse with clients to both succinctly explain our data and analysis, and also gather data and information through those interactions. This will be conducted in writing, in person and on the phone.Support account managers in their interactions with prospective and existing clients to encourage client acquisition and retention.Contributing to single client consulting work on the media industry and more broadly where required.Interacting extensively with other teams within Technology and wider IHS Markit.Sharing information and research findings as part of a trans-Atlantic team.Represent IHS Markit as a subject expert at client events, conferences and through the media (press, radio and TV). Required Education: Undergraduate degree from a top university as a minimum. A master's degree would be preferable or equivalent industry experience.  Required Experience: Previous experience should include an analytical role with high level of client interaction. Previous media industry experience would be highly desirable. Required Skills:Strong technical skills and demonstrable ease with working with dataMS Excel literacy to an advanced levelData literacy with experience of database workingHigh degree of mathematical fluencyModelling and forecasting techniquesExcellent written and verbal communicationProblem-solving and analytical thinkingMotivation and attitudeSelf-starting attitude and ability to work independently for extended periods of timeAbility to work productively in teams and openness to giving and receiving constructive criticismStrong organisational skillsThoroughness and attention to detailAbility to multitask and work on numerous projects at one time It is the policy of IHS Markit to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, IHS Markit will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. We maintain a drug-free workplace. For candidates in the US, we are a participant in E-Verify (see link below).  EEO is the Law  EEO is the Law Supplement  Right to Work  Pay Transparency Policy  E-Verify  Current ColleaguesIf you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.SDL2017

Name: Business Analyst - Data Warehouse
Description: We are seeking a Business Analyst with proven data warehouse experience for a 10-month contract assignment with extensions possible at our Austin, Texas based client. Responsibilities for this role include: Assist in requirements gathering for the organization's data warehouse.Perform detailed data analysis from a variety of source systems.Serve as a liaison between consumers of data, users of transactional systems, subject matter experts and the IT project team.Perform detailed data analysis from a variety of data sources.Develop reports, dashboards and interactive visualizations for the data warehouse project.Work with the Data Architect on the data warehouse, data integration and data modelling.Perform other analysis and documentation tasks as required to facilitate and support TWC?s Enterprise Data Warehouse Project. This position must be worked on-site at our Austin, Texas client location. Requirements: Yrs Skills/Experience  8 Analyzing data from a variety of source systems and different database technologies using advanced SQL techniques.  8 Experience as a liaison between consumers of data, users of transactional systems, subject matter experts and the IT project team.  6 Experience working on a data warehouse (both relational and dimensional) team.  6 Gathering, analyzing and generating requirements for a data warehouse.  6 Documenting requirements for reports and dashboards.  5 Developing dashboards and reports using data visualization tools, preferably Tableau.  5 Experience translating requirements into business rules for ETL team.  5 Experience with PL/SQL Preferred: Yrs Skills/Experience  3 ERWin or similar data modeling tools

Name: IT Application Analyst Senior
Description: Position Information Posting Title IT Application Analyst Senior (311 Service Center)Job Requisition Number AE501775Position Number 112872Job Type Full-TimeDivision Name Customer CareMinimum Qualifications Graduation with a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in a field related to the job plus two (2) years experience.Experience may substitute for education up to four (4) years.Licenses or Certifications:None.Notes to ApplicantsAPPLICATION  The City of Austin employment application is an official document; incomplete applications will not be considered. Additionally, this position is considered ESSENTIAL which may require working during emergency and/or weather incidents. Name: Sr. Salesforce Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job Description: The Business Systems Analyst for Salesforce implementation will play a key role on a project team by partnering with the business to understand their business needs, document business process flows, define requirements, and partner with IT counterparts and project team to ensure a successful delivery using Agile principles of IT solutions. Brokers services within IT community on behalf of customers; coordinates system solutions.
