Work involves creative application of wide range of technical and / or management principles. Establishes organizational objectives and manages multiple assignments.Education & Experience:Bachelor's Degree plus 4-7 years' experience, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.4-7 years' experience.Working knowledge of Salesforce platform.Experience implementing Continuous Deployment.Hands on experience with SDLC methods and tools (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum) Type:DirectLocation:Austin, TX, USASDL2017

Name: IT Business Systems Analyst Sr (Test Automation Developer)
Description: Austin Energy (AE) seeks a highly skilled Test Automation Developer with experience working with Automation/Performance testing tools to work in the IT Division of Business & Quality Management. This position is a member of the Service Validation & Testing ( SVT ) team, supporting IT’s Quality Assurance Program. The Test Automation Developer position requires a solid background in automation and manual testing, programming languages, creating and executing test plans, documenting test scripts from requirements, executing manual tests and automated scripts, and documenting variances for new, large, enterprise applications being deployed as well as existing enterprise applications being enhanced. The Test Automation Developer position requires working in a deadline-focused environment while balancing multiple projects and changing priorities while providing support to various IT groups, project stakeholders and business groups. The selected candidate will be able to review system and functional requirements and extract information to use in preparing test plans and scripts and develop test automation frameworks. Preferred Qualiﬁcations: 1. A degree in Computer Science with extensive experience using Java, C++, and Visual Basic. 2. Experience working with any test automation tool. 3. Experience working with any load/performance testing tool. 4.Experience working with Test Management and Defect Management tools. 5. Experience supporting the business of an Electric Utility or Water Utility. 6. Proven experience leading test status and results meetings. 7. Foundations level ITIL certiﬁcation. - provided by DiceTest Automation Developer, Automation/Performance, programming, test plans, test scripts, requirements, executing, automated scripts, variances

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJungle Scout is seeking a Financial Analyst to help lead the analysis driving our operational and strategic decision making. We want someone to build models and scenarios, and make recommendations to the executive and functional teams using those inputs, that will help us optimize pricing, reduce churn, assess buy vs build options, and determine the impact of all of our decisions on the companys financials. This is a critical role for the company and will report directly to the CFO.  The successful candidate will play a leadership role in several areas. She/he will own the forecasting and budgeting process, working with our functional leads and the executive team to build our annual budget and quarterly forecast models. She/he will also own the modeling that drives our pricing decisions, making recommendations to the Jungle Scout team that well then test to determine the impact on company results. Related, she/he will lead our monitoring around customer churn, making pricing and other recommendations to help us reduce unprofitable churn. The Analyst will play similar leadership roles on other key projects, leading the financial modeling necessary to help facilitate our decision making. Finally, should the Company examine acquisition opportunities, the Analyst will lead the financial modeling necessary to help decide which opportunities we should and should not pursue.  We are looking for someone with meaningful experience with financial modeling and scenario building, who can take high-level problems and can creatively and quickly build models that will help us understand our options and the impact of those options on our financials. This likely requires a significant amount of expertise when it comes to manipulating those models in Microsoft Excel. She/he must also be an excellent communicator and business partner, capable of making compelling business-driven cases and articulating them logically to the internal team to drive decisions. Finally, she/he must be flexible and adaptable, capable of getting feedback, learning from it, and adapting her/his models to reflect new information so we reach the best possible decision. Responsibilities:Lead the forecasting and budgeting process, building the underlying models and then partnering with internal stakeholders to ensure the inputs in those models reflect our best assessment of realityPrepare comparisons of actuals vs budget and/or forecast, so the company knows where our gaps are, and make recommendations of the best way to potentially address any issuesMake pricing recommendations, using models and historic data around customer elasticity to help understand the potential impact of pricing changes on overall company profitabilityDrive the companys efforts around monitoring churn rate, ensuring all constituents are using a common lexicon and definition, reporting is available and understood by all, and we can model and assess various options to reduce churnLead various analytical programs/projects designed to understand the potential impact of high-level strategic opportunities on the companys financialsBuild financial models to help us assess potential acquisition and/or other growth opportunitiesPrepare presentations on various opportunities to company management and BoardRequirements and Qualifications:Expert-level understanding of Microsoft ExcelSignificant prior experience (3+ years at minimum) building financial statements / budgets and scenario modelsPrior experience in either investment banking, strategic consulting and/or the finance department of a high-growth SaaS and/or subscription business strongly preferredBachelors degree required. MBA preferred but not requiredKnowledge and demonstrated prior use of SQL preferred (if candidate does not know SQL, must be willing to learn in order to extract data from our internal databases)Past experience with Tableau and/or other visualization software preferred but not requiredAdvanced verbal and written communications skillsExceptional interpersonal, leadership, and organizational skillsHigh energy and the ability to work hard and play well with othersWhy Jungle Scout: We are a fun-loving group of professionals, working remotely around the world with pursuing one goal: to help people launch and grow successful Amazon businesses. Jungle Scout has competitive compensation packages, generous vacation policy, educational stipend, and the mindset that you should work when and where most suits your personality. About Jungle Scout: Amazon Product Research Made Easy. Jungle Scout is the industry-leading Amazon product research tool, that has helped tens of thousands of people find profitable products to sell on Amazon.  Based on millions of data points collected every month, Jungle Scout has the most accurate sales estimates for Amazon sales around, so you know exactly which products will make you money. Come up with product ideas, validate demand, and find the exact products that fit your criteria. www.junglescout.com

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.  Do you love thinking analytically? Are you passionate about using your financial knowledge to navigate complex challenges? Just as our customers find value in Apple products, the Finance group finds value for both Apple and its shareholders. As part of this group, you’ll play an integral role in ensuring our day-to-day financial health. You and your team will support Apple’s growth, both top and bottom line, by applying the same level of innovation toward financial matters as we do toward our products and services. You’ll also collaborate with Apple teams across the world to develop more effective investment strategies and risk management. Finance is essential to upholding our global commitment to excellence, and it is directly responsible for shaping the company’s future. Join us, and you’ll have an important role in continuing Apple’s legacy of efficiency and success.  Apple's Global Business Solutions (GBS) organization is seeking a Data Analyst in Austin, Texas. In this role you will work as the global analytics lead for the Record to Report organization. You will also partner with IS&T to establish, maintain and constantly improve data analytics infrastructure, build world class reporting, and bring advanced analytics to GBS. The role will also provide support for other key organizations within GBS: Purchase to Pay, Order to Cash, Hire to Retire, GBS Ops, and Apple Travel.  Background in finance, computer science, mathematics or similar quantitative field with a minimum of 5 years professional experience  Ability to work on a small team in a constrained environment is a critical requirement  General programming language proficiency (Python preferred)  Highly proficient with SQL (Read and write)  Ability to gather requirements and clearly communicate complex data analysis results  Knowledge of data warehousing concepts, methodologies and frameworks  Foundational knowledge and demonstrated application of statistical data analysis, machine learning  Data munging and Extract Transform Load (ETL) automation experience  Experience with exploratory data analysis and data visualization using R, Python or Tableau  History of driving process improvements, system automation and world class reporting  Corporate finance and accounting (US GAAP) knowledge a major advantage  SAP experience a plus  Ability to work as an end to end data analysts (e.g. requirements and data acquisition to model deployment)  A sense of humor and an eagerness to learn Enable the Record to Report function's analytics and data automation capabilityAnalyze large datasets to glean, report and provide for decisions using actionable insightsIndependently design, code, and test major features, and work jointly with other team members to deliver on projects of all sizesBring creative solutions to induct, clean, monitor and streamline data from different internal big data stores, flat files, and unstructured sources","educationAndExperience":"• Undergraduate degree in computer science, mathematics or other quantitative disciplineUndergraduate degree in Finance or Accounting with three years demonstrated experience in data analytics and programming","highJobTitle":"Business Intel Analyst 4","lowJobTitle":"Business Intel Analyst 3Undergraduate degree in computer science, mathematics or other quantitative discipline • Undergraduate degree in Finance or Accounting with three years demonstrated experience in data analytics and programming

Name: Product Analyst
Description: The Zebra, named a Best Place to Work in Austin four years running, is revolutionizing how connected consumers research and shop for insurance. Were a purpose-driven company looking for a Product Analyst to drive smarter product decisions. Reporting directly to the VP of Product, you will have clear visibility into company direction and strategy. In this pivotal position, youll build out robust dashboards, reports, and processes to predict and highlight changes in the product and recommend optimizations to improve the user experience and monetization. What You'll Do:Build Out Reporting ProcessesCreate daily reporting that gives the product team easy to understand insight into the health and pace of the product and individual featuresBuild reports to track key metrics on user behavior and revenueCatch technical bugs using data Analyze impact of A/Bs and feature changes on key KPIs Highlight product gaps and inefficiencies Report monthly on changes in the product - improvements and declines Track and Predict Product ImpactBecome an expert in how all of our features interact and their various touch pointsUse regression analytics for helping to understand one features influence on the otherClosely analyze trends for each featureTake a proactive and self-starter approach to digging into the data to find opportunities Utilize data to alert the team to both wins and problematic areas Determine Methods to Improve Product Conduct research and gather the necessary data to support effective and innovative product enhancementsUse data to determine and support which product improvements should be made and why Collaborate with other analysts, the data team, and data science to establish best practicesHelp to spec what an A/B or multivariate test would look like to improve a particular product or marketing/ email campaign and what data we should track to determine the success of each A/B testAnalyze the impact of A/B tests and recommend subsequent tests using dataPartner with the UX research team to gather quantitative data for research studiesOur Match Made in Heaven:2+ years professional (or comparable) analyst experienceExperience with SQL and relational databasesExperience with BI platforms, e.g. Looker, Tableau, Adobe or Google AnalyticsStrong attention to detailA passion for problem solving with strong analytical capabilitiesAbility to communicate complex information to non-technical audiencesExperience That Would Truly Impress Us: Experience with tools like Snowflake, Redshift, Hadoop, HIVE or BigQueryProgramming experience in PythonExperience creating data visualizations using JavaScriptAdvanced STEM degreePerks:Competitive compensationHealth, dental, & vision benefitsWorking with a small team of passionate, collaborative and engaged peopleStock optionsWellness perk or monthly home maid serviceWork / Life Balance cultureAbout The Zebra:The Zebra is the most comprehensive online car insurance comparison platform in the U.S. Since 2012, the company has brought transparency and simplicity to car insurance shopping car insurance in black and white. The Zebra compares over 200 car insurance companies, and with its real-time, side-by-side quote comparison tool, drivers can easily and quickly find the coverage, service level, and pricing to suit their unique needs.Headquartered in Austin, Texas, The Zebra has garnered the attention and investment of some of the nations top venture capitalists, and the companys success has been profiled in publications like Inc., Time, Forbes, and TechCrunch. Austin Business Journal named The Zebra a Best Place to Work in 2015, 2016, and 2017. Austin American-Statesman also awarded The Zebra as a Top Workplace in 2016.The Zebra is aiming to grow our fantastic team to add to our dynamic culture and continue building on our success. Working at The Zebra means never being bored, always being challenged, and supporting one another. Were a happy, hardworking group, and were eager to add new stripes who share those values.The Zebra is an equal opportunity employer and at will company.As part of our dedication to maintaining an inclusive and diverse workforce, The Zebra provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, The Zebra complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.The Zebra expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of The Zebra's employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.**No external recruiters or agents, please.**

Name: Apple Media Risk Analyst
Description: SummaryApple is seeking an expert Apple Media Products Risk Analyst who will have a deep understanding of our developer community and payments industry. Your role will drive product advancement and operational execution that exceeds the levels of customer happiness we're known for. You’ll partner closely with engineering, EPMs, analytics, data services, and many more to remove friction from the customer experience. This role has the rare opportunity of helping optimize the world’s premiere internet services platform that’s growing at record pace. Expert level understanding of customers and what differentiates Apple You are passionate and well versed on industry solutions, emerging trends, and techniques Experience working with (SQL) and techniques to perform probability, link & ad-hoc analyses to improve a business We are looking for a self-starter who is willing to be hands-on and find innovative solutions You have a consistent track record of negotiating and influencing project execution in high performing cross-functional organizations Project Management and deadlines excite you, but you are calm and known for your interpersonal skills and attention to detail You have excellent judgment and integrity with the ability to make timely and sound decisions Knowledge of online commerce and/or digital products is preferred Additional Requirements Experience in working in the gaming or payments industry High degree of proficiency with Excel and Keynote Experience in enterprise data warehousing, Tableau and Python Apple Media Products Business Analyst represents our Operations team on program development and business opportunities within consumer experience, app development, and payments. You are responsible for delivering intelligent and relevant assessments of risk associated with Apple Media Products. In this role you will document and present research results using strong communication skills, demonstrating your ability to use professional discretion when presenting to cross-functional teams and vendors. You will be leading and developing complex business solutions that impact our developer communities and Apple Media Products ecosystems.Education & ExperienceBA or BS in business, accounting, business management, finance, computer science, or engineering

We combine a best-in-class, cloud-based video conferencing experience, with award-winning, easy-to-use devices that are designed for any conference room so you can connect to anyone, anywhere. For more information, visit www.lifesize.com or follow the company @LifesizeHD.Role and Responsibilities:Assist with creation and distribution of worldwide price listsRegionalize price lists as needed to support key country/market needsAnalyze pricing changes and trends to product mixAnswer sales and channel inquiries regarding pricing, promotions, and availabilityCreate ad-hoc analysis on customer financial and usage data Requirements: Bachelor’s degree. 2+ years of professional financial or pricing analyst experienceDealing with ambiguity and fast paced execution.Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse informationAbility to perform detailed analysis and extrapolate decision options from that analysis.Effective communication skillsAbility to work productively in a team environmentProficient in Microsoft Excel Lifesze is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Name: Data Analyst (AKA Lead Quant)
Description: About Seasoned:  Seasoned is a recently launched, well-funded start­up that is focused on disrupting the high growth, high turnover food service industry. Our goal is to continually improve the lives and livelihoods of the service industry professionals we serve with unmatched access to careers, content, and connections. The team is led by an experienced set of consumer technology veterans from LinkedIn, Lynda, Art.com, NoWait, and Home Away who have experience building rich, customer friendly experiences.  No other company seeks to create a place as diverse and dynamic as the industry we serve. With offices in Austin, TX and San Francisco, CA, we’re looking for people excited about being at the heart of how 10% of the American Workforce thrives.  In this role, you will report to our company President, but you will work with the entire company. (It’s okay, we’re pretty small.) You will be embedded with the Data Team (Data Scientist and Data Engineer) and Product Team. You will also support Sales, Business Development, and Marketing. Seasoned cannot succeed without world-class data intelligence, and you will be the point person on increasing our Data Intelligence every single day. Think of yourself as the Sherlock Holmes for the company. Your curiosity, insight, and attention to detail will help drive that intelligence. ResponsibilitiesWork closely with Seasoned’s Data, Product Management, Design, Marketing, and Engineering teams to drive our Data & Analytics vision, strategy, and roadmapServe as the data and analytics domain expert, evangelizing data literacy and building a suite of tools to empower every Seasoned employee to make data-informed decisions: dashboards, reports, ad-hoc queries, insightful observationsProvide support and expertise to Product Managers in defining KPIs and technical data requirements to ensure all product features and initiatives launch with proper metric tracking.Own E-commerce Web Metrics: tracking, analysis, and discovery. In other words, you know and understand our web traffic in every way possible, and you create windows (reports, views, demos) into that activity for the rest of the business.Build Business Intelligence views (dashboards, reports) enabling each department to successfully track their KPIsDrive and own A/B testing strategies, implementations, and analysis.Deliver data and data analysis on an ad-hoc basis using whatever tools are necessary for the taskMust HavesExperience with Google Analytics or other Web Analytics tool, and A/B testing concepts Demonstrated capacity to clearly define product and business KPIs in support of company goals and strategiesExcellent communication skillsDeep understanding and empathy for usersWillingness to get your hands dirty conducting data analysis, building dashboards, and supporting internal and external data requestsBasic knowledge of SQL: its concepts and basic syntaxNice to HavesExperience with E-commerce concepts, things like Conversion rate, Customer Acquisition Costs, Attribution, etc.Experience with a Business Intelligence Dashboards tool (Tableau, Google Data Studio, Superset, or similar)Math or Statistical Background, i.e., can you talk through Distribution functions (Binomial, non-normal, student t-test), linear and non-linear modelsExposure to A/B testing tools (Optimizely, Google Optimize, etc.)Direct Database experience: data structures, modeling, and SQL expertiseHospitality industry experience Last thing: bring a sense of humor and one or two passions outside of your professional interests. We are a team of diverse viewpoints and intellectual approaches, but we all agree humor and a breadth of interests make the team stronger (and more fun)! Name: Sr Business/Data Analyst (Client Systems Analytics)
Description: Common Purpose, Uncommon Opportunity. Everyone at Visa works with one goal in mind – making sure that Visa is the best way to pay and be paid, for everyone everywhere. This is our global vision and the common purpose that unites the entire Visa team. As a global payments technology company, tech is at the heart of what we do: Our VisaNet network processes over 13,000 transactions per second for people and businesses around the world, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks. We are also global advocates for financial inclusion, working with partners around the world to help those who lack access to financial services join the global economy. Visa’s sponsorships, including the Olympics and FIFA™ World Cup, celebrate teamwork, diversity, and excellence throughout the world. If you have a passion to make a difference in the lives of people around the world, Visa offers an uncommon opportunity to build a strong, thriving career. Visa is fueled by our team of talented employees who continuously raise the bar on delivering the convenience and security of digital currency to people all over the world. Join our team and find out how Visa is everywhere you want to be. The Sr Business/Data Analyst within the Client Systems Analytics Delivery team will be responsible for designing, developing and implementing Data integration and Analytics solutions on Hadoop and using BI tools, Data mining and/or Machine learning provide insights on the data. Name: Search Quality Risk and Fraud Analyst
Description: Ref#: R0009596  Additional Posting Location(s): Austin - Downtown Our mission.  As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers. The team.  We are the people behind the scenes of Indeed's search results. We ensure that our results are ranked as best as they can be for our job seekers and that they’re not being duped by scams or fraud. Beyond search, we invest heavily in ensuring that Indeed has the best data analysis tools available to optimize our recruiting products and run accurate A/B tests. Simply put, we help people get the right jobs. Your job.  Indeed is a job seeker-centric platform. You and your team will lead efforts to ensure when a job seeker types in a query and browses job search results, that the jobs they find meet both their expectations as well as the high-quality standards of Indeed. Our current approach to search quality requires significant human intervention, but as we scale, we need to develop tools and systems to detect poor search results more effectively and efficiently. You will have the opportunity to drive change and facilitate the shift from human-led processes to technology-based systems for search quality.As an Analyst within Search Quality Risk Operations, you are responsible for protecting the integrity of Indeed’s products by working in a team dedicated to reviewing content, determining if it is at Indeed’s standards, and actioning if necessary. Under the direction of your manager, you improve the job seeker experience by analyzing, investigating, and removing low quality and fraudulent content, while working cross-functionally in order to improve our internal moderation tools. You should be comfortable when asked to perform in-depth analysis and research in a competent and efficient manner. You are able to present your findings in a clear and succinct way. Once the analysis is complete, you are undaunted by developing, communicating, and implementing a plan that may include sweeping product or policy changes. You recognize exploitations of or gaps in products, policies, and standards, and you work toward filling those gaps via product and/or policy revision.  Responsibilities Conduct daily reviews in order to find suspicious, malicious, or low-quality accountsCommunicate with your peers and cross-functional partners regarding fraud trends, patterns, and other malicious activityChallenge the status quo working collaboratively as well as independently on projects focused on improving moderation methods, policies, and internal toolsInvestigate internal and external reports of suspicious activity or undesirable content. This will include in-depth reviews of activity and user-created content as well as companies, job types, industries, and business practicesUse data analysis to inform your decisions and the direction of our efforts dailyConsider the job seeker experience in every facet of your work About you. RequirementsExperience in Fraud, Risk, or Payments highly preferredStrong written and verbal communication skills. Able to deliver clear and succinct interpretations of extensive research in a manner accessible to all relevant Indeed teamsCurious-minded enough to pursue open-ended leads, but pragmatic enough to understand when to move on from an issueSelf-starter, intellectually curious and comfortable operating in a fast-paced, ever-changing environmentAbility to quickly identifying patterns and trends across seemingly unrelated contentCapability to validate and explain trends and results compared to outlined success metricsTechnical knowledge with a proficiency in manipulating data sets in SQL or equivalent and drawing insights from dataMust be organized, positive, proactive, and results-orientedStrategic thinker with strong analytical and creative problem-solving skillsIndeed provides a variety of benefits that help us focus on our mission of helping people get jobs.  View our bounty of perks: http://indeedhi.re/IndeedBenefits

Name: Treasury Management Sales Analyst
Description: Job SummaryThe Treasury Management Sales Analyst will support a team of Treasury Management Officers by assisting throughout the sales cycle and providing treasury solutions to both prospects and existing clients. Responsible for preparing proposals, coordinating services and implementation, and providing client training and assistance. Works closely with internal partners to ensure Treasury Management customer satisfaction is achieved.Essential FunctionsPrepares proposals that outline client-focused treasury solutions and will include pricing recommendations and related service information.Coordinates implementation of treasury services with applicable parties to ensure timely delivery to clients.Manages client documentation requirements.Provides and coordinates client training and installation of treasury services.Assists in maintaining accurate pipeline by tracking deal progress.Participates in relationship review process and cross selling opportunities.Develops working knowledge of all treasury products and technical requirements.Supports internal partners by providing training and assisting on special projects.Other duties as required. Job RequirementsBachelor’s degree in business or related field OR combination of equivalent relevant work experience and high school diploma, GED, or equivalent required.Prior experience in banking strongly preferred. Treasury management experience a plus.Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to interact with all levels of customers, clients, and Bank personnel.Must have strong, demonstrated customer service skills.Strong computer skills, specifically with Microsoft Office suite of products, and the ability to learn and utilize custom banking systems and applications.Excellent analytical, time management, organizational and problem-solving skills with the ability to multi-task and work in a deadline-driven environment.Must be self-motivated team player with strong attention to detail, high level of accountability, and the ability to work independently.Must be able to travel locally up to 50%. About the CompanyAt PlainsCapital Bank, we’ve always had a trailblazing spirit. PlainsCapital Bank was founded in 1988 by current Chairman Alan B. White and a group of young bankers who dreamed of bringing relationship banking to their hometown of Lubbock, Texas. With the acquisition of Plains National Bank, a Lubbock financial institution with one branch and $198.8 million, they began growing the bank one relationship at a time.  Today, PlainsCapital Bank is one of the largest banks in Texas based on deposit market share. We have a statewide presence with more than 60 locations in all major Texas markets. We are a strong and stable financial institution and a trusted community partner. We take pride in helping our customers blaze trails of their own, whether launching or expanding a business, raising a family, or moving into retirement. Our diverse range of services includes commercial banking, treasury management, private banking, and wealth management, as well as consumer banking.  To learn more, please visit us online at plainscapital.com/about.

Name: Salesforce Senior Analyst Business Systems
Description: At Abbott, we're committed to helping people live their best possible life through the power of health. For more than 125 years, we've brought new products and technologies to the world -- in nutrition, diagnostics, medical devices and branded generic pharmaceuticals -- that create more possibilities for more people at all stages of life. Today, 99,000 of us are working to help people live not just longer, but better, in the more than 150 countries we serve. JOB DESCRIPTION: The Business Systems Analyst for Salesforce implantation will play a key role on a project team by partnering with the business to understand their business needs, document business process flows, define requirements, and partner with IT counterparts and project team to ensure a successful delivery using Agile principles of IT solutions. Leads department level projects or provides assistance to Program or Project Managers on phases of larger projects.  Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and procedures.  Applies and executes standard information systems theories, concepts and techniques and assists in the development of standards and procedures.  Works directly with business unit clients to understand specific business processes and needs and opportunities for improvement; identifies IT capabilities and information required to support the business processes and collaborates in the development of appropriate information management strategies, developing them as an integrated part of the business strategy.  Strong analytical capabilities and attention to details.  Analyzes business processes; elicits, analyzes, and documents business requirements; identifies alternative solutions, assesses feasibility and makes recommendations typically seeking to exploit and leverage new or existing IT technology components.  Demonstrates an innovative approach to solving business problems.  Identify process disconnects and translate them into improvement opportunities with cost savings or avoidance, productivity improvements, or revenue generating business benefits.  Understands System Life Cycle process.  Software Life Cycle documentation creation (i.e. Project Charter, Process Flows, User/Functional Requirements, User Acceptance Tests).  Prepares testing plans to confirm that requirements and system design are accurate and complete.  Translates business requirements into user and functional requirements; performs data and process modeling; manages change; and leads, coordinates / performs testing, verification, and validation of requirements.  Develops information systems strategies that meet the requirements of the business. Identifies the business benefits of alternative strategies. Ensures compliance between business strategies and technology directions.  Partners with business to ensure the appropriate business procedures, training and communications are developed per project. Conducts training when appropriate.  Delivers projects on-time and within budget constraints and provide accurate and timely communications to management.  Understands the core business systems and how the integrate with upstream and downstream systems.  Manages and provides expert advice on, the selection, design, justification, implementation and business use of information systems.  Develops business relationships and integrates activities with other IT departments to ensure successful implementation and support of project efforts. Manages relationships between clients involved and IT organizations to assure effective communication between the groups is occurring. Brokers services within IT community on behalf of customers; coordinates system solutions. Allies with other IT functional areas to remain current on project status, and inform customer management of progress; conversely, keeps IT managers aware of user issues and resolves conflicts.  Manages medium to highly complex work activities covering technical, financial and quality aspects and contributing to formulation of IT strategy. Work involves creative application of wide range of technical and / or management principles. Establishes organizational objectives and manages multiple assignments.  Bachelors Degree plus 4-7 years experience, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.  4-7 years experience.  Working knowledge of Salesforce platform.  Experience implementing Continuous Deployment.  Hands on experience with SDLC methods and tools (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum)  JOB FAMILY:IT Services&Solutions Delivery  DIVISION:GIS Global Information Services  LOCATION:United States>Waukegan : J46 Floor-2  ADDITIONAL LOCATIONS:United States>Texas : 6300 Bee Cave Rd Building 2, suite 100.  WORK SHIFT:Standard  TRAVEL:Yes, 15 % of the Time  MEDICAL SURVEILLANCE:Not Applicable  SIGNIFICANT WORK ACTIVITIES:Continuous sitting for prolonged periods (more than 2 consecutive hours in an 8 hour day), Keyboard use (greater or equal to 50% of the workday)  Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities/Women/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Name: Analyst-Project
Description: We Are Hiring Analyst-Project - Executive Support 001 - Full-Time, Day - Seton Administrative Offices - Austin, TX Why Join Ascension?At Seton, we’re using the power of purpose to change healthcare for the better. As part of Ascension's Texas Ministry Market we do this through collaboration. Seton brings great minds and proven results from the across the nation together. From the best hires and strategic plans for growth, to the proactive connections we make within our community, we reach out to move ahead. Now, partnering with the University of Texas to build the new Dell Seton Medical Center, our future looks brighter than ever. We do this in force. With more than 12,800 associates, Seton is the leading healthcare service provider in Central Texas as well as its second largest employer. We serve an eleven county area of more than 1.8 million people. We have five urban acute care hospitals, two rural hospitals, a mental health hospital, three primary care clinics for the uninsured, and an increasing number of storefront care locations. We do this with vision. Since our founding in 1902, Seton has led the way in Austin --- expanding thoughtfully and with purpose; caring for our neighbors, because we know them so well. As a non-profit with a mission --- rather than a bottom line --- guiding us, improving health at a community level is our number one priority. Austin.It’s our home, and our heart. Located at the center of Texas hill country --- just a few hours from Dallas, Houston, and San Antonio --- Austin offers an appealing blend of hometown comfort and high-tech care. Whether you are looking for a vibrant nightlife and live music, recreational areas and activities, family-friendly fun, or educational offerings, Austin is a city that not only calls to you, but gently encourages you to sit down and stay awhile.  With cultural diversity, a mild climate (and truly great outdoors), attractive and affordable housing options, and no state income tax, Austin is a feel-good choice for a rewarding way of life. The way we connect,the lives we affect. The Seton Healthcare Family is always looking for dedicated, talented professionals willing to share their hearts with those we serve. Being part of our close-knit team means performing to a higher standard. Embracing innovation, while understanding the importance of individual connections. And continually collaborating, learning and growing to realize new levels of personal and professional satisfaction.What You Will Do As an Associate with Seton Family of Hospitals-TX, you will have the opportunity to Analyze, review and document the requirements of a project throughout its lifecycle. You will:Supports the project team with analytical data and information.Serves as the liaison for the project's technical and functional needs and requirements.Analyzes data and reports key trends, milestones and errors.Creates project documentation for both internal and external communication.Ensures all project reporting metrics are accurate.What You Will NeedEducation:Diploma High school diploma/GED with 2 years of experience, or Associate's degree, or Bachelor's degree requiredWork Experience:None required.Equal Employment Opportunity Seton Healthcare Family is an equal employment opportunity / Affirmative Action employer and complies with all applicable federal, state and local equal employment regulations and laws. It is the policy of the Seton Healthcare Family to afford equal employment opportunities to all employees and prospective employees without regard to their race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, citizenship status, veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic or status that is protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all personnel actions, such as hiring, promotion, transfer, demotion, termination, layoff and all other conditions and privileges of employment in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.Affirmative Action goes beyond the concept of equal employment opportunity. Affirmative Action policies and programs are required to overcome the present effects of past discrimination and to achieve equal employment opportunity for members of groups that are or have been formerly under-represented. Affirmative Action policies and programs are tools whereby additional efforts are made to recruit, employ and promote qualified members of formerly excluded groups, even if that exclusion cannot be traced to particular discriminatory actions. Through specific and result-oriented activities, Seton Healthcare Family’s goals are to ensure that every person is given full consideration through equal employment opportunity policies and practices and to achieve a representative workforce through its affirmative action efforts.It is further the policy of the Seton Healthcare Family to encourage vendors, contractors, affiliate institutions and others doing business with the Seton Healthcare Family to observe the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action.Seton Healthcare Family is an EEO/AA employer: M/F/Disabled/Vet. Name: Principal Research Analyst - Service Provider Technology
Description: Principal Research Analyst - Service Provider Technology London - Ropemaker Place | Austin - Northland Dr  Principal Research analyst  Job Description SummaryVideo has become a key battleground for the giant Internet companies like Amazon, Apple, Google, Facebook and Netflix. Pay TV companies are also investing heavily; fighting to stay relevant. This is leading to a momentous increase in the amount of content being created, how it's consumed and massive disruption in the technology ecosystem used to distribute it.  IHS Markit is seeking an experienced candidate to lead our research coverage of video encoding, processing, storage and distribution markets. Vendor and customer strategies for these are changing rapidly, as they seek flexible solutions for video distribution. This role is an opportunity to be a part of this dynamic industry through researching, forecasting and commenting on key developments; influencing the strategies our clients develop to enable this industry. The ideal candidate will be working under minimal supervision, while being responsible for leading the video processing, storage and distribution research within the Technology, Media & Telecoms group at IHS Markit. Specific Duties: As a principal research analyst for video technology the successful candidate will lead the creation of detailed research reports, presentations and bespoke consulting projects. The candidate will assume a client-facing role, attend events, speak at conferences, present key data findings to customers, serve as a thought leader and a recognized expert in the industry. Responsibilities will include:Provide expertise in the market for video processing, storage and distribution, with focus on the media and entertainment industryDevelop and maintain relationships with customers for business development purposes, and with key industry players to facilitate primary researchAttend conferences, events and vendor briefings, which will include domestic and international travelWrite research notes to deliver regular written opinion for clients on hot topics in this space, including technology shifts, regional and vertical activity, key product announcements and M&ADevelop and maintain relationships with the trade and business press, providing useful data and opinion in publications, raising awareness of our services and brandSuggest enhancements to the existing services and ideas for new services which could be offeredProvide subject matter expertise and support for consulting projectsWork with a global team of colleaguesQualifications:5 or more years of related industry or analyst experience. Name: SAP GTS FUNCTIONAL ANALYST
Description: SummaryThe people here at Apple don’t just build products — we craft the kind of wonder that’s revolutionised entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that supports the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.Are you deeply accountable for your work? Your passion for product ownership and track record will prove critical to your success on our team. SAP GTS Functional Analyst is a position within the corporate Information Systems and Technology (IS&T) SAP team and this position will be key to our Trade Compliance application space. You are self-directed and motivated with strong SAP GTS and SAP R/3 business process and configuration experience. You will be required to have business process skills as well as technical leadership skills, to be able to design and implement secure, scalable and sustainable solutions. It also requires the ability to create process flows, functional specifications and work with both onsite and offshore resources to build and test solutions, solve problems and resolve issues under pressure to meet timelines and present solutions to multiple levels of management. This is a tremendous opportunity for someone who has the ability to own and drive initiatives and a passion to work in a highly integrated global solution platform. Be ready to make something phenomenal when you come here. Dynamic, inspiring people and innovative, industry-defining technologies are the norm at Apple. The people who work here have reinvented and defined entire industries with our products and services. The same passion for innovation also applies to our business practices - strengthening our commitment to leave the world better than we found it. You should join Apple if you want to help deliver the next amazing Apple product. Six plus years of experience with SAP GTS and SAP ECC Two plus complete full life-cycle implementations of SAP GTS projects in a functional lead capacity Experience with Design and development of processes of Compliance and Customs Management etc. In-depth technical knowledge of SAP GTS as well as supporting business processes SAP project leadership including selection, implementation, and support of application-packaged solutions Ability to stay focused and prioritize a heavy workload while achieving extraordinary quality You are upbeat, adaptable, and results oriented with a positive attitude You have excellent judgment and integrity with the ability to make timely and sound decisions As the Functional Analyst you will be required to: - Design and develop SAP GTS IT solutions for Apple Trade Compliance. Perform detailed system analysis, develop functional and technical specifications, and make recommendations. - Work closely with SAP ECC, Data Warehouse, ABAP, Basis and other teams during design and implementation. - Work with key business users in developing detailed requirements and providing conceptual design of proposed solution. - Perform system configuration, modification and set-up for new projects as well as enhancements to existing projects and perform system testing and integration validations. - Support User Acceptance Testing (UAT) with business clients and provide project status updates and documentation of designs, processes and configurations. - Interact with business users and other IS&T teams to ensure that business requirements are met through proper system configuration. - The role will require strong influence and persuasion skills along with excellent configuration and development skills in order to seamlessly integrate SAP GTS and other systems.Education & ExperienceBS or MS degree with a minimum 5-7 years experience of SAP GTS functional experience

Name: L&D Analyst II
Description: Business TitleL&D Process Analyst II30-Nov-2018Posting LocationUnited States - Texas - Austin Posting Job DescriptionJOB SUMMARYThe Analyst II is responsible for designing, building and implementing analytic methods for the Customer Operations L&D team and internal stakeholders. This role facilitates the analytic methods to help improve service management and service delivery performance in support of the business objectives. The Analyst (2) is responsible for identifying inefficient and non-value-added processes in the production environment, resulting in improvements to Business Impact/Call Center Metrics, Productivity/SLAs, and Internal L&D (capacity, time tracking, and budget) activities.The Analyst II works with team members to perform one or more of the following analytic methods:Build a robust dashboard and measurement program that enables value definition for the business and the use of leading and lagging indicators to rapidly respond to changing and evolving learning needs. This individual will work across the L&D team to facilitate the collection, reporting, and monitoring of key metrics to drive both internal and external activities; research market trends and use insights to enable proactive call center relationships that surface call center problems; and define solutions that drive lasting change to achieve business impactBuild continual improvement capabilities and tools to optimize the L&D operating model performance. The Analyst researches and evaluates the Agile Learning Experience Process (ALEP) in order to provide the L&D team with recommendations and plans for continuous process improvement.Build an archive capability to organize, assemble, catalogue, preserve, and manage various types of content, tools, and artifacts that support the core business processes of the Customer Operations L&D team. This archive tracks a multitude of different assets and establishes how it is stored/retrieved in order to maintain the "single source of truth" of all materials in use by the L&D team.MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop and maintain dashboard tools, measurement frameworks, and SharePoint libraries for use by the L&D team. Architect a digital library in which all L&D content can be stored, tracked, updated or retired per the business requirements.Build methods to collect, store, and report data and own the process end-to-end for the dashboard, performance, or archiving analytic methods. Create necessary checklists, tools, documents, and forms to enable and support the analytic method. Monitor and manage method data interfaces, files, integrity and security.Perform project management duties as needed to support analytic initiatives and the implementation of new methods.Collaborate with Analytics team members to enable L&D processes and methods to scale the L&D organization and elevate the business impact. Identify opportunities to phase out dependencies on legacy databases, processes and reporting tools.REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONSSkills/Abilities and KnowledgeForward-thinking, with an ability to anticipate and prepare for changing demands for and uses of analytical informationGood business acumen and project management skills, with proven ability to plan and execute projects within deadline constraintsEffective oral and written communication skills coupled with the ability to establish and maintain productive relationships with peers, leadership, and internal stakeholdersAbility to develop logical policies and procedures that the L&D Team will follow to ensure integrity of analytical methodsAbility to audit analytic methods in use across the L&D organization to identify compliance with processes and procedures as well as improvementsDemonstrated knowledge of creating performance dashboards or SharePoint repositories to support internal or external stakeholdersDemonstrated proficiency to manipulate and report on data using measurement tools (MS Excel, MS Access, Tableau, and SQL)Experience in using one or more of the following methodologies: Balanced Scorecard, Strategy Mapping, SWOT, Value Chain, Six Sigma/Lean, Agile/Scrum, and Organizational Change ManagementRelated Work Experience 2+ Years Business Improvement, Analytics and/or Intelligence experience 2+ Years Dashboard Development or SharePoint Administration experience EducationBachelor’s degree or equivalent experience/certification in Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, Economics, or Business ManagementPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSSkills/Abilities and KnowledgeBig Data/Hadoop experience, Business Intelligence tool experienceCertification from Academy of Certified ArchivistsRelated Work ExperienceRelevant corporate experience in a large Fortune 100 companyManagement or business consulting experienceWORKING CONDITIONSOffice environment5% Travel (if Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Are you a superstar? Are you looking to be challenged, and feel like your work is valued? Does turning abstract ideas into an Excel model excite you? If so, we're looking for you.Senior Financial Analyst Consultant needed for the Finance and Business Intelligence practice in a rapidly-growing local consulting firm. Applicant should be experienced in providing premier client service, able to effectively manage multiple client engagements simultaneously, and provide superior work product with minimal supervision.  The 9Gauge Finance and Business Intelligence team leverages proprietary methodologies and collective intelligence to produce high quality deliverables in three areas: Reporting & ToolsData AnalysisProjections & Models Our clients utilize our team as an extension of their own, and look for us to deliver executive decision support, forecasting, reporting and analysis. Senior Financial Analyst Consultant will be expected to engage directly with clients to perform requirements-gathering, set schedules, build project plans, and produce and hand-off deliverables. Projects may include financial reporting system environment design and implementation, operational data transformation and reporting, and raw data analysis to provide new business insight.  The position will report directly to the Partner, and will be supervised as needed. Excellent communication and presentation skills required, as well as flexibility to work on multiple demanding projects simultaneously, ability to work independently, and to manage analyst(s), as needed. Can-do, hands-on attitude required.  Successful applicants will demonstrate the following: Leadership skills and the ability to work with client personnel at all levels within an organization;Expert Excel knowledge with a skillset focused on modeling, reporting, and data analysis;Experience with financial statement analysis, including budgeting and forecasting;Experience in database use and/or design is desired (including Essbase, SQL, and MySQL);Adaptive Insights experience a plus;Self-motivation, maturity, and versatility;Ability to work proactively, solve problems and make decisions with minimal supervision;Resourcefulness with a can-do results-oriented attitude to challenges and problem solving;MBA preferred and management experience a plus.Desire to work as a consultant; and5 to 10 years finance/business analysis experience required To apply for this job, please submit a resume and cover letter detailing why you're a great fit for this consulting opportunity.  9Gauge Advantages:  The 9Gauge Partners culture is tough to beat. We have been named one of the Austin Business Journals Best Places to Work and we are rated in the top 5 in Austin for Glassdoor Reviews. Our employees are empowered in serving their clients, work alongside a supportive team and with progressive leaders who truly value transparency and the impact our team makes each day. Our team enjoys competitive base salary plus bonus structure, comprehensive benefits offerings, and a flexible schedule.

Name: Senior IT Developer&Program Analyst
Description: Develops and/or modifies large, scalable Web and Desktop solutions that support Whole Foods Supply Chain IT applications. This individual will work across multiple projects as a project leader or technical leader/consultant. Supports and designs interfaces between custom in-house and 3rd party systems in support of our Distribution, Purchasing and Inventory Control environments. This position will work closely with our purchasing teams in deploying a transportation management system and developing interfaces between our systems and Amazon to support shipments to Amazon fulfillment centers.  Completes complex tasks, projects or issues that involve a high degree of risk, impacts business performance and makes use of the individuals' high level of knowledge within one or more areas of specialty.Candidate should be able to perform the following duties: Lead the design, development, and maintenance of custom Java and Web applications in a Linux environment.Investigate and understand the underlying structure, design, and interrelationship of the software applications and business objectives.Interact with the users/business partners of the system as needed, in order to answer questions, identify problems, and design solutions.Analyze business requirements to determine specifications, and the most efficient design approach for assigned project.Evaluate and Integrate 3rd party solutions.Provide accurate development estimates.Write/implement unit tests. Implement load/stress tests as needed.Design solutions for scalability, maintainability, performance and integration with other components and systems.Ongoing education and learning of new programming techniques and technology.Requirements:Minimum 5 years relevant application development and/or systems experience using Java for web application development, SQL, JSP, HTML, JavaScript, CSS, Linux/Unix, script developmentA strong understanding of Oracle databases, tables and data structuresAbility to work in agile team environmentAbility to multi-task, prioritize and meet deadlinesStrong problem solving skillsWillingness to learn and share new technologies with fellow technology team members Additional experience in the following areas is a plus: Supply Chain, Purchasing and Inventory Control applications business experience At Whole Foods Market we provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all team members and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. Whole Foods Market hires and promotes individuals solely on the basis of their qualifications for the position to be filled.

Name: Treasury Management Sales Analyst
Description: The Treasury Management Sales Analyst will support a team of Treasury Management Officers by assisting throughout the sales cycle and providing treasury solutions to both prospects and existing clients. Responsible for preparing proposals, coordinating services and implementation, and providing client training and assistance. Works closely with internal partners to ensure Treasury Management customer satisfaction is achieved. Prepares proposals that outline client-focused treasury solutions and will include pricing recommendations and related service information.Coordinates implementation of treasury services with applicable parties to ensure timely delivery to clients.Manages client documentation requirements.Provides and coordinates client training and installation of treasury services.Assists in maintaining accurate pipeline by tracking deal progress.Participates in relationship review process and cross selling opportunities.Develops working knowledge of all treasury products and technical requirements.Supports internal partners by providing training and assisting on special projects.Other duties as required.Bachelor’s degree in business or related field OR combination of equivalent relevant work experience and high school diploma, GED, or equivalent required.Prior experience in banking strongly preferred. Treasury management experience a plus.Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to interact with all levels of customers, clients, and Bank personnel.Must have strong, demonstrated customer service skills.Strong computer skills, specifically with Microsoft Office suite of products, and the ability to learn and utilize custom banking systems and applications.Excellent analytical, time management, organizational and problem-solving skills with the ability to multi-task and work in a deadline-driven environment.Must be self-motivated team player with strong attention to detail, high level of accountability, and the ability to work independently.Must be able to travel locally up to 50%. At PlainsCapital Bank, we’ve always had a trailblazing spirit. PlainsCapital Bank was founded in 1988 by current Chairman Alan B. White and a group of young bankers who dreamed of bringing relationship banking to their hometown of Lubbock, Texas. With the acquisition of Plains National Bank, a Lubbock financial institution with one branch and $198.8 million, they began growing the bank one relationship at a time.  Today, PlainsCapital Bank is one of the largest banks in Texas based on deposit market share. We have a statewide presence with more than 60 locations in all major Texas markets. We are a strong and stable financial institution and a trusted community partner. We take pride in helping our customers blaze trails of their own, whether launching or expanding a business, raising a family, or moving into retirement. Our diverse range of services includes commercial banking, treasury management, private banking, and wealth management, as well as consumer banking.  To learn more, please visit us online at plainscapital.com/about.

Name: Sr Financial Analyst
Description: Job Description The Soldier and Vehicle Electronics (SVE) Finance team is seeking an experienced Senior Program Control Analyst to join the Electronic Systems Survivability, Targeting & Sensing Solutions SVE finance team in support of the Family of Weapon Systems-Individual (FWS-I) programs. The selected individual will be responsible for ensuring timely and accurate program financial analysis for all programs within the assigned program area. This includes leading program Estimates at Complete (EACs) events and completion of related financial statements, managing cash flow, supporting Quarterly Business Reviews and the Integrated Business Plan. This individual will be expected to provide regular communication and presentation of financial data to senior leadership in an accurate, concise, and understandable manner, develop relationships as a full business partner with respective Program Managers/Directors, support business area strategy and provide financial data and analysis for decision-making. In addition, this person will be periodically developing business case analysis, supporting proposal activity, and acting as the primary point of contact for all financial matters related to the assigned program area. This Senior Analyst will be expected to influence the program team to minimize risk and maximize return of program profit through management of financial salients and program execution. In addition, this individual will ensure compliance with internal policies and procedures. Other duties as assigned.Typical Education & Experience Typically a Bachelor's Degree and 4 years work experience or equivalent experience Required Skills and Education Mastery / Working knowledge of Project Data, Iportal, Excel pivot tables and filtering, hyperion and all associated Program Control tool set. Preferred Skills and Education People skills include the ability to effectively communicate upwards and laterally across multiple functional organizations. About BAE Systems Electronic Systems BAE Systems is a premier global defense and security company with approximately 90,000 employees delivering a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support and services.  The Electronic Systems (ES) sector spans the commercial and defense electronics markets with a broad portfolio of mission-critical electronic systems, including flight and engine controls; electronic warfare and night vision systems; surveillance and reconnaissance sensors; secure networked communications equipment; geospatial imagery intelligence products and systems; mission management; and power-and energy-management systems. Headquartered in Nashua, New Hampshire, ES employs approximately 13,000 people globally, with engineering and manufacturing functions primarily in the United States, United Kingdom, and Israel. Equal Opportunity Employer/Females/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Gender Expression

Name: iTunes Royalty Analyst
Description: SummaryImagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Do you love thinking analytically? Are you passionate about using your financial knowledge to navigate complex challenges? You and your team will support Apple’s growth, both top and bottom line, by applying the same level of innovation toward financial matters as we do toward our products and services. Finance is essential to upholding our global dedication to excellence, and it is directly responsible for shaping the company’s future. Join us, and you’ll have an important role in continuing Apple’s legacy of efficiency and success. Apple’s Global Business Solutions (GBS) organization supports tens of thousands of Apple employees, customers and vendors on just about every topic under the sun. We offer advice and develop innovative solutions to challenging problems that come up all around the world. We are seeking an iTunes Royalty Analyst in Austin, TX. Name: AppleCare, Repair & Cycle Aging Analyst
Description: SummaryAppleCare Channel Service Support (CSS) is seeking a highly-motivated professional to manage Business Analytics processes and programs. CSS is responsible for two major functions in AppleCare: - The business-to-business support of partners performing service (Retail Stores, Apple Service Providers, and Carriers). - The efficient and accurate flow of service-related transactions (i.e. repairs and orders). This role will be responsible for driving Repair Aging and Cycle Time programs and efficiencies at a sub-regional level for the Americas (US, Canada, ALAC, Brazil) to minimize the number of Apple customers waiting for repairs. Aptitude for blending quantitative and qualitative data Strong analytical skills Experience with Tableau and other similar tools preferred Multi-functional collaboration, strong drive and ability to influence partners, accountability without control Experience with SAP Experience with Excel and Keynote System Knowledge: SAP, Tableau, Excellent conceptual, written and verbal communications skills at all levels, and the ability to build relationships across channels and functions to drive success worldwide Independent self-starter who can manage multiple priorities in a rapidly changing environment Experience in the development and delivery of reporting within multiple environments Ability to quantify strategic and tactical important metrics and drive decisions based on data Experience with projects from scoping and design, to planning and implementation Effective presentation skills, especially at the executive level Experience working in a large, complex global organization Demonstrated experience designing and implementing structure, focus, and standardization within a reporting and data analytics environment, including the development of standard methodologies across functions and regions High comfort level with analyzing performance, needs and expectations in order to anticipate upcoming analytical requirements or challenges Ability to quickly gain credibility and marshal resources in a global organization, including influencing decisions and facilitating change management through collaboration and leadership Great teammate with a positive attitude, solid sense of empathy and ability to be decisive Willingness to work at a very detailed level while still being able to abstract ideas for communication to multi-functional teams and senior management - Partner with CSS management to execute engaging, effective reporting, and data analytics programs and initiatives - Support new programs and instill standard methodologies within the service field to improve cycle/aging time - Have a curious eye on future technology and look for innovative solutions to problems or new ways to achieve goals - Dedicatedly identify process optimization opportunities by monitoring repair cycle time metrics and partnering with appropriate DRIs - Monitor aging repairs daily for opportunities to action Customers Waiting and ‘At Risk’ repairs - Identify issues, analyze via root-cause analysis, and drive to resolution - Manage partner relationships and build partnerships (Field Services, RCs, Depots, DCs, Logistics, Channel Solutions, Finance, Extended CSS Teams, GSSC, etc.) - Lead weekly Aging reviews with appropriate DRIs - Utilize Cycle Time & Aging assets for day-to-day analysis and action to improve performance - Develop clear and concise presentation summaries for management, illustrating trends and opportunities for improvement in Weekly Account Reviews - Perform regional Aging analysis and action for all channels and impact types - Identify aging repairs due to system or data integrity issues, drive ticketing with IS&T as appropriate, and perform manual cleanup - Collaborate with Repair Operation Center analysts for high-impact incident support and partner communications - Deliver training to regional teams as necessary - Collaborate and share standard methodologies with regional counterparts Education & ExperienceBachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required, MBA a plus

Name: Sr. Process Improvement Analyst
Description: Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.  Do you love thinking analytically? Are you passionate about using your financial knowledge to navigate complex challenges? Just as our customers find value in Apple products, the Finance group finds value for both Apple and its shareholders. As part of this group, you’ll play an integral role in ensuring our day-to-day financial health. You and your team will support Apple’s growth, both top and bottom line, by applying the same level of innovation toward financial matters as we do toward our products and services. You’ll also collaborate with Apple teams across the world to develop more effective investment strategies and risk management. Finance is essential to upholding our global commitment to excellence, and it is directly responsible for shaping the company’s future. Join us, and you’ll have a meaningful role in continuing Apple’s legacy of efficiency and success.  Apple’s Global Business Solutions (GBS) organization supports tens of thousands of Apple employees, customers and vendors on just about every topic under the sun. We offer advice and develop innovative solutions to challenging problems that come up all around the world.  We are currently seeking a Sr. Process Improvement Analyst in Austin, TX.
