Name: Business Systems Quality Analyst
Description: IGT is the global leader in gaming. We enable players to experience their favorite games across all channels and regulated segments, from Gaming Machines to Lotteries to Interactive. We have a well-established local presence and relationships with governments and regulators in more than 100 countries around the world, and create value by adhering to the highest standards of service, integrity, and responsibility. IGT has over 12,000 employees. The Business Systems Analyst identifies and validates business needs to create well-defined software requirements associated with the Texas Lottery Account. The Business Systems Analyst applies a systematic, disciplined, quantifiable approach to the design, development, implementation, operation and maintenance of customer solutions through software requirements management. This role will interface with multiple disciplines within the Texas Lottery, IGT, and 3rd Party Vendors. Business Analysis:Identify, document and analyze business and user requirements such as objectives, business, and information flows.Write new application requirements and write enhancements to existing systems.Document, analyze and interpret business policies and processes, write Test Plans, Test Cases and requirements, conduct Test Plans.Identify issues and risks related to requirements.Perform gap analyses.Demonstrate understanding of System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and requirements management methodologies.Quality Assurance:Analyze business requirements to identify testing needs.Provide inputs into test plans, operating scenarios, business processes, and test approach.Maintain the test environments and provide inputs to identify gaps.Perform test design, construct test scenarios, and execute tests to plan.Complete all test documentation.Record, report, and track defects to accurately depict the status of the system.Apply principles and techniques to evaluate systems during the development lifecycle.Present information clearly to the Texas Lottery. Respond to requests in a timely and accurate manner.QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor’s degree preferred in a systems/ software technical field or equivalent required.2-3 years related experience in software requirements specification (SRS) management and/or quality assurance testing.Strong customer relationship building skills.Analytical skills to develop solutions to business issues.Excellent communication skills; both written and verbal - able to bridge communication between technical staff, non-technical staff and customer.Strong problem resolution and conflict resolution skills.Working knowledge of MS Office and MS Project. Preferred: Proficiency with a Requirements Management Tool (i.e., DOORS).Proficiency in System Development Lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies, extending to requirements definition, testing and implementation.Business Process Modeling & experience with Quality Center 10.0 or higher or JIRA. #LI-AD1  #di  IGT is committed to sustaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of the global customers and communities we serve, creating a fair and inclusive culture that enables all our employees to feel valued, respected and engaged. IGT is an equal opportunity employer. We provide equal opportunities without regard to sex, race, color, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity or expression, and any other personal attributes protected by federal, state, or other laws. We thank all applicants for applying; however, only those selected to interview will be contacted.  In addition to our competitive benefits package, we offer employees a 401(k) Savings Plan with Company contributions, tuition reimbursement, and free identity theft insurance.  IGT (NYSE: IGT) is the global leader in gaming. For more information, please visit www.igt.com.

Name: Operations Analyst, Community Operations
Description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.Community Operations' focus is on supporting our users through both direct support interactions as well as scalable solutions, and on improving the health of our products by helping people understand how to use them. Those who join our teams are very passionate about solving peoples issues, and are strong advocates for the Facebook community. We need influencers who can align cross-functional partners to ensure the best possible experience for our platforms. We are seeking a resilient self-starter who is eager to learn, collaborative and a proven team player. We count on specialists who are passionate about protecting users, and are excited to build systems to support millions of people. We value people who can strategically drive the team using macro-level insights, while still caring for micro-level cases affecting people around the globe. We're targeting an intellectually curious and creative individual who is comfortable operating in ambiguity a strategic thinker with strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills. Responsibilities:Respond to user inquiries with high quality, speed, and accuracyWork directly with users to resolve their issues, identify user trends, identify bugs, and work with cross-functional partners to implement changeUse market specific knowledge, signals and insights to develop scalable solutions to support our global Facebook communityAdvocate for users within the North America market, partnering with global and cross-functional teams to develop global solutionsGather, analyze and utilize relevant data to develop ways to improve the overall support experienceUse problem solving skills to resolve large and complex business problemsMininum Qualifications:Bachelors degree6+ months of work experience in consulting, tech, project management or an operational capacityExperience communicating to a variety of audiencesPreferred Qualifications:Bachelors degree in a quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics, economics or related field6+ months experience working with data6+ months experience working with SQL

Name: Channel Training Reporting Analyst
Description: Summary For a lot of our customers, their first experience with an Apple product started with the help of knowledgeable and supported sales persons who were able to understand their needs and translate them into the flawless solution. Our organization is responsible for creating training content, tools and programs that assist our channel partners to successfully enable their sales staff to build those great customer experiences.  Data reporting is a tool we deeply rely on to effectively measure the success of our training and program initiatives and inform our organization about opportunities for further improvements. In order to achieve that, our team is looking for a talented, self-motivated, and results-oriented reporting analyst to gather, analyze, and present actionable information we can use to build more effective training content and programs.  You will be an experienced professional with functional expertise, and will perform all aspects of reporting and analysis — data acquisition, quality assessment, report and dashboard building, documentation, and presentation of results. They’ll be customer focused have good communication and analytical skills, project management expertise, a passion for data visualization, and previous experience with Business Intelligence (BI) tools. You'll work on a diverse scope of problems where data analysis requires evaluation of identifiable factors. They’ll work across multiple reporting systems and develop rich reports to help our business teams understand how audiences consume learning content across various vehicles. And their recommendations will drive continuous improvement in our team’s ability to create compelling content to enable consumer channel partners to sell Apple products and enrich customer lives.  Proven analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy  Experience with modern analytics, reporting and business intelligence  Working knowledge of business processes and related reporting & analysis activities  You demonstrate proficiency in Tableau, Excel/Numbers, and SAP BusinessObjects Web Intelligence  Proficient at SQL, report writing and presenting findings  Knowledge of other analytical tools (e.g. Splunk, SAS, R, Pandas, Hadoop, Spark) a plus  Technical expertise regarding data models, data mining and segmentation techniques  Excellent written and verbal communications skills, attention to detail, critical thinking and analysis.  Able to work effectively within a fast changing environment, tight deadlines, priority changes and multiple constituencies  Ability to evaluate workflows and tools, and to improve and simplify processes  Quick learner and avid to challenge yourself every day — curiosity is a must!  Minimum 5 years of experience in data or business reporting is required  You'll be the go-to person for consumer and staffing programs reporting requests in the Reporting & Operations team  You’ll work with business owners to scope reporting requirements and define meaningful metrics for training and communications consumption.  You’ll work with our reporting systems—including Tableau, BusinessObjects and Adobe SiteCatalyst (Omniture)—to measure content consumption across web, email, and mobile.  You’ll perform all aspects of reporting and analysis (data acquisition, quality assessment, report building and automation, documentation and presenting results)  You’ll prepare daily/weekly/monthly/quarterly analysis and reporting on key training metrics for management  You’ll extract and dive deep into the data, assess its integrity, and deliver meaningful insights to managers and channel partners in a comprehensive manner  You’ll conduct regular evaluations to measure content effectiveness and work with program and content owners to recommend strategies for improvement.  You’ll work on multiple projects with great attention to details and deadlines, and high awareness of business priorities. Education & Experience Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics, or relevant industry experience is required

Name: Director of Analytics & Business Intelligence
Description: #WeAreEA and we exist to inspire the world to play. EA values creativity, pioneering, passion, determination, learning, and teamwork. We mean things like acting with curiosity, speaking up with original ideas, and committing to each other as one team.  Were looking for all the best kinds of people to make great experiences for our players. The best people want a job that inspires them, while giving them room to enjoy their lives. And we want to give them that. We celebrate diversity and inclusion by creating a place where you can come to work and be yourself.  And we want you to join us. Were hiring a Director of Analytics and Business Intelligence. This role is part of EAs Customer Experience organization. The Customer Experience organization strives to make EA known for taking care of its players. Were players taking care of players and people talking to people whenever, wherever, and however they need us.  The Director of Analytics and BI will lead our Analytics, BI, Taxonomy and Search teams, developing a unified strategy across these teams that drives positive impact and change across both WWCE and EA as a whole.  Specifically, the Director of Analytics and BI will directly lead and mentor a team of analysts on projects across a range of domains and effectively prioritize resources to maximize impact. They will help solve complex problems and present actionable analysis to help the Customer Experience leadership team make business decisions and drive strategy.  This role will also lead our Business Intelligence team, where they will help deliver streamlined reporting and dashboards that enable our stakeholders to get access to the data and insights they need, when they need it. They will also lead our data governance function along with related training and education activities across the org.  Additionally, this role will lead Taxonomy and Search, providing guidance and mentorship to our team of subject matter experts. They will work to enable a taxonomy and search strategy that simultaneously provides an improved player experience while also ensuring that we capture actionable data to share with our stakeholders.  This is a leadership role and the right candidate will have a strong analytics and BI background and be capable of influencing within Customer Experience and among partners and stakeholders across EA. This position reports to the Senior Director of Insights for Worldwide Customer Experience.  Responsibilities: Manage the WWCE Analytics team by guiding, developing, and mentoring a global team of analystsManage day-to-day analyst deliverables, including capacity planning and best practices like peer reviews, problem solving methodology, archiving, and model selection and validation techniquesManage the WWCE BI and Taxonomy & Search teams by driving a cross-functional strategy and providing mentorship to the teamsPartner with leadership and stakeholders to define and prioritize highest value work for the businessSupervise and deliver projects to best achieve overall organizational goalsPresent actionable analytics and future recommendationsAnalyze performance, identify areas to optimize and test where appropriateImplement and champion analytics and BI best practicesContinue to evolve and upgrade the teams technical skills with SQL, R, Python and other relevant languages and toolsLead data governance, ensuring that our metrics are aligned to business goalsStay abreast of emerging trends in the analytics and customer experience industries in order to recommend and implement performance improvementsIf youre interested in this role, youll need these skills or experiences: A. or B.S. in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, and/or Engineering Sciences graduate degree preferred10+ years of experience with demonstrated experience applying analytics and BI to real world problems, particularly in the customer experience arena5+ years of managing and developing analysts supporting multiple functional areas impacting the customer experienceDemonstrated ability to synthesize data, reveal the story it tells, and present the analysis to senior leadershipStrong understanding of standard modeling strategies and descriptive statisticsExperience with a data visualization software package, e.g., TableauExcellent knowledge of a statistical software package or programming language, such R, SAS, or PythonExcellent knowledge of Excel including pivot tables, vlookups, charts, and graphsExcellent knowledge of SQLExperience with big data ecosystems like Hive/HadoopFamiliarity with the gaming industry, contact centers, managing global teams, and JIRA preferred #LI-TA1

Name: Operations Analyst
Description: The Operations Analyst will work closely with the Services leadership team to provide on-going support and maintenance of the organization's business systems, processes, and data. You will develop, maintain, and improve procedures, documentation, and reports that help maximize services resources, and improve Services results. Additionally, this role will be responsible for the execution of all integrations of acquired companies' Services teams onto Accruent business systems and processes.  This is not an entry-level role. Applicants must have at least 3 years in an analyst role for consideration. The successful candidate will be a highly motivated, detail, process and customer service-oriented individual focused on meeting the needs of growing and dynamic Services team by driving efficiencies and improvements. This position demands a high-level understanding of process and procedures that drive a successful Services organization. ESSENTIAL DUTIES &RESPONSIBILITIESExecute all integration activities required to bring acquired Services team onto Accruent business systems and processes.Provide analysis for acquired Services teams that supports the business objectives of the Services organization, in alignment with corporate vision.Develop analytical reports for all sources of services revenue, consistent with company standards, and management direction.Assist Services leadership team with resource management and proactive forecasting processes for acquired companies.Subject matter expert for FinancialForce for the Services organization.Subject matter expert for services personnel on all processes related to services revenue: time entry, project management, customer billing, and staff utilization.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES3+ years of experience as an analyst in a large consulting firm or computer software company.Proven ability to manage multiple projects and deliverables simultaneously.Strong analytic and quantitative skills; ability to determine trends and propose solutions.Knowledge of MS Office required, advanced proficiency in Excel preferred.Prior knowledge of Salesforce.com and Financialforce.com preferred.Strong attention to detail with effective organizational, multi-tasking, and time management skills.Self-motivated and a desire for continuous learning.Ability to lead and actively participate on working teams.Ability to work with and protect confidential information required.Undergraduate degree in business or accounting or equivalent work experience.Polished/professional demeanor and written communication.ABOUT ACCRUENT Accruent is a global software company that helps organizations achieve superior performance by transforming how they manage their physical resources. Its innovative, industry-leading cloud-based software and services enable organizations to optimize all stages of real estate, facilities and asset management, from capital planning through to IoT-based monitoring and control. With a proven track record across two decades, Accruent has created the only integrated SaaS-based framework and reporting platform for full lifecycle physical resource management. More than 7,000 global customers depend on Accruent solutions to drive out hidden costs, extend asset lifecycles, protect their brands, ensure compliance and deliver on the missions of their organization. Headquartered in Austin, Texas, Accruent serves a wide range of industries in 149 countries around the world.For more information, visit www.accruent.com. Accruent is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer.Women, minorities, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.All offers of employment are made contingent upon the successful completion of a background check. A background check may include: verification of education, past employment, criminal background reports, motor vehicle driving records, reference checks, civil suit records, drug test and/or investigations into incidents involving theft, fraud, harassment and workplace violence. The company is the sole determinant of a successful background check.

Name: Project Analyst
Description: Are you looking for an exciting opportunity working for a Global Technology Leader?  At Aviat Networks we take great pride in hiring a workforce that is committed to supporting and strengthening our values and attributes. If you're results oriented, customer centric, and an innovative thinker who also takes pride in personal and professional integrity, Aviat Networks is the ideal next step in your career. We are looking for people who love to solve problems, enjoy change and know how to have fun! Come join us as we bring communications to the world.  We currently have an immediate need for a Project Analyst. JOB SUMMARY This position will report to the Project Accounting Department, will be assigned to specific project managers in North America to provide support on all accounting and financial elements relating to managing assigned projects, and will support the Billing function. RESPONSIBILITIESResponsible for reviewing and maintaining cost and revenue budgets at the onset and throughout the life of each project to completion including change orders and other executed customer contract modifications.Advise on cash applications as payments are receivedReconciling accounts receivable and un-applied cash balances, as well as specific customer account reconciliations which involve reviewing the Purchase Order against booking, invoices, and paymentsProviding regular analysis on project cost budgets spent in comparison to original and updated estimatesProvide a monthly reconciliation of the project revenue budgets compared to the total funded amount from the customerEnsure appropriate & timely revenue recognition on Projects which includes margin accuracyPreparing accurate and timely financial data for Project Profitability reviews, especially for larger, complex projectsReview and approve vendor purchase order requisitions for service projects. Monitor vendor PO status, including upkeep of receipts against PO's as well as vendor invoicesProvide cost & revenue forecast input and analysis of actual performance results (Revenue, Cost of Goods Sold, Direct gross Margin)Work with the Project manager to prepare "Estimates to Complete"Provide detailed explanations for Unbilled balances and the forecasted future billingsSupport the monthly close schedule by performing all period closing tasks in a timely fashion, including but not limited to budget updates, invoice issuance, and providing project cost accruals requiredPrepare Services and Equipment invoices as per the customer PO specifications which may involve coordination with Sales department, other Project Analysts, and Order ManagementWork with customers to resolve billing disputesSupport Project Accounting function, which may involve account reconciliations with emphasis on project cost allocation and reconciliation of corresponding accountsAssist in ad-hoc reporting needsVarious other administrative tasks may be requiredREQUIREMENTS This position requires excellent financial, analytical, and communications skills. Candidate must be highly organized, be adaptable to on-going continuous improvements implemented and be familiar with accounting principles, Revenue Recognition rules, Percentage of Completion method and Cost Accrual Method. Individual must be computer literate with spreadsheets, word-processing and scheduling software. Must have the ability to balance and prioritize numerous tasks simultaneously while working with a variety of teams/individuals and meet target deadlines. Must can interact diplomatically with both internal and external customers and must be comfortable interacting with all organization levels, including Aviats senior management. EDUCATION/EXPERIENCEEducation and/or Experience Equivalent to: Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance or Accounting.Years of Related Experience: At least 5 years of financial / accounting experience.Other Qualifications/notes (Specific Skills, Licenses, Certificates, tools, etc.): Oracle ERP experience, preferably release 12.Excellent interpersonal skills and attention to detail required.### By submitting your application, you acknowledge that you have read and understood Aviat Networks Candidate Privacy Notice.  EOE/Minorities/Women/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans  Aviat Networks offers a competitive benefits package. Apply NOW to learn more!SDL2017

Name: Security Intelligence Analyst
Description: Do you live and breathe information security? Want to battle cyber criminals every day? Want to work on important problems, your way? Atlassian has an amazing opportunity for you!  We're expanding our security intelligence capability and looking for smart, technical, people to help us build and run new monitoring/analytics systems. As a Senior Security Intelligence Analyst you'll be watching over the our corporate environment and Atlassian cloud services, hunting for signs of compromise and implementing high-fidelity alerts. More than that, you'll be building new systems, developing automation and crushing security problems you care about.  We would love for you to be a great developer, but more importantly, you must be bright, motivated and love security. You should be comfortable writing code to get things done and not depend on third party products to do your job. You must have a solid understanding of network, system and application security and should be considered great in at least one by your peers. Your day to day will include:Run and manage security investigationsPerform investigations on a wide variety of events from various sources to determine whether they pose a threat to AtlassainDevelop technical solutions to help mitigate security incidentsAdvocate security and secure practices throughout AtlassianConduct research to identify new attack vectors against Atlassian's products and servicesAnalyzing log data for signs of compromiseResearching attacker tools and tactics On your first day, we'll expect you to have: 3+ years experience working in securityRelevant work experience in security and incident investigationFluency in any modern programming languages (preferably Python, Ruby, Java or Go)Written code to complete security tasksSelf-motivated and results-orientedExperience building and delivering projects from start to finishPassion for collaboration and strong interpersonal skills#SO It's great, but not required, if you have: Experience with AWS or similar cloud service platformExperience with malware analysisExperience with threat hunting and threat modelingContributions to the security community or open source projectsData analytics experience More about our benefits  Our offices are open, highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some fantastic perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, flexible working options, five paid volunteer days a year to support your favorite cause, plenty of food and beverages, ergonomic workstations with sit/stand desks, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years, generous employer-paid insurance coverage (medical, dental, and vision) for you and your family, 401k matching and more.  More about Atlassian  Software is changing the world, and we're at the center of it all. With a customer list that reads like a who's who in tech, and a highly disruptive business model, we're advancing the art of team collaboration with products like Jira Software, Confluence, Bitbucket, and Trello. Driven by honest values, an amazing culture, and consistent revenue growth, we're out to unleash the potential of every team. From Amsterdam and Austin to Sydney and San Francisco, we're looking for people who are powered by passion and eager to do the best work of their lives in a highly autonomous yet collaborative, no B.S. environment. Additional Information We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.SDL2017

Name: Privacy Analyst
Description: Ref#: R0014821 Our mission. As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.  The team. Our Legal team ensures that Indeed complies with the highest standards of business, law, and ethics, while providing Indeed's clients with excellent customer service and Indeed's management with the information and guidance required to succeed around the world. Every month, over 200 million people count on us to help them find jobs, publish their resumes, process their job applications, and connect them to qualified candidates for their job openings. Simply put, we help guide the people who help people get jobs.  Your job. How this department worksWe value the trust our users place in us to keep their personal data safe and secure, which is why we want to be at the forefront of data privacy and protection for our users. This means putting in place the appropriate safeguards and system infrastructure to make sure that user data is never misused and is always secure. With the progress in the field of information and communication technologies, new technical challenges to privacy and data protection have emerged. Indeed’s Privacy Department works to ensure that we are the best possible custodians of our users’ data and are at the forefront of industry data privacy and protection standards. Position SummaryThe Privacy Analyst supports the efforts of the Privacy Department; working closely with all stakeholders and the Privacy Engineering team to support the development and maintenance of ongoing privacy-related efforts across the organization. The individual in this position also helps to manage compliance reporting requirements, and participates in the development and maintenance of the auditing and monitoring process for Indeed’s Privacy Department. ResponsibilitiesYou will be responsible for providing oversight and guidance on privacy related initiatives, subject matter expertise on privacy laws and regulations, proactive and effective communication with internal and external parties, collaborative resolution of business issues, and exceptional customer service for internal and external clients.Work with our Privacy Engineering Team to implement and monitor privacy compliance programsUnderstand the flow of information and how the information is utilized and use that knowledge to support the integrity of the Privacy compliance programAssist in regulatory reviews, data protection audits, and privacy reviewsCommunicate with teams affected by new laws and regulations and monitors to assure that necessary changes to policies and procedures are madeServe as an internal expert resource for privacy complianceRespond to technical and procedural questionsIdentify and guide resolution for privacy compliance issues including effective communication of these issues to other business units.Review new engineering and product data use cases to ensure ongoing compliance with Privacy policiesAssist engineering teams with questions related to Privacy policiesComplete other related duties and special projects as assigned. About you. Required Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree or higher (or equivalent work experience)1+ years demonstrated work experience in a dynamic and fast-paced environmentMust possess a strong technical aptitude and be able to effectively communicate with technology professionals; data analysis and/or coding skills are highly preferred. Excellent written and verbal communication skills Highly developed analytical, problem recognition and resolution, project management, and organizational skills with strong attention to detail and accuracyProven experience managing multiple high priority projects and assignments simultaneously with minimal supervisionAble to make consistent decisions and apply prior knowledge to new situationsPassionate about digging into a problem and figuring it outPrevious experience in a software development environment is highly preferred.

Description: Job Number: R0039754 Program AnalystKey Role:  Plan, analyze, and evaluate the effectiveness of operating programs. Use source data to evaluate the effectiveness of programs and business processes. Use qualitative and quantitative analytical expertise to assess the effectiveness of the operations. Manipulate data to present program status and make recommendations on improving business processes. Name: Operations Analyst - Implementation Specialist
Description: Sensitech Inc. is a world leader in supply chain visibility and logistics security services, offering the only active monitoring solutions that provide organizations with complete cargo visibility and supply chain security from origin to destination. Using Sensitech Inc.’s layered solutions, organizations can actively monitor cargo in the global supply chain, to mitigate the risks associated with delayed arrival, theft, spoilage, counterfeiting, diversion, pilferage and more. Sensitech Inc. is a part of UTC Climate, Controls & Security, a unit of United Technologies Corporation, a leading provider to the aerospace and building systems industries worldwide. The Operations Analyst will work to accomplish business objectives by providing supply chain metrics through the analysis and identification of problems on customer specific programs. The individual will be responsible for identifying, analyzing, and reporting security and supply chain trends to create a value add for the customer. The Operations Analyst is also responsible for new customer integration and training on Sensitech security monitoring platforms. This position is located in the beautiful Arboretum area of Austin, Texas and is a full-time position.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIESDuties include, but are not limited to:Identifies program/project requirements, EFS/LPM account implementation & maintenanceNew program/project integration and training on Sensitech platformsPerforms quality audits on customer specific information as it relates to service deliveryConducts internal quarterly client auditsMaintains systems by researching and resolving problems; maintaining systems integrity and securityPrepares reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing informationPrepares and assists in Operations Reviews and Special ProjectsControl Center efficiencies, invoicing assistance, and international relationsContributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as neededCompany Support as neededQualification: Proficiency in Microsoft Office, data management, analytical skills, and logistical securityAbility to multi-taskExcellent customer service skills that include but not limited to assessment of customer needs, meeting quality standards, and evaluating customer satisfactionExcellent interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work effectively with a wide range of individuals in a diverse environment, understands business etiquetteAbility to foster a cooperative work atmosphere and build teamsAbility to travel if neededEH&S REQUIREMENTSComply with the EH&S Policy and applicable regulatory and company EH&S rules and requirementsReport to supervision conditions or practices that are either unsafe or that may adversely impact the environment, to ensure prompt resolution of potential hazardsAttend scheduled EH&S training programActively support the organization’s efforts to meet or exceed EH&S goals and plansRecommend improved EH&S practicesEducation: BA/BS in Supply Chain, Transportation and Logistics Management, Organizational Security and Management, preferred or related field, orAssociates degree in Security Management, Logistics and Supply Chain Management, or related field with 2+ years’ experience, or4+ years’ experience in related fieldUnited Technologies Corporation is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

Name: Compensation Analyst
Description: About CrowdStrike CrowdStrike started with a mission to revolutionize the entire approach companies take to security. CrowdStrike has disrupted the multi-billion dollar endpoint security market with innovative technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering. Our groundbreaking technology ensures that organizations can not only defend themselves but also do so in an efficient and future-proof manner. Today, the company continues to drive major innovations around AI/machine learning, behavioral-based prevention and detection, etc.to stay ahead of adversaries. We are one of the World's Most 50 Innovative Companies according to MIT, and one of Forbes Most Promising Companies.  We have received a number of exciting awards including:June 2018: Closed over $200 million, led by General Atlantic, Accel and IVP, with participation from March Capital and CapitalG (Google), achieving a valuation of more than $3 billion.April 2018: CrowdStrike Wins SC Award for Best Security Company Second Year in a Row.October 2017: 100 Best Medium Workplaces for 2017 by Fortune magazine.About the Role As a Compensation Analyst, you will report to the Head of Compensation and be an integral part of the People organization. You will support and administer compensation programs, processes and initiatives that span across multiple functions and represent ongoing base pay, variable and equity components. Specifically, Project manage our quarterly variable programsSupport the annual mid-year merit increase programProvide compensation guidance to the business in a timely and accurate mannerDrive Workday updates and approve compensation/job change requestsSupport Sales and Executive compensation initiatives and provide subject matter expertiseManage projects to deliver greater efficiencies and HR-related strategic initiativesPartner with HRBP team and People Operations to proactively identify, assess and provide solutions to compensation issues as they ariseBe responsible for all salary survey submission requirements and deadlines *This role is open to candidates in Sunnyvale, CA, Irvine, CA and Austin, TX. What You’ll NeedBA/BS degree, quantitative-focused major preferred4+ years of experience in compensation, preferably within the technology industryAdvanced data analysis skills (Excel or other quantitative tools)Excellent attention to detailProject management experienceAbility to work effectively in a fast-paced, result-oriented environment where many of the large partner/stakeholder groups are located both in and outside the USExperience with WorkdayBonus PointsCertified Compensation ProfessionalExperience working for a SaaS security companyBenefits of Working at CrowdStrike:Market leader in compensation + stock optionsCompetitive vacation policyComprehensive health benefits + 401k planPaid paternity and maternity leave, including adoptionFlexible work hours and remote friendly environmentWellness programsStocked fridges, coffee, soda, and snacksPeer recognitionInclusive culture focused on people, customers and innovationRegular team activities, including happy hours, community service events CrowdStrike believes that diversity and inclusion among our organization is essential to our success as a global company, and we seek to attract, retain and empower the industries best and brightest from a diverse talent pool. CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Name: Risk & Payments Analyst, Investigations
Description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.The mission of the Facebook Risk and Payments team is to enable anyone, anywhere to be able to pay and be paid with confidence. This can mean different things across our many payments products - from providing support to advertisers who need help paying their bill, helping charities onboard to receive donations, to identifying and resolving fraudulent transactions. We are looking for a strong individual contributor who can use data to drive insights that will help fuel the success of payments at Facebook. Responsibilities:Monitor events through dashboards, detect anomalies, and conduct deep dive analysis on specific issues to understand root causeDetermine best paths forward in the short, mid, and long term after identifying the root cause of an issueCommunicate to broad cross-functional teams the issue, remediation, and next steps in time-sensitive situationsApply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and provide experience, risk, and product insightsDrive key performance metrics such as fraud losses, payment success rates, and support efficiencyInfluence cross-functional partners such as Product, Engineering, and Sales to implement long-term product and process improvements to address issue root causesMininum Qualifications:A Bachelor's degree in Business, Science, Engineering, Economics, or equivalent practical experience5+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis2+ years of experience creating and delivering executive level communicationsExperience manipulating large data sets in SQL or equivalent, and drawing actionable insights from dataPreferred Qualifications:5+ years experience defining, utilizing and communicating performance metricsProfessional experience working in an operations environmentExperience working in global card-not-present payments environments

Name: Delivery Execution Analyst
Description: Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there’s no telling what you will accomplish.  3+ years experience in Reverse Supply Chain Operations or AppleCare  Knowledge in a full range of AppleCare Operations preferred  You should possess a highly developed business insight and analytical skill set paired with strong business partnering qualities  Data analysis and numeric skills with the ability to evaluate, analyse, present data and a pragmatic approach to problem solving. Name: Technical Analyst
Description: Overview  Public Consulting Group, Inc. (PCG) provides management consulting and technology services to help public sector education, health, human services, and other government clients achieve their performance goals and better serve populations in need. Founded in 1986 and headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, PCG has more than 2,500 professionals in 50 offices in the United States, Canada and Europe. The firm draws on more than two decades of consulting to public sector clients in all 50 states and Canada to deliver best-practice solutions and measurable results to state and local public agencies, state-operated facilities, and private providers that do business with government agencies. PCG is committed to a diverse workforce which is a reflection of our clients and the people they serve. Our organizational culture attracts and rewards people who are results-oriented and interested in making an immediate impact on their community as well as their own career. ResponsibilitiesSubject Area: Technical analysis of solutions in an agile development environment. Support of applications in production, development of defined projects, and design and development of new features and functions. Support includes analysis of current systems, monitoring of operations and  analytic support of new development activity Job Description: The Technical Analyst has expertise in system analysis of existing systems and new development, ideally with experience in quality assurance. Must be able to understand and apply business needs, interpret the business logic, and able to translate the business requirements to technical requirements. QualificationsSpecific Responsibilities:Translating and simplifying requirementsInfluencing stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.Respond to support requests from clientWorking closely with colleagues, developers, testers and a variety of end users to ensure technical compatibility and user satisfactionLiaising extensively with external or internal clientsConduct testing to ensure that the systems work as expectedRequired Skills:Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skillsExcellent documentation skillsWritten and verbal communication, including technical writing skillsKnowledge of software development life cycle protocolsExcellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.Ability to write SQL Queries to perform Data AnalysisProgramming skills in SQL and any other languagesAbility to follow instructions and run batch processesAbility to troubleshoot system issues and find solutionsAbility to review data, trends, and results to make recommendations on improvementsTesting skills to confirm results to business and technical requirementsRequired Experience:Bachelor's Degree2-4 years of applicable experienceA track record of following through on commitmentsBasic understanding of Database DesignStrong attention to detail and ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced environmentQuantitative skills and the ability to analyze and interpret dataSets you apart:Government healthcare experienceExperience with MMIS and/or benefits eligibility systemsMedicaid systems, programmatic and/or policy expertise #LI-SG1SDL2017

Name: Workday Analyst
Description: Job Description:Job Title: Workday Analyst Reports to: HR Analytics Manager Location: Austin, TX Summary/Objective: The Workday Analyst is responsible for assisting the HR Analytics Manager in configuration, testing, maintenance, and reporting for HR system, Workday. Essential Functions:Design, build, test, and deploy system configuration changesMaintain and develop reports and dashboards by using Matrix and Composite reporting​Review system data on a regular basis to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and completeness; performs any necessary data clean up and sanitizationSupport all current integrations and create and maintain new integrations as needed by the businessConsult with HR Analytics manager to configure and maintain all business processes in Workday to ensure compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley (\"SOX\") Act internal controls\\Partner with HR teams and Payroll and collaborate on business requirements to achieve efficient business operations and an optimal end user experiencePerform report writing function and prepare regularly scheduled reports and ad-hoc reporting to all employees, including executive levelAct as point person for upgrades/releases, fixes, testing and other technical projects as assigned including partnering on training content and deliveryManage confidentiality of data by following established security/confidentiality standardsKnowledge, Skills, and Attributes:Excellent written and verbal communication skillsExtensive Workday knowledge; specifically in integrations, reporting, business process configurationsAbility to work with all levels of employeesWork Environment: This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. Physical Demands: This is largely a sedentary role: However, while performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms. The worker is also required to have close visual acuity for viewing a computer terminal, reading, transcribing, and preparing and analyzing data and figures. Position type and expected hours of work: This is a full-time position, and typical work hours are Monday-Friday 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. or 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Some flexibility in hours is allowed, but the employee must be available during the “core” work hours. Travel: Out of area and overnight travel should be expected in this role. 20% maximum travel per year.
