Name: Sales Business Process Associate
Description: Job Description At Atlassian, we are on a mission to reinvent B2B selling. We have built a $874M fast-growing business without traditional sales tactics. By focusing relentlessly on high-quality products and converting free trials into happy customers, we have created a prolific "Flywheel" delivering over 125,000 customers to date. We believe we can proactively engage with our customers through "Smart Touch" - specific, value-added outbound engagements that generate higher conversions and incremental bookings throughout the customer lifecycle. The Sales Business Process Analyst will drive continuous improvements to the way our Field Operations teams get things done.  What we want to get done Act as a go-to point person for questions, escalations, and exceptions related to customer support tools and processesWork with stakeholders and IT to prioritize change requests and roadmap initiativesDrive the development and implementation of new processes and procedures to drive improved KPIs and customer experience; this includes, but not limited to: writing business requirements, project plans, and business process documents, performing user acceptance testing, and managing deployment and business readiness activities.Use customer service data, observations and market trends and reports to improve the operations of our support teams and customer experienceManage day-to-day escalations and exceptions related to customer support systems and processesRequired SkillsYou're true go-getter with a knack for solving problems. You get a rush from fixing things when they break.You're a self-learner who happily dives into new and complex technical tools to figure them out on your ownYou come with exceptional written and oral communication skills and are excellent at follow-upYou're thrilled at the opportunity to use automation and tooling to streamline our operationsYou have an uncanny ability to synthesize multiple streams of communication + data sets to deliver critical insights to our customers in a clear and concise mannerYou take responsibility for your actions whether they warrant congratulations or coachingYou're able to leap tall buildings and crash through walls without messing your outfit, getting stressed, or having the slightest doubt about your expected success More about our benefits  Our offices are open, highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some fantastic perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, flexible working options, five paid volunteer days a year to support your favorite cause, plenty of food and beverages, ergonomic workstations with sit/stand desks, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years, generous employer-paid insurance coverage (medical, dental, and vision) for you and your family, 401k matching and more.  More about Atlassian  Software is changing the world, and we're at the center of it all. With a customer list that reads like a who's who in tech, and a highly disruptive business model, we're advancing the art of team collaboration with products like Jira Software, Confluence, Bitbucket, and Trello. Driven by honest values, an amazing culture, and consistent revenue growth, we're out to unleash the potential of every team. From Amsterdam and Austin to Sydney and San Francisco, we're looking for people who are powered by passion and eager to do the best work of their lives in a highly autonomous yet collaborative, no B.S. environment. Additional Information We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.SDL2017

Name: JPC - 4342 - Treasury Analyst
Description: Location: Austin, Texas About this Position: JOB PURPOSE The Treasury Analyst supports the Treasury Department in managing all aspects of cash operations and administration of investment programs, in accordance with established policies and banking practices. JOB SUMMARY Performs essential banking operations, cash and treasury operations, short term borrowing and payments, and credit and collections. Processes day ahead, congestion revenue rights and real time settlement activities. Monitors compliance with Treasury Department goals. KNOWLEDGE: factual or procedural information which makes adequate performance of the job possible. ● Treasury Management - Knowledge of the process of administering the financial assets and holdings of a business in order to optimize the company's liquidity, make sound financial investments and reduce financial risk. ● Investment Management Knowledge of the professional asset management of various securities and other assets and portfolio structures. ● Economics and Accounting Knowledge of economic and accounting principles and practices, the financial markets, banking and the analysis and reporting of financial data, principles and practices of budget preparation, and financial controls. ● Law and Government Knowledge of laws, legal codes, court procedures, precedents, government regulations, executive orders, and agency rules as they pertain to the finance industry. ● Customer Service - Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer service. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction. ● Computers Knowledge of computer hardware and software applications, with a focus on spreadsheet, word processing, database and financial software applications. SKILLS: manual, verbal or mental manipulation of data or things. Can be measured by a performance test. ● Financial Analysis - Using financial data to monitor and evaluate the organization's financial position, to plan future financing, and to help determine the organization's rate of growth. ● Complex Problem Solving Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions. ● Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications: especially Excel● Highly motivated and team oriented● Strong oral and written communication skills● Extremely detail-oriented with strong organizational and follow-up skills, as well as experienced in handling multiple priorities simultaneously● Excels in a fast paced and evolving environmentABILITIES: power to perform an observable activity at the present time. Evidenced through activities or behaviors required on the job. ● Stress Performance - Ability to perform under stressful situations and meet daily posting deadlines. ● Mathematical Reasoning The ability to choose the right mathematical methods or formulas to solve a problem. ● Problem Sensitivity The ability to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It does not involve solving the problem, only recognizing there is a problem. ● Analyze Data and Information - The ability to identify the underlying principles, reasons, or facts of information by breaking down information or data into separate parts. ● Evaluating Data to Determine Compliance with Standards - The ability to use relevant information and individual judgment to determine whether events or processes comply with laws, regulations, or standards. ● Making Decisions and Solving Problems - Ability to analyze information and evaluating results to choose the best solution and solve problems. ● Attention to Detail The ability to focus on the multiple small tasks or concerns that make up a larger task or project. QUALIFICATIONS Education, All Levels Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or related discipline is required or a combination of education and experience that provides the applicant with knowledge equivalent to a major in such fields. Associate Level: Treasury Analyst 1 Entry level position up to 2 years (in excess of degree requirements stated above) of progressively responsible experience in the treasury or finance field. Essential Job Duties and Tasks ● Processes day ahead, congestion revenue rights and real time settlement activities to meet critical daily deadlines. ● Prepares daily cash transaction summary. ● Makes routine daily investment/borrowing decisions, and escalates issues to management when necessary. ● Assists with audits under the direction of the Lead Treasury Analyst. ● Assists the Lead with the treasury month end close process and helps ensures accounts are reconciled and variances researched. ● Provides input to help improve treasury policies, procedures and controls. ● Coordinates wire transfers and cash transfers between accounts. ● Analyzes balance sheet accounts and provides other analysis as needed. ● Prepares journal entries to record cash activity; posts cash receipts activity. Apply for Position

Name: Commercial Analyst
Description: Job Requisition ID: 24228  Department: Finance (DEPT_FIN)      Dover Fueling Solutions (DFS), comprised of the most trusted names in the fuel industry, are global leaders in driving innovation for over 100 years. DFS, the industry's 1st end-to-end fueling solution, provides advanced fuel-dispensing equipment, including systems and payment, automatic tank gauging and wet stock-management solutions. The DFS business is comprised of industry leading brands including Tokheim, Wayne Fueling Systems, Fairbanks, ProGauge, ClearView and OPW Fuel Management Systems. We lead every market we serve with focused expertise, progressive thinking and customer-inspired innovation in order to push the boundaries of performance for our customers and shareholders. To learn more about DFS, visit www.doverfuelingsolutions.com. DFS is part of the Fluids segment of Dover Corporation (NYSE: DOV).    Position Overview Manage the Commercial Analytics in order to improve profits for company. Support sales and product management, with analysis focused on competitive market strategy specific to customers, markets, territories and channels. Recommend changes to pricing and strive for value creation based upon analysis performed. Identify sources of profit leakage and work with the stakeholders to remedy those issues. Influence decision makers in an effort to minimize price erosion and ensure sales and product management are up to date on commercial procedures and methodologies. Provide reports/analyses as necessary to leadership team.  Essential FunctionsProvide analytical data support to the Commercial and Finance Teams to assist in identifying value creation in areas including but not limited to Competitive Pricing, Marginal Product Analysis, , Transactional Excellence, and Commercial Excellence.Build scorecard for sales teams so performance is understoodAssist in roll out of CRM system along with developing a sales playbookBuild and maintain market share analysis models to understand areas of opportunityBuild and maintain dealer and distribution scorecards to understand performance improvement areas.Support product management and sales teams with pricing analysis and recommendations on existing and new products based on value and margin optimization.Research market trends and competitive practices within and across territories and recommend changes to methodology and procedures as necessary.Review escalated pricing issues and work with respective teams to resolve pricing issues in order to optimize profitability.Provide analytical support for projects and programs and ensure that team is well prepared with sufficient data (volume compliance, current/predicted profitability, if/then price modeling, etc.) for discussions with product managers and/or sales.Proactively identify sources of profit leakage and provide recommendations on resolution. Work with business and process owners to implement recommendationsProvide reports and detailed analyses to management as requested.Perform other related duties as assigned by management.Required QualificationsBachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting or other related field of study5 years of experience in Commercial Analytics, Finance or related roles.   Skills & AbilitiesSolid understanding of commercial analytics including market analysis, pricing principles (strategies / techniques) and margin optimization.High degree of problem solving and critical thinking skills to perform deep analysis, identify root causes and create appropriate solutions across functional groups.Excellent interpersonal skills to work effectively with all groups, to build relationships, influence and to provide direction across organizational functions. Excellent written, verbal and listening skills for clear and concise communication at all levels within the company and to do so in a timely and accurate wayStrong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple competing priorities    All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age, genetic information, or any other factors prohibited by law.  This position may be located in: Americas : United States : Texas : Austin

Name: Implementation Consultant, Business Intelligence
Description: This position requires a motivated, independent person who excels working on a small team producing results. The position also requires excellent communications skills and the ability to work with all levels of an organization. This role requires performing high level business analyst tasks with extensive client interaction and doing technical application configuration and data analysis. This role will set the goals and objectives for the team Responsibilities:Work with the Professional Services, Customer Success (Accounts) Management, Product Management, Marketing and Sales teams to determine analytic goals, reports, KPIs and Success Metrics for our customersBecome an expert in the Verisae products and data structure and specifically the reporting metadataDevelop custom reports in Cognos reporting platform for customerBe able to work directly with customers on a consulting basis and to build our customer reports in the Cognos platorWork with the BI team to identify updates to the ETL and Data Warehouse structureDetermine operational objectives by studying client business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats.Lead client interviews and create Business Cases for projects.Direct business process management efforts to collect and analyze metrics and continually improve processesUnderstand customers' business requirements, prepare technical proposals, business requirements, functional requirements, negotiating scope and deliverables, and communicate funnel status and issues to the Verisae teams.Test enhancements and defects ensuring that the development items meet the business requirements and are functioning properly. As a part of this task use of our JIRA issue tracking system will be required.Perform demonstrations and a walk through of the reporting solutions available to customersContribute to the continual process of enhancing our products by providing customer feedback, requests and concerns to the Professional Services and Product Management Teams.Maintain user confidence and protect operations by keeping information confidential.Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.Travel as needed. Might be up to 50%.Perform gap analysis with application and/or data structure and submit requests to Product and BI teamsWork with Verisae internal groups like Sales & Marketing to find ways to retain customers and find new customer opportunities using data available in Verisae productsOther duties as assigned by your managerIdeal Work Experience and Skill Requirements:Bachelor's Degree in Business or Computer Science with 3+ years experience in data analysis, BI development, or the equivalent combination of education and experience.3+ years working in client/customer facing rolesExcellent communication, analytical, facilitation and consulting skills.Knowledge and experience in authoring reports. Cognos knowledge and experience desiredKnowledge of facilities and property management market place and related technology products is a huge plus.Ability to solve problems creatively and independently and drive for results.MS Excel skills are required.SQL (Oracle) is a strong plus.Proficient in written and verbal communication and ability to manage all levels of the organization.Demonstrates the ability to communicate problem resolutions to others with differing skill sets and educational backgrounds.Experience with anticipating clients' needs and proposing business solutions and articulating multiple alternative solutionsProven track record of capitalizing upon opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen client relationships.Hard working and a self-motivated who works well in a team environment that enjoys the benefits of a small and growing company.Proven ability to implement new solutionsExperience managing resources and commitments to ensure timely delivery and customer satisfaction.ABOUT ACCRUENT Accruent is a global software company that helps organizations achieve superior performance by transforming how they manage their physical resources. Its innovative, industry-leading cloud-based software and services enable organizations to optimize all stages of real estate, facilities and asset management, from capital planning through to IoT-based monitoring and control. With a proven track record across two decades, Accruent has created the only integrated SaaS-based framework and reporting platform for full lifecycle physical resource management. More than 7,000 global customers depend on Accruent solutions to drive out hidden costs, extend asset lifecycles, protect their brands, ensure compliance and deliver on the missions of their organization. Headquartered in Austin, Texas, Accruent serves a wide range of industries in 149 countries around the world.For more information, visit www.accruent.com. Accruent is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer.Women, minorities, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.All offers of employment are made contingent upon the successful completion of a background check. A background check may include: verification of education, past employment, criminal background reports, motor vehicle driving records, reference checks, civil suit records, drug test and/or investigations into incidents involving theft, fraud, harassment and workplace violence. The company is the sole determinant of a successful background check.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: We are a quickly-growing, acquisitive, private-equity owned software company providing Enterprise Risk Management solutions to community financial institutions. Join a CFO team with deep experience working in private equity including M&A, integrations, & buy-side and sell-side diligence. Expect to get your hands dirty working on current and future acquisitions, interact with the ELT and BOD, and help build a platform for growth.  What you’ll do… Tell it like it is by helping manage the monthly reporting process both to management and the Board of DirectorsFigure it outand improve the business by analyzing results and variances, identifying trends, recommending actionsPlan for the future by participating on the annual budget, latest thinking forecasts, strategic and long range plansPretty it up by focusing on “Board ready” presentations and reporting – always with a focus on getting the point across clearly and driving the audience to actionOwn it; never walk past a problem by jumping in on ad hoc analysis and other business projects What you’ll need: Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or Economics requiredMinimum of 2 years experience in reporting, consolidation and financial analysisAccounting/GAAP knowledgeAdvanced knowledge of Microsoft Office – an Excel wizard or willing to learnSpeed to results; you are easy to work with and you know how to get things doneUncommon grit; you do whatever is necessary to deliver on commitments and always persevere to winExceptional analytical skills and business acumen; you are data-driven, curious, and hungry to improve the businessExperience with Salesforce & NetSuite preferredMaturity, professionalism, and high level of discretion are requiredStrong presence with the ability to interact with Senior Leadership What you’ll get: Market competitive total rewards packageA team that strives for success and lives our core values each and every dayThe opportunity to have a SIGNIFICANT impact on our growing company

Name: IT Change Management Analyst
Description: About Blackbaud: Leading uniquely at the intersection point of technology and social good, Blackbaud provides software, services, expertise, and data intelligence that empowers and connects people to advance the social good movement. We serve the entire social good community, which includes nonprofits, foundation, corporations, education institutions, and the individual change agents who support them. We work with over 40,000 organizations, helping them realize their goals, fund their missions, manage their operations, and develop long-lasting supporter relationships. Our customers are passionate about making the world a better place, and we’re inspired by the opportunity to help them.  The IT Change Management Analyst plays a vital role within the Research, Delivery, and Operations organization reinforcing best practices while mitigating risks of introducing new technology services. As part of the Change Management Team you will ensure changes are appropriately and accurately logged, reviewed and approved, while maintaining and enforcing the processes and procedures that govern ITSM Change Management. The Change Manager will interact with and drive communication and planning across Leadership, Project, Business, Compliance and Technical teams. This role may require on-call support and will require at times for you to work during nights and weekends.What you’ll be doing:Receive and maintain a record of all technical change requests, ensuring records provide complete information as is required for quality assurance testing, deployment planning, roll back processes and risk mitigation.Monitor change requests for scheduling conflicts with other changes and business events; providing oversight of change implementation and coordination and monitor open change requests for missed target dates and other exceptions.Oversee the change review and approval process with technical teams and business stakeholders to ensure that all impacted systems, subsystems and functions are aware of proposed change(s) and engaged with the review/approval process.Schedule and host meetings including facilitating conversation around planning, execution, and post-change validation.Manage communications to internal stakeholders and external customers about upcoming changes/maintenance work.Monitor and govern compliance with the Change Management Process by maintaining and enforcing the processes and procedures that govern management of the RDO Change Management Standards, Policy and Procedures.Create, manage, and document measurement systems to measure adoption, utilization, and proficiency of changes.Identify resistance and performance gaps and work to develop and implement corrective actions.Create and enable reinforcement mechanisms and celebrations of success. Responsibilities may require an adjusted work schedule, overtime, and evening/weekend hours in order to perform the duties of the job.What we’ll want you to have:Bachelor's degree related field or minimum of 3 years related experience.Experience in ITSM Change Management, Project Management, and/or Software Development Life Cycle strongly preferredHigh attention to detail, strong technical aptitude, and ability to grow business acumenAbility to lead, influence others, and move toward a common goal, interfacing with individuals at all levels of the organization to establish effective working relationships.Critical thinking skills and understanding of change management or problem management approaches, tools, and phases.Strong analytical skills balanced with strong customer service orientationAbility to quickly learn and adapt to new systems and tools.Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.What we’ll prefer you have:ITIL Foundations certification preferredIntermediate understanding of networking concepts or related technology concepts, and/or familiarity with Blackbaud applications a plusRobust time management skills, diligent and conscientious approach, able to work under pressure, organize and prioritize a busy workload, and adapt to fit the changing needs of the business.Experience working with Virtual TeamsWhy you’ll want to come work here:Competitive salary (commission/bonus based on type of role), 4 weeks paid time off, great benefits (medical, dental, vision, FSA), 401K matchGift matching, volunteer for vacation program, and endless community involvement opportunitiesNamed to Forbes’ Fast Tech 25 and Fortune’s Change the World List; we are growing and offer incredible opportunity for advancementTremendous company culture and office perks as well as a new cutting-edge new headquarters completed in 2018 Stay up to date on everything Blackbaud, follow us on Linkedin, Twitter and Facebook.  Blackbaud is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.  To all recruitment agencies: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Name: Collections Analyst
Description: ESO Solutions is looking for sharp, detail-oriented people who love fixing problems and paving the way for future growth, while making customers happy.Working at ESOCome help shape the future of healthcare. If you like solving difficult problems while making a difference, you’ll like working with us.  At ESO, we’re innovative problem solvers with a passion for moving healthcare forward. We have a team of talented people who enjoy coming to work every day in an established, cutting edge company that has worked hard to maintain its start-up feel. We’re dedicated to solving some of healthcare’s most difficult problems through data and collaboration. If you’ve been looking for a challenge and aren’t satisfied with just showing up to work…let’s talk.A little about usAt ESO it isn’t enough to provide a software product. We provide wicked cool, clinically sophisticated, well-designed tools that make our customers’ jobs easier. Our products provide them the data to make the right decisions for their communities and help them collaborate with other areas of the healthcare system. The result? Patients get the absolute best care possible. And we’re just getting started.  You’ll be joining a tight-knit group of technologists, medical experts, data gurus, cyclists, gamers, photographers, foodies, dog lovers, aspiring guitarists and much more. The unifying force is our passion for what we do. We embrace a culture of openness and collaboration, where people lead with ideas, not job titles.A little about you, if you’re for usYou like challenges. If you wake up in the middle of the night with the next great idea and can’t go back to sleep until you get a chance to write it down, you’ll fit in with us. If you get frustrated working in inefficient, top-heavy companies and want to be somewhere you can truly make a difference, we might be a match. We are building the company we  want to work for every day and we encourage everyone to take part in continually shaping the new ESO. You love small teams. You’d rather be on a team with 100 “A” players than 1,000 corporate drones. Accountability is a term you are familiar with. You love working in a team, but also are capable of cranking out work independently. You believe in our customers. We use our national user conference, regional user groups and steering committees to get ESOers in front of our customers. You enjoy getting firsthand feedback from customers and knowing how your work impacts them directly. You can’t make a difference at ESO if you don’t understand our customers.The PositionAs part of our Finance Team, you are responsible for: contract review, collections, customer inquiries, and A/R metrics reporting. You’ll be a team player and contribute to the overall success of the team.More about what you’ll be doingYou have exceptional communication skills and are experienced in all facets of Accounts Receivable with an expertise in researching receivables and understanding the why behind the open receivables. You enjoy interacting with clients and team mates cross-functionally. You are a problem solver, self-starter and are detail oriented.  The opportunity to work with Accounts Receivables and clients excites you. You think outside of the box and are always looking to improve processes and build efficiencies.  You are fluent in both English and are versed in Accounts Receivable turnkey. You enjoy ensuring the customer is invoiced properly and if there is an invoicing issue, you are eager to determine the root cause and take corrective action.  You have excellent Excel skills and are capable of building reports. Systems include but not limited to: NetSuite, Zuora, and Salesforce.  You are a key player on a winning racing TEAM. Growing Company, High Change, and Fast Paced Environment are all thrilling reasons you get up in the morning. Wearing multiple hats, building and re- tweaking processes as the company grows makes you smile.The stuff you must have to give us a resume Proven experience with Accounts Receivable and CollectionsAccounting/Business degree3-5 years related experienceWe will be calling your references, so when we call they should tell us we’d be idiots not to hire you.You have integrity… No jokes about this one.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionSenior Financial Analyst Job in Austin, TX  Looking for a new and exciting opportunity to display your creativity with Sales and Marketing Analysis or Product Analysis? PrincetonOne is partnered with a growing company in the technology industry who is looking for a Sales/Marketing and Product Analyst jobs for their corporate office in Austin, Texas. These positions will be working very hands on with a new CRM implementation and design and automate reports.  As a Senior Financial Analyst, your job duties will include:  · Monthly financial review including statistical data and sales and marketing trends  · Analysis of financials including budget, forecast, and plan  · Presenting financial findings to management on a monthly basis  · Research financial issues and overall trend analysis on sales performance and margin review  · Establish financial process improvements and support best practice initiatives  · Additional ad hoc analysis projects as assigned  What should your qualifications be? See below:  · A Bachelor’s Degree in Finance/Accounting/Economics/Business or related field  · Having your MBA a plus  · 5+ years of related experience  · You must display exceptional communication skills both internally and externally  · You also must have a high level of proficiency in MS Excel and Google Analytics or Google Sheets  What are you waiting for? A position like this in this market will not last, so apply today! Please submit your resume via the link below. We are always working with some great clients nationwide and would encourage you to check out www.PrincetonOne.com to see what other accounting and finance roles we have.

Name: Senior Functional Area Analyst
Description: Responsibilities:The Senior Functional Area Analyst must have significant experience with the analysis of business, functional, technical, activities, and events.Analyst is responsible for working with users and customers to document and strategize for process improvements for current business processes (business process re-engineering).Responsible for providing market research on conditions that impact the overall operational efficiency of an organization and identifying symptoms for process improvement.Must have deep knowledge of process and risks.Education:Master's Degree Required

Name: Sr. Corporate Development Analyst
Description: SolarWinds Jobs Where  city, state, country What  job title, keywords Home  View All Jobs  (211) Solarwinds Inc.  Sr. Corporate Development Analyst  Austin, TexasOverview SolarWinds is seeking a corporate development analyst to join our team. Ideal candidates are those with 2+ years of experience in areas such as investment banking, equity research or management consulting who are seeking a better work/life balance in Austin, TX while continuing to drive their career forward. As a corporate development analyst you will support SolarWinds’ M&A efforts by performing due diligence while working closely with functional leaders across the business to build detailed financial forecast models, generate presentations for the executive team/board of directors and implement post-acquisition KPIs. In the process, you will have daily access to SolarWinds’ senior leadership and you will become a trusted advisor to the Corporate Development teams. This position reports to the Senior Director, Corporate Development. ResponsibilitiesAnalyze monthly performance across the business to understand variances versus planHelp prepare monthly board reporting packageSupport investment/M&A activities through due diligence, including financial modeling and valuationSupport post-acquisition integration planning/execution and investment monitoringQualifications • Strong work ethic  • Undergraduate degree in a quantitative field such as engineering, math, economics or finance. An MBA is preferred but not a requirement.  • 2+ years of work experience desired  • Minimum of two years of professional technology industry work experience in equity research, investment banking, management consulting, venture capital, private equity or corporate development  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail  • Driven, self-starter with ability to work both independently and in a team setting  • Ability to deliver accurate work on time  • Advanced Excel and PowerPoint proficiency. Knowledge of Tableau, NetSuite, Anaplan and/or Salesforce.com are a plus.  SolarWinds is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Name: Senior Financial Analyst, Marketing
Description: About 360training.com 360training.com (Austin, TX) is a leader in online training and certification across a wide range of industries and professions.  360training.com provides customers with the training they need to get the jobs they want. Over the years, we have continued to grow our expansive library of regulatory-approved training courses with new content suited for today's modern workforce. By offering these courses online, all 360training.com users experience the convenience and flexibility of earning their certifications in their own time, from anywhere in the world.  360training offers amazing career opportunities for self-motivated individuals who are interested in joining a growing company and utilizing cutting-edge technologies and tools to improve the outcomes for its customers and partners.  At 360training.com, we promote a culture of excellence that fosters the success of our employees, while maintaining a team-centric environment which inspires them to do their absolute best. We offer quality health plans to meet a variety of needs, life and disability benefits, a retirement savings plan with company match, and a paid time off program. About the Role: The Senior Financial Analyst - Marketing will be a strong business partner to Marketing organization. You will be responsible for performing research, interpreting data and providing insights regarding the market, trends, competitors, potential and existing customers and current campaigns. We have millions of ecommerce customers and a growing global B2B organization. Understanding ecommerce and Google Analytics is critical for this role. With the guidance of the new marketing analyst, we want to continue growing the ecommerce business, targeting customers who would benefit from our elearning, and identify and grow the expanding B2B area. We need an individual that can be a strong team member for our marketing team.  Responsibilities:  · Collecting data on consumers, competitors and market place and consolidating information into actionable items, reports and presentations.  · Understanding business objectives and designing surveys to discover prospective customers' preferences.  · Compiling and analyzing statistical data using modern and traditional methods to collect it.  · Take ownership of P&L at multiple levels of the company. Looking at pricing and profitability by campaign, sales channel, or at a summary level.  · Interpret data, formulate reports and make recommendations.  · Use online market research and catalogue findings to databases.  · Provide competitive analysis on various companies' market offerings, identify market trends, pricing/business models, sales and methods of operation.  · Evaluate program methodology and key data to ensure that data on the releases are accurate and the angle of the release is correct.  · Remain fully informed on market trends, other parties researches and implement best practices.  · Create dashboards and KPI tracking for the business.  · Utilize a variety of systems to collect and compile data, such as Adwords and Google Analytics.  · Develop actionable, informed financial insights to assist executive decision-makers throughout the Company.  · Work closely with Finance to align results, identify drivers for results, detect anomalies and create seamless processes for reporting.  · Develop detailed financial models for marketing programs and campaigns.  · Drive the development and production of marketing budgets, pacing and recurring forecasts.  Minimum Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:  · 5+ years experience in a related role.  · Bachelor's degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, or Marketing. Master's degree preferred.  · Extensive experience with financial systems and business intelligence tools for data reporting and modeling.  · Experience with Google analytics and Google Adwords is strongly preferred.  · Demonstrated ability to drive continuous improvement and solve problems in a team environment.  · Ability to analyze data for trends and make recommendations.  · Ability to work collaboratively on special project teams.  · Demonstrated ability as a self-starter with an exceptionally strong work ethic that allows the candidate to thrive in a challenging, fast-paced work environment with little day-to-day supervision and guidance.  · Extremely detail oriented.  · Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills. Ability to have fun and bring a sense of humor to work.

Name: Pricing Analyst
Description: The Pricing Analyst is responsible for developing pricing strategies and tactics that support the goals of a group of categories using pricing software and analysis. The Pricing Analyst will collaborate with Merchandising Category Managers and other support teams to deliver desired business outcomes.  More specifically, the Pricing Analyst will work directly with Merchandising Category Managers to understand the business opportunities and nuances, and develop a recommended pricing solution through pricing analytics. The role is a mix of hard and soft skills: Day-to-day duties will include using dunnhumby PriceStrat software to recommend and manage pricing for a set of categories. Analytics outside of our main tool may be developed using a combination of strategy and pricing frameworks and data manipulated via database reporting tools, SQL, Alteryx, Excel, R, and Tableau. The Pricing Analyst will influence pricing action by translating analytics into everyday language, presentations, and visuals to gain support for our recommendations.  This job is part of our merchandising evolution. Join us now in ATX!  Learn more at www.joinwholefoods.com/merchandising. RESPONSIBILITIES:Pricing Strategy:Collaborate with pricing and merchandising leadership to understand business issues, develop data and translate into appropriate pricing strategiesAnalytical Influence and Leadership:Determine areas of business where innovative analytical solutions may be used to drive business growth, create analysis, and develop recommendationsDevelop analytical presentations and communicate them to merchandising partnersNavigate ambiguity to get to recommendations, solutions and resultsCategory Analytics:Communicate pricing trends and supporting analytics to pricing, merchandising, and leadershipCreate relevant category analytical tools/reports/dashboards that encompass pricing data in connection with consumer, customer, and competitor insightsOngoing Price Management:Manage, analyze, and recommend price changes for a group of categoriesEvaluate effectiveness of pricing methods and rules. Identify opportunities and recommend refinements to pricing zones, competitive match levels, rounding rules, attribute premiums, and the likeImprove accuracy of forecast of financial impact of proposed price changesDevelop ad-hoc pricing analyses and recommendations as neededAdditional duties as assigned or requiredQUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Analytical Business Specialty, or commensurate retail experience preferred3 years of experience in retail, analysis, and/or pricing preferredProficient in a wide range of analytical, quantitative, and statistical techniques and tools to derive insights from large, complex data environmentsAdvanced Excel skills requiredExperience with SQL and database reporting preferredExperience with third-party pricing software preferred (e.g., PriceStrat, Revionics, DemandTec, ClearDemand)Experience with statistical analysis software packages a bonus (e.g., R, SAS, SPSS, Stata)Excellent communication skills including listening, verbal and written, and influencing othersExceptional teamwork and collaboration skillsStrong organizational, planning, and time management skillsStrong work ethic complemented with a positive, can-do attitude At Whole Foods Market we provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all team members and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. Whole Foods Market hires and promotes individuals solely on the basis of their qualifications for the position to be filled.

Name: WW Business Operations Manager, Apple Retail Contact Center
Description: SummaryThis position will manage a global team of operations analysts focused on operational excellence. The role will be a part of the WW Business Operations team, with a particular focus on performance management and decisions support for Apple’s Retail Contact Center. This position will have a direct role in managing the performance of key operational metrics for the Retail Contact Center (RCC) Order Administration group. The role requires a thorough understanding of contact center performance metrics and analytics. This position will drive operational performance improvement at vendor and Apple contact center sites. Using data, the role will make operational improvement recommendations and develop performance improvement plans. This position will perform root cause analysis working with contact center management. They will follow a structured process for identifying issues and help the contact centers teams create action plans that will ensure solutions can be measured and evaluated for effectiveness. The position will work to support RCC sites around the world and will interact with Contact Center management, Directors, Vendor Managers, Operations, Strategy, Legal and Finance. Experience managing a team, 3+ years preferred Experience working in a global role Experience developing relationships with senior stakeholders Attention to detail and the ability to manage complex processes Effective presentation skills and be able to explain complex data and charts in a concise manner to large audiences Distinctive problem-solving and project management skills Excellent communication and facilitation skills with the ability to work in a highly cross-functional environment An affinity to “talking with numbers”; inherent aptitude to quantify and support conclusions with data Advanced Excel Proficiency with Tableau a plus Strong work ethic and ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines and timelines Ability to maintain a positive attitude in high stress situations and multitask in an extremely dynamic environment Answer complex questions through data, analysis, and clearly communicate findings to multi-functional teams for direction Able to accommodate domestic and international travel Develop and lead a global team of analysts to achieve established goals and objectives. Define, measure and track performance, ensuring end-to-end visibility of metrics, and driving consistency across regions. Perform quantitative analysis that translates data into actionable insights and track and analyze key product usage and team productivity metrics while establishing and implementing new operational frameworks. Overall responsibility in ensuring the contact center is fulfilling its goals in customer satisfaction and quality performance globally. Act as a consultant and provide insights, observations and recommendations to help improve the business Drive positive engagement with Apple internal Managers (including Site leads, Vendor Managers, Area Managers) as well as provide guidance to Quality managers from our outsourced supplier network Initiate quality deep dives to identify trends, key root causes affecting quality performance indicators and define and drive quality improvement initiatives. Collaborate closely with both Site lead, Area Managers and Vendor Managers to drive both strategic and tactical quality initiatives Business Reviews - Participate, initiate and facilitate business reviews as required. Perform and develop strategic analysis to help support RCC business goals and solve business problems Drive performance improvement across the contact center (including internal and external vendors). Develop effective processes to enable the RCC organization to scale efficiently Gather, synthesize and prioritize business needs based on input from sponsors and global stakeholders Engage with the business to identify metrics used to measure the success of new programs/projects Proactively seek out expertise from SME’s to assist in making sound decisions. Ability to identify opportunities to automate and streamline processes  Partner with global partners to provide input into quarterly and annual business planning Partner with reporting team to automate and streamline processes related to data management Partner with Apple Online Store and RCC leadership on capital projectsEducation & ExperienceBachelor’s degree, MBA a plus. 8+ years of experience in operations, analytics, management consulting, investment banking, corporate strategy, or equivalent experience in a technology company

Name: Risk Analyst, Investigations
Description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.  The mission of the Facebook Risk and Payments team is to enable anyone, anywhere to be able to pay and be paid with confidence. This can mean different things across our many payments products - from providing support to advertisers who need help paying their bill, helping charities onboard to receive donations, to identifying and resolving fraudulent transactions. We are looking for a strong individual contributor who can use data to drive insights that will help fuel the success of payments at Facebook. Responsibilities:Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and provide experience, risk, and product insights.Drive key performance metrics such as fraud losses, payment success rates, and support efficiency.Influence cross-functional partners such as Product, Engineering, and Sales to make product and process improvements.Mininum Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Business, Science, Engineering, Economics, or equivalent practical experience.2+ years experience doing quantitative analysis.Experience manipulating data sets in SQL or equivalent, and drawing actionable insights from data.Preferred Qualifications:Proficient at defining, utilizing and communicating performance metrics.Strong communication and presentation skills.

Name: Operations Analyst
Description: Operations AnalystThe Operations Analyst is responsible for contracts and opportunities for Professional Services. The candidate must have strong attention-to-detail, accuracy, and problem-solving, while maintaining the flexibility to adjust to changing business needs in a rapidly growing company. The Operations Analyst must have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, the ability to understand and develop processes, and be comfortable working independently with internal customers and partners around the world. The ideal candidate has a strong understanding of contracts, project financials, and related data systems. Name: Data Analyst
Description: Req ID: 36034 At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.  NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Data Analyst to join our team in Charlotte, North Carolina (US-NC), United States (US).  Role is responsible for driving activities associated with ADS Adoption for CRR initiative. This includes  work responsibilities associated with the development of functional specifications, data and product  research, issue assessment and test execution.  The CRR Business & Product Analyst is responsible for supporting all data analysis related to reporting requirement needs, research requests, cross report  impacts and developing functional specifications to support the reporting process. Analysts will participate in data related research and functional prototyping in order to confirm use cases related to reporting requirements. The Business & Product role will focus on translating reporting needs into functional requirements, working with technology partners to enable and testing the results back to the functional and reporting requirements. The analyst role supports data sourcing efforts, partnering with GFC sourcing teams as well as ADS provisioning points.  The Business & Product analyst will support a product(s) and be responsible for maintaining  relationships with CRR Product/Schedule SME’s and Report Owners as well as technology and ADS  partners on a daily basis.  Key responsibilities Performs data research to support CRR data sourcing effortsPrototypes data derivations according to report requirementsPerforms data testing activities in support of changesAnalyzes incident cause to determine cross reporting impactsDocuments functional requirementsCoordination point with ADS and ADS sourcing teams BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: -3+ Years of SQL Experience  -3+ Years of Client Facing and Interaction Experience  -2+ Years of Banking and or Financial Services Experience This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.About NTT DATA Services NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.  NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.  NTT DATA, Inc. (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result. Nearest Major Market: CharlotteJob Segment: Database, Consulting, SQL, Technology

Name: Senior Analyst
Description: T3 is looking for a cross-functional data strategist - a versatile propellerhead who merges the best of Analytics and Data Science with the best in Digital Media practices. As part of the Intelligence team, the Senior Analyst will work to uncover relevant insights and collaborate with other disciplines and client teams to act on them to drive improvement in conversion, retention and customer value. We're looking for an analytical mind to guide the evolution of our performance media practice, to help us never lose sight of delivering tangible results. Building a Useful Brand is part and parcel of our culture, and T3 needs a creative, data-fueled brain who knows stats and experimental design to help us deliver remarkable work.KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Leverage multiple datasets to create both manual reporting and automated BI solutions with analysis and dashboard visualizations that deliver actionable insights and drive campaign optimization and decision-making. Lead development of measurement frameworks and KPIs for performance monitoring and optimization of online marketing programs. Work with channel leads to identify opportunities for increasing scale and improving efficient media selection and allocation on client's business performance. Deliver executive-ready analytics reviews and strategic POVs supported by quantitative analysis and clear and concise communication. Collaborate with team members to deliver complex results and presentations and to build client relationships. Support data operations and manage data quality assurance, identify data collection issues and gaps. Support web related tagging, including vendor pixels, UTM structures, and analytics implementation. Prioritize and respond to ad-hoc requests for performance analysis from stakeholders on occasionQUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE Bachelor's degree required. Masters level degree or equivalent training and experience preferred, with focus on Economics, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Data Science, or Marketing/Business Analytics. 2-3+ years of relevant experience in performance analysis and management of digital analytics in either an agency setting or consumer-facing enterprise. Proficiency with Media and Web Analytics packages (DCM, Google Analytics 360, WebTrends, Adobe Analytics). Certifications are preferred as is competency with adjacent Customer Data and Attribution platforms. Proven achiever of media-based performance analysis and campaign optimizations, across Display, SEM/SEO, Social and Programmatic. Proficiency with database design, data management data visualization utilizing programming languages such as SQL and Python and BI tools including Tableau and Datorama. Skilled at project management, with the ability to operate and prioritize work streams across multiple stakeholders and departments in different geographies. Executive communicator who exudes strong business thinking at a Senior level. Experience with media platforms including both network tools and 3rd party tools such as Doubleclick and Atlas. Exceptional critical thinker and lateral problem solver who can distinguish between observations and insights derived from data and research and translate data into relevant recommendations to achieve marketing program objectives. T3 is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer oriented toward inclusivity. We celebrate diversity, not just in commitment but in action. We get it and hire people who do, too.About T3 + Perks: Independent agency, family owned In business for 29+ years 35 potential days off (12 vacation days and up to 23 holidays) Flexible volunteer day 10 sick days Summer Fridays 401k matching Competitive parental leave policy 100% medical (with buy-up options) 5-year anniversary trip (company pays for a trip of your choice on every 5-year anniversary)
