Name: Assoc Technical Consultant
Description: PurposeWhy is it easier to share content on YouTube and Facebook than it is at work? At Box, we’re disrupting – and transforming – how businesses share, manage and access documents, media and other information with Cloud Content Management...and with the Box Platform, we are taking it to a whole new level. Whether someone is building a line of business app, content management software or in need of displaying content beautifully on both web and mobile, the Box Platform can power the content and data layer of an application. With this in mind, we are looking for individuals that want to be a part of delivering this transformation.Why the team needs youWe have a dynamic team of consultants and technologists who are dedicated to making our customers successful, but our customers' needs are getting even more sophisticated and technically complex. We are looking to add more consultative and technical muscle to the Technology Consulting team in order to solve our customers' most complex challenges through the application of thought leadership and technical domain expertise.Why you need BoxBox is growing fast. Real fast. Every business in the world is looking to modernize the way that they work. As the leader in cloud content management, Box has what it takes to enable enterprises to transform how people work together.We engage directly with the largest and most complex enterprises in the world. These enterprises are looking to Box and our technology to transform their business. For these enterprises to be successful, they rely on technologists who can advise them throughout the transformation.On any day, you could be advising an enterprise on how to design an application for a custom document vault or helping a customer migrate millions of files into Box. The next day, you may be advising another enterprise on how to best integrate Box into their custom CRM. There is never a lack of technical challenges.Who you areYou are a technologist at heart. You appreciate the power of technology and how it can be leveraged to solve complex problems. Being a trusted advisor and a change agent is energizing. You get excited about collaborating across all of Box to drive successful outcomes. You understand that you can never stop learning...and mentoring - keeping your technical skills sharp requires perpetual development.Here's the fine print:You have 5+ years technical experience as well as 2+ years customer-facing, preferably in a consultative roleYou have 2+ years of experience working with SaaS and Cloud technologiesYou enjoy working in a dynamic environment where ambiguity is common...and can effectively speak to both technical and non-technical partiesYou are comfortable working with one or more of the following: Python, Java, C#, Ruby, or .NETYou understand the application development lifecycle, RESTful API design concepts, and have done a fair amount of scripting against APIsBonus Points for the following:You have familiarity with OAuth, SAML, OpenID, Active Directory and/or Single Sign-on standardsYou have developed an application or twoYou have been exposed to or have some DBA and/or ETL experienceYou have some information security experienceYou are familiar with iOS and/or Android mobile platformsSound interesting? We look forward to meeting you. Sooner than later, please.

Name: Legal Investigations Analyst
Description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.The Legal Investigations Team analyzes current trends in user safety, identifies and investigates security threats, and develops solutions to mitigate future risk. We pride ourselves in helping prevent online and real-world harm by quickly identifying and escalating sources of abusive behavior. The team is looking for a detail-oriented, motivated analyst interested in online safety, conducting pattern and trend analysis, and applying critical thinking skills. Successful candidates will be able to assess and analyze large amounts of data in order to identify sources of potential threats and abuses. In addition, you must have the ability to operate independently in a fast-paced, small but growing environment, and work proactively with various teams across the organization.  This position is full-time and may be based at our Headquarters in Menlo Park, California, or at our offices in Austin, Texas. Responsibilities:Investigate cases that pose a high risk of harm to the community and identify sources of abusive behavior.Quickly and accurately assess the credibility of potential threats in an effort to prevent online and real-world harm.Identify risk patterns and link abusive behavior within a large data set.Summarize findings, generate reports, and escalate imminent threats as necessary.Work cross-functionally with internal teams on investigations, escalations, and incident response.Identify process and policy improvements and make progressive suggestions for change.Maintain quality standards while managing large volumes of time sensitive requests.Available for after-hours and occasional weekend duty.Mininum Qualifications:BA/BS degree or 5+ years of investigations or analysis experience in law enforcement, security, risk, or safety domains.Analytical and investigative experience with experience assessing amounts of data in order to detect information.Experience with social media, analytical tools, and internet-based research tools.Communication experience.Experience working with issues that includes graphic violence, religious and political views, and adult content.Experience working independently and making decisions.Preferred Qualifications:Ability and inclination to protect highly confidential information.Fluency in other language(s) including Arabic, Indonesian, Urdu, Bengali, Tagalog, or Pashto.SQL proficiency or understanding of other coding languages.

Name: Retail Partner Analyst
Description: The Retail Partner Analyst is a critical role in identifying and implementing partner segmentation and retention efforts. You will be responsible for developing, analyzing and drawing insights from our partner performance across markets. This will include providing detailed planning and organization across all the functional teams and supporting the implementation of our business initiatives end to end. You will drive partner programs from kick-off to completion and until tangible business impact is delivered.  The role will actively work with business analytics teams as well as cross-functional team members (Marketing, Product, Partner Success, etc.) to monitor, analyze and augment the business strategy, collaborate on action plans, coordinate execution, and track overall progress. Your work will have influence over almost every major function of the business and develop a very deep understanding of the performance drivers of our marketplace. You will have regular and frequent interaction with senior leadership across the organization. A successful analyst will maintain strong alignment and partnerships with key stakeholders to ensure that the partner strategy is well planned, understood, communicated and effectively executed.  The role will report directly to the Director, North American Business Operations in Austin, TX. What youll do:Responsibilities:Drive reporting, analysis, strategy and program management of partner performance and retentionMonitor progress towards achieving the operating metrics that result in hitting our business objectives. Collaborate with functional teams (sales, marketing, product marketing, product) to ensure the implementation of initiatives essential to achieving our business goals.Provide regular reporting to the company on the partner retention results and key drivers of metrics for each partner segment.Play a key role developing plans to drive adoption and usage of existing and new features: work with Product/CS/Sales/Marketing to promote features to all partner segments.Provide analysis for partner initiatives designed to achieve short-term retention goals and long-term business strategies. Develop detailed financial, planning and performance evaluation models for ongoing business and strategic options.Develop data-driven insights that achieve higher levels of partner performance, adoption of key features, retention, and overall satisfaction.Perform systematic industry research and analysis to highlight category trends and key competitive issues and opportunities.Who you are:Qualifications:Bachelor's degree required; MBA preferred5-7+ years of experience requiredExposure to strategy and/or E-commerce, preferably in Product, Marketing, Product Marketing or Business IntelligenceExperience with customer or supplier segmentation and retention efforts preferred.Strong attention to detail and excellent organization skillsDemonstrated track record of creative and structured approach to problem solvingProven excellence in program and project management.Ability to build effective relationships across a matrix of functional teamsKey Behaviors for Success in the Role: Ability to work both at the 30,000-feet level for the overall business, as well as the ground level to gather insights or drive executionPassion and tenacity for solving problems through creativity and resourcefulnessDesire and ability to learn quicklyStrong internal partner management skillsLogic and common sense in performing quantitative analyses and sharp sensitivity to implications and impactDirect and clear approach to communicationComfortable dealing with uncertainty by creating structure and prioritizing effectivelyAbility to inspire and motivate resources outside your own internal teamBenefits & Perks:Competitive health and insurance benefits.Competitive salary.Annual target bonus or commission.Parental leave for up to 20 weeks (dependent on eligibility).Paid vacation and sick time.Employee Stock Purchase Program.Free snacks and beverages.Frequent company update talks with our leadership team.Free listing on HomeAway.com.Electronic, adjustable stand-up desk.Discounted Metro & Rail pass.Casual dress.Why join us: Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them to tools to do so.  Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.  Our family of travel brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Egencia®, trivago®, HomeAway®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Wotif®, lastminute.com.au®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Hotwire®, Classic Vacations®, Expedia® Media Solutions, CarRentals.com, Expedia Local Expert®, Expedia® CruiseShipCenters®, SilverRail Technologies, Inc., ALICE and Traveldoo®. About HomeAway:HomeAway, a world leader in the vacation rental industry, is the place to book beach houses, cabins, and condos with more than two million places to stay in 190 countries. The site makes it easy to find and book the perfect vacation rental for any getaway, often for less than the cost of traditional hotel accommodations. HomeAway is part of the Expedia Group family of brands.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Information Technology Office Support Analyst - Legal Office
Description: Job DescriptionInformation Technology Office Support Analyst - Austin Office The Information Technology Office Support Analyst provides primary support of all technology systems for the Thompson Coe office where they are located and is the point of escalation on all support and infrastructure issues requiring physical presence in the office. The Office Support Analyst provides limited Litigation Support functions such as assisting with presentations and video capture/editing and handling large volumes of electronic discovery. The Office Support Analyst will also play a role in planning and implementing firm-wide projects. The Office Support Analyst provides direct user support, fill-in training and after-hours coverage as needed. This position will be filled by an energetic team player with exceptional customer service and communication skills. The ideal candidate will have the ability to communicate with all levels of firm personnel, solve technical problems quickly, and will be able to organize, prioritize and accomplish multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment. High attention to detail as well as clear and accurate documentation skill is required.  Please refer all qualified candidates to sryan@thompsoncoe.com. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Takes ownership of incoming support requests either directly from users or as assigned, and completes those requests ensuring a high level of customer satisfaction. Updates and maintains support ticketing system and reference guides/knowledgebase as needed.Provides local and firmwide end-user support via Skype, voicemail, e-mail and direct contact during both business and non-business hours as needed. Works with firm-wide support team to ensure that departmental coverage commitments are met.Provides infrastructure and back office systems support, typically under the direction of the Infrastructure and Security Manager or the IT Director.Executes on-boarding and off-boarding procedures including account and hardware setup as well as quality control procedures. Makes sure all appropriate documentation and communications to involved parties are completed.Works with Technology Adoption team to make sure new hire and on-going training requirements are met.Maintains local office inventory, making sure necessary items such as flash drives and replacement hard drives are kept adequately stocked. Makes sure that any “checked out” items such as laptops or mobile MiFi devices are tracked and properly returned. Maintains an inventory of “ready-to-go” laptops and desktops to fulfill unexpected requests.Working with the IT Director and other IT Managers, develop and implement new and updated technologies along with user best practices.May be assigned the management and implementation of small technology projects, both for the local office and firm-wide.May travel to other offices to provide support or as part of a project roll-out team.Provides basic Litigation Support tasks such as assisting with presentations and video capture/editing and assisting the legal teams to download, process and manage electronic discovery data.Troubleshoot and support applications and technology including:Microsoft Office 2010/2016 SuiteOffice 365/Exchange OnlineSkype for BusinessiManage DMSIntapp TimeCitrixMimecast AdministrationAdobe Acrobat ProfessionalWireless network connections/VPN ConnectivityAudio/Video conferencing with LifeSize systemsWindows 7/Windows 10 OSDragon Naturally SpeakingWorkshareElite Enterprise/WebviewDell and Lenovo PCs, laptops, iOS and Android mobile devices, HP printersRequired Skills: Experience supporting Windows 7 and Microsoft Office 2010. Experience with O365. Good interpersonal skills and the ability to lead small teams. Experience supporting iOS/Androids and remote access technology such as VPN/Citrix. Experience supporting standard law firm software such as iManage, Acrobat Pro, WorkShare and Intapp Time. Working knowledge of Active Directory and Exchange Administration. Experience with Windows file permissions/security. General hardware support experience. Education, Training and Experience: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience. 5+ years’ experience as a senior member of a support team with a legal/professional services firm.Physical Requirements: Normal office environment requiring extensive use of typical business equipment (e.g., computer, telephone, fax, copier, security system). Should be able to lift normal office equipment up to 50 pounds. Working Conditions: Works in a typical office setting. Overtime hours as needed.

Name: Budget Analyst
Description: The Employees Retirement System (ERS) supports state employees who have dedicated their career to supporting Texas! The Budget Team in the Finance Division is seeking a motivated and customer-oriented Budget Analyst to perform advanced budget preparation and analysis work. The Budget Analyst is an integral member of the Finance team and responsible for preparing, organizing and evaluating budgetary activities. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, extremely detailed oriented, and has an overall positive attitude and demeanor.  ERS promotes a strong work-life balance while driving employee excellence through professional development, a collaborative working environment and a competitive benefits package.  To apply for positions at the Employees Retirement System of Texas, a State of Texas Application and ERS Qualifications Form are required. To access these forms and for more information on how to apply, visit our career page.  http://ers.texas.gov/Careers/How-to-Apply Essential Functions includes, but not limited to: Under minimal supervision of the Budget Supervisor, prepares or assists in the preparation of operating budgets and budget schedules.Interpret budget directives and establish or ensure compliance in policies for carrying out directives.Perform analysis on and identify anomalies in trend data and prepare graphs, reports and forecasts for Finance management.Develop, maintain, and utilize quantitative MS Excel spreadsheets and workbooks to disseminate data and provide reports to internal customers.Monitor projects, expenditures and encumbrances and prepares budget transfers as needed.Drafts, reviews, and updates the agency operating budget policies and procedures.Collect, analyze and provide data and recommendations that support alternative solutions to budget problems.Review budget reports for accuracy. Consult with managers to ensure that budget adjustments are made in accordance with program changes, policies and procedures.Examine operating budgets to determine whether funds have been appropriately allocated including assistance with the administration and maintenance of the Clarity timekeeping system.Advise divisions on areas in which action may be required to stay within budget.Respond to overall agency budgetary inquires appropriately.Required Minimum Qualifications: Your application for employment must reflect how you meet each of the following minimum qualifications:  1. Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major course work in accounting, finance, business or public administration, or a related field with a minimum of 20 hours of accounting college credit. Each year of related experience may be substituted for one year (30 semester hours) of required college credit.  2. Four (4) years of experience in accounting, financial auditing, overall agency budget preparation, financial analysis, and/or related financial professional work.  3. Two (2) years experience developing internal budgets for a public or private agency.  4. Two (2) years experience developing MS Excel spreadsheets and workbooks using advanced formulas and pivot tables/charts. Preferred Qualifications: Your application for employment should reflect how you meet the following preferred qualifications:  5. Two (2) years of experience performing government accounting work.  6. Experience in computer software including Access and Crystal.  7. Experience in budgeting and forecasting practices or operations related to a state agency. Other Information: Work is performed in an office environment. This position may require overtime during peak periods. Flexibility in work hours, including overtime and/or extended hours, maybe required for this position as needed. This position may require access to privileged, confidential, or sensitive data. ERS will conduct either a TXDPS or FBI criminal history check on all new hires. For more information about this policy inquiries can be made to Human Resources. Military Occupational Specialty Codes: Veterans, Reservists or Guardsmen with experience in the Military Occupational Specialty (http://www.hr.sao.texas.gov/Compensation/MilitaryCrosswalk/MOSC_AccountingAuditingandFinance.pdf) along with the minimum qualifications listed above may meet the minimum requirements and are highly encouraged to apply. Please contact Human Resources with questions or for additional information. How to Apply: Submit a State of Texas Application for Employment with an ERS Qualifications Form & other required materials, if any, to the ERS, Human Resources Office by 5 p.m. CST on the closing date. Resumes will be accepted only as supplements to an application. Please contact a Human Resources representative if you need assistance or require accommodation during the application process.  Web: www.ers.texas.gov  Fax: (512) 867-3161 Relay Texas TDD: (800) 735-2989  Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $4,598.66 to $5,316.33 /month

Name: Pricing Analyst
Description: The primary purpose and function of the Pricing Analyst is to conduct detailed analytics and reports on Pricing, Sales, and Cost related metrics; work cross-functionally with multiple teams on various projects; conduct comprehensive Market Reviews on a local level; and measure impacts of any changes within the organization.  Evaluates assigned price lists for accuracy and identifies opportunities to enhance margin while maintaining competitiveness (optimization).Manage the practice pricing database ensuring accurate costs and pricing for all Pathway hospitals.Reviews cost changes and how such changes impact assigned price lists.Works with administration team to ensure that pricing is updated in accordance with the applicable effective dates.Communicates price changes to management and/or sales personnel as appropriate. Identifies operational improvements using available systems that allow us to report information and update pricing in a more timely and accurate manner.Gathers data and provides statistical analyses of various hospital segments, including analyses for all levels of sales management.Monitor, research and resolve price related issues from all Pathway hospitals.Contributes to the development and enhancement of the analytics tools used and created in the achievement of departmental objectives.Partner with Medical Operations team to research, analyze and price new goods and services.Participate and assist in financial analysis and development of business cases to ensure profitability.Perform analysis of competitive and market intelligence to identify trends and business opportunities.Analyze medical costs and price information; translating into meaningful conclusions and recommendations for improvement and pricing.Manage a mix of regularly scheduled deliverables and ad hoc responsibilities.Other job duties as assigned.Job Specifications/QualificationsEducation & Professional Qualification: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Engineering or MathematicsYears of Experience Required: 5 years in Pricing, Purchasing, or Finance, preferably in the Veterinary industryExperience querying large amounts of data.Reports to CFO Pathway Vet Alliance offers an amazing benefits package that includes health, vision, dental, life, 401k and pet benefits.  Come join our team of Change Agents as we revolutionize the Veterinary Industry!  Apply today! We look forward to hearing from you!

Name: Global Headcount & Billing Analyst
Description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.Global Operations' focus is on improving the health of our products and helping people understand how to use them through both direct support interactions as well as scalable solutions. Those who join our teams are very passionate about solving peoples issues and are strong advocates for the Facebook community. We need influencers who can align cross-functional partners to ensure the best possible experience for our platforms. If you like helping people, Global Operations is for you.  The Global Headcount & Billing Analyst role will focus on informing and managing the global outsourced billing reconciliation, and site location strategy for Global Operations; a multi-thousand headcount operation spread across a broad global footprint. You will partner closely with a variety of teams including Global Outsourcing, Partner Management, Workforce Management, Capacity Planning, Recruiting, Finance, Data Analytics and multiple Operational teams to create tools to analyze and drive visibility to our physical footprint and resource utilization (headcount). The role is based in the Austin, Texas office. strategies balancing the priorities and timelines of multiple business unitsInfluence site & location strategy, working closely with cross-functional partners to understand projected demand, supply and other factors influencing utilization of headcount and physical footprintCoordinate with Global Facilities partners to plan new build-outsDevelop physical occupancy analysis mechanism to provide of our internal and external footprintBuild invoice projection & reconciliation model to ensure alignment across internal and external partners across a complex global organizationDrive change management and communications related to invoicing, billing data governance and reportingResponsible for billing queries and coordinate resolution, not limited to missing invoices/statement of account, ads spent discrepancies with invoices, update of customer details and local tax queries on invoiceMininum Qualifications:5+ years of experience in finance, labor planning, resource planning, workforce management, workforce analytics, space planning or a combination of these2+ years of experience developing financial plans, budgets, return on investment analysis or cost benefit assessmentExperience in process documentation and iterative process improvementExperience managing organization-wide projectsExperience in space management, facility management or project management experienceExperience in resource or labor planning and managementKnowledge in Excel, SQL, Tableau or similar data visualization applications,  Lean, Six Sigma, Agile or other process methodologiesPreferred Qualifications:Python experienceCommitment to work on behalf of the users to create a better community experience

Name: Conversion Analyst
Description: Description:Austin - TX, AUS2, 2309 Gracy Farms Lane, 78758  Christal Lynn Fortunato  20181114-7114 We believe that, when done right, investing liberates people to create their own destiny. We are driven by our purpose to champion every client’s goals with passion and integrity. We respect and appreciate the diversity of our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve. We challenge conventions strategically to create value for our clients, our firm and the world. We live and bring to life the concept of ‘own your tomorrow’ every day. We champion our employee strengths, guide their development, and invest in their long-term success. We hire optimistic, results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people with the desire to help our clients and one another succeed.  As a company, we were established by Chuck over 40 years ago to champion Main Street over Wall Street, and to help Americans transform themselves from earners to owners. Through advocacy and innovation, we work to make investing more affordable, accessible and understandable for all. As we enter our fifth decade, we are looking for talented, innovative and driven people who believe they can help themselves, and our clients, create a better future. Our Opportunity: Retirement Business Services (RBS), a division within Advisor Services, provides trust, custody, trading, and technical services through the Business Trust Division of Charles Schwab Bank, Charles Schwab & Co., Inc. and Schwab Retirement Technologies. RBS is growing rapidly by providing retirement plan trust and custody services to independent recordkeepers, Registered Investment Advisors (RIAs) and Third Party Administrators (TPAs), and leads the industry in servicing retirement plans through intermediary relationships. The Retirement Business Services (RBS) Conversion Group's objective is to manage the seamless conversion of over 2,000 employee benefit plans per/year. A strong understanding of the retirement market and the ability to coordinate multiple parties involved within a conversion of retirement plans is paramount to our success. Relationship building plays an important role in the organization to ensure that Schwab Bank remains the preferred choice for new trust and custody business. What you’ll do: The position is responsible for managing new plan integration, and reviews plan documents for acceptance. The candidate will assist with coordinating new plan conversions and oversees the asset review process for adding investments and transfer of assets for new plans. He/she will work closely with Relationship Managers and Operational teams to successfully transition new business and support existing clients. Qualified applicant will have exceptional communication skills enabling them to interact with various clients and management levels within and outside our firm.  Responsibilities include: Primary contact for all conversion related activity for the Independent Recordkeeper and/or AdvisorDaily review of Charles Schwab Bank onboarding legal agreementsReview of system set ups and databases prior to conversion completionDaily correspondence to Recordkeepers and/or Advisors relating to new businessReview of plan types and specifications to support business exception requestsDevelop productive relationships with various operation teams, legal, and relationship managersCultivate positive relationships and experiences with assigned clientsWhat you have:Bachelors degree or equivalent.Three to six years financial services experience; ideally (but not required) with employee benefit plans providing trust/custody or recordkeeping services.Preferably strong understanding of rules governing qualified retirement plansExcellent verbal and written communication skillsIntermediate/Proficient working knowledge of software applications including Word, Excel, and trust accounting systems, such as SEIDetail orientedStrong customer focus, including ability to think in terms of customer experienceAbility to work independently and meet deadlines within a dynamic environment.What you’ll get:Comprehensive Compensation and Benefits packageFinancial Health: 401k Match, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Employee Discounts, Personalized advice, Brokerage discountsWork/Life Balance: Sabbatical, Paid Parental Leave, New Mothers returning to work Program, Tuition Reimbursement Programs, Time off to volunteer, Employee Matching Gifts ProgramEveryday Wellness: Health and Lifestyle Wellness Rewards, Onsite Fitness Classes, Healthy Food Choices, Wellness ChampionsInclusion: Employee Resource Groups, Commitment to diversity, Strategic partnershipsNot just a job, but a career, with an opportunity to do the best work of your life Learn more about Life@Schwab  Charles Schwab & Co., Inc. is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversifying its workforce. It is Schwab's policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, legally protected medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, military status, citizenship status or any other status that is protected by law. Schwab also does not discriminate against applicants or employees because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. At Schwab, we believe that every employee, through their diverse abilities and experiences, can contribute to our growth, innovation and client loyalty. We embrace diversity and are committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees and applicants. If you have a disability, and require reasonable accommodations in the application process, call Human Resources at 800-725-3535. We will be happy to assist you. Name: Program Financial Analyst
Description: OverviewWith world attention on both the environment and the economy, Environmental Defense Fund (EDF) is where policymakers and business leaders turn for win-win solutions. By focusing on strong science, uncommon partnerships and market-based approaches, we tackle urgent threats with practical solutions. We are one of the world’s largest environmental organizations, with more than two million members and a staff of approximately 630 scientists, economists, policy experts, and other professionals around the world. We operate in 22 geographies with unique projects running across four programs. You will be part of a vibrant workplace that welcomes diverse perspectives, talents and contributions, where innovation and results are a way of life.ResponsibilitiesOverall Function As a key member of the Energy Program, the Financial Analyst will help develop, track and analyze Program budgets and fund-raising proposals, will organize and present complex financial data for reporting and decision-making, and will oversee all financial processes for the program. This requires organizing the data, build spreadsheets and financial reports, review contracts and grants, perform financial analysis and projections, reconcile variances, and resolve any issues. S/he will also take the lead on the Program's annual budget submission. S/he will pursue continuous improvement in reporting and processes used to monitor budgets, and present complex financial data for decision-making to both financial and non-financial audiences.  The position will report to the Senior Program Financial Manager, Energy Program and will work very closely with EDF's Finance Department. Key ResponsibilitiesWork with the Energy Program to produce timely month-end reports of actual vs. budget results, ensuring accuracy and completeness; investigate, analyze and explain variances from budget for income and expense line items, and advise managers and finance staff on trends, opportunities for improvement, and issues of concern.Organize data and create clear and accurate presentations, including spreadsheets, graphics, and insightful summary material.Assist in the preparation of grant proposals and financial reports for funders;Assist in the preparation of grant financial reports for funders; identify variances and issues in grant-level budget management, and advise program managers and project staff on solutions.Work with program management, program staff, finance staff and development staff to assist in the development of the Program's annual budget submissions.Serve as the Energy Program's primary financial contact within the organization to insure coordination of financial management efforts and timely resolution of issues.Coordinate with cross-programmatic staff using Energy Program funding to ensure resources are being used appropriately.Approve Energy Program invoices, ensure the proper coding of expense items, and review other organizational and Program-specific financial and operational processes.Assist in educating staff on budgetary, operational, and financial policies and processes. Participate both in program meetings and finance departmental meetings and trainings.Assist with new hire on boarding and educate staff on team procedures including the budget process.Perform ad-hoc financial analytics that will provide decision-making support on strategic initiatives.Collaborate with the team's program assistants, currently four staff located in two different offices. Assist in coordination of work flow between program assistants and program staff.Assist with new hire on boarding and educate staff on team procedures including the budget process.Identify and advise on the reallocation of resources as appropriate. Coordinate with the Manager, Oil & Gas Program on the proper allocation of resources to meet the program's operational priorities.Coordinate the hiring of consultants, ensuring process and contracts are in accordance with EDF guidelines, with special attention to potential international issues.QualificationsBachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, or AccountingMinimum 4 years of progressive experience in a Finance and Accounting department within a non-profit organization with a B.A., or advanced degree with at least 2 years' experience. International non-profit experience is a plus.Demonstrated familiarity of GAAP; thorough understanding of non-profit accounting principles and grants management. Government grant reporting is a must.Proven knowledge of budgeting, forecasting, and reporting: the ability to perform complex financial analysis and to create insight from a large-scale general ledger.Detail-oriented: the ability to spot trends and ensure accuracy.Experienced in MS Office Suite, with excellent Excel skills: the ability to develop formulas, charts and spreadsheets that clearly present data to facilitate decision-making by management.Excellent communication, interpersonal, and diplomatic skills: the ability to effectively liaise with colleagues in a diverse environment.Solid organizational and problem-solving skills: the ability to be flexible under pressure with changing priorities, and perform well in a fast-paced team environment.Self-motivated: the ability to work productively and independently.Experience with forecasting, budgeting and reporting software packages a must.Environmental Defense Fund is an equal opportunity employer where an applicant's qualifications are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Name: Health Care Information Analyst
Description: GENERAL DESCRIPTION The Health Care Information Analyst performs advanced data analysis and information design work. Duties involve analyzing complex health care data and developing reporting methods to most effectively convey this data; developing strategies and designing methods to clearly communicate complex health care topics and information through various media, making it is easier to understand and use; and researching, writing, editing, and producing informational programs and materials. May assign and coordinate the work of project team members. This position is located in downtown Austin and reports to the Manager of Health Care Informatics and Communications.  State classification: 1575/Program Specialist VI/B23/Exempt ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES Communications Creates clear, engaging, informative content for TRS staff and leadership, health plan participants, the news media and other key stakeholders.Consults with and advises agency leaders and staff about communication strategies, public education campaigns, and public information options and programs.Designs and develops a wide array of organizational publications including infographics, newsletters, presentations, website content and health benefit marketing materials and publications as well as website content, social media content, and video scripts.Creates executive-level dashboards, visual briefings, and decision documents on health care topics and plan performance.Participates in the planning and execution of public information programs, conferences, seminars, workshops, and public meetings.Participates in the development of long-term communications strategies for marketing HIB programs.Conducts research on stakeholder engagement to identify and implement effective communication and content strategies.Develops, writes, and edits presentations, scripts, and other communication materials.Assists with establishing an effective online presence, including the development of a health care strategy for the TRS website and social media platforms, including drafting main messages and designing content. Data Analysis Analyzes and evaluates healthcare-related data, website utilization data, social media and e-newsletter engagement data to develop communication strategies, objectives, and tactics and refine messages.Compiles, analyzes, and evaluates member utilization data, claims data reports from vendors, and program funding, costs, and other financial data.Presents data in ways that communicate key information about TRS' health benefits programs and that promotes shared understanding among a large and varied audience.Develops and creates models, scorecards, dashboards, and other quantitative analytical tools based on a thorough understanding of business and industry requirements.Assists with researching, analyzing, and evaluating other state group health programs for comparison with TRS programs.Prepares, presents, and/or distributes routine and ad hoc reports.Participates on special projects, task forces, and committees.Performs related work as assigned.MINIMUM QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS/LICENSES AND CERTIFICATIONSEducation:Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university.High school diploma or equivalent and additional full-time experience in data analysis, health care informatics, health care administration, benefits administration, communications or a related field may substitute for the required education on an equivalent year-for-year basis.Advanced degree in data analysis, health care informatics, health care administration, benefits administration, communications, business administration or a closely related field may substitute for one year of the required experience.Experience:Five (5) years of full-time experience in health care, insurance, benefits administration, communications, accounting, financial analysis, or a related field.Three (3) years of experience analyzing health care data.Two (2) years of experience in designing data-intensive presentations, publications, and other content.Two (2) years of experience in communications, marketing, public relations, or a related field.Experience may be concurrent. Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's or Master's degree in health care administration, business, communications, or a related field.Experience in developing communications plans and marketing strategies to inform and engage stakeholders.Experience in technical writing, editing, and publication development related to health care or health insurance administration.Experience developing data-centric graphics in software such as Adobe, Excel, Pictochart, or Canva.Skill in editing and publication development including intermediate to advanced knowledge of Adobe InDesign Suite or other design product.Veterans / Military Crosswalk: TRS is committed to maintaining a veteran-friendly workplace and attracting, developing and retaining military service members as employees. To assist in determining whether your military experience may relate to the minimum qualifications for this position, Military Occupational Specialty (MOS) codes from each branch of the armed forces have been assigned to each state classification title where applicable.  Depending upon actual duties, the following fields may pertain to the minimum qualifications of this position. Candidates who meet the minimum qualifications for this position are highly encouraged to apply.  Branch of ServiceMilitary Occupational Specialty (MOS) Code Equivalent Army Military Occupational Codes Enlisted: 11B, 11C, 13B, 13D, 13F, 14S, 29E. Officer: No military equivalent.Navy Ratings and Designators Enlisted: OS, YN, YNS. Officer: 641X, 711X, 712X, 715X, 721X, 731X, 732X.Coast Guard Ratings Enlisted: 205, 360, OS, YN. Officer: 040, OSS.Marine Corps Occupational Codes Enlisted: 0111, 0231, 0481, 0521, 7011, 7041. Officer: 8005.Air Force Specialty Codes Enlisted: 8U000. Officer: 16GX, 60C0, 86M0, 86P0, 88A0. Please contact the TRS Human Resources Department or the TRS Veterans Liaison with questions or for additional information.  Additional Military Crosswalk information can be found at: http://www.hr.sao.state.tx.us/Compensation/JobDescriptions.aspx KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTSKnowledge of:Communication principles and practices including new media strategies.Data analysis techniques including statistical software, tools, and databases.TRS health care related laws, regulations, policies, procedures, processes, and systems.Skill in:Interpreting and applying complex laws, regulations, policies, and procedures.Managing projects, including planning, organizing, and prioritizing work assignments to manage a high-volume workload in a fast-paced and changing environment.Researching, compiling and analyzing complex health care related data.Thinking critically, analyzing problems, evaluating alternatives, and recommending effective solutions.Completing detailed work with a high degree of accuracy.Effective written and verbal communication of complex information to people of varying backgrounds, including organizing and writing various types of communications and business materials; and drafting and delivering complex correspondence, reports, presentations, and proposals.Utilizing a personal computer and various business software programs including Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook, including using spreadsheets for data analysis and presentation.Ability to:Establish and maintain harmonious working relationships with co-workers, agency staff, and external contacts.Work effectively in a professional team environment. Physical Requirements and/or Working Conditions  Work is performed in a standard office environment and requires: normal cognitive abilities including the ability to learn, recall, and apply certain practices and policies;marginal or corrected visual and auditory requirements;constant use of personal computers, copiers, printers, and telephones;the ability to move about the office to access file cabinets and office machinery;frequent sitting and/or remaining in a stationary position; andthe ability to work under deadlines, as a team member, and in direct contact with others. Workforce Expectations Must be able to:regularly, reliably, and punctually attend work;work extended hours as necessary;travel occasionally for work assignments and trainings;show flexibility and adaptability toward changes in assignments and work schedules;adhere to the agency's internal management policies and procedures; andexhibit work behaviors consistent with agency core values.SDL2017

Name: Operations Analyst - Implementation Specialist
Description: Sensitech Inc. is a world leader in supply chain visibility and logistics security services, offering the only active monitoring solutions that provide organizations with complete cargo visibility and supply chain security from origin to destination. Using Sensitech Inc.s layered solutions, organizations can actively monitor cargo in the global supply chain, to mitigate the risks associated with delayed arrival, theft, spoilage, counterfeiting, diversion, pilferage and more. Sensitech Inc. is a part of UTC Climate, Controls & Security, a unit of United Technologies Corporation, a leading provider to the aerospace and building systems industries worldwide.  The Operations Analyst will work to accomplish business objectives by providing supply chain metrics through the analysis and identification of problems on customer specific programs. The individual will be responsible for identifying, analyzing, and reporting security and supply chain trends to create a value add for the customer. The Operations Analyst is also responsible for new customer integration and training on Sensitech security monitoring platforms. This position is located in the beautiful Arboretum area of Austin, Texas and is a full-time position. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIESDuties include, but are not limited to:Identifies program/project requirements, EFS/LPM account implementation & maintenanceNew program/project integration and training on Sensitech platformsPerforms quality audits on customer specific information as it relates to service deliveryConducts internal quarterly client auditsMaintains systems by researching and resolving problems; maintaining systems integrity and securityPrepares reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing informationPrepares and assists in Operations Reviews and Special ProjectsControl Center efficiencies, invoicing assistance, and international relationsContributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as neededCompany Support as neededQualification:Proficiency in Microsoft Office, data management, analytical skills, and logistical securityAbility to multi-taskExcellent customer service skills that include but not limited to assessment of customer needs, meeting quality standards, and evaluating customer satisfactionExcellent interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work effectively with a wide range of individuals in a diverse environment, understands business etiquetteAbility to foster a cooperative work atmosphere and build teamsAbility to travel if neededEH&S REQUIREMENTSComply with the EH&S Policy and applicable regulatory and company EH&S rules and requirementsReport to supervision conditions or practices that are either unsafe or that may adversely impact the environment, to ensure prompt resolution of potential hazardsAttend scheduled EH&S training programActively support the organizations efforts to meet or exceed EH&S goals and plansRecommend improved EH&S practicesEducation:BA/BS in Supply Chain, Transportation and Logistics Management, Organizational Security and Management, preferred or related field, orAssociates degree in Security Management, Logistics and Supply Chain Management, or related field with 2+ years experience, or4+ years experience in related field United Technologies Corporation is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.
