Name: Associate Analyst
Description: Sprefast-Lithium is looking for an Associate Analyst to join our fast-growing Social Strategy Team. The Strategy Team’s mission is to drive revenue growth and improve customer retention through strategic client engagements that showcase the platform’s capabilities and help customers connect with the people they care about most.  The Associate Analyst will be primarily responsible for collecting and analyzing data gathered via social listening. This role will be managing social insights projects from beginning to end, spanning project kickoff, research design, analysis and report design. Familiarity with the development of Boolean queries and experience analyzing social data is a must.  The Associate Analyst will also be responsible for managing and executing analyses to evaluate social content performance, identify notable trends in the social landscape and uncover opportunities to improve social marketing performance This role will also assist with the development of research-backed social media marketing playbooks, establish channel-specific KPIs for measurement programs and execute paid social media optimization analyses. The ideal candidate has demonstrated experience creating and executing reports and optimizing social media campaigns on behalf of a brand or media company. Required qualities include a high level of comfort with data management (gathering, organizing and analyzing data) and ability to develop reports with a minimal guidance or oversight.  This role will report to an Associate Analyst and work closely with the sales and professional services teams to enable world-class social media measurement and reporting for Sprefast-Lithium customers. What you’ll be doing:Collect, analyze and interpret both organic and paid social media data to generate reports that succinctly summarize social media campaign performance and relevant. insights;Collect and analyze information from multiple social media/digital data sources, ensuring data is reliable and accurate, using technical expertise to identify trends and insights that align with and inform customers’ business goals;Responsible for downloading and analyzing raw data sets and transforming them into visually appealing reports that provide insight and context as to what the numbers mean for the customer’s daily operations as well as long-term strategy;Analyze trends and innovations in social media measurement models and tools;Facilitate and contribute to the development of new products delivered by Strategic Analytics Services at Sprefast-Lithium.What you’ll need:At least 3-5 years experience in communications, marketing, advertising, public relations or statistics;Demonstrated experience in creating reports that transform raw social media data into a succinct, digestible and actionable reports for brands and/or agencies.Experience using social listening tools to gather and analyze data to develop reports that address strategic marketing questions.Passion for using data to solve complex challenges and an insatiable curiosity for understanding/explaining how social/digital media workStrong adaptability and ability to multi-taskExcellent project management skillsHigh level of proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint and ExcelExcellent attention to details and are highly organized;Work efficiently, are dependable and have an entrepreneurial spirit;Experience with advanced paid media measurement, media planning and media mix modeling a plusStrong grasp of paid offerings on major social networks, including ad units, objectives, targeting and campaign best practices a plusExperience with analytics tools or related programming languages (e.g. Tableau, R, Python, etc.) a plusExperience with statistical analysis software a plus (e.g., R, SAS, etc.)Moderate travel will be required.Why you should join our team:An incredible work environment – fun, casual, and fast-paced.Health, dental, vision, disability, and 401K benefits.Flexible paid time off.Unlimited snacks and drinks.

Name: Market Strategy Analyst
Description: Everi (www.everi.com) is a leading supplier of technology solutions for the casino gaming industry. Our Company provides casino operators with a diverse portfolio of products including innovative gaming machines that power the casino floor, and casino operational & management systems that include comprehensive, end-to-end financial technology solutions, critical intelligence offerings, and gaming operations efficiency technology. Everi's mission is to be a transformative force for casino operations by facilitating memorable player experiences, delivering reliable protection and security, and striving for customer satisfaction and operational excellence. We are proud to be the gaming industry's single source provider of financial technology solutions, games, and intelligence solutions that power the casino floor FOLLOW US: Twitter - @everi_inc / @EveriTalent Instagram everi_inc / EveriTalent YouTube Everi Holdings Inc LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/company/everi Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/EveriTalent This position can be based in our Keep AUSTIN Weird office. Job Responsibilities: * Develop visualizations of game performance to provide insight and decision-making around product marketing. * Communicate with technical teams re: data source diagrams, supplying requirements, and clarifying business rules. * Communicate data analytic findings to the business. * Identify data gaps * Manipulate data that is not always in the exact format required for reporting. * Customarily and regularly provides analysis reports that can assist with driving the marketing strategy and positioning of products and games. * Assists in gathering high level data on competitors to analyze pricing, sales, method of marketing, and distribution. * Responsible for tracking performance trends, assisting and preparing data analytics collected from test banks, gaming operations, and Splunk to develop insights and make recommendations on areas for optimization. * Customarily and regularly prepares reports of findings, illustrating data graphically, and translating findings into written text. * Performs ad hoc customer intelligence analysis and reporting as required. * Actively seeks to understand the competitive landscape and keeping a finger on the pulse of the market. * Performs other related duties as assigned. Education/Qualifications: * Bachelor's Degree in Business Management or Marketing or equivalent combination of relevant background and experience. * 3-5 years of actual on the job experience in product marketing, brand management, or strategic marketing focusing on analytics with demonstrated examples of market assessment. * Demonstrated effectiveness at cross-functional project / program management. * Possess a keen understanding around market trends and drawing conclusions on competition, customers, product projections, and opportunities via market research, market size analysis, data mining, etc. * T-SQL * Tableau or PowerBI report development. * Strong Excel skills. * Communication skills able to understand technical concepts, then translate them to the business. * Strong interest in data mining to find answers, and ask additional questions. * Gaming industry experience a plus. * Experience joining data from multiple data sources. Apply Now/Connect Later: Job opportunity brought to you by https://www.linkedin.com/in/raylperez Everi is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants and employees will be afforded equal employment opportunities without discrimination because of race, creed, color, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, or any other characteristic or class protected by federal, state, or local law. For All Recruitment Agencies Everi does not accept agency submittals. Please do not forward resumes to our Executive team, Management team, or any current Everi employee for review. Everi is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.SDL2017

Name: Compensation Analyst
Description: Absolute Software is seeking an energetic, analytical-minded person that craves career development, growth and is very willing to learn. Candidate should possess strong process and systems orientation to support functions related to sales commission and incentives administration. Responsible for calculating commissions on a monthly basis, coordinating with regional sales organizations and internal sales support to maintain accuracy and data integrity. Position offers opportunity to gain industry knowledge and exposure to various facets of the business. Accountabilities Will Include:Commission CalculationCalculate monthly and quarterly commissions and incentivesMaintain accurate hierarchy, applicable plan components and eligibility of paymentsPrimary point of contact for compensation inquiries, including resolution, and responsible for providing any additional compensation plan trainingPerform detailed audit of commission statements prior to release of payments, ensuring data integrity and accuracy of plan calculationProactively assist sales force and team members to correct or overcome processing obstacles • Execute ad hoc analysis as neededShould be tightly aligned with finance payroll & audit controllersAssist with the administration of year-end compensation for specific populationsTrack all bonuses, manual adjustments, deal splits and returnsPayment ReportingProvide internal staff with required payment data per a predetermined scheduleCollaborate and assist other internal organizations to ensure payment accuracyImplement and maintain compensation software, and serve as subject matter expert on software.Prepare presentations for function leaders on a range of compensation topics.What You'll Need:A systems thinker with strong process orientation and logical reasoning skillsMust be a proactive, self-driven learner with a high degree of intellectual curiosityAbility to partner with business leaders and develop strong working relationshipsStrong MS Excel skills, including complex formula building, IF statement, v-lookups and pivotsExcellent organizational skills with extreme attention to detail, accuracy and accountabilityAbility to multi-task, adapt to multiple demands and shifting/competing priorities and deliver high quality work in a fast-paced environmentExcellent written and verbal communication skills; must be able to communicate clearly, comfortably, and professionally with internal and external clients including senior leadersExperience capturing and organizing data in a manner that allows for impactful analysis and insightsAbility to be a team player, but also have the capability to work independentlyAbility to work well under tight deadlines and juggle multiple responsibilitiesWhy Work For Us:Absolute is the new standard for endpoint visibility and control, delivering self-healing endpoint security, always-connected IT asset management, and continuous data visibilityboth on and off the network. Unlike other endpoint security agent solutions that can be corrupted, compromised or deleted, Absolute can self-heal itself and other critical applications through our patented Persistence technology that is embedded in the firmware of over 1 billion endpoints. No other security company can make this claim.  Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada with international offices in Austin, Texas, Reading, UK and Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, we are a collaborative and innovative place to make your mark in the world of security. Our agile, high energy culture rewards top performance and the contributions of those passionate about our collective growth and success. We celebrate our wins in our large common areas where we hold engineering hackathons, end of quarter celebrations, and monthly socials. We believe in a good work / life balance which is reflected in our annual employee retreat where its all about friends and family. To learn more about Absolute, visit our website at www.absolute.com or visit our YouTube channel. Absolute is an equal opportunity employer.

The analyst will provide support for quarterly financial cycles. T he analyst will be responsible for both cost center spending and capital spend within their respective groups. Name: Financial Analyst
Description: JOB TITLE: Financial Analyst DIVISION: Financial Services REPORTS TO: Senior Financial Analyst COMPANY: Established in 1958, Goodwill Central Texas is a non-profit organization that has transformed thousands of lives through the power of work. We are the leader in workforce development, one of the largest employers in our region, and a cornerstone of the community. Our mission is funded through our donation-driven retail stores, comprehensive business and staffing solutions, and generous community support. Our ten-year vision is to transform the lives of 100,000 Central Texans through work.  Work. Empower. Transform.  Join the team whose work empowers people to transform their lives. POSITION SUMMARY: Reporting to the Senior Financial Analyst, the Financial Analyst will provide technical support and analysis to the organization. The candidate will directly interact with all levels of the organization to ensure complete success of the function. The focus areas are the annual budget, the monthly close process, and the monthly financial outlook process. Additional areas of opportunity include Point of Sales system, Payroll, and reporting maintenance. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Assists in the annual budgeting process. Includes maintaining budgeting and forecasting software.Tracks, measures, and reports on outcomes from the monthly financial performance: a. Attends financial close meetings with the operating business owners as needed  b. Conducts research on variances in monthly budgets Works with the Senior Financial Analyst each month after close to establish the financial outlook: a. This is done monthly and requires the ability to understand the financial software  b. Identifies areas of challenge in ability to perform to budget Completes routine reports. a. Prepares weekly company revenue data sheets and reports for EG.  b. Runs daily cash report to assist the Controller in cash management strategies.  c. Coordinated with Loss Prevention to conduct donation audit reports. Performs maintenance on the reporting and Point of Sales software as needed.Works closely with Senior Financial Analyst and Accounting department to streamline reporting processes for maximum efficiency and create new reports.Prepares the compilation of the annual 403B information send to the plan administrators for ADP testing.Attend staff meetings of the operational teams in order to best understand the several and complex businesses of the organization.Maintains and controls revisions for SOPs and Policies and Procedures.Demonstrates ethics and complies with the Corporate Compliance program.OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY: This position does not have direct supervisory responsibilities. The candidate is expected to be able to deliver to the position requirements in a matrixed environment, which includes being able to direct individuals that do not report to the position. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:Associates degree, preferably in business with finance and accounting emphasis, or equivalent experience.Excellent computer skills including office applications. Advanced Excel. Experience with budgeting software programs.Two to five years of accounting and finance experience.Other qualifications include:Personal qualities of integrity, credibility, and unwavering commitment to the mission; a proactive, hands-on strategic thinker who will work closely with the Senior Financial Analyst.Ability to act and operate independently with minimal daily direction from manager to accomplish objectives.Strong organizational, planning and project/time management skillsStrong interpersonal and communication skills; experience in effectively communicating key data, including presentations to senior management, board or other outside partnersPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:Experience in a not-for-profit entity/environmentExperience with Great Plains, FRX, Dynamic Budgets software.COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS: $17.00/hour depending on experience and qualifications.  We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer minority/female/disability/vet. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.  recruiting@goodwillcentraltexas.org

Name: Business Intelligence Developer-Healthcare
Description: Category : IT/Software Development  Location/City : TX - Austin  Id : 4598  Recruiter Email : btaylor@prgrecruiting.com  Job Type : Permanent  Job Summary:Leading Healthcare organization is seeking a Solution Development and Programming Analyst to join a staff of professionals in the design, implementation and operations of clinical and business applications to support the organization's model of healthcare delivery. Duties consist of working with clinicians, business owners, and IT personnel to design and integrate a solution stack to electronically capture the necessary quality measures in an Electronic Medical Record or Clinical Disease Registry/Health Information Exchange to support the collection and reporting of both commercial and government payer's quality measures.Responsibilities: Responsible for developing and integrating technology solutions to meet the program's objective of providing quality healthcare outcomes and reducing the overall cost of car. As a solution developer, you will be responsible for integrating multiple commercial products to enable Health Information to be exchanged between solutions. A large part of your responsibility will be in harvesting data from disparate transactional systems and making the data available to a number of aggregation and reporting solutions (both commercial off-the-shelf products and internally developed solutions). In general, the role will include the creation/revision of the following programming artifacts and deliverables. SQL reports and extract scripts Business intelligence Report / Dashboard design and creation Interface design and associated data acquisition services/methods Test Plan and Test Case development Acceptance TestsSpecific responsibilities for this role include: Collaborate with other developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between required functions, clinical impact, usability and performance needs. Work with program leadership to define program and operational reporting needs to included healthcare quality measures, care management effectiveness, program budget and financial performance measures and operational performance. Work with the business users, technical users, and functional teams to define and create the technical processes to extract and convert data from both legacy systems and newly implemented EHR/HIE solutions into a reporting framework that will support reporting (quality measures) and business intelligence. Work with other developers and architects to design application interactions and data sharing, access and synchronization processes that will fit into the overall population health architecture. Work with Medicare claims data provided by CMS. Interface with Center for Medicare and Medicaid Innovation (CMMI) to address questions and issues with CMS provided claims data. Work with commercial claims data provided by multiple parties to derive insight into the managed, at risk population by working with business and technical resources in identifying care opportunities that will increase patient outcomes and decrease the overall cost of care for that payer's managed population. Work within defined Data Governance as defined. Work with the integration team to design, test and complete integration activities which will leverage existing Data Integration processes and tools. Ensure data access methods and interfaces conform to HIPAA and hospital data security and privacy requirements. Assist with the development of test data as needed. Offer new ideas, solutions and/or options.Qualifications:To be considered for this position, the qualified candidate should have: Requires a four-year college degree (e.g., B.S., B.A., Computer Science, Business Information Systems preferred) Experience in one or more of the following solution sets: Microsoft SQL Server â Transactional SQL Integration Services Analysis Services or Reporting Services Information - Extract Transformation and Load (ETL) tool suite Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition (OBIEE) â BI tool suite Cerner/ECW/Athena/Epic or other electronic medical records and associate HL7 interfaces Integration Services through standardized service/integration architectures - Microsoft .NET framework Microsoft Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Framework 2+ years of system analysis and programming experience required 1+ year working with web services or other transactional based data access or application integration methods Strong SQL skills required Prefer experience with or a working knowledge of healthcare terminologies including ICD 9, CPT 4 and interface standards including HL7 Strong analytical skills Able to work independently with general direction and understanding of desired outcome Excellent verbal and written communication skills; strong interpersonal skills are required to initiate, develop, and manage relationships Innovative thinking to approach problems with curiosity and open-mindedness US Citizen or Permanent resident ( Green card / EAD ) is required

Name: Deal Strategy Desk - Senior Analyst
Description: Company DescriptionDropbox is a leading global collaboration platform that's transforming the way people work together, from the smallest business to the largest enterprise. With more than 500 million registered users across more than 180 countries, our mission is to unleash the worlds creative energy by designing a more enlightened way of working.  Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, Dropbox has more than 12 offices around the world.Team DescriptionOur Business Strategy & Operations team sets and drives key business initiatives across the company. We complement and support product, engineering, sales, and marketing teams across three critical areas: corporate and business unit strategy, business planning and sales operations, and business systems and tools development.Role DescriptionAs a Deal Strategy Desk Analyst on our team in Austin, you will be a powerful advocate that helps our Americas Sales & Channel team drive revenue, enables contract velocity and deal structure guidance. Joining the Deal Strategy Desk team on Global Sales & Channel Operations, you will act as the trusted sales guide to execute complex deal structures and terms, think critically and proactively to identify improved processes and approaches, and synthesize information from multiple sources to drive deal execution across all sales verticals.In this role, you will strategically partner with our Sales team to structure proposals and contracts that mutually benefit both our external customers and internal cross-functional teams. This individual contributor role is a true value-add partner and considered the business liaison to the sales organization and reports to the Americas Deal Strategy Desk lead.ResponsibilitiesCraft proposals as the go to liaison between our sales team and legal/financeDevelop an in depth understanding of licensing models and recommend contract structuresEnsure adherence to our quote to contract processes and policies for our sales teamMaintain scaleable operations to increase contract velocity and efficiencyPartner with cross-functional teams including Finance and Legal to review or address revenue recognition concerns for non standard deal structures.Serve as the point of contact and subject matter expert on deal constructs, special pricing, operations, and revenue policies for ad hoc troubleshooting of deal issues and sales escalations. Requirements36 years of experience in a sales operations functionSelf starter with prior experience with complex, cross-functional pricing & proposal execution across sales, legal, and financeClear and thoughtful communicator with exceptional critical thinking skillsAbility to analyze and recommend licensing structures and contract termsPrior experience with Salesforce and quote to contract tools and processSelf-motivated, innovative and has ability to lead both external (partners) and internal stakeholders directly and by influence is neededSuperior interpersonal, verbal and written communication and presentation skillsWilling to deal with dynamic learning environmentAn in-depth understanding of the sales process and the ability to navigate and progress complex sales cycles Benefits and Perks100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage401k + company matchMarket competitive total compensation packageFree Dropbox space for your friends and familyWellness ReimbursementGenerous vacation policy10 company paid holidaysVolunteer time offCompany sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics) Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work. A big part of that effort is our support for members and allies of internal groups like Asians at Dropbox, BlackDropboxers, Latinx, Pridebox (LGBTQ), Vets at Dropbox, Women at Dropbox, ATX Diversity (based in Austin, Texas) and the Dropbox Empowerment Network (based in Dublin, Ireland).

Name: Upstream Technology Consultant
Description: Job descriptionJoin Accenture Consulting and you’ll work alongside fellow industry experts to lead transformational projects, and Join Accenture Consulting and you’ll work alongside fellow industry experts to lead transformational projects, and define cutting edge solutions, solving our client’s most complex issues. And because our clients span the full range of industries - Including 94 of the Fortune 100 - you’ll have the opportunity to pursue your passion, hone your expertise and deepen your knowledge.By joining Accenture’s SAP team you will embark on a fast paced career path to Managing Director that will allow you to utilize your deep functional, technical and industry experience and specialized skills to design, sell and lead industry defining transformation programs. In this role, you’ll use your expertise to drive opportunity—for the company and for yourself—while maintaining the flexibility you need to keep your career ahead of the curve.Accenture Consulting SAPAre you ready to help our clients’ move their ERP away from a monolithic application towards a more modular, agile architecture, enabling the digital enterprise? Do you want to help the biggest brands simplify their existing IT investments, better connect them to the rest of the business and improve their agility? Are you capable of leveraging business and technical disciplines to transform ideas into fully assessed, designed and implemented ERP solutions?If yes, then Technology Consulting is the place for you to grow your reputation as you become an Accenture leader! As part of a diverse global community you’ll both learn from and coach our consulting practitioners as you work to originate new sales opportunities with our clients, architect innovative technology solutions, and develop critical thought leadership in your area of expertise.As a Technology Consultant you will be:Part of a team that is delivering enterprise-wide SAP Transformational ProgramsHelping to define and deliver SAP roadmaps and solutionsDelivering client-facing advisory services to the IT Function of organizations: CIO/CTO/CDOContribute to large-scale, global work streams requiring specific knowledge of SAP within your functional or industry area of expertiseAnalyzing technical and functional integration requirementsBuilding and applying technical, industry and functional knowledge to support efforts in selling opportunities to both existing and new clientsDeveloping your skills as a Technology Consulting practitioner to ensure continued market and client relevancy.OUR COMMITMENT TO YOUWe offer a transparent approach career progression, with a focus on your strengths and continuous coaching from senior colleagues.You’ll benefit from working alongside Accenture experts who are solving some of the biggest industry challenges with innovative thinking and cutting-edge tools.Flexible work arrangements and a range of benefits.You'll have access to leading-edge technology that will give you the opportunity to deepen your existing skills even as you help create the latest business trends.Competitive rewards linked to fast-paced progression.You’ll also have opportunities to make a difference to the communities in which we work and live.What we are looking for?SAP Technology Advisors, individuals who not only understand the technology but how it affects their area of the business; trends associated with the technology; functional area and industries and the value propositions for clients to rotate to the newIndividuals how have a desire to be client-facing and develop a career that involves being at the forefront in communicating to C-suite individuals about how SAP can help them achieve their strategic initiatives This is a fast-paced, dynamic career path so we are seeking individuals who come from or will be comfortable in an "up or onward" model where learning, growth and development are a constant essential part of becoming a successful consultant + Basic qualificationsBasic Qualifications3 years of experience within the upstream oil and gas industry as a consultant or practitioner with a specific area of practice such as joint venture or revenue accounting1 year of experience implementing SAP upstream oil and gas modules – JVA, PRA, UOM, etc…Bachelor’s DegreePreferred QualificationsExperience with SAP finance, plant maintenance, procurement, supply chain, or other modules is a plusProduct or process owner within upstream software or business processesResponsible for sales targets or business KPIsProven success in contributing to a team-oriented environmentProven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environmentDesire to work in an information systems environmentExcellent leadership, communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skillsApplicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of aviso for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Name: Call Analyst
Description: NavientFounded in 1991, Gila LLC offers business process outsourcing focusing on revenue enhancement services. We serve state governments, transportation authorities, municipal government entities and other public entities, using a technology platform that delivers exceptional customer service. We empower talented employees with advanced technology, data management tools and leading edge business practices to exceed the expectations of our clients.  Gila LLC is a wholly owned subsidiary of Navient Corporation, a Fortune 500 company publicly traded on the NASDAQ (NASDAQ:NAVI).  Navient provides asset management and business processing solutions to education, healthcare and government clients at the federal, state, and local levels. We help our clients and millions of Americans achieve financial success through our services and support. Headquartered in Wilmington, Delaware, Navient employs team members in Western New York, Northeastern Pennsylvania, Indiana, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, and other locations. Learn more at navient.com.  The Call Analyst will work closely with the Dialer Team to monitor campaign and system performance to support all collections and servicing groups under Navient. Training and Development**This position will support a federal government contract. Name: Operations Analyst, Health Practice
Description: Overview  Public Consulting Group, Inc. (PCG) provides management consulting and technology services to help public sector education, health, human services, and other government clients achieve their performance goals and better serve populations in need. Founded in 1986 and headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, PCG has more than 2,200 professionals in 55 offices around the U.S. and in Montreal, UK and Poland. The firm draws on more than three decades of consulting to public sector clients to deliver best-practice solutions and measurable results to state and local public agencies, state-operated facilities, and private providers that do business with government agencies. PCG is committed to a diverse workforce which is a reflection of our clients and the people they serve. Our organizational culture attracts and rewards people who are results-oriented and interested in making an immediate impact on their community as well as their own career. ResponsibilitiesOverall Responsibilities: PCG is seeking candidates for Operations Analyst positions located in Austin, TX. These positions will be members of a dedicated team of data and operations professionals who focus on data analysis, data management, data validation, quality control, and first-line client service ("Data Team.") The Data Team supports a portfolio of projects that currently spans more than 10 states and two product lines, school bases services and emergency medical services. Both product lines seek to complete financial cost reports for public sector clients who receive Medicaid revenues.  As part of this team, the Operations Analyst will work with both internal teams and external clients and be assigned day-to-day operational tasks arising from project work. The Operations Analyst will be trained on the specific product lines and internal software but are expected to have a strong analytical and operational focus as well as the ability to provide front line client service. Responsibilities: Data Analysis and Validation Conduct financial analysis of cost reports including trend analysis, variance analysis, and root cause data investigations.Gathering and interpreting cost and/or ratio data to identify variances and trends, create reports and perform advanced analysis when necessaryPerform "desk audits" of cost reports, validating data submitted against supporting documentation Quality Control Monitor and track data received for projectsComplete quality assurance checks for assigned projects Client Service Communicate with internal and external clients about data discrepancies, missing information, needed documents, upcoming deadlines, and status.Appropriately escalate issues within the Team.Provide first line client support via group email box and shared phone help line. Operational Improvement With guidance, identify, document, and review opportunities for operational improvementsAssist in the development of standard materials to execute operational improvements such as trainings, standard operating procedures, and job aids Other Special projects as assignedQualificationsRequired SkillsStrong interpersonal, organizational, research, and time management skillsDemonstrate a detailed and process-oriented approach to problem-solvingDemonstrate sound judgment in completing tasks and in seeking guidance when neededDemonstrate a positive attitude and demeanor; showing initiative, enthusiasm, and strong willingness to learnDemonstrate a commitment to deliver exceptional client service for internal and external clientsAbility to report and track findings, review documentation, and notify upper level management of key issues.Ability to embrace change and flexibilityAbility to juggle multiple assignments at once, seeking prioritization when necessary.Ability to work both in a team situation and autonomously.Proficiency in Microsoft applicationsRequired Experience:Bachelor's Degree is required1-3 years of relevant work experience is requiredProficiency with Excel is requiredExperience with or knowledge of Medicaid, Healthcare, Education, and/or customer support is beneficialOther Requirements:Full Time, 40 hours per weekLow to No Travel Required (maximum travel of 10%)#LI-SG1

Name: Human Resources Data Analyst - Austin, Texas

Its portfolio includes 35 outstanding contracts, such as Port Miami Tunnel and maintenance of the Chevron refineries in California. With more than 1,500 employees and a presence in 14 states, Ferrovial Services North America, generates true value and growth for its clients while maintaining a strong commitment to safety and social responsibility. This position will support the overall HR strategy and initiatives while facilitating and supporting HR transactional business processes.Primary Duties and Responsibilities Maintain HR analytical tools, reporting and dashboards.Maintenance of data in HRIS and other HR systems, ensuring accuracy and consistency of key data sets.Complete monthly, quarterly and adhoc reporting and data analysis.Respond to HR data requests from HR and other functions. May require up to 25lbs, climbing ladders, and occasional work in a warehouse environment.  Other duties (not listed) may be assigned to this job at any time.  Safety comes first! Name: Staff Division Order Analyst
Description: Job Description: Job Title: Staff Division Order Analyst  Location: Austin, Texas  Reports To: Land Administration Manager Summary Objective: The Staff Division Order Analyst is responsible for division order work pertaining to new deck set ups, title curative, suspense fund research and any special projects that arise. This position requires understanding all aspects of Division Order work. This position will assist, and could coordinate, for SOX related activities. Also provides feedback on accuracy of the work of team members. Essential Functions:Works with the Land Administration Manager to keep the department moving toward the department's goals and objective.Provides updates and/or guidance for the master DOI decks for changes in ownership interests, including processing deeds, assignments, probates, affidavits of heirship, and name and address changes.Review and approve ownership changes, new deck set ups, escheat and revenue suspense releases.Approves ownership transfers, pay code changes and new Revenue and JIB deck set ups.Communicate and collaborate with Landman on JIB and title issues; set up JIB decks as necessary.Communicates with working interest and royalty interest owners, responding to division order inquiries to resolve revenue and joint interest billing discrepancies, verification of well/unit interests, address any concerns or questions for working interest owners over JIB and revenue that needs further review and confirmation and explanation of interest calculations.Prepare and distribute Division Orders accurately and promptly.Research suspense account and escheat issues.Respond to requests for information from other members of the company such as Landmen and accounting personnel.Analyze and interpret title documents affecting record title ownership of mineral and leasehold rights.Detailed analysis of leases, farm-out agreements, title opinions, operating agreements and other contracts and legal documents to determine the record title ownership division of interests.Complies with service level agreements, corporate policies, and SOX standards.Special projects as needed.Knowledge, Skills, and Attributes:Excellent written and verbal communication skillsStrong analytical and problem solving skillsAbility to adhere to stringent compliance requirementsAbility to lead and mentor the Division Order Analyst I, II, III and Division Order Techs while adhering to Parsley Energy corporate values and cultureAbility to communicate and multi-task effectively at all timesStrong understanding of leases, farm-out agreements, title opinions, operating agreements and other contracts and legal documents to determine the record title ownership division of interestsMust have the ability to research suspense account and escheat issuesExperience with QuorumAdvanced user of Microsoft Office Suite products. (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)Supervisory Responsibility: None Work Requirements: This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, scanners, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. Physical Demands: This is largely a sedentary role: However, while performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms. The worker is also required to have close visual acuity for viewing a computer terminal, reading, transcribing, and preparing and analyzing data and figures.  Position type and expected hours of work:  This is a full-time position, and typical work hours are Monday-Friday 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. or 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. This position may require additional time. Travel: Minimal travel expected, but is required for training, seminars, and visits to other corporate office locations. No more than 10% per year. Minimum Qualifications:Bachelors' degree in Law, Energy Management or Business related field.Eight (8) or more years of relevant experience with an active oil and gas exploration company. Name: Sr Data Scientist / Analyst
Description: Sr Data Scientist / Analyst - Round Rock, Austin, Texas  Dell provides the technology that transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company we are a people company. We inspire, challenge and respect every one of our over 100,000 employees. We also provide them with unparalleled growth and development opportunities. We cant wait for you to discover this for yourself as a Sr Data Scientist/Analyst on our PowerEdge Server Product team in Round Rock, Austin.  Data Science is all about breaking new ground to enable businesses to answer their most urgent questions. Pioneering massively parallel data-intensive analytic processing, our mission is to develop a whole new approach to generating meaning and value from petabyte-scale data sets and shape brand new methodologies, tools, statistical methods and models. Whats more, we are in collaboration with leading academics, industry experts and highly skilled engineers to equip our customers to generate sophisticated new insights from the biggest of big data.Key ResponsibilitiesEstablish and expand good understanding of overall ISG Server product portfolioContinue to build deeper Data Science practice within the PowerEdge Product groupDrive requirements in the Data analytics team to improve the Scientific models and outcomeBuild models, specific and advanced data analytic tools using big data sources to enable Product management, Engineering and Strategic initiatives across ISGBuild on and improve existing dashboard reporting on Tableau and other visual tools.Research and document data sources and relevant outcomes creating end-to-end process, flowsUse business rules and processes to design data quality rules for automated production of data and use of tools where possibleWork in a team environment and serve as technical/data subject matter expert for projects such as Sales enablement platform and overall Data Analytics framework.Recommend and drive cross-functional continuous improvement opportunitiesUnderstand business process management and business requirements of the customers and be able to translate to BRDs, data mapping specs, and create business casesPerform ad-hoc analysis from a data science perspective; participate in special projectsRecommend methods to improve the use of data within specified areas as well as across the ISG groupsEnsure that the data governance standards are adhered to support data integrity Required SKILLS / Qualifications:Solid knowledge of server products and business regarding competitive landscapeMasters or PhD in Computer Science, Actuarial Science, Math or related fieldMore than 3 years of requisite experience in Data Science specific fieldMinimum of 5 year experience working as a data analyst in a computer Science fieldDemonstrable work done related the Servers business.Experienced in dashboard and data tools designSkilled in Tableau, proficiency in Visio, SQL, BI analysis/visualization toolsSkilled at writing advanced SQL queries and stored proceduresAbility to tell a story using high quality data visualizationExcellent analytical, quantitative skills and problem solving skills.Familiarity with libraries for data visualization is a plusDemonstrable experiences and skills in software development languages in particular R, Python plus JavascriptPermanent Residency or US citizenship is requiredBenefits We offer highly competitive salaries, bonus programs, world-class benefits, and unparalleled growth and development opportunities all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment.  If you share our passion for data and youre keen to play a key role in driving progress, this is your opportunity to develop with Dell.  Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: FloSports is looking for a Sr. Financial Analyst to join our Finance team and work across departments and verticals to provide leadership with financial support, guidance, and analysis. This person will act as an internal consultant across the business to gather information, accurately produce forecasts and help decision makers make better data-driven, financial decisions. You will have tremendous exposure to all aspects of the annual budgeting, forecasting and monthly planning process. This position will report to our Director of Finance and Strategy and will be based in our Austin, Texas office. ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIESSupport the annual budgeting and monthly planning processes, working across departments to gather all information necessary to accurately forecast our businessDeliver monthly financials and actionable analyses to department heads to help guide decision supportDevelop financial models and analyses to support strategic initiativesHelp departments and verticals track spend and make adjustments as necessaryDevelop insights through analysis of actual results and reported variances to tell a story of the company's financial status and risksAssist with investor relations and corporate FP&A projectsPrepare various financial reports and ad hoc analysis as requestedRespond to requests for financial/accounting information from all business functionsKNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES1-3 years of investment banking, private equity, venture capital, or corporate FP&A experienceAdvanced financial modeling experienceAbility to digest financial and operational data and subsequently communicate findings and action steps effectivelyAdvanced Microsoft Office Suite experienceBachelors degree in Business (Finance or Accounting a plus)Excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as interpersonal skillsTeam player and ability to collaborate with other departmentsExceptional problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to maintain the highest standard of integrity, accuracy and precisionAbility to independently prioritize in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentDESIREDNetSuiteWorking for or with start-ups / lean teamsSubscription-model experience, including cohort data & analysesABOUT FLOSPORTS FloSports, the innovator in live digital sports and original content, partners with event rights holders and governing bodies to unlock a world of sports coverage that true fans have been waiting for. Through live streaming of premier events, original video programming, and weekly studio shows, FloSports is growing the sports, the events, the athletes, and the fans. Current verticals under the FloSports header include Rugby, Basketball, MMA, Football, Wrestling, Track, Gymnastics, Cycling, and more.

Name: NEDSS Systems Analyst IV
Company: Texas Health and Human Services Commission
Description: Posting Type: Open to All ApplicantsCategory: Healthcare Practitioners and Technical FLSA Exempt/  Non-Exempt: ExemptAgency: Dept of State Health Services Department: Infectious Disease Contrl UnitJob Title: NEDSS Systems Analyst IV Posting Number: 396486Full Time/Part Time : Full Time Regular/Temporary: RegularJob Location: 1100 W 49TH ST City: AUSTINContact: AccessHR Service Center Telephone: 888-894-4747Salary Range: $4,301.16 - $5,670.54 Salary Group: B22Shift: Days (First) Travel: 20%Closing Date:Job Description: Systems Analyst IV  The Systems Analyst performs advanced technical work and system administration for the National Electronic Disease Surveillance System (NEDSS) and Public Health Electronic Reporting System, under minimal direction with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. Work involves overseeing and implementing systems and procedures for complex data systems. Works in a fast paced, customer service based environment. Supports and performs the planning, testing, administration, operation and maintenance of NEDSS and the Public Health Electronic Reporting System database. This position will be responsible for extensive end user training and ensuring end users confidence and acceptance of the system. Performs workflow and report design. Provides technical assistance and manages program help desk requests. Work outside of regular hours may be required. Travel to other work location may be required. Performs other duties as assigned.Essential Job Functions: (35%) Provides expertise and participates in the development, testing and implementation of the National Electronic Disease Surveillance System (NEDSS). Prepares complex documents related to the development and maintenance of NEDSS including but not limited to a comprehensive testing strategy outlining the testing objectives, methods of testing, timeline for testing, and resources needed. Develops overall training strategy considering change management principles. Coordinates user acceptance testing and unit testing for the application. Tests and approves new development in the application for sign off. Develops test scenarios and verifies that the application passes tests; determines adequate amount of testing required and ensure regression testing is performed and adequate. Works closely with project manager and NEDSS team lead and informs them that deliverables are met according to contractual requirements.  (35%) Gathers business requirements from subject matter experts, develops workflows and question packages, assists in interface layout and design and develops reports and data extracts. Develops and manages NEDSS database to improve effectiveness of surveillance, investigation and other epidemiologic practices. Works closely with NEDSS database users and stakeholders to develop policies, procedures and automated work plans. Works with program to advise them on the capabilities of the system to find the optimal method of gathering the information. Amends policies as required to ensure information is captured effectively. Ensures that the development of system interfaces and workflows are in alignment with program work processes and business requirements. Alerts supervisor and project manager if system development and maintenance are not in alignment with project schedules. Proactively works with program staff to identify program needs and solutions as they relate to NEDSS.  (25%) Develops a comprehensive training strategy. Develops and conducts end user training, including in person and webinar based training. Serve as change management agent. Provides ongoing technical assistance for the application. Responsible for all aspects of end user support, including responding to help desks requests, setting up new user accounts, deactivating accounts. Prepares and maintains high quality written documents, including project updates, training plans, and system documentation.  (5%) Other duties as assigned, including actively participating and/or serving in a supporting role to meet the agency’s obligations for disaster response and/or recovery and/or Continuity of Operations.Knowledge Skills Abilities: Knowledge of software tools that support online public health data acquisition, entry, abstraction, management, analysis, and reporting. Knowledge of information technologies and communication tools necessary to support epidemiologic investigations and surveillance. Knowledge and understanding of HL7 for the exchange, integration, sharing, and retrieval of electronic health information. Knowledge and ability in testing software applications.  Skill in ensuring the utilization of interoperable data standards for storage and transmission, and be able to find the relevant standards specifications as needed.  Skill in synthesizing data and information from multiple sources to create new information to support public health decision-making.  Skill in composing and managing systems development teams in a manner that demonstrates recognition of the appropriate roles and domains for computer scientists, epidemiologists, and programmers and other information technology specialists in information systems development.  Skill in using SQL and/or Oracle databases. & Skill in using Orion Rhapsody and HL7 data.  Ability to use software tools that support online public health data acquisition, entry, abstraction, management, analysis, and reporting.  Ability to use information technologies and communication tools necessary to support epidemiologic investigations and surveillance.  Ability to solve complex problems and think critically in the operation of computers and applicable computer software.  Ability to communicate effectively in writing and orally.  Ability to use HL7 and Orion Rhapsody for the exchange, integration, sharing, and retrieval of electronic health information  Ability to apply procedures (policies) and technical means (security) to ensure the integrity and protection of confidential information in electronic files and computer systems.  Ability to establish and maintain effective interpersonal relationships.  Ability to handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines.Registration or Licensure Requirements: Initial Selection Criteria:Bachelor’s degree (or higher) from an accredited four-year university/college in business analysis, data management, information technology, computer science, database management and administration, or other related field.Two years of work experience in an oracle database or related domainProfessional experience with Rhapsody, HL7, XML, VBA, and SQL preferred. Minimum of two years’ experience as a Business/Systems Analyst or similar job function. Knowledge of information systems project methodologies.Must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship.Additional Information:requisition 396486MOS Code: 25B, IT, 2621, 3D1X1HHS agencies use E-Verify. anddeveloping test scenarios and scripts, performing system testing, and documenting results.Five years of experience with PeopleSoft FSCM.Four years of experience in each of the following areas:configuring PeopleSoft modules;working with application end-users to prototype PeopleSoft modules in a workshop setting;Three years of experience in each of the following areas:conducting presentations, providing instructor led training, or facilitating workshops; andexperience with two (2) or more of the following PeopleSoft FSCM modules:FSCM 9.x General Ledger/Commitment Control;FSCM 9.x Accounts Payable;FSCM 9.x Purchasing / eProcurement;FSCM 9.x Asset Management;FSCM 9.x AR/Billing;FSCM 9.x Grants;FSCM 9.x Project Costing;FSCM 9.x CA;FSCM 9.x Strategic Sourcing Two years of experience working in a lead role related to PeopleSoft FSCM.Preferred Experience:Three years of public sector experience.Experience working with Texas state government processes, policies, and procedures.Experience with Texas PeopleSoft Financials implementations and production support.Experience working within an environment with a managed service provider.Specialty expertise in any of the following:Enterprise Portal;State of Texas Mainframe Systems State of Texas ERP State of Texas ERS Applications;Web ServicesTexas Smart Buy.About our Company: Connecting people’s aptitude & ambitions with our opportunities to deliver results.22nd Century Staffing is a Minority & Woman Owned Business Enterprise (MWBE) that supports demanding staffing programs for Corporations and State and Local Government Agencies. Our journey began in 1997 by supporting large Federal contracts which nudged us in the direction of creating large candidate pools across the country. Over the last 20 years, we have built a strong business model that is carefully constructed to deliver on multiple facets. We have proven past performance of providing services that exceed our clients' expectations. Today 22nd Century supports clients in all 50 states and has grown to be a company that is trusted and sought for providing a complex mix of workforce solutions.Our Global Delivery model with over 110 recruiters, data miners and research analysts working across multiple time zones is backed by an internal database of 800,000 resources across all major industries.With a firm grip on the entire spectrum of staffing solutions, we have placed more than 500,000 skilled resources and delivered 15 million+ man-hours.“22nd Century Staffing is an Equal Opportunity Employer" and “US Citizens & all other parties authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply."

Name: Implementation Consultant
Description: In order to apply for a position at Lumeris, you must create an account using your email address and a password of your choosing. This account will allow you to receive notifications each step of the way through the job application process. With these updates, you'll never have to wonder where you are in the process. Additionally, we can easily send pertinent documents to you for your review. Once you create the account, you may apply to any position you feel is a good fit without having to re-enter information. Thank you for your interest in Lumeris.  Position:Implementation Consultant  Position Summary:The Implementation Consultant is a critical member of client facing project teams. This individual works directly with internal and external clients at all levels of the organization to ensure successful implementations that are executed effectively and on schedule. Implementation Consultants define the specific business requirements and goals of each client, work to configure the ADSP platform, and train end users. Implementation Consultants find solutions to complex issues and collaborate with internal teams to create innovative solutions that will transform the healthcare industry. Job Description: Role and Responsibilities Serve as project technology implementation lead and subject matter expert for the Accountable Delivery System Platform (ADSP) and educate clients on platform functionalityDemonstrate a strong desire to understand our business, our product, our people, and our clientsIdentify and document client business and technical requirements for the ADSP through client interviews and coordination with internal clinical and consulting teamsDevelop ADSP configuration recommendations that support unique, client-specific business requirements and goalsSchedule, plan, and facilitate client calls and in-person meetingsProactively identify and resolve potential issues that could impede project successWork collaboratively with cross-functional team to ensure project successPresent ADSP functionality to senior level client representatives and foster relationships with client executive teamsCoordinate with QA on the planning and development of end-to-end client testing plan and test casesAssist with UAT test plan and User Acceptance Testing (UAT)Lead in development of client training and rollout plan for ADSPDeliver ADSP training throughout the client organization in multiple formats (remote, in-person) to all levels of the client organizationPartner with account management team to drive adoption and to ensure client satisfactionAct as client advocate to collaborate with product management and development teams to define, scope, develop, and implement new functionalityCollaborate in the ongoing development of project deliverables including training materialsMaintain and share business and technical expertise with clients and other staffProvide ongoing technical and business support of the ADSP with assigned client(s)Direct and perform follow-up as necessary to complete projects and elicit customer satisfactionOther responsibilities as assigned Experience, Qualifications and Education Bachelors Degree in healthcare, technology, business, or relate field required, Masters Degree preferred5-7 years of experience in technology implementationExperience in the healthcare industry in a technical capacity (EMRs, HIEs, HL7 etc.)Experience with customer facing businesses analysis and/or project managementDemonstrates a strong drive for efficiency, problem resolution, and consistent progress on deliverables while ensuring timeliness and a focus on qualityDisplay a high level of critical thinking in cross-functional process analysis and problem resolution for new and existing solutionsEffectively establish strong working relations with various internal organizations including IT, Engineering, Sales, Marketing, Product Development, and OperationsExperience managing multiple concurrent project tasks and competing prioritiesStrong customer interaction skills and the ability to present complex information to both business and technical audiencesAbility to manage multiple tasks with shifting prioritiesDetail oriented; able to work independently and set prioritiesMust be able to work in a fast paced, rapidly changing environmentAbility to travel nationally up to 50% - 60% Lumeris is an EEO/AA employer M/F/V/D.  Location:St. Louis, MO  Time Type:Full time  Status:XL - FT

conversations and meetings with a focus on collaboration and actionable results  ?Designing, leading, and facilitating process improvement initiatives  ?Developing and facilitating implementation of organizational strategy and design  ?Championing organizational change and participating in the implementation of new ideas  ?Identifying and implementing best practices for process re-design, improvement, and implementation  ?Using research to uncover insights leading to proposed solutions, refined through further research and analysis, targeted to support rapid iteration  ?Identifying new opportunities to add value both within and beyond the scope of formal projects  ?Organizing, leading and facilitating enterprise wide process improvement initiatives that encompass an end-to-end analysis and future state redesign  ?Developing root cause analysis and business case for proposed technology, staff and structure changes, including cost estimates  ?Identifying key customer metrics and KPIs based on raw data and interview insights  ?Developing delivery solutions based upon the analysis output and/or conversations with prospective clients and creating proposals, statements of work, project plans, project team, deliverables, savings opportunity accordingly  ?Leading and participating in consulting engagements  ?Leading and/or participating in change initiatives, improve client business operations and deliver significant improvements to process, management discipline, bottom line, etc. *Minimum Requirements:** ? This means we are committed to providing equal opportunity to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to one?s race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, disability, alienage or citizenship status, marital status, creed, genetic predisposition or carrier status, sexual orientation, Veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.
