Name: AP Analyst
Description: Job Description: AP Consultant helps to drive AP processes and payment schedules out of Austin office. Utilizes a broad knowledge of financial theory and application to perform moderately complex financial analysis and activities that support and impact decision-making within a department or the entire Company. Duties may include: analyzing and reporting findings from economic research, operating or financial data; compiling, testing, modeling analyzing, and summarizing moderately complex, internal financial data; finding and resolving moderately complex problems; conducting variance, trend and forecasting moderately complex analyses; updating and operating financial models and systems; preparing, analyzing and providing input and recommendations to strategic plans; adhering to and communicating financial policies and procedures; recommending best practices and new business approaches to improve efficiencies in policies and procedures. May own medium to large sized projects. Understands Company’s compliance and risk management policies. Minimum Qualifications:8+YrsBS/BAPreferred Qualifications:Master ABOUT DJO GLOBAL DJO Global is a leading global developer, manufacturer and distributor of high-quality medical devices that provide solutions for musculoskeletal health, vascular health and pain management. Our products address the continuum of patient care from injury prevention to rehabilitation after surgery, injury or from degenerative disease, enabling people to regain or maintain their natural motion. Our products are used by orthopedic specialists, spine surgeons, primary care physicians, pain management specialists, physical therapists, podiatrists, chiropractors, athletic trainers and other healthcare professionals. In addition, many of our medical devices and related accessories are used by athletes and patients for injury prevention and at-home physical therapy treatment. Product lines include rigid and soft orthopedic bracing, hot and cold therapy, bone growth stimulators, vascular therapy systems and compression garments, therapeutic shoes and inserts, electrical stimulators used for pain management and physical therapy products. Our surgical division offers a comprehensive suite of reconstructive joint products for the hip, knee and shoulder. Our products are marketed under a portfolio of brands including Aircast®, Chattanooga, CMF™, Compex®, DonJoy®, ProCare®, Exos™, Dr. Comfort®, DonJoy Performance® and DJO® Surgical.  For additional information on the Company, please visit www.DJOglobal.com.  DJO is a portfolio company of the Blackstone Group  EOE AA M/F/VET/Disability  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, protected veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws.

Name: Recoveries Analyst
Description: Recoveries Analyst-96246 Description Every day, the people of TSYS® improve lives and businesses around the globe through payments. We make it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions including credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services. We are "People-Centered Payments", and our team has the unique opportunity to help create a world in which payments make people's lives easier and better. This is both a tremendous honor and an important responsibility for those who accept the challenge. If you are looking to make a valuable difference for people everywhere — and for yourself — TSYS may be the right place for you.  The Recoveries Analyst will collaborate with Customer Service and third party processors to proactively attempt to recover negative balances from merchants via various mechanisms, including charge backs. Responsibilities:Investigate account transactions to determine whether or not outstanding funds can be recovered from merchantsProcess chargebacks with the card associations (MC/Visa)Apply risk mitigation strategies in the areas of Risk Management, Overdrawn Analysis, Collections, and RecoveriesSuggest and implement new risk strategy recommendations for system and process enhancements to mitigate future lossesCollaborate with Customer Service and other teams within the Risk Department on special projectsAdhere to a strict attendance and punctuality policyAdhere to strict compliance and regulatory requirementsResponsible for phone calls, fax processing, and account managementQualificationsSkills/Education/Experience:Strong customer service background required; prefer experience with escalated callsAbility to gather facts and deliver unwanted news with diplomacyExcellent writing skills with the ability to communicate effectively to customers, co-workers and managementOne or more years of previous experience in collections or fraud analysis preferredAbility to analyze financial transactions and investigate suspicious activityStrong math skills and problem solving skills, with extreme attention to detailAbility to multi-task and work on various accounts and issues consecutivelyPrefer familiarity with the following: ACH, NACHA, processing in payment card industry or bank back officeProficient in MS Word, Excel and AccessAbility to work flexible scheduleExperience working for a bank, financial institution, or with billing statements preferredExperience in database management, analysis and data mining preferredCollege degree preferred, but not requiredAs provided in NetSpend's Background Check policy, eligible candidates may be subject to drug, criminal history, and credit checks, which will be conducted and used in accordance with applicable local, state, and federal lawsJob: Managed Services (Call Center) Primary Location: US-Texas-Austin Organization: NetSpend Corporation Schedule: Full-time Job Posting: Dec 15, 2016, 8:50:51 AM Unposting Date: Ongoing Recruiter: LaVonne Sheets

Name: Project Analyst Sr/Project Analyst
Description: PREFERRED CANDIDATES WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:Strong Microsoft Project experiencePMIS (Project Management Information Server)At a senior level, performs project support services for one or more project managers and for the overall project services function. Understands and uses established procedures and practices to provide project support skills primarily in the areas of financial analysis and variance reporting, program utilization, closeout, account management, schedule development and management, customer contracts, documentation, financial reporting and analysis, budget and cost management, and system support. Performs a wide range of day-to-day project activities using established procedures and practices. This position is fully proficient in all areas of project support and controls techniques and systems. Takes a new perspective to solve complex scheduling and cost tracking problems. Works independently and receives minimal guidance with appreciable latitude for independent action and decision making. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. May take on assignments broad in nature and requiring leadership and independent judgement, such as general additions projects, cross functional teams, or small projects. Provides support to project managers for project control functions such as developing project plans, monitoring and communicating project costs and accounting, preparing progress reports, coordinating contract documents and payments, and setting up and maintaining project documents. Works with the project manager to track progress, maintain and update project schedules.Provides support throughout the project lifecycle including initiation, planning, execution, control and closeout.Identifies, researches and documents variances or discrepancies and monitors and communicates project status and information to project managers and work package managers.Resolves scheduling issues, resource conflicts and costs and accounting structures and escalates problems to the Project Manager as needed. Sets up and maintains files in accordance with recordkeeping and records retention and documentation guidelinesManages the closing of project accounting structure and records retention once projects are complete.Maintains knowledge of standard LCRA project management tools and software, including but not limited to the development and on-going maintenance of project schedules including cost loading and managing project schedules to the program dates. Trains others on the use of these systems.Supports the team to ensure adequate quality control measures are in place to support project goals. Reviews and analyzes the business case with the project manager and team members. Works with the project stakeholders to capture and document the business requirements and desired end-state for the project. Communicates with project managers and stakeholders, to ensure accurate and timely dissemination of information.Promotes collaboration, effective decision-making and the development of solutions and captures and shares lessons learned.Researches and recommends new project controls methodologies to improve project management processes and utilizes knowledge of best practices and experience to solve problemsEnsures that projects are carried out in accordance with all applicable LCRA policies and procedures.Maintains a comprehensive understanding of LCRA project control procedures and initiates process development. Advises project managers and management personnel on the interpretation of project control policies, programs and procedures.Actively supports departmental continuous improvement and may be called upon to help develop new project delivery practices that improve overall productivity of staff and project managers or that address management problems.Provides a high level of customer service and promotes team building. Builds strong relationships with peers, stakeholders and management.Represents Project Services positively and with professionalism.Travels independently or with a small team to project sites as needed.This general overview only includes essential functions of the job and does not imply that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to follow any other job-related instruction and to perform any other job-related duties requested by supervisor or management.Nine or more years of experience in project controls, project management, accounting, business analytics, data analysis, budget analysis or administrative support, including five or more years experience in project controls or project management. A degree(s) in project management, business, accounting, finance, economics, engineering, construction management, math, science, computer science, information technology or relevant field may be substituted per LCRA guidelines for certain years of experience. Driver’s licenseMicrosoft Project (MSP) and Project Management Information System (PMIS)

Name: Temporary Hourly System Analyst
Description: TEMPORARY/HOURLY POSITION WITHOUT BENEFITSJOB PURPOSE & RESPONSIBILITES: This position performs complex technical analysis and support associated with student data and related systems of the Austin Independent School District. A Systems Analyst functions as a team member or project team leader to accomplish the objectives of a project; works directly with project teams and customers to analyze and specify business requirements; develops detailed functional specifications; systems specifications, program specifications, and system test plans. Incumbent develops programs according to specifications and performs system tests; woks with customers and team members to provide technical support and problem analysis for all supported software. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Analyzes existing procedures for efficiency and effectiveness. Designs and implements new or revised methods that more effectively meet the needs of the Austin ISD.Participate in use meetings as requested to identify and solve highly complex technical central office and/or campus issues, concerns, and problems with Austin ISD systems.Determines operational, technical, and support requirements for the location, installation, operation, and maintenance of data processing, data communications, word processing, and other office equipment and systems.Prepares charts, diagrams, and tables that depict the present and proposed systemsPrepares general system flowcharts for present and proposed systems that portray the movement of work through the organizational elements.Prepares procedural flowcharts that describe the technical processes at each point in the system.Prepares logic flowcharts, decision tables, narrative descriptions, and similar materials of computer programs required in the proposed system.Upon request, consult with and make presentations to management and administrative personnel regarding respective areas of support.Details input/output record formats for computer programs; designs forms and writes instructions for their use.Assists in formulating logical descriptions of problems and devising optimum solutions.Assists in writing descriptive material to supplement system and procedural flowcharts.Assists in training District staff prior to the implementation of new or revised technical systems and offers advice and guidance during the implementation process.Assist in conversion of data between systems and/or loading of data to system files.EDUCATION: This position requires any combination of training, education and experience equivalent to a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Quantitative Systems or a related field. EXPERIENCE: Incumbent must have experience in web-based programming, software support, systems analysis and design experience. Experience in the following areas is required: Structured Query Language (PL/SQL SQL), Linux, Oracle, HTML, and Java. In addition there must be demonstrated experience in SQL and application performance tuning and measurement. Data warehousing experience is desirable. KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS: This position requires incumbent to perform technical and analytical work (planning, analyzing, designing, programming, system testing, implementing, maintaining and supporting) of new or existing computer systems and/or programs. Incumbent must be able to communicate proficiently in writing and orally, and be able to present subject matter in lay terms. Incumbent must have a high degree of technical competence in UNIX, network, SQL databases, and computer security skills. Incumbent must be able to maintain confidential information dealing with campus and district personnel and students. Incumbent must keep abreast of frequent changes in computer technologies, applications, and standards. Incumbent must also have knowledge of special district, state, and federal policies, rules, and regulations as they pertain to the gathering, storage, and use of Austin ISD data. Incumbent must have knowledge of computer network and personal computer equipment, operating procedures, operating and software systems and of the principles, practices and techniques of analysis, skill in operating computer keyboards accurately at moderate speed, and be able to maintain a pleasant attitude and have the ability to work with people effectively. Incumbent must be able to efficiently manage time and resources in completing assigned tasks, and be able to work effectively with minimal supervision.  SALARY: $27 - $30/hour depending on years of experience Application Procedure: Apply onlineSDL2017

Name: Reporting Analyst / Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionPosition Duties and Primary Responsibilities:The reporting analyst will design and develop metrics, reports, and analyses to help drive key business decisions for our clients in support of their supplier diversity programs.The person in this role must be comfortable working with large sets of data in the performance of extracting, analyzing, and preparing final reports for distribution.You may be required to create custom programs or templates to properly present the data.Requests may come from all members of the management team so the person in this role must have strong task prioritization skills in addition to good statistical and critical thinking skills.As the link between the account management team, client and technical support staff, you will be required to be knowledgeable about the information being reported to properly advise management and provide direction to clients.The position will report to Account or Senior Management.The person in this role will coordinate with the internal software development and data support teams, particularly on data collection procedures.This position will produce reports for client presentations and hand off to the account lead to present.The reporting analyst may from time to time be asked to be client facing during account launches and status updates with customers.Qualifications:A bachelor's degree and 3 years minimum experience.Extensive computer software skills with programs such as SQL, Access, and Microsoft Excel.Ability to work overtime when needed.Limited travel may be required.Strong attention to accuracy and detail.Ability to properly prioritize projects, and strong communications skills are a must. (PPS) is the leading resource for advertising, communications, and media agencies interested in developing and enhancing their supplier diversity efforts. As the industry is transforming, the ability to adapt quickly to change is critical.  For more information visit /professionalps.com or follow us on Twitter @PPSCreativeSupp.

Name: Sr Financial Analyst
Description: Job ID  Requisition Id:- 13432  Job Description  The position reports to the Mfg Finance Foundry Controller.  The primary focus of this position is to support the worldwide Foundry Group which includes; over 15 foundries in 6 different countries, and has an estimated annual budget of ~$500M of mfg. spending.  This position leads the forecasting and close process for the Foundry group, and provides support for costing, adhoc financial analysis and process improvement. The position may serve as a team lead to the group of analysts in coordinating the close and forecasting.  Job responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:  Business partner with Foundry Group managers to provide timely/accurate financial support  Produce the Foundry MSO (Mfg Statement of Operations), actuals/forecast  Perform MSO variance analysis and provide detailed information for management review  Develop standard costs  Perform balance sheet reconciliations  Develop journal entries and accruals for period close  ROIs for Capital Projects  Manage Foundry assets, depreciation and amortization actuals/forecasts  Prepare financial analysis support for requests from Finance and Foundry Group Sr. Mgmt.  Estimate and track cost reduction intiatives  Skills  Specifically, the successful candidate’s experience / qualities will include:  •Excellent interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to work with all levels and collaborate with partners across an international organization  •Strong business sense with the ability to utilize financial data to influence in company decision making  •Detail oriented, organized and accurate  •Presenting monthly and quarterly reporting packages  •Strong verbal and written English, practiced in communication across time zones  •Successful process improvements with a continuous improvement mentality  •Cross functional team participation and leadership  Minimum Education & Work Experience:  •BS/BA Finance or Accounting. MBA or CPA a plus.  •7 to 10 years of financial and accounting experience, preferably in the semiconductor or the high tech industry  •Hyperion Essbase experience  •Oracle Financials or equivalent  •MS Office experience, very strong Excel spreadsheet skills  Note  Cypress is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, physical or mental disability, or status as a Protected Veteran.  TO ALL RECRUITMENT AGENCIES:  Cypress Semiconductor does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Cypress Semiconductors employees or any other company location. Cypress Semiconductor is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.Nearest Major Market: Austin Job Segment: Financial, Database, ERP, Oracle, Financial Analyst, Finance, Technology

Name: NetSuite Senior Implementation Consultant
Description: Our clients are interesting. They are experiencing significant growth and faced with critical finance and accounting requirements. They range in size from pre-revenue/pre-funding start-ups to mid-market and enterprise public companies. Theyre involved in fundraising, IPOs, internal restructuring, validating new markets and testing new strategies. They need the right financial software platforms that support their environment and want help evaluating, selecting, implementing and integrating the right solution.  Thats where 9Gauge comes in.  We are seeking a NetSuite Senior Consultant to challenge the status quo and help us launch the NetSuite initiatives within our software selection, integration & implementation practice. 9Gauge will consider offering relocation assistance to well qualified candidates outside of the Austin area.  NetSuite Senior Consultant Job Responsibilities Responsible for leading all phases of NetSuite Implementation processes, including:Participate in and lead aspects of the NetSuite proposal development process with 9Gauge business development team; participate in the development of proposal pricing strategies and engagement agreements with 9Gauge leadership.Scope, plan, budget, and lead NetSuite implementation and integration projects from business development process through Go Live.Tailor, manage and deliver various components of client engagements with 9Gauge delivery teams, including:Identify, design, and implement technology and creative business solutions.Define the systems strategy, develop systems requirements, design and prototype testing, training, define support procedures, and implement workable NetSuite business solutions under tight deadlines.Manage day to day interactions with clients executives and project sponsors, and 9Gauge delivery teams. Skills and Qualifications 4 - 10 years of experience in full lifecycle ERP, Accounting, or Business Intelligence and Finance software integrations.Excellent understanding of business practices related to Accounting/ERP (Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, General Ledger, Invoicing, etc.).Previous consulting experience with NetSuite is preferred. Experience with other G/L Solutions, including Intacct, Dynamics (Great Plains, Solomon), SAP, or Oracle is required.Proven project management, configuration and design skills.A self-starter with excellent written and verbal communication skills with an aptitude for learning new technologies.Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.Ideal candidate can jump in as a team lead.Ability to handle a variety of different projects simultaneously and capable of managing multiple deadlines.University degree required or equivalent.NetSuite certifications, or proven progress toward certifications is preferred.

Name: JPC - 4304 - Senior Accessibility Analyst
Description: Location: Austin, Texas About this Position: Description Seeking a Senior Accessibility Analyst with significant specific experience in WCAG 2.0 testing and solving/training developers to improve consumer-facing payment applications and platforms for web. Education/Experience Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, User Experience, or a related field. 5+ years of experience with proven experience in accessible (508/WCAG) testing, analysis, and teaching. Responsibility level Exercises independent judgment with minimal direction from supervisor Responsible for accessibility of a large product. A whole team will depend on this single person's ability to find all issues and teach staff how to fix them.Qualifications / Skills ● Deep, demonstrable Subject Matter Expertise in WCAG 2.0, Section 508, ADA, other accessibility laws and standards ● Experience is critical - "being familiar with WCAG" or having done "some testing on a couple projects while in another role" is not enough. ● Significant experience using Accessibility testing tools AND screen readers such as JAWS, NVDA, Voiceover, and TalkBack ● Significant experience performing accessibility audits on web applications, iOS apps, Android apps AND providing solutions to developers with little accessibility expertise. ● Knowledge of and ability to discuss ARIA (Accessible Rich Internet Applications) solutions ● Knowledge of and ability to discuss HTML5, CSS, JavaScript solutions ● Extremely strong verbal and written communication skills . This role must easily be able to to have clear communication over email, IM, phone, and in person. ● Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills ● This position will be a busy one. Self-drive and a desire to work hard, cranking through a backlog and keeping up with multiple fast-paced teams is required. ● Thorough, methodical, problem solver and creative with extreme attention to detail ● Expert at time management as well as working & finding answers to questions independently ● Passion for making websites and applications accessible to all users ● Understanding of SDLC and the technical and business challenges that come with development of a product ● Understanding of UX and the design techniques and principals involved in the production of conceptual prototypes and wireframes ● Past Experience as a Developer and/or Accessibility Consultant preferred ● Past Experience in QA a plus Major Job Duties and Responsibilities ● Analyze existing web applications for Accessibility issues and provide developers and designers with workable solutions ● Analyze future designs and provide feedback to Product Owners and others to ensure Developers receive accessible designs and specs on new features ● Work with diverse team of product owners, UX designers, and developers in a fast paced and complex environment, with quick iterative cycles Apply for Position

Name: OIEC - Data Reporting Analyst
Description: OIEC - Data Reporting Analyst (00003677) Organization: OFFICE OF INJURED EMPLOYEE COUNSEL Primary Location: Texas-Austin Work Locations: CENTR 7551 Metro Center Dr #100  Austin 78744Job: Business and Financial Operations Employee Status: Temporary Schedule: Full-time Standard Hours Per Week: 40.00 Travel: No State Job Code: 1571 Salary Admin Plan: B Grade: 18 Salary (Pay Basis): 3,333.34 - 3,750.00 (Monthly) Number of Openings: 1 Overtime Status: Exempt Job Posting: Nov 26, 2018, 2:00:10 PM Closing Date: Ongoing DescriptionStatus: Internal/External-OIEC employees and the general publicJob Posting Number: 00003677Location: AustinTravel required: noneThe Office of Injured Employee Counsel (OIEC) is the state agency that helps injured employees with their Texas workers’ compensation claims. The agency assists, educates, and advocates on their behalf. OIEC provides services in 20 offices across the state. Agency services include advocacy, customer service, and dispute assistance through OIEC’s Ombudsman Program.Before you apply, please click or copy and paste the following link into your browser: https://www.oiec.texas.gov/contact/jobs.html for more information about working for the Office of Injured Employee Counsel (OIEC).Please note: All applications must contain complete job histories, which includes job title, dates of employment, name of employer, supervisor's name and phone number and a description of duties performed. If this information is not submitted, your application may be rejected because it is incomplete. Resumes do not take the place of this required information.Data Reporting AnalystWe are looking for a Data Reporting Analyst who is skilled in Microsoft Excel for the use of data reporting; generating agency reports and surveys. Maintains the agency performance measures, reviews data for accuracy, ensures data is auditable and makes certain data definitions/calculations are accurate. Relevant experience may be substituted for education on a year-for-year basis.Additionally, this position requires:-two years full-time experience in working with Microsoft Excel in an office setting.Preferences for this position include experience in:-State of Texas agency reporting requirements; and-survey tools.This position requires demonstrated knowledge of:-research and data analysis methodologies.This position requires demonstrated skill in:-intermediate level of Microsoft Word and Excel (i.e. formulas, pivot tables, and charts);-eye for detail; and -working effectively across multiple groups and areas.This position requires the demonstrated ability to:-handle/organize multiple tasks simultaneously;-gather, assemble, correlate, communicate, and analyze facts; and-communicate effectively both verbally and in writing with all levels of employees and the public.Veterans’ Preference:To receive veterans’ preference, applicants must attach at least one of the following documents with their Application in CAPPS Career Center: -a copy of the DD 214, member #4;  -a statement of compensation from the Veterans Benefits Administration; or  -a copy of the DD 1300. Applicable Military Occupational Specialty (MOS) codes are included, but not limited to one of the following: OS, 641X, 205, 0111, 16GXAdditional Military Crosswalk information can be accessed by clicking or copying and pasting the following link into your browser: http://www.hr.sao.texas.gov/Compensation/MilitaryCrosswalk/MOSC_ProgramManagement.pdfVeterans: Click or copy and paste the following link into your browser: www.texasskillstowork.com for assistance with translating your military work experience and training courses into civilian job terms, qualifications/requirements and skill sets.SUBMITTED THROUGH WORK IN TEXAS: Work In Texas (WIT) applicants must complete the supplemental questions to be considered for the posting.In order to complete the supplemental questions, please go to CAPPS Career Center to register or login and access your profile by clicking or copying and pasting the following link into your browser: https://capps.taleo.net/careersection/ex/jobsearch.ftl?lang=en. Criminal background checks will be conducted on all final candidates. An applicant who has been convicted of a criminal offense relevant to the position may be disqualified from employment.The Office of Injured Employee Counsel does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, religion, age, or disability in employment or in the provision of services. Any request for reasonable accommodation needed during the application process should be communicated by the applicant to OIEC staff.QualificationsThis position requires:-graduation from an accredited four-year college or university. Relevant experience may be substituted for education on a year-for-year basis.Additionally, this position requires:-two years full-time experience in working with Microsoft Excel in an office setting.Preferences for this position include experience in:-State of Texas agency reporting requirements; and-survey tools.

Name: International Product Analyst - Czech Republic
Description: Ref#: R0006911 Our mission.  As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers. The team. We are a rapidly growing and focused product team building the most popular job site on the planet. Every month, over 200 million people count on Indeed to help them find jobs, make it easy to apply, research companies, and connect qualified candidates to their job openings. With product teams in Austin, Tokyo, Seattle, San Francisco, Singapore and Hyderabad, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job at a time. Your job.  We are looking for someone who has experience with web or tech products, loves to crunch numbers and has comprehensive knowledge of the Czech Republic market. You will act as the subject matter expert for all products as they relate to the Czech Republic. This is a great opportunity to take ownership, develop skills across marketing, Product, QA and all-around business skills for the Czech Republic Indeed site.  Come and share our commitment to help people get jobs in the Czech Republic! Responsibilities:Learn all areas of our product to become a market expert for product-related needs to provide expert guidance on our product portfolio for the Czech RepublicResearch Indeed product performance within your markets to help identify areas of improvement and provide evidence-based proposals to implement themLocalize the website and support English to Czech translationsResearch, identify and address additional localization needs for the Czech Republic producTogether with your team, help develop a long-term strategy for the success of Indeed in your marketUse market expertise to provide feedback and support to teams in other functions in the execution of their initiatives.Support search engine marketing (SEM) and search engine optimization (SEO) campaignsSupport the Legal Team in resolving and mitigating legal matters in the Czech Republic market as neededLeverage proprietary software and systems to analyze data and monitor site performanceCollaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to define new and enhanced products for the Czech Republic market About you. You want to see the impact of your work making a difference every day. Your friends describe you as persistent, thorough and detail-oriented. You drive forward your projects independently while leveraging the strengths of your teammates to get things done through collaboration.You are someone with high standards and a strong work ethic who is not afraid to push us to be better by example, and who will take pride in Indeed like we do. Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Business field including Finance, MIS, Economics or a closely related business analytics fieldExpert fluency in Czech is a requirementIn-depth familiarity with and knowledge of Czech culture from extensive experience working and/or living in the Czech RepublicExcited about web and mobile technologyExpert written and verbal communication skills in Czech and EnglishStrong quantitative and analytical skills to recognize patterns and issues specific to the Czech Republic marketPassion for digging into a problem and providing simple solutionsProven multi-tasker who can work independently and across functional teamsDetail-oriented and extremely organizedPreferred:Master’s degree in an aforementioned field2+ years of work experienceWeb analytics, tech product, Excel and SEM/SEO experience is a plusIndeed provides a variety of benefits that help us focus on our mission of helping people get jobs.View our bounty of perks: http://indeedhi.re/IndeedBenefits

Name: 1174 - Budget Analyst Supervisor (ON HOLD)
Description: Essential Functions The Employees Retirement System (ERS) supports state employees who have dedicated their career to supporting Texas! The Budget Team in the Finance Division is seeking a Budget Analyst Supervisor with experience in state agency accounting to develop and assist in the planning, organizing, coordinating and evaluating of the agency’s operating budgetary activities. The Budget Analyst Supervisor plans, assigns, and supervises the Budget Team while working under minimal supervisor of the Assistant Director of Finance, with extensive latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. The ideal candidate must be a self-starter, extremely detailed oriented, and has an overall positive attitude and demeanor.  ERS promotes a strong work-life balance while driving employee excellence through professional development, a collaborative working environment and a competitive benefits package. Essential Functions: Oversees, develops and coordinates the agency’s annual operating budget in conjunction with the Assistant Director of Finance. Monitors and analyzes budget for expenditures and encumbrances to provide Finance management with trend data and recommendationsSupervises, assigns, and monitors the work of Budget Analysts; sets performance standards; conduct employee evaluations; trains or coordinate staff development; and counsel’s staff regarding work rule violationsDetermines methodologies and techniques for analyzing the operating budgetExamines the operating budget for completeness, accuracy and conformance with policies, procedures and methodsAssist with the administration and maintenance of the agency’s timekeeping system Clarity, to assure accurate allocation of costs to the agency’s fundsInforms Finance management of budget deviations, problems and events likely to impact operationsOversees the analysis of or analyze fiscal management information, determine appropriate use of funds, perform statistical analyses, develop budgetary reports and schedules, and develop and communicate solutions.Responds to operating budgetary inquires appropriately from internal sourcesIssues instructions on budget and funding policies, procedures, and methods.Develops and updates instructions on budget procedures and methodsCommunicates effectively and respectfully with co-workers and customersAttends work regularly in accordance with agency leave and attendance policiesComplies with all applicable agency policies and procedures, including safety and standards of conduct Required Minimum Qualifications Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major coursework in accounting, finance, business, public administration, or a related field. Each year of related experience over the required may be substituted for one year (30 semester hours) of required college credit.Three (3) years of supervisory and/or team lead experience. Preferred Qualifications Five (5) years of experience performing state agency accounting work.Three (3) years of experience performing state agency budget preparation and analysis work.Experience in implementation or assisting in developing databases and/or automated financials. Other Information  Work is performed in an office environment. This position may require access to privileged, confidential, or sensitive data. This position may require work outside of normal business hours and weekends as needed. ERS will conduct either a TXDPS or FBI criminal history check on all new hires. For more information about this policy inquiries can be made to employment@ers.texas.gov. Military Occupational Specialty (MOS) Codes  Veterans, Reservists or Guardsmen with experience in the Military Occupational Specialty Codes (http://www.hr.sao.texas.gov/Compensation/MilitaryCrosswalk/MOSC_AccountingAuditingandFinance.pdf) along with the minimum qualifications listed above may meet the minimum requirements and are highly encouraged to apply. Please contact Human Resources at employment@ers.texas.gov with questions or for additional information.

Name: Product Analyst
Description: Spredfast + Lithium is seeking a Product Analyst to join the Product Portfolio Management team. This team is responsible for guiding our product investment strategy, managing our data-driven approach to making product decisions, and ensuring our product investments are achieving sufficient ROI.  The Product Analyst will support the Product Portfolio team and the broader Product Organization by providing in-depth analysis into existing product’s performance and future market opportunities. Name: Analyst, Paid Advertising
Description: Analyst, Strategic Advertising Services Sprinklr is 1,500 employees strong, valued at $1.8 billion, and positioned at the forefront of the customer experience management industry. At a time when consumers are connected and empowered like never before, Sprinklr is helping the world’s largest brands provide amazing experiences at every turn.  Sprinklr offers a set of powerful social capabilities that allow our clients to reach, engage, and listen to customers across 24 social channels. We empower entire organizations to work together – across marketing, advertising, research, commerce, and customer care – to manage customer experience at scale.  Sprinklr works with more than 1,000 of the most recognized brands around the world, including Nike, JPMorgan Chase, Verizon, McDonald’s, Microsoft, P&G, and more than 50% of the Fortune 50. Meet ourStrategic Advertising Services Team! Our department is a group of advertising experts who manage our strategic clients’ budgets across social platforms. We are a resource for large advertisers who do not have a team with the skill set to run their own campaigns, but want to take advantage of the Sprinklr platform.  Clients include Fortune 500 companies across tech, finance, retail, gaming, health, and telco verticals. We provide cross-platform strategy, creative services, test and learn development, execution, and ROI analysis. We work with our platform partners and the development team to drive the Sprinklr ads module forward as a best in class media solution that integrates with front office tasks such as customer service. What You'll Do The Social Media Analyst focuses on applying Sprinklr/SAS and industry best practices to media campaigns, whilst supporting media managers with client needs.  They support media managers with accounts to ensure client expectations are met and campaigns are flawlessly executed. They also work with their clients and other additional Sprinklr teams if the client is also a core customer, including Success, to find integrations across Sprinklr that can positively impact paid performance and capabilities. What Are Your Responsibilities Manage paid social media campaigns for external clients (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube) from planning & execution to analysis and reporting  Carry out campaign management tasks according to client needs, such as optimization of accounts and budget control  Develop new creative ideas for clients  Develop new test & learn strategies  Work with clients to improve both the Paid service itself and its alignment with client’s core business  Work with the partner Reps to ensure the client gets the best possible service.  Ensure you are prepared for all client meetings and calls having new insights, test recommendations or industry updates to discuss with the client  Actively make sure that you are knowledgeable on all Sprinklr software products  Actively make sure you are knowledgeable on at least one channel’s ad products package. Who You Are & What Makes You Qualified 0-1 years of campaign execution experience in social platforms (FB, Twitter)  Experience with third party tracking companies a plus (mobile and/or web)  Analytical mind-set with attention to detail  Expert Excel skills  Ability to solve complex issues by finding new ways to resolve via process updates, teamwork cross-functionally, or platform enhancements  B.A./B.S. required in a relevant course of study (ex. Communications, Business, Marketing, Finance, etc) You know You're Successful if…. Account upsells  Deliver 100% on each allocated account  Process & platform improvements  Becoming a trusted advisor internally and externally  Become the go-to specialist for at least one Social Media Advertising Channel  Sprinklr has spent the last eight years building software for an “un-enterprise” world and we’re bringing the very best talent together to take us to the next level.

Name: Data Analyst III

Provide advanced analytical support for business operations in all or some of the following areas: claims, provider data, member data, clinical data, HEDIS, pharmacy, external reporting Extract, load, model, and reconcile large amounts of data across multiple system platforms and sources Review data to determine operational impacts and needed actions; elevate issues, trends, areas for improvement and opportunities to management. Develop reports and deliverables for management Model data using MS Excel, Access, SQL, and/or other data ware house analytical tools Ensure compliance with federal and state deliverable reporting requirements by performing data quality audits and analysis. Assist with training and mentoring other Data Analysts. Education/Experience: Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience. 4 years of statistical analysis or data analysis experience. Healthcare experience preferred. Advanced knowledge of Enterprise Reporting and Analysis tools, SQL, and Microsoft Office applications, including Excel and Access. Experience managing projects or heavy involvement in project implementation. HEDIS: Bachelor’s degree related field or equivalent experience. 4 years of statistical analysis or data analysis experience or 2-4 years of HEDIS data analysis experience including measurement and rates impacted. Advanced knowledge of Business Intelligence Tools, SQL, and Microsoft Applications, including Excel and Access. BUSINESS ANALYTICS:: Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience. 4 years of statistical analysis or 2 years of related IT experience, including data warehouse, coding or ETL experience. Healthcare experience preferred. Advanced knowledge of Enterprise Reporting and Analysis tools, SQL, and Microsoft Office applications, including Excel and Access. Experience managing projects or heavy involvement in project implementation. Encounters experience preferred. Data Governance: Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience. 4 years of data analysis or 2 years of related IT experience, including data warehouse. Healthcare experience preferred. Advanced knowledge of, Microsoft Office applications, including Excel and Access. Experience managing projects or heavy involvement in project implementation. HRIS Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience. 4 years of related IT experience and/or data analysis experience, including 2 years’ experience with HRMS such as PeopleSoft, SAP or Workday. Healthcare experience preferred. Advanced knowledge of Enterprise Reporting and Analysis tools, SQL, and Microsoft Office applications, including Excel and Access. Strong understanding of HRMS database design, structure, functions and processes, and experience with databases tools. Supports HR systems as functional administrator evaluating new release functionality to include testing and implementation of new functionality. Experience managing projects or heavy involvement in project implementation.  Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Name: Pricing Desk Analyst
Description: Forcepoint is transforming cybersecurity by focusing on what matters most: understanding people's intent as they interact with critical data and intellectual property wherever it resides. Our uncompromising systems enable companies to empower employees with unobstructed access to confidential data while protecting intellectual property and simplifying compliance. Based in Austin, Texas, Forcepoint supports more than 20,000 organizations worldwide. For more about Forcepoint, visit www.Forcepoint.com and follow us on Twitter at @ForcepointSec.  Pricing Desk Analyst I Job Description As part of the North America Pricing Desk team, you will be responsible for providing sales support and pricing administration to a team of sales professionals. The ideal candidate has some prior experience in operations. Attention to detail and the ability to prioritize are essential.  Essential Functions Assist Direct sales reps with pricing scenarios through to pre-approvalReduce Pre-approvals rejections, respond to pre-approval issuesPoint of contact for Sales Team on high-value dealsLiaise with Sales Reps, Legal, Ops, Rev Rec, and IT to facilitate custom quotesHelp implement/test channel margins/discounts, business rules and product changesProvide Sales training on pricing scenario best practices and pricing logicReport on pricing rejections, review with sales management, and address problem areasReview feedback with ops team, develop plans to improve ease of use of systemProvide general admin support to the North America sales team Education and Experience Bachelor's degree highly preferred1+ years of order processing, customer service, administrative or related experience, preferably for a high technology company.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Attention to detailExperience with Customer Relationship Management software (SalesForce.com) strongly preferred.Thorough knowledge with email, MS Windows, Word, PowerPoint and Excel is required.Aptitude for numbers and data analysis essentialSDL2017

Name: Associate Consultant - Migrations
Description: Role: Associate Consultant - MigrationsReports to: Director of Technical ConsultingDepartment: ConsultingLocation: Austin, TXJob Type: Full Time, ExemptHelp Us Shape the Future of DataAnaconda is the creator of the world's most popular Python data science platform. With more than 6 million users, the open source Anaconda Distribution is the easiest way to do data science and machine learning. Anaconda Enterprise allows organizations to collaborate, govern and deploy their Python and R data science in enterprise data centers and clouds. Customers include leading companies from the banking and financial services, energy, auto, technology, and healthcare industries.Anaconda is seeking people who want to play a role in shaping the future of enterprise AI, machine learning, and data science. Candidates should be knowledgeable and capable, but always eager to learn more and to teach others. Overall, we strive to create a culture that is both relaxed and focused, and we stress empathy and collaboration with our customers, open source users, and each other. Our primary employee perk is that we are actively working on projects that have a global impact, whether it's detecting fraud in the financial markets, accelerating cancer research, or fighting human trafficking and terrorism.Ensuring Customer Success with Migrations to Anaconda EnterpriseMore organizations every day are adopting Anaconda Enterprise, our cloud-native platform for collaborative AI development and deployment. Many of them are users of our earlier Anaconda Enterprise Notebooks offering, our Anaconda Distribution desktop environment, or even competing data-science development platforms. To help these customers get the most out of Anaconda Enterprise, we help them migrate their data science notebooks, applications, and other assets to the platform.A Migrations Specialist works directly with customers to move their data science workflows to Anaconda Enterprise. You will be working directly with our clients to understand their existing models and the data science packages they need to run them. You'll help them bring up these projects on Anaconda Enterprise, and in doing so help to train our customers to be effective users of the platform. In the process, you will help us refine the tools, documentation, and training that we offer our customers to help them be successful.This is an important position in the Anaconda Consulting team, and a great opportunity to fully master the Anaconda ecosystem and develop your customer-oriented soft skills. With success comes the opportunity to become full Consultants, working directly with customers to champion the use of Anaconda Enterprise and the Anaconda Distribution in production-ready analytics, machine learning, and AI solutions. More than just software engineers, Anaconda Consultants are advisors, trainers, architects, and implementors, all at the same time.What You'll Do:Be a key member of the Anaconda Consulting teamWork with customers to migrate their data science projects to Anaconda EnterpriseGain exposure to a data science applications across multiple industriesRecommend feature requests, enhancements and best practices to product marketing from client experienceDevelop the experience needed to become a full Anaconda ConsultantPerform other related duties as assignedWhat You Need:2+ years of software development experienceFluency in Python and the core data science packages in the ecosystemMastery of Anaconda's package and environment management technologyCore infrastructure and tooling experienceBS in computer science or a related fieldSuperior communication skills; English fluencyWhat Will Make You Stand Out:Experience working in a client-facing environmentExperience in the financial, healthcare, or utility sectorsExperience coding in RWillingness to travel up to 25%Why You'll Like Working Here:A dynamic company that rewards high-performersBe on the cutting edge of new technologies and servicesCollaborative team environment that values multiple perspectives and fresh thinkingEmployees First cultureCasual dress codeFlexible working hoursMedical, Dental, Vision, HSA, Life and 401KPre IPO Stock optionsUnlimited Vacation!

Name: Summer Intern: Insights Analyst (MS/PhD)
Description: #WeAreEA and we exist to inspire the world to play. EA values creativity, pioneering, passion, determination, learning, and teamwork. We mean things like acting with curiosity, speaking up with original ideas, and committing to each other as one team.  Were looking for all the best kinds of people to make great experiences for our players. The best people want a job that inspires them, while giving them room to enjoy their lives. And we want to give them that. We celebrate diversity and inclusion by creating a place where you can come to work and be yourself. And we want you to join us. Were hiring an Insights Analyst Intern. This role is part of EAs Customer Experience organization. The Customer Experience organization strives to make EA known for taking care of its players. Were players taking care of players and people talking to people whenever, wherever, and however they need us.  An Insights Analyst Intern is responsible for analyzing, reporting, and providing recommendations around the player experience with specific focus on our Signature EA Customer Experience. So how does an Insights Analyst Intern make great experiences for players? They do this kind of work:Reporting and insights Collect, interpret, and simplify incoming data across multiple data sources to find actual insights that improve the player experience and deliver a Signature Customer Experience for EA. Examples Include: Operational data around employees, top-issue analysis for our largest games and services, linking operations data to player game data to give insights to game development teams.Exploring data We work with multiple data sources from MySQL databases with terabytes of data to RedShift clusters with petabytes. We sift, sort, collect, and analyze these sources to provide insights to the business.Storytelling Youll give insights to drive actions from our analysis in a compelling story targeted at leadership, stakeholders, and development teams. With the correct insights and story, we have an opportunity to shape the player experience and drive the Signature Customer Experience for EA.Having fun As a game company, a passion for games and improving the player experience is a must. This carries through everything we do in our insights, storytelling, and methodologies.If youre interested in this role, youll needthese skills or experiences: Currently pursuing an MS or PhD or degree in computer science, statistics, or social scienceSelf-driven with the ability to take projects from kickoff to executionStrong problem solving skills you must be able to keep focus on multiple tasks and effectively set priorities among projectsStrong verbal and written communication skillsHighly proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPointExperience with analytics tools such as SQL, R, Python, Google Analytics, and Tableau

Name: Analyst 2, IT Support
Description: Analyst 2, IT Support  Austin, TX Requisition #: 189586Job Type: Full TimeLocation: Austin, TXTeam: Other, TechnologyPub Date: 11/20/18 Responsible for providing efficient and effective technical support to user community in areas such as desktop, help desk and IT project support along with network troubleshooting / support.  Employees at all levels are expected to:  - Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job  - Own the customer experience-think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services  - Tests, diagnoses and resolves end user desktop hardware, OS and application problems.  - Coordinates with vendors for hardware parts/repairs/replacements.  - Assist in a collaborative role to help manage system outages to resolution.  - Collaborates with fix agents, both internal and external, to resolve issues.  - Provides consultation services for users with problems or new tasks and formulates solutions.  - Provides immediate technical application support via telephone, email, and Internet.  - Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.  - Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.  - Dispatch service requests and issues to appropriate points of contact defined within the IT support organization  Job Specification:  - Technical expertise in Microsoft Windows 10 and Office  - Technical expertise in Mac OS, Apple hardware and Office for Mac  - Working knowledge of Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange  - Proficient with SCCM  Education Level:  - Associate's Degree or Equivalent  Years of Experience:  - Generally requires 2 – 4 years related experience in associated fieldComcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

Name: Technical Risk Analyst
Description: Red Ventures is both a marketing and a technology company. We are expanding both nationally and globally. We operate in a myriad of industries, each with unique compliance and legal needs.With an environment that presents unique and changing challenges, it's with excitement that we begin our search for a talented, multi-faceted Technical Risk Analyst.A successful candidate needs to possess general knowledge of cloud and network architecture, as well as a general understanding of US and International information security laws, regulations, and industry best practices. Under the direction of the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) and the Information Security Director, you will work and interact with bright and energetic people throughout the organization. This candidate will reside in Central Texas and work out of the Austin office.KEY RESPONSIBILITIESSupports the organization's information security program to ensure consistent, effective practices which minimize risk and ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of organizational assets.Collaborates with other members of the information security and privacy team to ensure alignment between security and privacy compliance programs including policies, practices, investigations, and acts as a liaison to the organization's technical and business stakeholders.Evaluates whether appropriate technical controls are in place and aligned with the organization's business needs and strategic direction relative to all aspects of security and related compliance.Identifies, measures, monitors, and consults on information technology risk by performing hands-on and data-driven risk assessments.Assists with enterprise vulnerability management efforts to include triage and remediation.Correlates threat intelligence with security systems & controls to handle security events.Collaborates with engineers to ensure new features & services meet security requirements.Maintains current knowledge of applicable privacy and security compliance laws, regulations, and accreditation standards.All other duties as assigned.DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE3 5 years relevant experience in two or more functions: information technology, risk management, audit, compliance, software engineering, privacy.3 5 years in financial services or heavily regulated industry preferred.Demonstrated knowledge and experience in information privacy and security laws and practices (ISO 27000, PCI DSS, HIPAA, SOC, SOX, GLBA, GDPR).Demonstrated organization, facilitation, written and oral communication, and presentation skills.Demonstrated skills in collaboration, teamwork, and problem-solving to achieve goals.Ability to manage multiple tasks and responsibilities, work alone or in small teams, achieve established goals and objectives, and communicate progress in a timely and meaningful manner.Ability to understand information security and network risks, with strong technical background and knowledge of information technology and security, including Linux, Windows and networking environments.Fundamental understanding of Cloud environments and DevOps security compliance.Fundamental understanding and experience working with SIEM, AV, Firewall, WAF, Vulnerability Scanning.Fundamental understanding of web application and network exploitation.Fundamental understanding of email, DNS, content filtering, and DLP technologies.Current information security certifications such as CEH, CISM, CISSP, GSEC are preferred.Open-minded, adaptable and passionate about learning.Occasional travel when required. At least once per quarter in a calendar year.About Red Ventures:Red Ventures is a leading digital consumer choice platform. Through deeply integrated brand partnerships and consumer-facing assets, Red Ventures connects online customers with products and services in the home services, financial services, and healthcare industries. We use advanced analytics, data science, and integrated technology to cultivate and customize digital connections between brands and customers. We marry the speed of a start-up, the DNA of a digital agency, the strategic thinking of a consultancy, and the analytical skills of a big data company. Red Ventures is headquartered in Charlotte, NC and has more than 3,500 employees in offices across the US as well as in Brazil and London.About Bankrate:Bankrate is a leading publisher, aggregator, and distributor of personal finance content. Bankrate provides consumers with fully researched, comprehensive, independent and objective personal finance editorial content across multiple vertical categories including mortgages, deposits, insurance, credit cards, and other categories, such as retirement, automobile loans, and taxes. For over two decades Bankrate.com has been a leading personal finance destination. Bankrate aggregates rate information from over 4,800 institutions on more than 300 financial products. With coverage for over 600 local markets, Bankrate generates rate tables in all 50 US states. Bankrate develops and provides web services to more than 100 cobranded websites with online partners such as Bloomberg, Comcast, Yahoo! And CNBC.

Name: Programmer/Analyst
Description: Job ID: 37662***Not able to use 3rd Party Agencies***Programmer/Analyst Our client is seeking a Programmer/Analyst to join their team in Austin, TX. Responsibilities of the Programmer/Analyst Work directly with the Product Management team to PBCS translate business requirements into functional & technical configurations.  Work with NetSuite Product Management, Professional Services & Sales to build PBCS templates for NetSuite Customers for provisioning.  Ensure the creation of domestically competitive PBCS template for seven core industries - Software, Wholesale Distribution, Retail, Manufacturing, Advertising, Media & Publishing, Nonprofit and Services.  Create and maintain documentation in associated with the PBCS template Solutions.  Documentation includes but is not limited to:  Installation instructions  Architecture guides  Design guides  Showcase PBCS solutions to the Product Management and vertical/regional influence teams to ensure product readiness per market.  Conduct testing and quality assurance in line with standards defined by the Strategic Initiatives standard operating procedures. **If interested, please include a brief explanation of your experience with the qualifications below. This information is helpful for the end client to review.**Qualifications of the Programmer/Analyst 5+ years’ experience building, implementing and/or demonstrating technology solutions, or other financial, business, CRM or ERP or EPM solutions.  Oracle E/PBCS, Hyperion Planning and/or Essbase experience is required.  Need someone who has developed/coded within PBCS-not just a typical PBCS user.  Bachelors degree preferably in Business, Accounting, Finance, Computer Science, Software Development or equivalent.  Accounting or Finance knowledge, education or background is preferred.  Demonstrated ability to communicate ideas clearly and concisely to leadership, both written and verbally.  Ability to translate business requirements into functional configurations on the NetSuite platform.  Accounting or Finance knowledge, education or background is preferred.  A strong understanding of Accounting Solutions, Business Solutions, ecommerce, ERP or CRM is preferred.  Experience with Agile delivery principles a plus.  High level of comfort with ambiguity; ability to structure unstructured problems and resolve quickly.Benefits Benefits are available to eligible VanderHouwen contractors and include coverage for medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short and long term disability, and matching 401k. About VanderHouwen VanderHouwen is an award-winning, Women-Owned, WBENC certified professional staffing firm. Founded in 1987, VanderHouwen has been successfully placing experienced professionals throughout the Pacific Northwest and nationwide. Our recruitment teams are highly specialized in either Technology and IT, Engineering, or Accounting and Finance career markets. Our recruiters value building meaningful, professional relationships with each candidate as well as developing honed knowledge of companies' staffing needs and workplaces. Partner with us to land your next exciting career.

Name: Data Operations Analyst
Description: eDiscovery Data Operations and Processing  We seek a customer-focused individual with a strong eDiscovery data processing skills to join DISCOs growing Services team. In this role, you will consult with customers to prepare data for legal review in DISCO, provide assistance to end users throughout the legal discovery process, troubleshoot technical issues, and guide customers to use the DISCO platform optimally. You will also provide critical technical input to the Engineering team to diagnose and address platform issues and prioritize enhancements to the product.  The ideal candidate will have a passion for solving problems and creating highly satisfied customers. The role requires sufficient technical skill to understand and address data file issues, identify and navigate network problems, and diagnose issues. The role also requires the ability to communicate effectively to technical and non-technical users, helping them meet their discovery deadlines. BenefitsWork at an exciting and rapidly growing Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) company with a unique platform in the Legal industry.We use the latest customer service systems and workplace collaboration tools.Open, inclusive, and fun environment.Many high-profile clients offer a rewarding challenge for people who love to make clients happy.DutiesCoordinates the processing, loading and exporting of data to and from DISCO matters.Ability to troubleshoot any issues encountered while working with load files, image files and native files.Ability to work with E-Discovery vendors for such tasks as data collection and data processing; particularly the ability to review work performed, identify problems and work toward resolutions.Facilitates the administration and tracking of client data and performs periodic audits of same to ensure that DISCO is in-line with clients case requirements and data retention policies.Accurately log and classify issues to provide complete information for Engineering interventions, product improvements, reporting, and other needs within DISCO.Analyzes and remediates systems or network problems related to DISCO.Handles multiple projects and priorities under stressful circumstances.Proactively contributes to improvements in documentation and our product.Adheres to company policies and procedures for creating, updating and resolving tickets. Proactively monitors open tickets, contact customers and provide updates on a timely basis.Advises DISCO customers on how to best leverage the tool. This will involve the ability to analyze clients needs and determine the appropriate course of action, including identifying opportunities for smart workarounds when necessary.Contributes to DISCO's mission to consistently improve its image both internally and externally.Displays professionalism, quality service and a "can do" attitude to internal members/departments of DISCO as well as external clients and vendors via written and verbal communication.Qualifications:Strong understanding of the eDiscovery lifecycle and related data processing standards and concepts, including, without limitation, data processing, data de-duplication, de-nisting, imaging, metadata extraction, load files, and data migration across eDiscovery platforms.Knowledge of SQL, scripting, and basic programmingKnowledge of various data storage methodologies, data collections, data processing and methods of effective electronic production.Knowledge of EDRM, including the ability to communicate effectively to both technical to non-technical audiences on the life-cycle of litigation information.Strong interest in technology with excellent problem-solving skills, with initiative to research and craft creative technical solutions.Ability to handle high stress situations and deal successfully with conflict.Ability to accurately determine clients requirements and take ownership of client requests.Strong presentation and communication skills (written and verbal) in order to interact effectively with coworkers and clients.Attention to detail, strong organization and client-service orientation skills.Flexibility to work nights and weekends as necessitated by project work and periodic on-call rotation.Required Experience / Educations:Bachelor's Degree: in Technology, Business, Legal or related fields; or significant relevant experience.Minimum three (3) years experience with legal technologies, Prior E-Discovery vendor experience a plus. Disco is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Disco will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.  Job Type: Full-time

We take our responsibility to Texans seriously and strive for excellent customer service through our professional attitude, competence and efficiency. Before you apply, please click or copy and paste the following link into your browser: http://www.tdi.texas.gov/jobs/apply.html for more information about working for the Texas Department of Insurance (TDI).Budget Analyst II-III (Budget Analyst) The Budget Analyst assists, prepares and analyzes operating budgets; compiles financial data and reports relating to budgetary activities; assists, prepares and revises biennial appropriations requests, and provides technical advice and assistance to agency staff on budgetary matters. Assists other analysts with budgetary responsibility for a major division or area. Works under general direction with limited latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. transfers; -assists in the preparation of biennial legislative appropriation requests, and corresponding summaries and responses to legislative inquiries; -assists in monitoring and analyzing operating budgets to determine funding authority and availability; -provides advice and assistance to operating managers on financial planning and management, ways to better utilize funds and personnel, improvement of management accountability, and efficient means to reach program objectives and;-performs other duties as assigned.QualificationsThis position requires:-Graduation from an accredited four (4) year college or university with a degree in business, public administration, or in a field relative to assignment;-one (1) year experience in auditing, accounting, budget preparation and analysis, statistical analysis or policy development.Note: Education and experience relevant to position requirements may be substituted for one another on a year-for-year basis.This position requires demonstrated knowledge of:-accounting principles and practices;-capabilities and products of electronic data processing;-Texas state government budget principles and appropriations process.This position requires demonstrated skill in:-writing fiscal notes and/or cost impact statements;-using advanced analytical skills.This position requires the demonstrated ability to:-gather, analyze, evaluate and present expenditure data clearly and concisely;-analyze fiscal data and determine the need and best use of funds;-foresee types of reports and schedules which will be assistance to the agency and Budget Office;-plan and organize work to produce timely and meaningful results;-express recommendations in a specific, concise, and understandable manner, and;-work effectively with others, and to apply an agency-wide perspective in analyzing data.Applicable Military Occupational Specialty (MOS) codes are included, but not limited to one of the following:36, 36B, 36A, 020, 21,
