Name: Program Analyst, Senior/T4NG IOSS RFP 0023-SAB-40518/RFP - 5.6.5 - SYSTEM A
Description: GENERAL SUBCONTRACTOR JOB DESCRIPTIONStatement of Work Leidos will act as the Prime Contractor under the Information Operations Services Support (IOSS) Program.  This Statement of Work (“SOW”) defines the tasks and requirements of the subcontractor by Leidos to provide labor hour support in support of the IOSS Program. Subcontractor will provide labor support to help Leidos fulfill its contractual obligations. The assignment of qualified personnel shall be the responsibility of the Subcontractor with concurrence from Leidos. Leidos reserves the right to reject any assigned Subcontractor personnel that Leidos feels is not meeting the requirements for the position. Leidos reserves the right to change its staffing requirements. Any award will be contingent upon successful completion of the Department of Veterans Affairs Background Investigation process and Program Management start date approval. TEMP TO PERM: No NUMBER OF POSITIONS: 1 LABOR CATEGORY: Program Analyst, Senior LABOR CATEGORY DESCRIPTION: A Senior Program Analyst must have knowledge in how to plan, analyze and evaluate the effectiveness of operating programs. Must be able to use source data to evaluate the effectiveness of programs and business processes. Must be able to use qualitative and quantitative analytical skills to assess the effectiveness of the operations. Senior PA must be able to effectively manipulate data to present program status and make recommendations on improving business processes. JOB DESCRIPTION/RESPONSIBILITIES: Assist with preparing documents for construction project approvals.  Establish and maintain assigned project files for the Facilities Management Section. Maintenance  includes the development and upkeep of spreadsheets to track project schedules, material  delivery, project(s) progress, modifications, and cost estimates.  Perform engineering and cost analyses related to proposed projects. The Contractor shall  research online or other sources for market research information and prepare results for VA  PM(s).  Review assigned project plan for content, code compliance, cost, schedule, and procedures,  ensuring required documentation is included, and provide recommendations for quality assurance  on reviewed projects.  Meet with Facilities Management Section on a weekly basis to discuss status of work, and meet  with VA PMs on an as needed basis to discuss problems and concerns, status of work, changes in  assignments or other project related issues.  Meet with customers to gather or determine needs, and make recommendations for project tasks  and schedule. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: Background in facilities projects  Technical Writing experience  Experience managing physical infrastructure projects in a data center REQUIRED SKILLS: Self-motivated and assertive  Ability to set priorities and adapt to changes in a quick and professional manner.  Excellent oral and written communication skills;  Ability to interact with internal and external stakeholders at every level  Ability to use discretion when handling confidential information  Strong analytical, reasoning and problem solving skills LOCATION: AITC TRAVEL: No  VIRTUAL: No EXPECTED START DATE: 4/27/18 EXPECTED PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 4/16/18 – 3/6/19 with two possible one year option periods through 3/6/21  ANTICAPTED HOURS: 40 hours per week – 8:00a – 4:30p PROGRAM/TASK ORDER: IOSSMINIMUM EDUCATION/MINIMUM EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: Bachelor's Degree Business Discipline 10 years 8 years of additional relevant experience may be substituted for education SUBCONTRACTOR REPORTING REQUIREMENTS: (If your Program has specific reporting needs, please include as applicable to the work to be performed.)  Accurate and timely, weekly SLICS system submissionsMonthly IOSS Status Reports – due the first business day of every month

Name: Sr Mgr - Branch Network BI Reporting Analyst
Description: Description:Austin - TX, AUS2, 2309 Gracy Farms Lane, 78758  Lance Alan Britton  20180824-5495 We believe that, when done right, investing liberates people to create their own destiny. We are driven by our purpose to champion every client’s goals with passion and integrity. We respect and appreciate the diversity of our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve. We challenge conventions strategically to create value for our clients, our firm and the world. We live and bring to life the concept of ‘own your tomorrow’ every day. We champion our employee strengths, guide their development, and invest in their long-term success. We hire optimistic, results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people with the desire to help our clients and one another succeed.  As a company, we were established by Chuck over 40 years ago to champion Main Street over Wall Street, and to help Americans transform themselves from earners to owners. Through advocacy and innovation, we work to make investing more affordable, accessible and understandable for all. As we enter our fifth decade, we are looking for talented, innovative and driven people who believe they can help themselves, and our clients, create a better future. Our Opportunity: Analytics & Business Insight, Support Analytics is a centralized support organization that provides reporting and analytical solutions to many business units within Schwab. ABI provides reporting for senior management, legal/compliance, service quality, and many other areas. We partner closely with the business units we support to understand processes and data to provide the best technical solution possible for their reporting needs. What you’ll do: Analytics & Business Insight (ABI) is looking for a highly experienced Business Intelligence Developer, self-driven individual well versed in analytical and reporting, relational databases, SQL, and data analysis. As a member of an organization with broad business impact, you will work directly with business partners and colleagues to develop and support the Branch Network, which will include high degree of data visualization, user-driven analysis capabilities, and risk assessments, all geared toward driving action and business growth. What you have:An undergraduate degree in Business Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems or related field (or equivalent experience).Minimum 5 years of Business Intelligence, Data Analytics and SQL structured programming, ad hoc queries, and data analysis development using Teradata, Oracle, and/or Microsoft SQL Server.Hands on experience as a BI Solution architect to design and build effective and scalable Business Intelligence solutions including; Tableau, SAP Business Objects, Power BI etc..Extract complex data from multiple data sources into usable and meaningful reports and analyses by implementing SQL queries.Strong understanding of data warehousing, data architecture, data management, data quality processes, fact and dimension tables, and data modeling.Highly proficient in working with large volumes of business data including strong understanding of relation databases, structures, theories, principles, and practices.Work in conjunction with BI Analysts and Business users acting as a liaison between technical and business teams in developing dashboards, data visualizations, analytics and other BI related solutions.Experienced developing dashboards wireframes and design requirements based on discussion with an understanding of technical and visual design considerations.Develops and implement BI Standards and Best Practices.Conceptual thinker, learner, and effective problem solverComfortable delivering complex solutions in tight timeframesMust have excellent written and verbal communication skills, and be able to communicate effectively in business terms with business partners up to the VP levelStrong client focus/customer service skillsMust be able to work independently as well as in a team environmentAbility to consistently deliver solid, successful solutions with short development cycles that hit the mark on the initial deliveryKnowledge of brokerage business, financial services, and/or Schwab a plusWhat you’ll get:Comprehensive Compensation and Benefits packageFinancial Health: 401k Match, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Employee Discounts, Personalized advice, Brokerage discountsWork/Life Balance: Sabbatical, Paid Parental Leave, New Mothers returning to work Program, Tuition Reimbursement Programs, Time off to volunteer, Employee Matching Gifts ProgramEveryday Wellness: Health and Lifestyle Wellness Rewards, Onsite Fitness Classes, Healthy Food Choices, Wellness ChampionsInclusion: Employee Resource Groups, Commitment to diversity, Strategic partnershipsNot just a job, but a career, with an opportunity to do the best work of your life Learn more about Life@Schwab.  Charles Schwab & Co., Inc. is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversifying its workforce. Name: CERNER FSI SUPPORT ANALYST
Description: Title: CERNER FSI SUPPORT ANALYST  Location: United States  Job Number: 18212776  Seeking a Cerner Millennium Foreign System Interface support analyst. Responsibilities include all support activities such as incidents, service/change request, routine maintenance. This is a remote position but must be on site for knowledge transfer (3-6 weeks) at the start of project. Support includes being be part of the 24/7 on call rotation. Preferred candidates will have 5 years of Cerner experience, particularly around Cerner Core build and functionality.  ? Review interface design specs and integrate external applications with the Cerner Millennium suite  ? Work with business users to identify requirements for maintaining application tables, dictionaries, and parameters required for system operation and configuration  ? Understand current design and implications to process and workflow  ? Serve as primary contact for application design regarding new requirements  ? Provide support for testing and conversion activities  ? Install patches/fixes provided by the vendor in accordance with change control processes  ? Work closely with all area application analysts to coordinate and resolve cross-department design and implementation issues  Candidates should be prepared to be part of a multifunctional team and provide support where needed.  Cerner 2015.01.19 code level  Ability to understand the impact of interface issues on Cerner clinical applications  Expert understanding of both inbound and outbound processing  Expert understanding of both basic matching parameters and special interface configurations (SI_Manager)  Expert knowledge of interface monitoring tools, including all levels of Millennium logging and Olympus server monitoring  Expert knowledge of various levels of scripting required for interfaces  Strong CCL Skills a plus Qualifications: CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).  CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.  CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran. SUBSTITUTION:  One (1) additional year of experience analysis and logical organization of information for automated and non-automated business processes may substitute for thirty (30) semester hours of educational requirement with a maximum substitution of 120 semester hours (four years).  LICENSES/CERITIFICATIONS: None  PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: The physical demands described here are represented of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  This position requires the incumbent to primarily perform sedentary office work; however, mobility (standing and walking) is routinely required to carry out some duties. It requires extensive computer, telephone and client/customer contact. The job also requires normal cognitive abilities requiring the ability to learn, recall, and apply certain practices and policies. It requires the stamina to maintain attention to detail despite interruptions. Marginal or corrected visual and auditory requirements are required for reading printed materials and computer screens and communicating with internal and external customers. scriptingProject Management methodologiesObject relational mapping, UML modeling and OO modelingSkill in:Evaluating, testing, implementing and maintaining Data Administration toolseffectively Name: Worldwide i2 Analyst Notebook - Sales SME
Description: Job Description IBM Security is seeking to hire an i2 Sales SME to work with global IBM teams and business partners in developing and driving sales of i2 software to expand its global market leadership in intelligence analysis.  You will work to develop solutions tailored to client business needs and offer IBM i2 capabilities in a way that is valued by the customer and provides a greater impact than that of the competition. You should be able to apply existing customer-specific industry to actively bring new business and technology insights to assigned clients. You will have had extensive experience as an intelligence analyst for military, intelligence, law enforcement or fraud investigation related organizations. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:Act as industry subject matter expert with regards to IBM i2 Intelligence Analysis Portfolio.Demonstrate i2 solutions within context of an industry use case for the client needs.Engage with business partners and IBM Security Sales teams to build a local territory plan, identifying prospective customers and execute the associated sales engagement plan.Work with business partners to continually build knowledge on how to sell IBM i2 solutions against the key competitive offerings.Professionally communicate with all appropriate levels of decision makers and influencers internally at IBM and externally with prospects and clients.Identify and contribute to creation of content and marketing materials for use in sales cycles.MEASURES OF SUCCESS:Achieve agreed upon sales revenues and new customer winsMaintain and present accurate sales management reports detailing progression against territory plans Required Technical and Professional Expertise Thorough understanding of tools, tactics, techniques and procedures, including open source intelligence (OSINT) used in intelligence analysis and production.Demonstrated knowledge of client mission, their budgeting and purchasing processes, typical recommended and decision maker roles involved, and how to progress opportunities from opportunity identification to closure.Experience in enterprise software sales within complex matrix environmentsDemonstrated verbal and written skills with proven ability to present at all levels within a customers organization.Assist Marketing and Sales Leadership to create/implement pro-active sales campaigns.Work within a multi-discipline, long term sales engagement.Candidate must be self-starter, well organized and strong team player.Must have a desire to keep up-to-date on technology trends, developments & best practices. Preferred Tech and Prof Experience 5 years of enterprise software solutions sales experience.College degree EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Sr. Financial Analyst - Planning & Reporting
Description: ABOUT USArchitectural Surfaces Group, parent company of Architectural Granite& Marble, Modul Marble, Pental Surfaces, Bedrock International and Cosmic Stone Tile Distributors has been a worldwide leader in granite, marble, quartz,tile and soapstone supply, now in over 20 locations across the United States.Our deep industry experience and excellent reputation give us access to the finest quarries in the world, while our diverse customer base gives us the buying power to bring our customers top quality natural stone at an economical price. We carry more than 120 colors of natural stone in slabs from Brazil,India, China, Europe and beyond. POSITION SUMMARY The Sr. Financial Analyst - Planning & Reporting reports to the Vice President of Finance at Architectural Surfaces Group and is responsible for the financial planning, reporting, and analysis. Duties include working with management to build the annual plan and working with management to attain the plan. In addition, this position will facilitate and work with management to develop forecast updates; prepare reports and analysis for management and the executive team. Business partnering, strong modeling, analytical skills and business acumen are key competencies for this position as the individual will work independently with business leaders to prepare various financial models that support business decisions to improve growth and profitability within the business. General ResponsibilitiesServes as strategic business partner who works with and presents information to Business Leaders and Executive team on routine basis.Works with business leaders to create financial models to support the decision-making process in areas such as capital acquisitions.Understand and apply complex concepts that identify risks and propose potential solutions and process improvements to issues or problems.Plan and execute annual financial plan, including balance sheet, income statement, cash flow statement, and CAPEX as well as all monthly financial forecasting activities for each.Creates monthly financial reporting and board and executive level presentations.Provide executive team monthly plan & forecast to actual analysis & reporting and develop schedules to help explain variances.Support managers in the development of action plans to address plan to actual variances.Monitor key operating metrics (KPIs, as defined) across the company and identify opportunities for improvement.Provide cross-functional support and lead specific business initiatives/projects and to help ensure financial goals are met.Support acquisition integration activities.Utilize strong excel skills to drive efficiencies, improve reporting and automate tasks utilizing complex formulas and functionsPerform other ad hoc activities as needed or as directedBASICQUALIFICATIONS: Bachelors degree in Finance or Accounting, with preference for an MBA7+ years of relevant work experience, with a minimum of 5 years in financial planning & analysisDemonstrated business partnering and presentation skillsStrong business and financial acumenExpert knowledge of Microsoft Office, with advanced Excel modeling skills and PowerPoint skillsDemonstrated experience building complex models and analysisStrong communication skills, both orally and written, especially communication of financial results and informationDemonstrated ability to work with and present complex data to Executive ManagementStrong attention to detail and high organization skillsCOMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:Competitive Salary, commensurate with experienceFull Benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, supplemental, 401K, vacation and sick timeOpportunities for advancement

Name: Entry Level Data Analyst
Description: Entry Level Data Analyst  Austin, TX  Terms: Temp-to-hire  Requirements: Recent Graduate with Bachelor's Degree in Economics, Finance, Accounting, or Mathematics  Looking for GPA of 3.6+  Strong Excel Skills (formulas, pivots, etc.)  Must be analytical and detailed oriented  Determined to provide the highest quality service to regional users  Day to Day: Work on discrepancies between two systems (Salesforce & Lawson)  Identify the discrepancies, troubleshoot to resolve the issues  The information that is incorrect includes private/secure user information (i.e. name, address, SSN, passwords, financial information, etc.)  Growth Opportunity = opportunity to move in to other roles down the road including, Salesforce Support/Admin, Sr. Data Analyst, etc. but you must be in this role for a year or longer  Environment = open cubicle office space surrounded by other team members - will be assigned a mentor to help you out  Nesco Resource is an equal employment opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics with respect to employment opportunities.

Name: Business Consultant
Description: Business Consultant  03-Aug-2018 Job DescriptionPOSITION SUMMARY This position focuses on the support of Austin Independent School District providing data analysis, recommendation, program development and evaluation in support of population health. Will serve as a trusted advisor to the account team and customer providing strategic insight. Fundamental Components but not limited to the following: This role works in partnership with the account team and customer to assist in the development of employer health and wellness strategy, provide subject matter expertise on Aetna programs and integrates when appropriate with other community based goals/services. Additionally this position will: Deliver clinical, analytic solutions in support of healthcare business initiatives that drive short and long term results  Participation in customer meetings, developing and presenting ideas and strategies  Act as a trusted clinical/health wellness resource to the customer and account team  Network within the organization, community and health/wellness industry as needed in support of customer strategy BACKGROUND/EXPERIENCE: 5+ years experience with one or more of the following methodologies: management consulting, project consulting, health and wellness programming, data analysis to support program development  Experience with moderate scale initiatives with moderate degree of complexity.  Demonstrated project management and organizational redesign experience in the health and wellness arena.  Demonstrated experience successfully implementing change in complex organizations.  Demonstrated relationship management skills at the senior level; capacity to quickly build and maintain credible relationships at varying levels internally at Aetna and at the customer organization simultaneously.  Demonstrated relationship management skills at the membership level. EDUCATION The minimum level of education desired for candidates in this position is a Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience. LICENSES AND CERTIFICATIONS Nursing/Registered Nurse (RN) OR Certified Health Educator (CHE) is required  Health and Fitness/Health Fitness Specialist Certification is desired  Healthcare Management/Certified Professional in Healthcare Management is desired  Managed Care/Managed Healthcare Professional is desired FUNCTIONAL EXPERIENCES Functional - Nursing/Disease management/1-3 Years  Functional - Planning/Strategic/1-3 Years  Functional - Communications/Member communications/1-3 Years  Functional - Medical Management/Medical Management - Case Management/1-3 Years  Functional - Clinical / Medical/Consultative informatics/1-3 Years REQUIRED SKILLS General Business/Consulting for Solutions/ADVANCED  General Business/Demonstrating Business and Industry Acumen/ADVANCED  Leadership/Developing and Executing Strategy/FOUNDATION DESIRED SKILLS General Business/Communicating for Impact/ADVANCED Telework Specifications: Employee will be located at he customer site in Austin, TX with occasional work at home with prior approval.ADDITIONAL JOB INFORMATION This is an exciting opportunity to create health and wellness programs informed by data analytics. The successful candidate will have a passion for wellness and data in order to identify areas for improvement. You will use this information to create actionable insight into population health and the action steps needed to make a change. Use all your experience and skills to impact member lives and drive value as a trusted advisor.  Aetna is about more than just doing a job. This is our opportunity to re-shape healthcare for America and across the globe. We are developing solutions to improve the quality and affordability of healthcare. What we do will benefit generations to come.  We care about each other, our customers and our communities. We are inspired to make a difference, and we are committed to integrity and excellence.  Together we will empower people to live healthier lives.  Aetna is an equal opportunity & affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of personal characteristics or status. We take affirmative action to recruit, select and develop women, people of color, veterans and individuals with disabilities.  We are a company built on excellence. We have a culture that values growth, achievement and diversity and a workplace where your voice can be heard. Benefit eligibility may vary by position. Clickhere to review the benefits associated with this position.  Aetna takes our candidates's data privacy seriously. At no time will any Aetna recruiter or employee request any financial or personal information (Social Security Number, Credit card information for direct deposit, etc.) from you via e-mail. Any requests for information will be discussed prior and will be conducted through a secure website provided by the recruiter. Should you be asked for such information, please notify us immediately.Req#52548BRJob Group Management Full or Part Time Full Time Supervisory No Percent of Travel Required10 - 25%Posting Job Title Business Consultant (RN) Registered Nurse (CHE) Certfied Health Educator Austin, TX Potential Telework Position Yes Additional Locations TX-Austin Primary Location TX-Austin EEO Statement Aetna is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer Resource Group6

Name: Policy Analyst
Description: Company DescriptionTexas Workforce Commission (TWC) is the state  agency charged with overseeing and providing workforce development services to  employers and job seekers of Texas. TWC strengthens the Texas economy by  providing the workforce development component of the Governor's economic  development strategy. Texas boasts an incredibly skilled workforce ready to  attract enterprise to the Lone Star State. By focusing on the needs of  employers, TWC gives Texas the competitive edge necessary to draw business  here.Job DescriptionThe Texas Workforce Commission (TWC) is seeking two Program Specialists IV-V to be Policy Analysts on the Child Care Policy team with TWC's Workforce Program Policy department. This position is located in Austin at 1117 Trinity Street.  The Child Care Policy Analyst performs highly complex (senior-level) to advanced (senior-level) consultative services and technical assistance work. Work involves planning, developing, and implementing the Child Care Services program, funded through the federal Child Care and Development Fund as authorized by the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act and providing consultative services and technical assistance to program staff, governmental agencies, community organizations, or the general public. May train, lead, and/or prioritize the workload of others. Works under limited supervision, with moderate to considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.  The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of child development, early childhood education, and/or high quality child care, excellent writing skills and the ability to communicate effectively with a variety of audiences. Excellent time management skills and the ability to juggle multiple, shifting priorities. The ability to quickly learn complex new content and to gather, assess, correlate, and analyze facts. Attention to detail and an enthusiasm for producing high quality work products. Demonstrated ability to successfully collaborate in a team environment. Experience presenting to or training adults. Policy development experience. GENERAL DUTIES:Researches, interprets, and analyzes complex state and federal laws and regulationsDetermines or oversees the determination of the impact of legal and regulatory changes on program operations and managementDevelops written analyses to identify policy and operational issues at the state and local levelsMakes recommendations for program policy changes, automation changes, and other changes necessary to successfully operate programsDevelops or oversees the development of plans, policies, procedures, standards, and guidelines for programsDevelops and facilitates trainings, webinars, and presentations on program standards and policy changesPrepares administrative reports, studies, and specialized research projectsRepresents the department at cross-department meetings and for agency and division-wide effortsRepresents the agency at meetings and conferences with federal, state, and local agencies or organizationsPerforms related work as assigned.  The position may involve working hours other than 8 am-5 pm, Monday-Friday. Hiring process will include an interview and written exercises.  Duty requires up to 10 % travel (within the state of Texas) and the ability to lift 10 pounds.  The pay range for this position is $4,023.17 - $5,200.00 a month, depending upon qualifications. TWC not only offers a competitive salary but the State of Texas benefits package includes health insurance, a retirement plan, and a variety of leave types. Learn about TWC jobs and benefits at www.texasworkforce.org/twcjobs.QualificationsMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: PSIV: Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university plus three years and six months of full-time experience in the development, implementation, or interpretation of policies and procedures in a public or private agency.  PSV: Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university plus four years of full-time experience in the development, implementation, or interpretation of policies and procedures in a public or private agency.  All: Twelve semester hours of graduate study from an accredited college or university may be substituted for each year of the required qualifying experience. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university may be substituted for three years of the required qualifying experience. One additional year of full-time qualifying experience may be substituted for each year (30 semester hours) of the required education.Additional InformationHOW TO APPLY: To be considered, please complete a State of Texas Application for Employment and submit only ONE of following ways: apply online at www.workintexas.com by choosing the option: Im interested in this job and clicking save (Preferred Method); or fax a completed State of Texas Application to 512-463-2832; or mail a completed application to Texas Workforce Commission, Human Resources Department, Room 230, 101 East 15th Street, Austin, Texas 78778-0001. VETERANS: Use your military skills to qualify for this position or other jobs! Go to www.texasskillstowork.com to translate your military work experience and training courses into civilian job terms, qualifications and skill sets. Also, you can compare this position to military occupations (MOS) at the Texas State Auditor's Office by pasting this link into your browser: http://www.hr.sao.texas.gov/Compensation/MilitaryCrosswalk/MOSC_ProgramManagement.pdf

Name: IT Support Analyst
Description: IT Support AnalystWe’re car2go  car2go began as a radical idea at Daimler, the company that invented the automobile and operates Mercedes-Benz. Today, we are the world’s largest, fastest-growing carshing service, helping our members in North America, Europe, and China get to where they want go through instant, affordable mobility. With a fearless attitude and a focus on member happiness, we helped create the sharing economy by disrupting the status quo. We may have well over three million members, but we still exude the scrappy, passionate attitude that got us here.Our Family  The best work happens when smart people rally around a common purpose. At car2go, we’re shaping the future of mobility, and we do that as a team. We help each other out. We don’t take ourselves too seriously. We know that the best ideas can come from anywhere. And we believe great cultures start with great people who trust one another to do great work.The Opportunity  Our IT department serves as a key support function to entire business. This role would be responsible for serving internal customers by installing and servicing systems and products. The incumbent would also provide 24/7/365 support in event of emergencies and after business hour support. The individual in this role would implement computer system requirements by defining and analyzing system problems; designing and testing standards and solutions. The person in this role would document current systems and services for smooth transition with the upcoming joint venture, allowing proper disconnect from Daimler and integration to the new infrastructure.Your Daily Impact Serves existing clients by analyzing service tickets; investigating complaints; conducting tests; resolving problems. Maintains rapport with customers by examining issues; identifying solutions; recommending system improvements. Keeps personnel equipment functioning by following company guidelines and processes; troubleshooting breakdowns; maintaining inventory and supplies; performing preventive maintenance; managing equipment and warranty repairs– 50&Documenting service and installation actions by completing forms, reports, logs, and records. Updating and maintaining knowledge base for IT and end-user use. – 20&Providing on-site and remote training sessions; developing manuals and guides; organizing and directing learning and tutorial seminars for IT related tools, hardware/software, and services. -25&Accomplish operational and organizational mission by completing related results as needed (KPI’s). Reviewing current trends in technology; deciding which peripherals and accessories are necessary for operational functionality; investigating new services and solutions available in market. -5&As an IT Support Analyst, you will need: High School Diploma or equivalent requiredBachelor’s or Associate’s Degree preferred3-5 years of experience in IT/Networking. This includes Operation system; Key account management; MS Office applications; e-Technologies/Web.Must be able to work flexible hours/work scheduleTravel domesticallyTravel internationallyWork Holidays when requiredWork weekends when requiredAbility to incorporate new technology into current and future business applications We offer salary commensurate with experience and a full benefits package. car2go is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessable environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. car2go is an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Data Analyst II
Description: The Texas Workforce Commission (TWC) is seeking a Data Analyst II in the Occupational Employment Statistics (OES) Unit to join the Labor Market and Career Information (LMCI) department team. This position is located at 101 E. 15th Street, Austin, TX.  The LMCI program strives to improve the way Texans make job, career and educational decisions by providing useful and reliable information about careers, educational training options and jobs. LMCI provides key economic data about occupations and in-demand industries along with information about labor market trends and economic conditions to help job seekers, employers, economic development entities and local workforce development boards make informed choices. LMCI gathers and provides information on the labor market, educational programs and training opportunities along with career planning and career development principles to help its customers evaluate current market trends in order to design and deliver services to businesses and job seekers.  The Data Analyst II performs routine (journey-level) data analysis and data research work. Work involves conducting data analysis and providing results. Works under general supervision, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.  The ideal candidate will possess the ability to learn internal databases and coding systems in order to perform pertinent job duties, but Department is willing to train the right candidate.  GENERAL DUTIES: Collects occupational employment and wage data for select survey firms primarily via email and by phone using extensive knowledge of the NAICS and SOC coding classifications.Collects confidential information from reluctant employers.Researches survey firms to obtain contact information, determine business activity, track predecessor/successor transactions, and verify business closures.Completes email log sheets weekly, detailing call activity with notes included in SPAM.Completes data collection phone forms completely and accurately based upon information gathered from employers, including documentation of all changes.Analyzes staffing patterns and verifies or recommends NAICS changes as necessary.Verifies and documents anomalous data upon collection.Follows up on all postal returns received after the second mailing by BLS by phone and/or by email.Researches and updates any changes in SPAM and comment.Coordinates collection activities with assigned team members under supervision.Develops initial contact and follow up procedures used in conducting collection activities.Communicates with staff on problem areas and industries to ensure compliance with BLS policies and procedures, assisting in meeting BLS deliverables.Coaches and helps develop team members.Facilitates problem solving and collaboration.Performs ongoing evaluation of procedures to determine the effectiveness as it relates to each individual staff member/ team member.Provides timely feedback of ongoing evaluation to Program Supervisor and Manager.Coordinates collection activities with assigned team members under supervision.Performs other duties as assigned.  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:Comprehensive knowledge of the 1175 detailed NAICS classifications and how they relate to the 821 SOC classifications.Ability to work in a fast paced, team-oriented environment with an emphasis on excellence and continuous improvement.Excellent interpersonal, communication, organizational, planning, and problem-solving skills are highly preferred.Ability to prioritize workload and manage time effectively.Multi-tasking, attention to detail and accuracy are strongly preferred.  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major coursework in data science, business analytics, computer science, computer information systems, management information systems, accounting, finance, mathematics, statistics, economics, or a related field plus one year of full-time experience in data analysis, research, compilation, and/or reporting work.  Twelve semester hours of graduate study from an accredited college or university may be substituted for the year of the required experience.  One year of full-time experience in economic research, data analysis, research, compilation, and/or reporting work may be substituted for each year (30 semester hours) of the required college.  Duty requires up to 10% travel (within the state of Texas) and the ability to lift 25 pounds.  A writing sample will be requested at the time of the interview.  The salary for this position is $3,763.18 per month, depending on qualifications. TWC not only offers a competitive salary but the State of Texas benefits package includes health insurance, a retirement plan, and a variety of leave types. Name: Performance and Data Analyst, Client Insights
Description: Job Description:As the Dealer Performance Data Analyst on the Client Insights team, you will serve as the champion of dealer performance data within the Dealer Sales & Service team, with an emphasis on close rate performance. Critical responsibilities include big data collection, analysis, story development, visualizations, and presenting of results. This is an outstanding opportunity to dig deep into a key TrueCar priority, integrate data from a wide variety of internal and external sources, and produce visually compelling insights. In addition to your direct team, you will work closely with other key functional groups within TrueCar outside the Dealer Sales & Service organization. About the Job:Develop and operationalize key dealer close rate performance KPI reporting for the dealer management teamSupport the dealer sales and service teams with dealer close rate performance collateral and reporting to facilitate effective conversationsDefine and execute dealer performance related analyses requested by the dealer management teamIdentify areas for optimization/automation to streamline processes, particularly in migrating excel based reporting to TableauWork with functional groups across the company – product, data science, and business operations – to support strategic operating decisions around dealer performanceCollaborate with data engineering, business intelligence and data warehouse teams to set up data pipelines as neededSupport other initiatives as directed by managementWhat you need:BA or BS, preferably with coursework in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering)3-5 years minimum experience in an analytical roleKeen eye for aesthetics and talent for story-telling through dataStrong analytical background, with experience identifying trends and key takeaways from dataAbility to analyze, organize, and integrate large amounts of complex data into clear and concise presentations and status reportsOutstanding attention to detail and time-management skillsDemonstrated experience with Excel and PowerPointAbility to communicate to both technical & non-technical audiences in a clear and concise mannerNice to Have:Experience with a BI tool (e.g. Tableau) preferredProficiency with SQLExperience with a programming language or statistical software (Python, R, SAS)Passion for the automotive and internet industries Location(s):Austin Office

Name: Sales Analyst - Whole Foods Market Team
Description: POSITION PURPOSE:The Sales Analyst is a national position responsible for reporting, data mining, data analysis and project support for the Sales team as well as the customer. Has a direct relationship with the customer’s business, data, and IT teams and works with any internal business partners involved in managing, determining, and maintaining data, in order to support the customer’s utilization of company data. Provides recurring reports and develops ad hoc reports needed to monitor company and customer businesses. Analyzes data, prepares and presents results in order to identify and/or resolve business problems as well as drive business actions in often-critical areas. Develops processes and technological tools, identifies technological and data-driven solutions, and leads or participates in the development of and execution of IT-related projects such as new report development and system enhancements/fixes to meet company and customer goals. The nature of the work is highly analytical and organized. EEO / VETERANS / DISABLEDESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES:Serves as a resource for Sales, and other UNFI departments with internal and external customer requests for reports, presentations, analysis and process mapping, including system operation and general technologyEvaluates data using Access, Excel and other tools to identify root causes and possible solutions to company and customer business issues and to support business project and change needs; sources and manipulates data from company and customer.Guides on pros and cons of possible solutions, recommends business process changes, and develops metrics.Schedules, prepares and distributes recurring and ad hoc reports required by Sales and the customer to answer one-time questions, satisfy continuous monitoring needs, satisfy or monitor contract compliance, supplement company fill rate reporting, identify sales increase and expense decrease opportunities, and guide sales and account management decisions.Provides direct support to the customer’s data and IT teams to research and resolve issues with transmitted company data, especially cost and product data.Submits IT Service Requests to automate ad hoc reports, enhance system functionality, and fix system issues; designs and performs high-quality and accurate user-acceptance testing; approves developed solution for install. Required SkillsQUALIFICATIONS:Education/Certification:Bachelor’s degree preferredExperience Required:3-5 years experienceSystem implementation experience is preferredRequired Knowledge:Advanced Microsoft Excel and AccessWorking to intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint, SQLAdvanced mathematical understanding and calculation abilityFamiliarity with UNFI Datamart and Microsoft Reporting Service is a plusSkills/Abilities:Root cause analysis, solution research and development, modeling of change options and recommendationsSituational evaluation leading to presentation of alternatives or changed perspective when appropriateCompilation and presentation of data and analysis results in professional and concise formats that inform and drive leadership decisionsAdvanced utilization of technology, advance and support team use of technology to increase efficiency, support and improve team members’ skill levels in technological and analytical contextsIndependently develop and conduct project plans to reach given goals Excellent interpersonal, communication, analytical and organizational skillsRequired Experience  Job Location  Austin, US-TX

Name: Financial Analyst, New Products Finance and Strategy
Description: Ref#: R0014618 Our mission. As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.  The team. Our Finance team ensures that Indeed complies with the highest standards of business, law and ethics, while providing Indeed's clients with excellent customer service and Indeed's management with the information and guidance required to succeed around the world. Every month, over 200 million people count on us to help them find jobs, publish their resumes, process their job applications, and connect them to qualified candidates for their job openings. Simply put, we help support the people who help people get jobs.  Your job. Indeed is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Financial Analyst to join our FP&A team in our Austin Tech office. The ideal candidate has experience analyzing and forecasting new products and investments, understanding ROI, and synthesizing that information into actionable recommendations, solutions, and predictive outputs. This person will have solid and proven experience monitoring, analyzing and forecasting headcount and cost in an ever-changing environment.  About you. Responsibilities:Effectively monitor products using analytics to predict financial outcome, including weekly tracking of headcount and spend cadence, ROI analysis on investments, monthly reporting and trending, biweekly detailed re-forecast and annual budgetingDevelop and maintain financial forecasts and budgets (monthly and quarterly) to support strategic decision-making (e.g. what/if strategic analysis, global business forecasting, new product P&L projections, headcount planning, etc.)Develop deep understanding of cost structure in terms of metrics, productivity, seasonality and key cost driversIdentify, analyze and communicate current trends and most importantly their impact on forward looking financial forecastsBuild strong working relationships with Product leadership team Forge solid relationships with local finance colleagues to understand and remain plugged into local operating models, processes and proceduresDrive efficiency in the Finance organization by identifying process deficiencies, offering viable and scalable solutions and driving cross-departmental collaboration to implement those solutionsRequirements:Bachelor’s Degree1+ Years of analytical experience in banking, consulting, FP&A, or related field Experience with executive level partnership and an emphasis on cost and headcount strongly preferredAdvanced Excel skillsProven experience analyzing data with an ability to synthesize it into trends and actionable recommendations and present in an executive formatExperience forecasting headcount and expense, managing to budget for multiple departmentsDynamic financial modeling skills to drive actionable productivity recommendationsExceptional communication and time management skills for working globally and achieving multiple priorities on time and in a quality fashionExperience with OLAP based financial planning software (i.e. Hyperion, Host Analytics, Cognos)Solid foundational understanding of accounting processes and concepts, including USGAAPIndeed provides a variety of benefits that help us focus on our mission of helping people get jobs. View our bounty of perks: http://indeedhi.re/IndeedBenefits

Name: Senior Manager of Business Planning and Analytics
Description: This person will work closely with business partners & infrastructure teams to provide actionable recommendations and create new tools to accelerate sales. You will be both technically strong and business savvy, with a real passion for making an impact through creative storytelling.  Lead a team of high-performing data science & analyst professionals in a hands on technical capacity.  Act as a champion for a data-driven culture, evangelizing standard methodologies both within Company and among the local and global data science community. Additionally we would like:  3+ years experience in managing analytics teams.  10+ years of industry experience in analytics or engineering  Experience working with large datasets  Experience with statistical modeling, machine learning, and data/text mining.  Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline: statistics, operations research, computer science, informatics, engineering, applied mathematics, economics, etc.  Expertise in applied statistics in at least one statistical software package  Are you eager to translate high-level business objectives into actions  Do you have excellent communications skills, with the ability to synthesize, simplify and explain complex problems to different types of audience, including executives  Do you have experience in Software, Cloud, or Infrastructure such as Compute, Network, Storage

Name: Sr. IT Security Analyst (GRC)
Description: Forcepoint is transforming cybersecurity by focusing on what matters most: understanding people's intent as they interact with critical data and intellectual property wherever it resides. Our uncompromising systems enable companies to empower employees with unobstructed access to confidential data while protecting intellectual property and simplifying compliance. Based in Austin, Texas, Forcepoint supports more than 20,000 organizations worldwide. For more about Forcepoint, visit www.Forcepoint.com and follow us on Twitter at @ForcepointSec.  Sr. IT Security Analyst (GRC)  Open to remote work  No Sponsorship available for this position  This position is technical and analytical in nature and calls for a fast-learner with a history of technical and business experience. The ideal candidate will have strong organizational skills and the ability to manage a diverse workload in a fast-paced environment. Responsibilities include FedRAMP Certification, information security risk analytics, reporting, change management process, and risk remediation process implementation for the Information Security Team. This role focuses on applying risk management principles on solving complex business issues involving advanced analysis and reporting of data that inform business decisions through threat modeling with the development of information security risk scenarios leveraging internal, external, and systemic inputs.  The individual contributor will evaluate business issues with the intent of delivering traditional-to advanced solutions to teammates/business stakeholders by gathering and analyzing security and operational intelligence from various sources. This role partners with various information and cyber security teams to identify control opportunities across different functional business areas of the enterprise. Duties and responsibilities:Work with our Engineering, Products, Security Operations Team to implement and monitor FedRAMP certification program.Responsible for documentation review; reading over policy and procedures; Ports Protocols and Services; system and network diagrams, descriptions, SOPs, earlier certification, and accreditation documents; perform monitoring & oversight of federal information security compliance objectivesInteracts enterprise-wide with all levels of personnel, including executives, business functional heads and technical staffAnalyze key business processes in order to produce comprehensive risk scenarios that will be implemented by working by with and through business leaders and information security risk architectureCollaborating with threat and vulnerability intelligence teams to develop risk scenarios from new and emerging risksConduct comprehensive analysis of risk scenarios and inform key stakeholders of findings on an ongoing basisResponsible for advancing the enterprise-wide information security risk function to create a union of business risk and information security riskBuild awareness and accountability around IT governance, risk, and compliance control functionsUnderstand the flow of information and how the information is utilized and use that knowledge to support the integrity of the Privacy compliance programTeam-oriented and will promote execution and change through influenceExperience articulating information security risk into business termsQualifications:Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience3 years of work experience related to the Information Security disciplinesUnderstanding of Information Security and Governance Risk and Compliance (GRC) terms and terminologyKnowledge of and experience with Federal security regulations, standards, and processes including FISMA, FIPS, NIST 800-53, FedRAMP, RMF, and POAMsFamiliarity with common technical security controls and control frameworks such as ISO 27001/2/18, SOC2, NIST 800-34/53/61/171, and GDPR.Industry recognized certifications are a plus, e.g., CISSP, CISM, CISA, GIAC, etc.SDL2017

Name: Search Analyst
Description: About Sysco LABS  Sysco LABS is a technology-focused division within Sysco, dedicated to reimagining foodservice through innovation. An extension of Sysco's commitment to deliver exceptional products and services to the foodservice industry, Sysco LABS uses customer and market intelligence, data-driven insights and agile technology development to rethink the entire foodservice ecosystem.  Our innovation will improve everything from the ordering process, inventory, pricing and automation to the in-restaurant customer experience. Operating with the mindset of a startup and backed by the authoritative expertise of an industry leader, Sysco LABS' mission is to improve the Sysco customer experience and consistently deliver cost savings and new innovations through technology. About the Role Executes strategies and tactics to optimize the onsite search experience. The role includes direct management of search optimization tools, processes, and reporting.  What You'll Do  This role is primarily responsible for the performance, accuracy, and effectiveness of the onsite search engine. Additional responsibilities include: Participate in strategic planning to improve the Sysco Shop eCommerce product search experienceAnalyze Sysco's onsite search activity; identify and execute opportunities for improvementManage internal tools and business processes that optimize the onsite search experienceCollect and respond to internal and external onsite search feedback; execute and measure search improvement tacticsEstablish and implement product data standards, guidelines, and best practices in order to optimize the onsite keyword search accuracyDevelop search measurement plans and dashboards; monitor and report on onsite search metrics and KPIsBenchmark the Sysco onsite search experience versus its competitorsProvide support for efforts managed by Senior Onsite Search Analysts as needed What You'll Bring to the Table  Must have 3-5 years of experience in large data-focused organizations with complex business processes and systems BA/BS or equivalent preferred1-3 years ecommerce experienceDemonstrated expertise in analysis, including web analyticsExperience with faceted search enginesUnderstanding of Product Information Management systems and methodologiesExperience with User Acceptance Testing methodologyUnderstanding of Agile developmentStrong detail orientationProven systemic thinking skillsProven ability to work with complex data setsOutstanding communication skills including the ability to translate detailed technical information to easily understood concepts, decisions, and actions.Makes decisions on search criteria and data which impacts onsite search relevancyDecisions on search criteria and keywords impacts customer search experience and online KPIs, such as conversion, revenue, etc. At Sysco LABS, you will be on a team who values trust, learning and working closely together to build groundbreaking experiences for our customers. Come join us!  We embrace diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.SDL2017

Name: Healthcare Operations Analyst (ACO) - Austin, TX
Description: OverviewAs an Operations Analyst, you will:Bring a creative problem solving approach to health care delivery.Demonstrate entrepreneurial minded and client-service oriented leadership that values strong teamwork and data driven decisions.Be a fast-paced learner who excels in communicating with all audiences as well as in analytical rigor who is eager to change the direction of American health care toward value. Additional DetailsImperium Health Management is a proud Joint Venture of LHC Group, Inc. Imperium enables Accountable Care Organizations (ACO) with all of the management systems and infrastructure on a turn-key basis to successfully coordinate care so that patients get better care and the ACO's shared savings opportunities are maximized. Our services include:ACO Development and OrganizationPayor ContractingCare Coordination and Utilization ManagementDisease Management and Chronic Condition SupportPatient Education and Self-Management ToolsQuality ManagementPerformance Tracking and AnalyticsIncentive Reconciliation and DistributionFinancial & Data Guidance A successful candidate will partner with operations and business leaders in support of driving maximized revenues, streamlined processes and reduced costs for a growing ACO management company.  Work directly with operational leaders and clinicians to translate clinical ideas on how managing utilization, costs, and quality leading to improved operational businesses success.  Create dynamic financial models for internal and external financial performance to more deeply understand the business, key performance metrics and opportunities to lower costs and improve results.  Develop financial pro formas, dashboards, and presentations for senior leadership and clients.  Manage analysts who work in claims databases, contextualizing the problems, translating big data into useful insights for partners and operations team.  Review contract proposals providing business leaders feedback maximizing Imperiums revenue in partnership with sales and other business leaders. Project Execution Manage multiple projects including very complex, high risk projects and projects with demanding stakeholders to ensure required deliverables are met.  Deliver business value through effective project management of one or more large and/or complex project(s) like new vendor selection, contract management, partner service execution, service line expansions, etc. and is accountable for identification of adequate staffing, leading cross-functional project teams, identifying and obtaining resources needed, identification of major organizational process impact and completion within constraints of scope, time, budget, and quality.QualificationsBachelors degree with an MBA or MHA preferredTwo to three years of experience with demonstrated analytical and reporting skills, ability to multi-task, balance priorities and set and manage timelines for deliverables.Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint, with the proven ability to produce professional documents in MS Power Point and develop complex Excel models with pivot tables and reporting functionality.Familiarity with Tableau.Experience generating reports and dashboards for internal and external audiences.Ability to speak in front of groups, including physicians, executives, and other medical professionals.Familiarity and interest in value based health care, health informatics, and/or the business side of health care.Understanding of clinical workflows and experience with performance improvement in clinical settings.Driven, willing to ask questions, and comfortable with ambiguity.Strong ability to succeed in a fast paced, fluid work environment.Equivalent combination of relevant education and experience may be substituted as appropriate.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Forcepoint is transforming cybersecurity by focusing on what matters most: understanding people's intent as they interact with critical data and intellectual property wherever it resides. Our uncompromising systems enable companies to empower employees with unobstructed access to confidential data while protecting intellectual property and simplifying compliance. Based in Austin, Texas, Forcepoint supports more than 20,000 organizations worldwide. For more about Forcepoint, visit www.Forcepoint.com and follow us on Twitter at @ForcepointSec. Position Overview: Responsibilities of the FP&A Team encompass a full range of forecasting, budget management, and investment analysis activities. This role is a challenging position with high-level visibility. The Senior Financial Analyst position sits at the intersection of the business' operations and company's financial results and, consequently, comes with the ability to influence the business beyond Finance. A successful candidate will embrace opportunities to take on new challenges and be comfortable leading/motivating their peers. Essential Functions:This role will have a focus on cost management including oversight over the Finance Team's monthly expense forecasting process as well as ownership over the budgeting / forecasting cadence for several functional groups.Team forecasting oversight responsibilities will include coordinating the team interface with Accounting for the monthly actuals close process, rolling up the team's company-wide headcount and non-compensation plans, conducting variance analysis, and preparing/analyzing the consolidated company-wide expense forecast. A successful candidate will have excellent analytical skills, an ability to motivate and help their peers, a strong work ethic, and an ability to self-task based on a desired outcome rather than step by step instruction.Budgeting process responsibilities will include working with functional budget owners to generate monthly expense forecasts and quarterly CAPEX forecasts, analyzing actuals, preparing variance analysis, and developing/tracking key performance metrics. As the primary Finance point of contact for these functional budget owners, responsibilities will also include modeling, data analysis, business cases, and investment analysis among other items on an as needed basis. A successful candidate will have top tier excel modeling ability, strong independent reasoning/problem solving skills, and strong interpersonal skills.Responsibilities may include other duties as necessary. Education and Experience REQUIRED:A minimum of 5 years of relevant professional experience is required for this position. A successful candidate will have at least a Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.Required skills and abilities include excellent analytical skills, top tier Excel modeling skills, strong leadership skills and a strong sense of initiative. Candidates should have broad experience leveraging their analytical and modeling skills in a wide variety business situations and feel comfortable leveraging this skill set to help other team members.SDL2017

Over the next several years Operational Insight will be modernizing its analytic and reporting capabilities to take advantage of the rich data available to it. Applicants must fully complete the summary of experience to determine if minimum qualifications are met.  25B, 25D, 25N, 255A, 255S, 181X, 182X, 681X, 0171, 8848, 8858, 3D0x2, 3D0X8 ESSENTIAL DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES 1. May supervise the planning, design, development, implementation, support, and maintenance of information technology in support of mobile technology.  2. Analyze and test new or existing procedures and CAD systems for efficiency and effectiveness.  3. May supervise projects that cross functional agency systems and other state entities that require coordinating, planning, and scheduling during project development and implementation stages.  4. May supervise the training of staff prior to implementation of technical and/or In-Car and Communication computer systems and offer advice and guidance during the implementation process.  5. Organize and review the design and implementation of new or revised methods that effectively meet agency needs.  6. Supervise, organize, and assist with agency disaster recovery responsibilities and procedures.  7. Supervise the development of analysis of revised system design procedures, test procedures, and security standards.  8. Update and maintain servers, server applications, and support programs.  9. May supervise and oversee the development, execution, and technical direction supporting the configuration, installation, and maintenance of software applications for In-Car and Communication applications.  10. Assign the evaluation and recommendation on testing and certification of software and hardware upgrades.  11. Prepare and define the goals of the system and devise flow charts and diagrams describing logical operational steps of program.  12. Supervise, schedule, and monitor disaster recovery and mobile command support and response.  13. Coordinate with various managers and department heads to discuss, plan, design, and implement projects. Monitor projects and compare measured progress via reports and reporting metrics.  14. Analyze budget recommendations for new or replacement technology.  15. Attend work regularly and observe approved work hours in accordance with agency leave and attendance policies.  16. Perform other duties as assigned.QualificationsGENERAL QUALIFICATIONS and REQUIREMENTSINTERNAL POSTING FOR INCAR & FIELD SERVICES EMPLOYEE'S ONLYEducation – Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with a major in Computer Science, or a related field is required. Experience – Minimum of nine (9) years’ experience involving systems analysis including hardware and software configurations on various platforms in a networked environment. Substitution Note: Additional work experience of the type described or other related education may be substituted for one another on a year-for-year basis. Licensure and/or Certification – Must possess a valid driver license from state of residence. CJIS security awareness, TLETS certification, TLETS mobile, TLETS_LE, and TCIC less than full access are required certifications every two (2) years. Regulatory Knowledge – Working knowledge of, or the ability to rapidly assimilate information related to TXDPS, State and Federal regulations, legislation, guidelines, policies and procedures. Supervisory/Managerial/Leadership Skills – Knowledge of management and supervisory methods and principles, performance and productivity standards, and fiscal/budget management. Able to develop plans, policies, and procedures for efficient workflow and overall effectiveness. Must exhibit integrity; provide clear direction to subordinates; promote teamwork and be able to motivate others to accomplish goals. Interpersonal Skills – Must demonstrate an ability to exercise poise, tact, diplomacy and an ability to establish and maintain positive, working/professional relationships with internal/external customers. Organizational and Prioritization Skills – Must be organized, flexible, and able to effectively prioritize in a multi-demand and constantly changing environment; able to meet multiple and sometimes conflicting deadlines without sacrificing accuracy, timeliness or professionalism. Presentation/Communication Skills – Must be able to construct and deliver clear, concise, and professional presentations to a variety of audiences and/or individuals. Research and Comprehension – Must demonstrate ability to quickly and efficiently access relevant information, and be able to utilize and/or present research and conclusions in a clear and concise manner. Analytical Reasoning/Attention to Detail – Must demonstrate an ability to examine data/information, discern variations/similarities, and be able identify trends, relationships and causal factors, as well as grasp issues, draw accurate conclusions, and solve problems. Ability to analyze systems and procedures, and write and revise standards and procedures. Ability to coordinate and solve problems in scheduling, installing, and implementing programs. Technology (computers/hardware/software/operating systems) – Must possess appropriate levels of proficiency with utilized software and systems and be able to learn new software/systems. Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook). Knowledge of the limitations and capabilities of computer systems, techniques used in the design of automated systems, applicable server operating systems, hardware and software, computer operating system, and mapping system. Skill in troubleshooting computer systems. Confidentiality and Protected Information – Must demonstrate an ability to responsibly handle sensitive and confidential information and situations, and adhere to applicable laws/statutes/policies related to access, maintenance and dissemination of information. Safety – Must be able to work in safe manner at all times, avoiding shortcuts that have potential adverse results/risks, and must be able to comply with safety standards and best practices. Travel and/or Schedule – Availability for after-hour, weekend, holiday, and emergency work is required. Availability for duties on-call and on varying shifts to provide twenty-four (24) hour support to vehicle mobile networks. Environment: Office, Outdoors, Vehicle;Ambulatory skills, e.g. stand, walk, sit, climb, stoop, kneel, and crouch;Hand-eye coordination and arm/hand/finger dexterity;Ability to speak, hear, and exercise visual acuity;Ability to transfer weights of fifty (50) pounds anticipated for this position;Driving requirements: Moderate frequency (forty 40%).State of Texas Benefits and Retirement Information: https://www.ers.texas.gov/ DPS employee who is selected for a position in their current salary group and state title will be transferred with no salary change.DPS employee who is selected for a position in their current salary group with a new state title may receive an increase up to 3.4%. Name: New Accounts Analyst
Description: NOW HIRING: NEW ACCOUNTS ANALYSTPAY: $15.00/ hr. SCHEDULE: Monday - Friday, 7:30 AM - 4:00 PM. LOCATION: Austin, Texas 78701 The New Accounts Analyst will contribute to the success of the Banking Operations department; the primary function of this role is reviewing new card orders daily and approving them for production while meeting daily operational deadlines. The New Accounts Analyst mitigates losses to NetSpend by monitoring card order trends, attempting to identify anomalies indicative of fraudulent behavior, and referring accounts as appropriate to investigative departments for further research. In addition to reviewing card orders, the New Account Analyst also reviews and performs CIP verifications account maintenance utilizing reports relating to Compliance and Risk Management. This role may cross-train with other Banking Operations departments. RESPONSIBILITIES: -Review all new debit card orders -Review cardholder information for validity -Initiate new strategies and make ongoing recommendations for process improvement -Manage multiple priorities and projects simultaneously -Support and interact with other internal departments as needed -Adhere to a strict attendance and punctuality policy -Adhere to strict compliance and regulatory requirements -Ensure that regulatory, legal, bank, and audit requirements are met REQUIREMENTS: -Professional business acumen, demonstrated through excellent written and verbal communication skills -Strong problem solving skills and inherent decision making abilities are required -Interact with staff members and others encountered in the course of work -Learn and apply new information or skills -Perform detailed work on multiple, concurrent tasks -Must be able to work under deadlines and high volume pressure with little supervision -Excellent organizations skills and capacity for attention to detail -Strong time management skills; comfortable handling multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment -Able to work independently and also as a strong team player with a positive can do attitude, working with the team to adhere to daily deadlines -MS Outlook and Excel 07 skills -Some college and/or banking experience preferred -Must be able to work a flexible schedule As provided in NetSpend's Background Check policy, eligible candidates may be subject to drug, criminal history, and credit checks, which will be conducted and used in accordance with applicable local, state, and federal laws REQUIREMENTS:Professional business acumen, demonstrated through excellent written and verbal communication skillsStrong problem solving skills and inherent decision making abilities are requiredInteract with staff members and others encountered in the course of workLearn and apply new information or skillsPerform detailed work on multiple, concurrent tasksMust be able to work under deadlines and high volume pressure with little supervisionExcellent organizations skills and capacity for attention to detailStrong time management skills;
